Leni and Jeric now know there is more than just a physical attraction between them. They start a journey together to find out their mysterious connection to each other and the book of Phoenix. They must figure it out fast. Shadowy forms that are more monster than men are closing in. Their own existences are falling apart around them.The author recommends this book for ages 16 on up. I am not so sure about that. I don't think 16 year olds would be able to "get" this book as it is deep as the end of the book will show you..  I would recommend it to a minimum of age 18 on up.Enjoy your read.

This the second in the series and I have read both. I love both of them too. This book is interesting and fun to read while also telling a story. This is a clean book. It has no cuss words or sex scenes.The story is written well, flows smoothly and is easy to understand.The characters are likeable and you can relate to them. This book has more of Ebony's mother.Ebony has barely had a chance to recover from the last threat to her town before things start heating up again. Something is bothering her though. She keeps finding rather large gaps in her memory. But, no time to concentrate on that. The wizards are in town for their yearly get together. They have not come Vale in about 80 years. Of course the portal has their interest, so Nate and Ebony think this is why they have chosen Vale this time. One of the wizards is the handsomest magic man she has ever seen. Soon Ebony is chasing after monsters in the sewer and trying to figure out what to do about a jealous detective.I do recommend this book for ages 14 on up. It is interesting, fun and parents have nothing to worry about if they read the book.

This is a work of fiction. This is a disappointment. I hated it so much I could not get past the 20% mark and had to delete it. I am not a pride, but once Ysabel gets to hell there are far too many cuss words. The devil even has her clothes burn off and she is standing there naked before he decides to give her a robe to cover herself. I tell you the truth,  as I was reading, I thought to myself this book has got to be written by a guy because so far that is my experience when you hit a good amount of bad language. Imagine my shock when I saw it was written by a female!I am really saddened because I think if this book was cleaned up yo would have a really interesting book.Sorry but I do not recommend this book to anyone.

This book is awesome beyond belief! This story is so well written and the defense so entwined that it is going to be hard to review this book without spilling the beans.Anyone who knows anything about race hate by living it, reading about it, doing it, or seeing it done, knows this book to be right on target. In this story a man is accused of setting an explosion in a church that ends up killing the Pastors daughter, a 12 year old girl, and harming the Pastor. He, Brian Stone, is arrested and spends time in jail before his trial.  Judge asks Jasyn Cook, a Black lawyer, to represent Brian. Jasyn is not so keen on doing this and does try to get out of it. The Judge speaks to Jasyn and gets Jasyn to agree. Jasyn, a man or honor, vows to give Brian the best defense possible.Throughout much of this story the Pastor, also a Black man, organizes protest groups to protest Jasyn's defending Brian. Members of this protest group even call Jasyn an Uncle Tom Now I am not even going to spill if Brian is guilty or innocent. What I will pose is The Pastor has placed himself on the same level he believes Brian is.  The Pastor has let forgiveness and compassion go right out the window. I do understand he lost his daughter, but I would expect more from a man of the cloth. I think the way the author has written this Pastor is really good.I think this story is well written, easy to follow and understand, and you will not want to put it down. The characters are well written and you can relate to them easy.I do recommend this book very much. I would recommend it for age 16 on up. There is nothing in this book that you couldn't easily get from Law and Order on television.I warn you though, allow enough time to read it as you won't want to put it down.

To be honest, I read up to about 33% then I had had enough and stopped reading. My dislike for the book has nothing to do with it having strong Christian slant in the storyline either.The cover is nice. Way too many characters to make the story easy to understand. The first 1/3 of the book is rambling.Between the excess amount of characters and the rambling, the story has lost much of what I think that the author is trying to have Jay Jarvis think and feel.Sorry, but I do not recommend this book unless you want to get a headache trying to follow it or understand it.

The book has typos but the story is so good I am still giving it a 5 star rating.This is good. This is really really good. And, surprisingly enough, there are no sex scenes except for kissing. There are no cuss words either.This is a work of fiction. This is a romance.  The problem is that it may take an earthquake to get the couple to figure out they belong together as a married couple. The story is well written, flows smoothly, and is easy to understand.The characters are well written and totally believable. The author has managed to make you feel like you are right inside the skins of both Dani and Wes.Dani and Wes have been best friends ever since college. SO, when Wes needs a date for his sister's wedding, and Dani needs a date for her company's retreat, they decided to pretend to be engaged to get through both events with no problem. Wes wants to prove to his ex fiancee and his family that he has moved on in his life. Dani wants to prove to her boss that she is worthy of a promotion. What they end up proving to each other is that they are in love with each other. Will they end up getting married? Or must their relation be relegated to just being friends forever?Read the story and find out.I do recommend this story for ages 16 on up.

This book is fantastic! It is chilling, suspenceful, and will keep you glued to the edge of your seat from page one to the very end. This is an author we all must keep watch for so we can grab any future mysteries he writes. The book is well written, flows smoothly, and is well described. Every time you think you know who the killer is, something comes up to make you have to change your mind. The characters are well written and easy to understand. You can relate to them and get to know who they are and where they stand in life.Benjamin Tucker was traumatized by a violent event in his teen years. It took him a long time to get over it, and even now he is drawn to think about it. Ben is a true crime author and amateur detective. Now he is obsessed with solving cases near his home in Holly Springs, North Carolina.  A series of decapitated female victims is found in near by communities and he is helplessly drawn to the investigation.  The hunt for the killer becomes personal and Ben is not sure if he has become the killers idol or his next victim.The secrets that come out while Ben, the police, and the FBI try to solve this case to catch the killer will rock Ben's world for a time.I do recommend this story to ages 18 on up. I say 18 because there are some murders in it that are a bit gruesome. There are also some cuss words that you might not want to read.

Never read anything by this author that I can remember, so I have to admit I am surprised at how much I like this book. I don't usually go in for blood and gore, but something told me to take a chance. Not sorry I did either.This book is well written, well explained and easy to understand.The characters are well described and you can relate to them easily. Well, except for the killer.A dead body is pulled from the Chattahoochee River in Atlanta. This would not normally attract much attention except for the fact that it is missing some parts. A deranged killer is collecting specific body parts from the victims and tossing away the rest of the body. This bizarre MO has the Atlanta Homicide Unit referring to the killer as "The Collector".Detective Tom "Brick" Brikler relentlessly hunts for this killer as the body count rises. This Collector is as clever as he is deranged. He seems to leave no evidence behind.This is a really good book, but because of the content I would only recommend it to 20 on up. . You are going to want enough time to finish this book because once you start it, you will not want to put it down.Enjoy your reading.

This is a great mixing of mystery and humor. A wonderful cozy mystery. If you are looking for a refined set of investigators, then this is not the book for you. If you are looking for more human investigators, then this is a great find for you. Lt. Dekker and Sgt. Murdock and a much smarter version of Ralph Cramdon and Ed on the Jackie Gleason show and about 2 steps down from Law and order. They know their stuff, but it is mixed in with the humor of their date life and the food that they eat. I have read at least half of the series and have never been disappointed.The story is well written, flows smoothly and is easy to understand. It is a fast read.The characters are well written and described. Dekker is more serious and smarter than Murdock, but you will love them both equally. Their girlfriends are a bit flakey, but they are a perfect match for them.Their girlfriends get them to attend the local craft fair. After awhile, our two detectives know they would have had to attend anyway because before the weekend is over, a murder has been committed.  The two detectives must look at all the possible suspects to see who had both motive and opportunity to kill this victim.This is a really good story. I do recommend it for ages 14 on up.

This book is absolutely wonderful. It is a true to life romance that teaches a few things at the same time. It teaches us not to settle for 2nd best. It teaches that while money can be nice, you should never settle for this in a marriage without love.I have a Kindle that talks and I usually let Kindle read me the book while I do crafts. Well, I started doing that up to about 38% and then I just had to read it myself, it was that good.The story is well written, well described and explained. The characters are well written and described. In fact they are so well described that you will find your self wanting to smack 2 people right in the face. Read the book. You will know who those 2 are.At twenty-six Jessica Wilson believes her future is laid out. Her father and brother-in-law both died in war, and now shes helping to care for her mother and her sisters children. Shes also managing a wildlife rescue center in the Georgia mountains, where she met her wealthy Canadian fianc, Blake McCormack, a rancher. Everything seems perfect. So why is it that she breaks into a sweat whenever she pictures Blake announcing their engagement at his parents annual rodeo?Jessica is engaged to Blake. She has the engagement ring. All that needs to be done is announce their engagement. Blake wants to announce it to the masses at the rodeo his family puts on. Jessica has many doubts about this marriage. She loves him but she doesn't LOVE him if you know what I mean. He has money and will take care of her nicely.Mark, the boy she fell in LOVE with 10 years ago, shows up on her doorstep to fulfill his mother's dying wish.  When he had to leave town with his family, she was devastated. Took her a long time to get over him, or has she. Why did he leave and not write to her? Why did she not try to write to him? Was it pride or insecurity?Read the book for the best story in a good long time.I do recommend this book for age 16 on up. There is one sex scene for those who do not like sex in their stories. It is not disgusting. In fact, it is beautiful..

This book is fantastic! I am from Salem, Massachusetts and have seen and read by fair share of witch stories, places and books, so at 67 years old, I think I can safely say if you like this subject, you will love this book.It will keep your interest from page one to the end. In fact, when you get to the end you will find yourself saying :"Over already!". If you like witches and wizards you will love this book. It is a book set in real life with a town witch who protects her town. There are no sex scenes, so those who don't like them will be pleased. There are no cuss words, so those who do not like those will be pleased. This is just really good story. Remember the program called Charmed? Well this book is better.The book is well written, flows smoothly, is well described and easy to understand.  You will find yourself right into the story with the way the author has written it.The characters are also great! They are extremely well described and you will be able to envision them as if you were right there watching.Ebony Bell owns a magical bookstore with the personality of a battering ram. Her best friend is an older detective who drives like a NASCAR driver. There is also a new detective in town. His name is Nathan Wall and he is tall, dark, and irritating.Ebony is a consultant witch to the police department. She sells books in the morning and spends her evenings fighting magical crime.One investigation end sin a costly mistake. She reveals her powers to a normal human. The coven punishes her by suspending her powers for one month. When the coven sends her back to the crypt, she passes out from an injury sustained in the fight. You see, she is now the same as human and needs medical attention, which is a strange thing for her.There is a curse on Ebony Bell, She must fight it or die.I do recommend this book very highly if you are into this type story. I know you will not be disappointed. This book can be for age 16 on up.

This is a work of fiction. While I do think this is a good story, I also think the beginning was a tad too drawn out. If you stick with it though, you will soon get to some exciting adventure and mystery. There are no specific sex scenes in this story. There are some kissing, but not actual sex. I do remember a very small amount of cuss words.The story is well written, flows smoothly, and is well detailed and easy to understand.The characters are unique. The Dallas people are true to that area, and the Caribbean people are true to there.Katie Connell is an attorney whose sloppy drinking habits and rejecting love interest leads to some funny, as well as sad situations. The last straw is a doomed celebrity case in Dallas where Katie is shamed beyond belief. She leaves Texas for the Caribbean to escape humility, a broken heart, and hopes to kick her drinking habit. Sadly, she has traded one set of problems for another when she starts investigate her parents suspicious deaths. She sees an abandoned house in the rain forest and becomes bewitched by a voodoo spirit.I do think you will enjoy this story and I recommend it for ages 18 on up.

The book is a bit slow moving in the first chapter, but it does pick up speed after. I just finished it and am ever so glad I stuck with it. Success in both business and romance is sometimes not achieved unless you help it happen. Foster and Becca worked to make it happen. Yes, they did some things that were a bit sneaky at times, but it was for good purposes. They both loved each other.This book is well written, flows smoothly, is well explained and easy to understand. I see this story as two people who are both insecure and need to belong to someone and be loved.  For Rebecca, she has been hurt so bad in the past because her parents and her boyfriend left her. For Foster, he has been controlled so much by his mother and supposed fiancee that nobody cared enough to show him love.They only showed him what must be done to be a member of this rich family. They meet, aided by Rebecca through a devious action. They spend one glorious week together and fall in love. Their relationship has more twists and turns than you could ever imagine. Through it all, they always end up together.This is a book I do recommend highly. Like I said about the beginning of the book, please have a bit of patience and you will not be sorry. Yes this book is a story about the corporate world, but it is a story about true love even more than the corporate world.There are some sex scenes in this story. They are not the blow by blow detailed descriptive sex scenes. I think there may have been one or two cuss words, but I am not sure.While I do recommend this book, I would say the ages would be 18 on up because of the sex scenes.I do think you will enjoy this book..

This book has the right mix of everything. It has mystery, romance, family and more.The book is well written, flows smoothly, and it is easy to read. I have to say that yu have to start this book with enough time to finish it. You just will be grabbed from page one to the end and not want to put it down. I was up until 2 a.m. finishing this. I just couldn't stop until I hit the end.The characters are a wonderful mix of many people you would find in real life. The author has a knack of describing them so you understand who they are and where in life they are coming from. . The main character, Toni, is utilized to bring all the characters to light in kindness and compassion.Toni Diamond is the makeup artist to middle America. She has a nose for trouble and a passion for solving mysteries. Toni has had a hard climb up as a single mother, but she has made it to a high position in Lady Bianca Cosmetics. Toni is smart and has a good eye for details and the funny side of life. When a sales rep is murdered at a convention in Dallas, it is Toni who notices things that others, like sexy Detective Luke Marciano, might miss.Only someone who understands how appearances might be deceiving can have an eye into this killer. Toni starts snooping and eventually gets death threats from this killer.The attraction Luke feels for Toni happens almost at the very beginning. He originally thought she was an airhead I think. When he finds out she had a good mind and is actually very wise, his feelings begin to grow.This is a really great first of the series. I do recommend it highly.For those who do not like sex scenes, there are 2. I personally did not find them bad. There was not all the step by step type descriptions that some authors put. I don't remember any cuss words either.I recommend this book for age 18 on up.

I did like this book. The book description has it down as "political intrigue with a splash or romance". This description may well be accurate, but I would have elaborated it to include something about political intrigue and corruption. The book shows too well how politics works, and how corrupt politics really are. Makes me wonder if there were ever truly honest politicians. Anyway, I digress.This book is well written, it flows smoothly, and you always have an understanding of what is going on. The book shows clearly what the plight f the homeless is all about and how hard it is to end this problem.The characters are awesome. I see each of these characters growing from the start of the book to the end. It is not just a sense either. You can actually see them grow.Jane Patterson inherits a hotel from her uncle. Jane's dreams of operating a 5 star hotel come crashing down when she finds out the hotel is filled with vagrants. She turns to her local politician to get a grant to convert the hotel to a hostel for young tourists. This slick politician has not told her he has plans to ban beggers from the streets and make homelessness illegal. Jane discovers she has a conscience and tries to play the politician at his own game.This story is Jane's journey in trying to do right. It is not always easy to read though. Some of the predicaments Jane gets into are frightening at best. It does make a good read though. Her journey is very thought prevoking. You just may find yourself with a new outlook on the plight of the homeless.This book does have a couple sexual encounters. I word it so because it is not the same thing as in some stories.There are a few cuss words too.I do recommend this book for age 18 on up.

This is the most confusing book I have ever read. I gave up trying at 24% read. The writing style leaves loads to be desired if the author wants us to be able to understand the story. If you have to keep reading and then re-reading to figure out what is going on, then this is not the book for me. If this style of writing is supposed to be the authors version of science fiction, think again.The journalist is a nut job. In Chapter 13 the journalist is supposedly cleaning up the mess from a murder he committed in the motel. So, okay, when did he kill someone and whom did he kill? I went over the previous pages three times and there is no mention of him having killed anyone.Do I recommend this book? Absolutely not.

I confess I got to about 30% read and gave up. I just did not like it. It is boring, depressing, and drawn out beyond my tolerance level. This book is like a glorified soap opera and I don't like soap operas either. I will say this though, at least the soaps are less depressing than this book. This book is about people, both rich and poor, who seem to be trying to impose their wills and desires on everyone in bad manners.The book is well written, too drawn out, too well explained, and full of people being nasty to each other.The characters are cruel, depressing, and most re seriously damaged in one manner or another.Sorry, but I can't recommend this book.

If you do not like sex in your books, this is not the book for you. There are also some cuss words.I am rapidly getting to the point where I will not buy a series book unless it is a stand alone type of thing. By  this I mean I could read this book and have the story come to an ending to be taken up in another book and brought forth. The ending of this book is a cliff hanger designed especially to get you to buy the next book so you can know what happened. This is all well and good in order to increase the author's earnings, but it is a bit cruel to people who can't afford to keep buying more books like that. Yours is not the only books we read. If all authors were like this we would rapidly go broke. It is for this reason I am giving this book only 3 stars.Anabelle owns a bookstore in the town she has lived in all of her life. She is smart, sassy, sexy and lose.Luke is new in town. He is all man and control is his middle name. He is determined to win Anabelle.When the meet, rocket explode.Strange things are happening in the town of Northfield and it seems like Anabelle is the center of all the trouble. Her biggest problem though is the intriguing and sexy Luke. You see, Anabelle is determined not to fell in love. She was hurt before and love is too painful.I recommend this book for age 21 and up. Sorry, but I would not want any child of mine younger than this to read it. Too much sex.

This is the first book of this series that I have read and I love it. I love paranormal mysteries.It is well written, flows smoothly, and is easy to understand and follow. There is mystery, romance, and suspence in this story.The characters are well written, easy to relate to, and Mary's family offers a wonderful sense of family closeness and love.There are no sex scenes in this story, so those who don't want them in their stories can feel safe in getting this book.There are also no cuss words that I remember either.In Black Friday, in the middle of a snow storm, Patrice Marcum leaves her 3 month old son Jeremy in the hands of an older woman and a store worker while she goes outside to get the snow off her car so she can come near the door to retrieve her son and he will not have to be out in the cold that way. She goes back and her son, and the old woman, and the store worker have disappeared. The store manager says there is no older worker there named Ron, only a 17 year old Ron. The police say there are not enough facts to work on but they will keep a lookout. Patrice is frantic, as most mothers will understand.Mary O'Reilly is a Private Investigator of an unusual kind. She sees dead people. She is in her office decorating for Christmas when a young boy comes in wanting to hire her to find his missing baby brother. . She agrees to work for him but he has one stipulation. He does not want Mary to tell his mother that Mary is working for him. He does not think she would understand seeing he is dead.This is a really great story folks. I was hooked from the first page or two to the end of the book. In fact, I was up until 2 a.m. reading as I could not put the book down.I recommend this book highly.

This is a mixture of suspence, a bit of humor, love, and a psychotic rapist / killer. It is well written, flows smoothly, and you will be glued to the pages until the very end.This is a story about a young woman who has had a tragedy in her life that many women fear ever having. Like the Phoenix Rising, she has survived. It is a story of courage, and ultimately about how the love of her life is there to help her be victorious after a second attack.The characters are exciting, chilling, and some are amusing. Lexi and Noah, our two main characters, make the perfect couple. The ladies of the Senior Center could be anyone's grandmother with a bit of spicey attitude.Lexi Hanson moved across the country to rebuild her life after the attack that almost destroyed her spirits and nearly killed her. She inherited a beach cottage from her grandmother and is now living there. . Her life is now complete.Noah is Rock and Roll's hottest star. After years without a vacation, he finds the solitude he needs at his beach house. Noah is surprised to see his neighbor in his garden crawling around. And so they meet.... Lexi and Noah....But, someone was watching them. Someone who thought Lexi was his, and his alone. Lexi was his. How could she be talking to this guy? He would get her. He would make her pay.When I first saw the ale lead was a Rock star, I thought, "Oh No! I am not going to like this." But, I took a chance and started reading. I am not sorry I did. Yes, he is a Rock Star. No, this is not a story about your typical Rock Star. This guy is what every girl dreams of. A good catch and one who will love you forever.For those who don't like sex scenes in their reading, sorry, but there are some. I can only say they are not disgustingly graphic and dirty as some are. There are also a small handful of cuss words.I do recommend this story.

I finished this book last night. I found this book to be well written, flows smoothly, and leaves you in suspence pretty much for the entire story. This book is mind blowing. I do not have a complete enough grasp on psychic phenomena to say all the facts in this book are true. I will say this though, the manner in which the author writes about the psychic incidents will have you believing them all. That is just how well the book is written.The characters are well written and described. The two main characters are Samantha (Sam) and Brandt. The author has written these, as well as the rest of the characters in such a manner that you feel what they feel, and can understand why they feel that way.Sam Blair is a young psychic who has been through emotional torture because of her gifts. She has been ridiculed, hounded, and even put into a mental institution because of them. For these reasons, she now hides her abilities and lives on the fringes of society. Since she has yet been able to control the times of her visions, she has even tried not to make friends lest they find out. She has recently been given multiple visions of women getting murdered. The murders are so horrifying that she feels she must go to the police and try to help. She hopes they will believe her. Here she meets Detective Brandt Sutherland who only trusts in evidence, but Sam's visions offer him clues that he needs to catch a killer. The more he learns about her visions, the more he sees that they have placed her in risk of harm. While he works o keep her safe, he risks losing his heart.I do recommend this book for age 17 on up. I put age 17 because of one or two sex scenes and some mildly descriptive murders.Enjoy your book.

This book is thrilling, chilling, spine tingling, and you will not be able to put it down, especially if you like psychics.It is well written, well explained, and just plain a great read. The book will grab you from page one to the end. Think "I see dead people" and you have a good idea of what the story will include. This is a paranormal murder mystery.The characters are well described and easy to relate to and understand.Nobody has found her yet, but there is a  decomposing corpse in an alleyway. Medium Patrick McLaughlin knows she is there. Patrick dreams of death. This is not the first time he has dreamt of death, and it surely will not be the last.Local police are stumped as to who the murderer is. s the corpses start to pile up, Patrick starts to work alongside the police to catch him.The nightmares do not ease up and are taking a heavy toll on Patrick's health and sanity. What will it cost Patrick before he can find the killer.I do recommend this book as it is a great read for adults. I do not recommend it for under age 18. There is enough violence in this world. They do not need to be subjected to it in their reading yet.

This story is well written, well explained, and flows smoothly. The story offers suspence, a bit of humor, New Orleans life, and a lawyer / detective who always to be for the little guy.The characters are well written, well explained, and you can relate to them. My favorite is, of course, Tubby. He is a good guy who is not afraid to bend the rules when needed. Tubby is, above all else, charming in his own unique way.The last words that escaped an old friend's lips will not leave Tubby's mind. He also can't get out of the way of a political campaign that is turning rough. Both the Sheriff and Tubby's friend the judge are running for election.  Tubby is obsessed with the thought that a shadowy crime boss is pulling string and costing good people their lives. Tubby is going to get into a courageous battle with the most violent people in New Orleans. Not only that, he meets a beautiful prostitute who is looking for revenge because the bad guys murdered her boyfriend right in front of her eyes. Has Tubby met his match? Get this book and find out now.I do recommend this book for mature teens of about 18 and adults on up..

Amazon: Can someone remove the **** from stories? It is getting annoying to have Kindle speak the book because of these.This book is well written, well described, and flows smoothly. It is very easy to understand. The plot is a bit involved, but not so that you can't figure out what is going on. The book has intrigue throughout the entire book. You will just get to thinking you have the book figured out then, wham, it changes.The characters are well written and described. Some of them are rough, but this is in line with the type of story this is. It is about crime.Lishman hooks up with Natasha Rok in a bar and brings her home. Both have done loads of drinking and can't even complete the sex act. Three days later news of Natasha's murder is all over the papers. Lishman is the prime suspect. Only problem is that Lishman can't remember much at all about the night of 'passion'.  He makes a snap decision to run. He turns into a fugitive hiding out on the back streets of London. With the help of Dani, a female photographer friend, he ventures into the world of East End gangs and conspiracy theories to figure out this mystery.This is an interesting read and will keep you glued to the book until the very end. There are one or two crude words in the story.I do recommend this story.

This book has it all, adventure, magic, humor, a little bit of romance, and more. It is well written, well explained, and once you start it, you will not want to put it down. The story is so well written that you will feel like you are right there when the action is taking place. The characters are fantastic. They are written so well it is like they are right in front of you.Raven is 15 years old and was supposed to snatch a cauldron, but instead, she accidentally blows up the library.Raven's father is a spy for Kingdom Quest. He has been charged with finding. He coerces Raven to help. Raven is disguised and employed at Saint Cloud Library. The library is ruled by a tyrannical director who has closed all book sections.  Her coworkers are wary, unfriendly, and have no concern that the library's magic is taking on the demeanor of a chained monster. There is a cyber security leak and an organization of magic abusers know the cauldron is at the library. Raven must find it first.You have to read the book for the full story.I do recommend this book for age 14 on up. It is a clean story. No cuss words or sex scenes.I hope you enjoy this as much as I did.

The story is well written, flows smoothly, and is easy to understand.The problem with this story is that if these 3 women drink this much they should be spending most of their vacation drunk and unable to investigate anything, or in the hospital getting a liver transplant. I mention transplant because the way they drink it is not just on this vacation they are doing it. I know this is supposed to be a work of fiction, but with the pictures at the end of the book I have to wonder how much actual fiction there is in the book.The characters are well written and described. The problem is that the large amount of them are written as stupid beings. The three girls, for example, are taking far too many chances with their lives by trusting way too many people. Let's take the supposed drug lord, sex fiend guy. When he says he will drive them back to their hotel via boat, they go. Huh?? Nobody in their right mind would do that with the fears, no matter how small they are, of this man. So, can I relate to this story, absolutely not.Victoria's dreams died the night she found her husband in the pool of his apartment (they had seperated) with another mistress. Days before her divorce is final, her 3 closest friends whisk her off to Playa del Carmen, Mexico. Vivian meets a sexy Canadian soap star Jon Tourney. They have a hot night on the dance floor than for a walk on the beach. Next morning Jon is found dead on the beach and Vivian is the suspect.So, do I recommend this book? Well, if you want to read a book with characters that have no strength, integrity, or maturity, be my guest. If you want to read a book where the three main female characters are a bit loose, and drink like fishes, then go ahead.  I would only recommend it for ages 18 and up due to some of the items found on Shorty's boat.

Okay, I gave the 2 star rating because the author tried. He did not succeed. To me, this book was plagiarized It is far too close to Christie's book, and I believe the title was "And Then There Were None", but I could be wrong. I read it a good many years ago.My next problem with the book is that it was too drawn out. So much so that it became boring. When you add the closeness to Christie's book, it became even more boring. .I do admit for the last about 25% of the book I was speed reading just to get through to the end and not because I was interested.If it were up to me, I would suggest the author take this book and rework it, keeping only his own ideas in the reworked version. I know I am being snotty here, but this is how I feel.Do I recommend this book? Not really. It is a remake of a classic. I found the classic far more appealing than this book.
I have a Kindle DX and the text to speech keeps stopping with a message that the text to speech is malfunctioning. Please fix.

According to the author at the end of the book, this is her first novel. Well, I am here to say that she has done a fantastic job! I loved the story! I love the pace of the story. No we are not all rich like our 2 main characters, but the events are real life. Congratulations Ms. Grace! Well done!Yes, there are a few typos in this story, but I personally feel the story is so good that it is not important. By the way, I started this book about 10:30 last night. I could not put the book down. I was up until 3 a.m. to finish it!This story is well written, well paced, easy to understand and relate to. The characters grow on you right away. You will love them. The character of Faith shows her gaining strength and becoming more assertive. There is a touch of religious value in this book, but not enough to turn off those who don't like to read about religious values. And then we come to Zac. If only each and every one of us ladies could find someone like him. Wow!Faith and Zac grew up together. Faith had a strog and loving family. Zac's family was almost non-existent. . As each went on to different paths in life, they remained strong friends. When ever Faith needed him, Zac was there to support her. Same with Faith. Her support of Zac was invaluable to him.Zac and Faith loved each other deeply, but they could not see it well. Others knew it though. Zac's family has a histroy of cheating men who hurt their wives. Zac was afraid to profess his love for her in fear of hurting her. Faith did not think Zac felt that way about her.Then, one day, Faith's father had a heart attack. When she was there another good friend, Dylan, was holding her in his arms to comfort her. Zac came and saw this and it was like a thunder bolt. He was intensely jealous.Ladies, I stop here. For the best effect you have to read this book yourselves.I strongly recommend this book for all ages. It shows what true love is really like. There are no sex scenes. There are no cuss words. This is just a highly enjoyable and great story that all must read.Again, congratulations to the author on a fantastic first book. I am willing to be your test reader when ever you need me.

This is the second book of this author's and he has again not failed me. This story will grab you from page one and keep you on the edge of your seat to the last page. I am looking forward to the next in the Hyder Ali series.The story is very well written. It is easy to follow and flows smoothly. Hint: allow enough time to read it as you will not want to put it down.The characters are well described and and you will like them all.Hyder is an American-Muslim. He is working as a reporter for the Daily Times. His old professor, Eric Freeland, is found hanging inside his home. Freeland's daughter, Jessica, asks for Hyder's help to prove her father was murdered.Detective Tom Nolan is assigned the Freeland case. Tom is an alcoholic and would rather get drunk than work on a case, but, the bills have to be paid so he lets himself be convinced to come out of mourning for his dead wife. .What looks to be an apparent suicide turns into something sinister and dangerous when Hyder, Jessica, and Nolan begin looking for answers.  For the rest, you need to read the book.I do highly recommend this book. There are no cuss words or sex scenes, for those who don't like them. .

I have to admit I read the first 2-3 ages of the lead in and then just skipped to the actual story. We don't need so much description. I would have much rather seen a short character description then so much detail in the beginning. Minus the beginning it is a good story and still worthy of reading.The story is written well, flows smoothly except for to much detail in the beginning. The characters are written well and you can understand them.Chauncy St. Armant is shot to death at a Mardi Gras festival parade. Rookie cop Skip Langdon is there and tries to get through the massive crowd to the body. She had seen the shooter. It was someone dressed in a Dolly Parton outfit.Skip has to interview those who were near Chauncy and untangle a web of clues and secrets to solve the murder. This investigation means danger for Skip and possible doom for the St. Armants.This is an interesting story and, despite the overly long read in, I do reocmmend it for ages 16 on up.

This is another in the list of books by Dr. Gold that I have read and I love it as much as the others.The story will grab you right from the beginning and keep you sitting on the edge of your seat until the very end.If any reader has medical background, you will find this book factual in the medical aspects while also being a good fictional work. I have to say when ever I see that a book is written by Dr. Gold I grab it without even reading the description. I know it will be great.The story is well written, flows smoothly and is easy to follow. The characters are real life and you will relate to them easily.This book takes the reader on a search for the cure for malignant melanoma. This type of cancer is not common, but it does cause deaths almost every hour. The rate of occurence has tripled in the last 20 years. Ever wonder why we see so many ads about sun block. This is one of the reasons.The husband of Dr. Terri Powell died from this skin cancer. She went further in her studies to be able to do research in skin cancer so that she may prevent others from death like her husband.A drug courier is killed in order to get an experimental and promising treatment for malignant melanoma. This theft unleashes a chain of devastating consequences.PAT a company created to find cures for rare diseases has fallen on hard times and was bought out by Kendall Pharmaceuticals. Kendal has very different ethics than PAT.  Here is where the story gets frightening.I recommend this book for age 14 and up. I recommend this book for anyone who wants to see how companies work, and why we should prevent companies from the ability to lobby our Congressmen. The Congressmen get a kickback from the companies and sometimes bad and harmful things can happen.

I have had this book for awhile now. I read it and was questioning myself as to how to review it. Then I finally decided to just tell it like it is. I gave the book 3 stars because I knew most of it already and nothing to do with the quality of the book, which is very good by the way..I am 67 years old and my grandmother, who would likely be about 120 or so now lived with us until she died. She taught me most of what is in this book, so no, the book did not teach me anything new. That being said, if you are younger than I am and never had the benefit of your Grams wisdom and experience, this book will be superb for you. Those who like to go natural remedies, this is the book for you.The book is well written and explained. It is the type of book you would want to keep handy at all times.Enjoy your book folks.

One of the major things I love about Brit mystery books is that there is much more mystery and much less romance. This is something I am utterly thankful for. This author has done a superb job with this book and I recommend it highly for age 16 on up.DS Joy Marsh, newly promoted, is sent to Dover to work under DI Romney. Romney has a reputation as a cantankerous man but very good at his job.  The first night as his sergeant a brutal crime in town starts a chain of events that will test the strength, resolve and the detective in both March and Romney.  Marsh has a good teacher in Romney, and Romney comes to respect and trust Marsh as they try to solve this case.The story is well written, explained  and easy to follow.The characters are well described and easy to understand.You are going to love this book folks. Happy reading..

it has been a little over a week since I tried reading this. In fact, I was not going to review it because my review is going to be totally negative. I gave this a 1 star simply because the author wrote it and nothing more. I find it flabbergasting that this work should come out of a female. I downloaded this book knowing the rating was Explicit. For me, there is a  bog difference between explicit and a XXX rating, AKA raunchy. This book is raunchy and I could not ring my self to read it further than about 25%. In good conscience I can't recommend this book for any age. I did not like it at all.

This is the 2nd in this series and I have read both and not been disappointed with either. .The story is well written, easy to follow and flows smoothly.The characters are well explained, and you will find yourself relating to them easily. I like the character of Quincy, our main character, especially.All Quincy wants is to make a success of the flower shop and a wonderful romance with Alex Cooper. The problem is that with Alex's job and Quincy planning weddings and trying to run her business, there are many road blocks. Every time things start to get hot and heavy they are interrupted.Despite the fact that Quincy promised Alex she would stay out of crime solving, when one groom is missing and the other becomes the prime suspect, Quincy has no choice but to try to solve the mystery.  Just when Quincy thinks nothing else could go wrong, a person from Alex's past comes back to haunt them both.Then the ending, oh what an ending! I refuse to spill the beans here folks. It is just too good. I can't wait for book 3 in this series. Ms Adams has yet to disappoint me, so I do look forward to it.I recommend this book to age 16 on up. There is one love scene, but it is not described. You get told they went to bed, then you get told they got up. No cuss words. This is just a really good book.

I just finished this book and found it warm, touching, humorous, sad, and loving. This is a clean cut story, so none of you have to fear cuss words, or descriptive love scenes. For Cammy and Race, the author just says they made love.The story is well written, flows smoothly, is easy to follow and understand. This is a story of fate, or another word would be kismet. I can't go further in the kismet thing or I would blow the whole ending for you and it will mess up your enjoyment of reading this story.You are going to love the way Cammy is written. She grows in this story to be a strong woman who becomes well equipped to live life. After you get a bit into the story, you will come to love Race too.When Cammy's husband of 25 years comes to her and says he is in love with another woman, Cammy is devastated.as any of us would be. She spends the requisite time wallowing in self pity and not accepting phone calls or answering her door.  Her husband Race comes to see her to 'talk' to her and get the divorce going. Cammy asks who the woman is. He finally tells her. Cammy finds herself going to face her, like some of us would do. I have to compliment the author here. I know this is a story and I found myself wanting to slap this 'mistress' silly.Cammy's friends decide to take her on a trip to St. Gabriel. She grudgingly agrees. Once there Cammy falls in love with the place.And the story continues if you read the book. Can't say more or it will wreck the story for you.I recommend this book highly for about age 16 on up. It is a wonderful read.

For only having 154 pages, this book is jam packed with action, adventure and mystery. You are going to be sad when Jake Sullivan is having his troubles. You are going to be even more sad when things get to the bottom of the barrel for Jake. Then, as things start picking up for him, you will be elated. Jake is a good man who has had a corrupt politician set him up.The story is well written, it flows smoothly, and is a real page turner. You will start and not put it down until you finish. The characters are well written and defined.Jake had the world by its tail. He was the chief prosecuting attorney in the Miami office of the Justice Department. Jake had a strong moral side and nobody could understand what happened to him. Jake takes on a high profile case when his drinking and obsession with the horrible side of the crimes involved the case is thrown out of court and a killer goes free. Shattered, Jake takes off for Key West and starts a small practice fighting marine insurance companies. Until one day..........  buy the book to read the rest....This story is suitable for age 16 and up. It is a really good story and you won't want to miss it.

I usually never have trouble keeping up with who the characters are until this book. By 38% read I was at a loss, so I stopped reading the book. This is a first for me, so not even sure how to write the review.The story was well written, but very hard to follow due to too many people involved. The plot, in and of itself, is a good one. You are involving 3 generations here, and also sisters, cousins and so forth, so in writing you have to be very good in making it easy for your readers to follow. I don't feel you have achieved this at all. If it were up to me, and I do know it is not, I would start with the mother of the autistic woman, the child of the autistic woman, and eliminate the rest of the characters. Otherwise it is too confusing.I personally can't recommend this book as it is too hard to follow. Sorry.

This was a really great read. It was entertaining, well written, flows smoothly, well detailed and more. The characters are well written and explained. I have to admit I love the character of Roxy.A dying man speaks Roxy Parker's name as his dying words. These words place Roxy right in the midst of her most baffling and brutal mystery yet. Roxy does not immediately understand why a man she barely knows would utter her name in his dying breath. She has to find out what he gave her that holds the key to his murder. Is this key the reason she now has burglar who is tailing her? Th dead man's daughter pays Roxy a visit asking her to hopefully solve the case. by finding a missing photograph. Read the book so you can watch the story unfold.I recommend this book for age 16 and up.

The one thing I do not like is how the story cuts off and we have to get the next book to see what happens. Yes, I do know this is a prequel. Thing is the story is so great that it is very hard to be left off right when the harder part for Allie is coming up.The title, Rumors, is an accurate depiction of what goes on in this book. Teens can sometimes be nasty beings with their talking behind your back. Like all tales, they get distorted beyond belief. Unless dealt with, the rumors can become the truth. Sadly, for Allie, talking about things is no longer possible since Maddie's death. Maddie was Allie's little cousin who died in an accident when she fell into the water. Try as she might, Allie could not quite grasp Maddie's hand and Maddie drowned. Allie made it out by the skin of her teeth. If any of you has ever been the lone survivor of a accident when the survivor was a loved one, you know what Allie went through, Add the fact that Allie is a teen, you can times her problems dealing with this by 3.Her Dad calls her almost at the beginning of summer with an ultimatum. If you want college money, come with me and my new wife and step-son to that same lake where Maddie died. Allie balks, but she feels she has no choice but to go if she wants to go to college.Is her Dad right? Will this help Allie onto the path of healing? The next book will tell the story and it is on sale now.This book, except for a couple kisses and a one time drinking, is a clean book. I would recommend it for age 14 on up. It is also a good teaching tool on how to deal with problems.

This is a really good story that requires just a tad of work on it. You left MacKensie in the hospital and we never learn what is wrong with her eye, or even if it can be fixed. Did I miss that part?This story is well written, well explained, flows smoothly, and grabs you from start to finish. The characters are believable almost completely. I say almost because I have to wonder at the percentage of people who would have turned that money in.Vincent Fox, in his 80's, has self-published a book. This book has some of the residents scouring the beaches for Al Capone's treasure. When Fox suddenly goes missing, Sheriff Ray Elkins and Detective Sue Lawrence are hit with a complex web of facts and fictions to get through. Along the way they find new information about a decades old unsolved murder.Get the book and see what happens and if they find the treasure.I recommend this book for 18 on up.

I do know this is fiction, but I think this work of fiction is messing with the Catholic religion in excess. Let's face it. If purgatory was like this fictional purgatory, nobody from purgatory would ever get to heaven. And I repeat, I do know this is a work of fiction. Thing is the author has taken a Christian fact and played it to be dirty.The book is well written and flows fairly smoothly. The characters, while inappropriate for where they are supposed to be residing, are well written and easy to understand.I would only recommend this book for ages 21 and up. I would also stipulate that if you are a devout Christian, especially a Catholic, don't buy the book. You are only going to get really mad.

I was up until 2 a.m. reading this book because I just could not put it down. It grabs you from page one to the end. In fact, I found myself saying 'that's all, I want more' at the end. There is humor, life's lessons, small town lif and more in this book. You will either love or hate Gertie. I personally found her amazing.The story is well written, flows smoothly and is easy to understand. The characters are true to small town people. I know because I was raised in a small town.Gertie Thump is what we used to call a pariah. She has made it her mission in life to correct all the town's citizens when they do wrong, even if they barely do wrong. She has made herself the most hated person in town. Even the police chief does not want to take her calls anymore.The only person who can tolerate her is the town Deputy Sheriff Seth Randal. Seth has made it his mission to bring Gertie back into religion. Will he be successful? You have to read the book to find out.I do recommend this book for all ages. It is fun, lighthearted. and interesting.

This book is well written, flows smoothly and is easy to understand. The characters are typical small town, easy to relate to, and well written.When Bekki catches her cheating boyfriend in the act, she decides to return to her home town. Here, in Harroway, she hopes to mend her broken heart. Harroway is a quiet town where nothing usually happens, that is, until Bekki moves back. Bekki's mother wants to retire and Bekki will take over and run the family hair and beauty salon. When the owner of their rival beauty salon, Daisy, is found dead after Bekki threatens her, Bekki is under suspicion for murder. As it turns out Bekki's old flame, Nick Malonie, is now a police detective. Will Bekki stop interfering and let Nick do his job of proving her innocent? you need to buy the book to find out.I recommend this book for age 14 on up. It is a good story and light reading with no sex or cuss words.

Okay, I got to 35% read and gave up. I could not deal with the massive amount bad language and sexual references.Sad part is that this could be a really great story if you eliminate the above. I am not a prude and I can usually deal with an amount of bad language and sexual references. thing is that there is just too much in this story.Frankly, I would not recommend this for most women. Men would likely find this story grand. I do not. I would rate this X.

Sentey Sport Earbuds Audiophile Tyon LS-4205 provide great sound quality. I have been very successful with Sentey products, no surprise these were a hit for me. I like the design of these earbuds, their appearance and ease of use works well for me. Attractive in appearance, controls are on the cord allowing easy access. Three sizes in earbuds to select from for your comfort/fit. The sound is outstanding especially given the price point. Great bass, no distortion, even through high volume clarity remains. Plus they are great for working out, they stay put through vigorous activity. Great quality for your money.Product received at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

Power of the Matchmaker is a prequel for a new series that will release one new book each month in 2016.The story tells of Mae Li, the matchmaker. Mae Li faces heartbreak along with hope and love. Mae's strength is admirable, her selflessness is a major draw of this courageous young woman, you'll be captivated instantly.A wonderfully written novella, with a compelling and fascinating character. I didn't want the story to end, although I will be anxiously awaiting other installments in this series, I wish the entire series were available now. Only a taste of what's to come and I'm already hungry for more.

The C+F Vagabond packing cubes ease the pain of packing. I'm am an organizing fiend, needless to say these cubes feed my organization hunger.These transport easily, a handle at the top allows you to carry the cubes to location to location without a hassle or even ease into suitcase without much effort. I like the dual zipper aspect, once again allowing quick and easy access to items. Zippers are sturdy too. I like the mesh pockets. Waterproof, rip proof nylon, the medium size is perfect, especially if you're a minimalist packer. Well constructed, durable. Plenty of space so you can organize items to your liking. Highly recommend, after using these cubes you'll love packing. I keep a cube in my car with seasonal clothing in the event of emergency, great for camping, beach anywhere to keep items organized.Product received at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

I3C Anti-Theft RFID Blocking Credit Card & Passport Holder Protector Sleeves provide protection from thieves. Decorative, easy to slide card in and out, I found it best to use one sleeve per card, inserting two is too tight for my liking. Well constructed, nice material both inside and out. The sleeves fit into various size wallet slots without issue, you won't need to take scissors to create a perfect fit. Plenty to cover the average consumers plethora of credit cards PLUS a passport sleeve which is also included. Can't go wrong with added protection these days.Product received at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

Inlife Decorative Doorstop is not only attractive but durable, and well constructed. Nice change from the unsightly standard rubber doorstops available. The rubber slats grip on a variety of surfaces - hardwood, tile, carpet. Easy to place and remove with the handy attached 'handle' accessory.I received product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

Great bowls, easy to clean, collapsible for travel and storage. Made well, durable, nontoxic. I failed to pay attention to the size (my bad). Sadly these were way too small for my Rottie. Suitable for felines, very small dogs or other small critters. Vibrant colors,  great product all around.I received product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

Yoga Backpack Mat Bag by Gecko is my FAVORITE yoga bag! Kudos to the design engineering team for the minute detailed thought into constructing this bag to perfection.I'm a minimalist, I prefer to carry only the essentials. A big part of this is is contributed to lugging around extra weight weighing me down not to mention the discomfort. However, this bag is not exclusively for yoga use but for other uses allowing the wearer to carry items with great ease along with comfort.I like the fact this bag provides adjustable straps to securely hold yoga mats of any size and thickness with ease. You can adjust placement, height suiting your frame for ultimate comfort. The pockets accommodate a large variety of sized items. A cover for mat is included which is appreciated especially given the fact the composition of some mats are rather delicate and should not be exposed to natures elements. The padded laptop envelope is another welcomed feature. Water bottle holder has a pull string closure, another feature I appreciate.I loaded this bag with items I would never carry in order to test comfort. Let me say it was more than comfortable. I contributed the high level of comfort due to the engineering and placement of pockets. It seemed as if the weight was evenly distributed for maximum comfort. Even though I am a minimalist I have the option of toting items if need be. This fabulous bag is my yoga go to bag as well as my all around gym bag. No doubt on my next mammoth hike this will be accompanying me with its accommodating and comfort abilities.Workmanship is top notch, stitching, fasteners, zippers all well constructed. A very high end bag providing room and comfort. This will be your favorite carry all with a certitude. Can't recommend enough.Product received at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

Zero Grid Money Belt w/ RFID Blocking is EXCELLENT. Multiple features make this pouch superb. Comfortable with its adjustable belt, not strangling your waist, it's rather elasticize so it moves with you as opposed against you. The material is soft. The fit makes this very comfortable, the fasteners are placed in such a way they make fastening easy and adds to wearing comfort. Details make this pouch a winner.The numerous pockets allow for plenty of various items in size to be stored easily. There is a unique carabiner clip which secures your keys or other items you might want to tether. RFID protection is added peace of mind.Workmanship, quality, stitching, feel of material and overall smart design make this a travelers must. Extremely high end with a more than reasonable price point.Product received at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

Zero Grid Neck Wallet w/RFID is extremely versatile which is why I am a huge fan. The adjustable comfortable strap allows you to wear around your next, across your body or hide, you can secure on to belt as a wallet all possible with comfort and security. RFID is a bonus as well. Lots of good sized pockets with well made zippers to allow for plenty of storage with easy access. The wallet is also lightweight but durable, well made, stitching isn't an issue, great workmanship. The fabric is soft, noticeable is a front and back with slightly differing material indicating such. Great for travelers, secure way to carry belongings including cash without being obvious or easily available for miscreants. The numerous ways to wear this wallet scores high with this avid traveler.I received product at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

RIVBOS 806 POLARIZED Sports Sunglasses really do the job blocking sunlight. The 5 interchangeable lenses are easy to change and suit every condition possible. The glasses are lightweight with a rubberized nose bridge for added comfort. The case keeps every thing contained and protected. Included is a cleaning cloth and harness if needed for keeping glasses secure while wearing. Glasses are stylish, I wish more than 1 lens was polarized. I experienced no fogging as I heated up through riding, indicating ventilation. No distortion though lenses. Well made, durable. Great deal for quality and price point.Product received at a discount in exchange for my honest review.

These ear buds were pretty amazing. Easy to connect, amazing quality sound, makes you practically deaf when they're in your ears, and they fit comfortably... mostly. I couldn't get the left earbud to sit comfortably in my ear all the time, but it was something I could get over.I use these motorcycling and even in my helmet, at 80 mph, I could hear only the music. No wind at all... like I said. They make things very quiet.Unfortunately, I dropped them off my neck without noticing and a car ran over them. Funny thing is, they still worked after, even with the wires exposed on the left earbud and the internals popping out -- atleast, until the plastic failed and then the left stopped working. But the right kept working. AKA they're virtually bulletproof.I did notice a few instances where the sound cut in and out moving throughout urban areas, but nothing crazy.Just make sure to use the connector to tie them together so you don't lose them like I did -- they'll easily slip off your neck without notice. I recommend these for anyone wanting quality earbuds, but reserve 5 stars due to the uncomfortable left fit...

I prefer plastic cutting boards over wood to due arthritis in my hands. Plastic is much easier for me to deal with on all levels as opposed to wood cutting boards - handling, cleaning, design is user friendly with the handles/storage if desired etc. I expect grooves are inevitable but my limited experience hasn't been much more than the norm one would expect. Have not had any staining but I usually chop the basics which are nonstaining. I like the three varying sizes and the drip lip. Dishwasher safe, textured to grip food and slip resistant, light weight. Suits my foodie needs, very satisfied.Product purchased at a discount for my unbiased opinion.

ThermoPro All-in-one Meat Thermometer exceeds my needs, very handy, it can be set based on what you are cooking - chicken, beef have varying internal temperature requirements thus you set the desired temperature. I have the option of using a timer or program it to desired setting (both Fahrenheit and Celsius available). AAA batteries included which is greatly appreciated. The thermometer is easily contained in a handy box with a magnet for extra storage options. Gotta say this is clearly more than your standard meat thermometer with its high tech capabilities. Very pleased with its workmanship, ease of use and smart functionality and practicality. Highly recommend.I received this product at a discount for my honest and unbiased feedback

I am a huge fan of essential oils, I have a diffuser in nearly every room. I find them relaxing while purifying, refreshing and moisturizing the air. The Lenova diffuser is easy to use hands down. The optional LED light feature provides a soft ivory glow creating a functional yet relaxing functionality. The diffuser lasts up to 5 hours shutting off automatically when reservoir is dry. Extremely quiet, perfect size and once again easy to use, not a lot of parts to deal with. My only gripe, I wish the cord was a bit longer, my outlets are a distance from where I have areas to place diffuser sadly, also including a ''measuring' cup would be convenient. Simple design allows the unit to fit comfortably with any decor, well made, instructions could use editing, however, the unit is virtually self explanatory. Very satisfied, would recommend for price, ease and design along with its enjoyable benefits.Product provided at a discount for my unbiased review.

Outstanding quality. The bracelet is stunning, the stones are brilliant. Weight is of substance, looks and feels high end. Excellent craftsmanship. Sizing runs appropriate, I have exceptionally petite wrists, bracelet is large on me but nevertheless it's gorgeous. Highly recommend this vendor.Product received at a discount for my honest review

A nostalgic coming of age story of recent college graduate Mark Amici.It was great reading a coming of age store of a male, I was hesitant at first thinking it would be an Animal House affair but it was far from it. Sure I was submerged into the depths of the male world, however it wasn't hard to stomach.Mark Amici is an all around great guy - ambitious employee, dutiful son, loyal friend and a great potential romantic partner. He's surprisingly mature and grounded for his age. He's classy, honest and willing to listen to others, he's completely endearing.His persistence in securing employment, and a girlfriend I found relatable and humorous. He has a great attitude and takes his licks and quickly moves on. The book has many tender moments along with humors instances.I was well established in the early nineties, however I did bond with Mark in a few ways. Given his personality of over analyzing and holding on to the past somewhat limited his growth which is the polar opposite of myself. Nonetheless reading of Mark's journey was enjoyable. No doubt this young man has a bright future ahead. As the story progresses Mark and his friends evolve and move on as life, career, choices pave the way for independence, opportunities and establishment.Wasn't thrilled with the heavy hand in sports, however, it's what most men enjoy so I was a sport about it. I also felt it could have been shorter yet it was a satisfactory read.Patz smartly writes of a young adult venturing out into the big bad world as he navigates his way in career, love, life and family. Revisiting the pre-tech days was a blast, NSM's, Clinton presidency, brought many smiles to this reader.

OUTSTANDING collection of short stories. I love to sink my teeth into exceptionally written hardboiled, noir, gritty masterpieces and I was more than fulfilled with Jordan Harpers stellar writing talent.Harper manipulates language shaping and forming it into amazing prose. His creativity cannot be denied. His style possesses a beautiful brutal in your face slap, and at other moments its stark, smooth and melodic, highly detailed and visual as well. EVERY story in this collection is amazing with its various substance.Character development, hardcore narratives, revisiting characters from previous stories in the collection, repeating characters, each dealing with violence in their individual circumstances. Jordan captures the required ingredients to craft powerful stories and characters. I anxiously await more from this gifted writer, Jordans abilities should be highly noted. Incredible writing and reading!

Absolutely beautiful sweater. It's simple yet the gold toggles add posh. The sweater is unbelievable soft. Very comfortable, lightweight, perfect for an AC environment without causing you to overheat, handy when the evenings are cool, or wear to look pretty or dress up your ensemble. The smart design is great as a layering piece to almost any outfit. The workmanship is quality, no issues with stitching, very well made, no loose threads or snags. I had no issues with dye rubbing off on my clothes. I washed by hand and dye held as well as shape, no shrinkage. I find the sizing running on the small side (I'm an XS and the M was a tad too big demonstrating it runs small), use as consideration when ordering. Great gift, super comfy no doubt it would be enjoyed. Price is wonderful considering workmanship and design. Would order more items from this vendor using this sweater as my benchmark.I received this product at a discount for my honest and unbiased feedback

I prefer Proimb Anidea Silicone Heat Resistant Grilling BBQ Gloves over the traditional cloth/insulated type, the reason being is the grip factor, and not as bulky and awkward while handling items. Providing protection from heat while also providing amazing gripping action, no slippage a cause leading to many of my kitchen mishaps. Great for hot uses as well as cold. A plethora of uses, easy to clean, waterproof and dishwasher safe, BPA free lots to appreciate.My uses: shelling lobsters, draining boiling water, carving a roast, digging into the deep freezer scrounging around for my selection, removing casseroles dishes, broiler dishes etcMy only complaint - the ONE SIZE FITS may not apply to all, certainly didn't work for all in my household. My hands are long and slim so I had no issues, a member of my family has ham hock hands so these didn't fit. I'm sure my case is the exception but still consider the sizing issue when ordering.  I'm more than satisfied with these gloves.I received this product at a discount for my honest and unbiased feedback

What an outstanding book. A brilliant adjoining of history and mystery with an extremely intriguing main protagonist.No doubt Hart spent painstaking time researching due to the attention paid to the smallest of details. You feel every bit of eighteenth century China lending a tactile feel in atmosphere alone. I enjoyed the mystery but the heavy history element captured my attention an added a dimensional ambiance to my reading adventure. The small remote village feel gives you a true essence to China, culture, traditions, people as opposed to the opulent distraction of a big city life.Li Du is fascinatingly intriguing. We know he is an upper class intellectual in exile but the exact reason in unknown, we are privy to scattered bits of the big why. He takes on the unintentional role of sleuth as he attempts to name the culprit in the murder of a Jesuit. Hart wonderfully describes Jesuit attitudes and those of the local people towards the Jesuits.The mystery kept me guessing until the end, enthralling enough to maintain my interest. Plenty of secondary characters fully developed allowing for constant guessing in naming the actual evildoer.I look forward to more of Li Du as well as much more of this time period and of China. Hart displays strong writing, smart plot matched with an economically cerebral main character Li Du. Outstanding research, cannot emphasize this fact enough.

The best part of this book, the way Stewart provided the backstory of Constance's accidental stumbling into position of deputy sheriff. Constance evolves and ferrets who she is in her self-discovering sojourn as we read of one inspiring woman tapping into her authentic self.Constance, a maverick, fascinating, in short a remarkable woman. A woman refusing to fit into societal expectations, norms. Constance wanted to pursue a career, however, her mother disagreed with her desires, as well as the era proving difficult. Infrequent snippets of her past reveal threads weaving this woman into who she truly is today. The much younger version of Constance is a sharp contrast to the mature woman we are privy to, her attempt in navigating life leading to a few dicey situations on the precipice of ruin, fortunately her family serves by her side.The reader will receive a crash course in the happenings of circa 1914, Stewart creates a vivid setting complete with detailed accouterments. The tension of females is felt as time warrants change as women demand and fight for more than their predecessors. Constance's bravery and courage for nonconformity must have caused her peers to pause, perhaps they lacked the determination Constance possesses, once again she inspired even the ones remaining silence yet wishful.The pace felt sluggish, also a lot of peripheral scenes distracted and dragged in certain portions, really serving no merit translating to padding as opposed to purpose.Stewart provides a smart take on an incredibly new-fashioned woman.

A memoir of Chen Guangcheng the blind Chinese activist who inspired millions with the story of his fight for justice and his belief in the cause of freedom.Chen Guangcheng is a man full of drive, determination, fighting for the basic human rights of others, he is quite an inspiration, an unsung hero. Undeterred by the consequences of his government or politicians he takes on hard-hitting issues  rights for the disabled, polluted water, forced sterilization and abortions.Chen Guangcheng provides the reader with his challenging background, despite his blindness he finds a way to compensate and make use of his other gifts with steely determination and grit to fight for justice. Suffering prison for four torturous years for his activism accompanied by beatings, unimaginable conditions and general cruelty he survives. His mettle tested once again as he endures years of house arrest where he makes a heroic escape ready to continue his battle for justice to all.An enthralling read from the first page. One mans story of a successful fight for justice no matter the trials and tribulations faced proving your voice can make a huge difference in improving issues along with your quality of life.

pureGLO Konjac Facial Sponge does in fact gently exfoliate your skin no matter the pressure used you won't discover your facial skin cut or skinned. My skin looks polished, feels smoother and dead skin once visible has now been removed, and feels super clean, glows. The size of the sponge is perfect allowing to scrub all the intricate areas large sponges can't reach, perfect to grip on to as well. The fact that it is 100% natural and eco friendly is highly appealing. The sponge comes with two suction hooks as the sponge itself has a 'hanger' attached so air drying is easily accomplished. Wonderful sponge, I hope pureGLO comes out with a Konjac body sponge! Super easy to use just wet sponge until soft and buff away to glowing radiant skin, viola simple. Highly recommend this natural effective sponge.I received this product to test and review in exchange for my honest opinion.

Instareads really summarizes the book quite well. I did in fact read 41 and found Instareads provides an excellent summarization of the book without revealing so much you won't consider perusing the book, rather it gives enough to adequately entice the reader with highlights lending a fair and broad perspective. Basically the barebones is in Instareads and the actual book contains the minute details and intricacies for both emphasis and enjoyment. Bottom line Instareads is a wonderful tool in deciding to read the actual book or perhaps pass. As an avid reader and blogger I find it resourceful and useful in adjusting my TBR and/or passing books I feel aren't the right fit. Handy all around, useful.

The Hopsooken Travel Neck Pouch is extremely versatile. Not limited for travel use, I use this for my many athletic pursuits. I'm a motorcyclist so this is a savior for me. There are times I don't want to carry a handbag or wallet due to my activity, however, the Hopsooken allows me to carry my items easily and securely, my hands are free!! The adjustable neck toggle allows the perfect fit, comfortable too. Well made and easily wipes clean. Waterproof and durable which I appreciate, lightweight too. Zipper is easy to work, RFID barrier is a HUGE plus, I like the window ID holder, plenty of pockets to story an array of items even a cell phone. Nice to have all important material in one secure location without needless rummaging, allows for easy and convenient access. Great size not cumbersome at all, although I only carry what I absolutely need, I'm a minimalist, this pouch can hold a lot. I prefer the neck pouch over fanny pack, safer and discreet - easily hidden under garments without being obvious. Highly recommend, especially for hands free freedom while keeping items secure. Great gift most would enjoy.One suggestion, a compartment with credit card holders, would be very handy.I received this product to test and review in exchange for my honest opinion.

Love this spray. It works like a charm. I enjoyed the original citrus scent, I enjoy this new rose/strawberry scent too. Four pumps will do the job, the spray is concentrated, lasts quite a while. A spritz will freshen any room, sink, trash a multitude of uses not limited to bathroom. Highly recommend, great for travel too. Both scents smell equally heavenly.I received this product to test and review in exchange for my honest opinion.

Impressive design. The flower design is very intricate and detailed, absolutely gorgeous. Very sparkly, perfect size for my petite face and ears. Glamorous yet great for everyday, timeless design. Post is a great length, and sits at top of earring as opposed to center of earring, I prefer post at the top seems to balance earring better. Beautiful earrings, received loads of implements. Jewelry appears well crafted. Earrings came in a lovely jewelry box, looking very high end. Would make a thoughtful gift, really quite pretty, I'm thrilled to wear these.I received this product to test and review in exchange for my honest opinion.

I'm a fan of rose gold so I am partial to these earrings. The CZ's sparkle and are very clear, the rose gold really frames the CZ's.
