Some of the best scenes are when Flannery sets out to talk to a political connection and he learns whose leaning on who.Like a lot of the Flannery mysteries, this one has a plot extremely reminiscent of old time paperback mystery novels.  A beautiful model disappears and Flannery starts nosing around and trying to find some answers.  On the way, he trips over a corpse, a retired madam, a lonesome salesman, a photographer and a well-connected politician.  And this model might not be as innocent and pure as Flannery once thought.Campbell does a great job of setting out the narrator's voice and placing this story in the neighborhoods of Chicago.

This is an absolutely terrific book that should have wide appeal to many mystery readers.  Campbell has taken many classic Hardboiled detective themes and managed to wrap them in an entirely new package and, in doing so, he has created a detective novel entirely unlike anything else out there.  Here he has the dogged investigator working on his own with all of the bureaucrats and the mobsters warning him off.  He has a story about corruption and girls who come to the big city expecting to make a new life only to end up in the morgue because that ended up being the most convenient way to shut them up.  This essence of this tale can be found in dozens of fifties paperbacks.What makes the Jimmy Flannery stories unique are that Flannery is narrated in perfect cadence capturing his Irish Chicagoan persona.  Flannery is a precinct captain in the old patronage system of Chicago where votes were bought by doing favors like greasing the wheels so a fireman who drove his car into the lake after having a few too many thirty days short of earning a full pension at thirty years can rest in peace knowing his widow is taken care of.  Favor for favor, markers being offered, this is Flannery's world, a world starting to change with the old neighborhoods changing.But what happens when a bomb goes off at a clinic and a young girl and an old woman dies in his precinct and everywhere Flannery turns someone is trying to squealch the investigation and Flannery may be like a junkyard dog once he gets his teeth into something, but at a certain point can he fight the entire power structure of Chicago.But it's not just the Davey and Goliath one man against corruption and evil story that makes this book.  It's all the neighborhoods and the bars and the hangouts and all the people in this neighborhoods from all these different backgrounds that Campbell brings to life.Campbell took a large risk having part of the plot revolve around the bombing of an abortion clinic, but he managed to humanize people involved on all sides of the issue.At bottom, this book is simply a top notch mystery and stands with the best of them for its well crafted plot and for a writing style that just pulls you right in.

The Girl With The Sweet Plump Knees is a terrific old-style paperback private eye novel.  You might think this one was a soft, cozy take at first with all the light banter and hanky panky between Pete Schofield and his sexy redheaded wife Jeannie.  However, there's much more to this novel including a full-on boxing tale, an active riding ranch, a pair of hoods, a blonde babe in a fast car, gambling, strip clubs, and murder.  This is a fast-moving and well-written tale and just an all around top notch read.  Dewey knows how to tell a story and how to tell it well.  Even the lighthearted portions of the story are good.  Recommended read.

Viva Labs The BEST Doctor Recommended DHA Prenatal supplements.This item was given to me for my review.I will not even pretend that I have been taking these supplements long term. This is a new supplement to me, so I can only share what I have observed short term. DHA for adult brains has shown promise in reducing inflammation, as well as impacting the brain's structures and signaling systems. Additionally, DHA has been used to prevent migraines in teens and adults. I am taking DHA for brain health and to prevent migraines. The pills are gels and very easy to take, and I can easily take two tablets at the same time, once a day as directed. I have a hard time swallowing pills, so this was a nice surprise for me. In the short term, I woke up without my usual background headache in the AM for the first time. There is no way to know if this will continue over the coming months, or at what regularity, but it is the first product I have tried that seems to have some research to support it. I am hopeful. So, my initial impression of this supplement is that it shows great promise and is easy to use in my daily life.

This item was given to me for my review.I use latex gloves for several activities like chopping raw chicken, painting, cleaning our drain, and pooper scooping the yard. I have never tried these Ammex XNPF Xtreme Blue Nitrile gloves before, or any nitrile glove. I find these to be much more comfortable than the latex. Possibly because they are cut a bit bigger, and possibly because they feel thicker and more sturdy. I prefer these gloves for comfort, yet they function just they way I need them to.

This item was given to me for my review.Dogs like to crunch water bottles. At least, my dogs seem to be really into it. I thought that this toy would be good because it is basically a water bottle and a noise maker like you would find in a doll wrapped in material and with a stuffed head. This Bottle Giggler was grabbed out of my hand by my border collie/heeler, and she really had a good time with it. I could tell that she really loved the crinkling sounds it made as she bit it and tossed it around. However, though the bottle in it was more heavy duty than the water bottles I sometimes buy, after a few chomps, the bottle is flat and does not crinkle anymore. I would buy this item again, if it is not priced too high, but I would understand that it is not a toy that will last a long time at the same level it does when you first purchase it.

This item was given to me for my review.The Outward Hound Wobblerz Monkey Plush toy is not a really large toy, but is big enough for my 55 lb. bordercollie/healer/whatever mix. Marcy loves thinking toys, and she really gets a kick out of toys with kibble in them. This toy is a roly poly treat dispenser that does not hold a whole lot, but seems to keep Marcy busy for more than the few minutes a lot of toys do. The treats do not come out super easily, so, for a smart dog, this is a good point. I would not give this to a dog that guts stuffed toys, like my other dog, because its life span would be short. My only complaint is that I had a hard time screwing the bottom on and off, and initially removing the plug that allows the kibble to be dispensed. I would have liked it to be bigger, so it can hold more, but Marcy is getting fat, so maybe that is not such a bad thing. A cute little toy for a bored dog.

This book was given to me for my review.SPOILERS.There are not too many books written about the Dark Ages, probably because they were a bit grim at times. War was rampant, and living conditions were not as romanticized as the High Middle Ages came to be. Avelynn, by Marissa Campbell is an interesting historical novel about the Dark Ages,and Campbell does a good job describing the setting, living conditions, government and general customs of the time. Avelynn is a good historical, and even a love story, but it is not a romance. Not unless your idea of romance are a few quickies in the woods. However, if you are wishing to read a good historical with good descriptions and a more true to life love story of the time, this is a good one to read. It is not, however, a PG book. There are some descriptions that definitely fall in to the Mature Audience category. It was, after all, a brutal time. I enjoyed the novel as a whole, though I wish the author could have dumped the "high spirited heroine equals stupid decisions" trope, that I am growing so incredibly tired of. The heroine made one mistake after the other, and if the rest of the story had not been so strong, I would have tossed the book. But, the rest of the story is very interesting, and I found I could not put the book down. This is a book for someone who really wants to come away with a feeling for the time, and who does NOT want a cozy romance.

This novel was given me for my review.SPOILERS....Being brave and trying new things that frighten you should not be synonymous with being foolhardy. However, the author of How To Be Brave, by E. Katherine Kottaras, has her heroine, Georgia, doing things that are less brave and more self destructive. Accepting drugs from the one girl in school that you don't really know but is obviously messed up is foolhardy. And, I have a hard time with how Kottaras treats the issue of drugs in the story. The "people are going to make mistakes" defense is true, but can, also, be a weak attempt at downplaying the kind of behavior the 12 Steps walk you through. Additionally, when Georgia tells her old world dad that she might do pot and drink alcohol in college, but those are her decisions, and he needs to accept that, I wondered why she would even mention it to him? It seems selfish. You plan on doing it? Okay, your decision, but show a little mercy, and leave him out of the loop. Frankly, it is one, of many, examples where I found Georgia to be self absorbed to the point of unkindness. And, what is that whole thing with the party? If you are THAT messed up, and you made THAT big a mistake, then why are you planning on a potential repeat performance down the road? Hello, a little self realization here! I loved the supporting characters, though. I even found Evelyn to have more depth and to be more of an empathetic character than Georgia often is. I loved the Dad, and I really think Daniel and Liss are interesting characters, too. Georgia is a mixed bag of nuts, but I did care about her story, her art, and her list,  and I enjoyed those moments when she has some emotional clarity, even if she seems to contradict herself at times. The story is interesting, especially the last half, but I was able to put it down and not come back to it for a while. Not my favorite of the many YA books I have read. I definitely do not expect young adults in these stories to not make mistakes. There would be no stories, if that were the case. However, the author seems to send a mixed message of what was learned in this situation. Her father obviously loves his daughter, but unconditional love does not mean unconditional agreement with a child's decisions, and I felt that Kottaras allowed Georgia to lay too much of the blame on her parents, while only accepting some of the blame, with justifications, herself. I get that being a teen is a somewhat self focused time, I totally understand what losing one's mother at that age does to one. I have been through all of it. However, there was a missed chance in allowing Georgia to be more honest with herself. The author came close, but, for me, just not enough.

This item was given to me for my review.I suppose everyone is looking for something different in a bathroom spray. I wanted something that had a nice scent but not of flowers. I mean, I have NEVER smelled a bathroom where flowers and poo make a good combination. Ew. I chose the Juniper scented Poor-Pourri Before You Go Toilet spray because I thought it would be a nice choice, and since it is supposed to be used BEFORE you begin, it needed to be a smell that did not give me a migraine like most bathroom sprays. Well, I could not smell Juniper in the spray. Normally, that would have knocked the spray down several stars, except what I DID smell, a sort of citrus/ginger smell, is so very pleasant and efficient at covering the NOT pleasant bathroom smells, I gave this product four stars. What is more, the scent lingers in the air for a while after use, so you can make your getaway with your dignity intact. I don't suppose it will fool EVERYONE, but it certainly beats the alternative of other sprays I have tried. The bottle is purse size, though I would suggest putting it in a sandwich bag to keep the essential oils from getting on your purse. This is a nice product. I think I would like to try other scents in this brand to see what the differences are. However, I, personally, could not discern a particular juniper scent, though the citrus and ginger may have overpowered it. Very nice.

This novel was given to me for my review.The pace is steady, the hero is someone one can admire and empathize with, and the quest is noble. The Letter for the King is a good, old fashioned adventure story, that is long on interest but short on anything that would offend most parents. Written in the 1960s, the storyline of a young man on a quest to bring a secret letter to the King, is old, yet always new. Tiuri, our young hero, is a genuinely good guy. He is everything one should be in a knight, yet he is not a knight. He gave up that chance by doing the right thing, at the right time, for the right reason. A lot of what drives this story are the decisions people make and the consequences those decisions bring. Another theme is that while the goal of the quest is important, so is the journey itself, and Tiuri's journey is as much a pilgrimage, as it is an adventure story. The story is written in a linear fashion, like journey stories of yore. Tiuri, and later his friend Piak, are constantly faced with how to reach their destination alive. Yet, the story, while involving some violence, is not really a violent story. It was nice to be caught up in a plot without grisly detail. The only negative in the story, for me, is that there were a few spots where the author got bogged down in too much detail over things I was not particularly interested in. However, the rest of the story is interesting and fun. I would have read this story to my sons. A perfect night time book for a wide range of ages. The pace is soothing, but it kept my interest through most of it.

This item was given to me for my review.My family likes rice, and I usually make a slightly sticky medium or long grain rice similar to what we ate in Korea. However, I noticed that several recipes I have in my recipe books suggested using parboiled rice. Zatarin's Extra Long Grain Parboiled Rice is the first time I have used this type of rice, and I understand why the recipe books mentioned it. This rice did not get mushy when I made Arroz con Pollo. The rice held its shape, and it tasted good. I plan on using it for those recipes that are multiple ingredients because it really did work out much better. However, for gumbo and other dishes, I will be using the stickier rice. After 40 plus years of cooking, I am glad I finally know what the buzz is about parboiled rice!

This item was given to me for my review.I am the un-fun house. My kids are grown, and when little ones come over, I have nothing for them to play with. I remember that my brother and I absolutely LOVED blocks growing up, but the set I bought my boys went through two dogs (sometimes literally), magic markers, lost pieces and something sticky. I wanted a nice set to have on hand. Well, I don't think this block set is just for kids. It is really nice with unusual shapes and a instruction book for building. It comes in an open wooden box for storage, and there are a LOT of blocks in the set. The colors are bright and cheerful. This is a more mature block set with smaller pieces, so it is not appropriate for anyone who still puts items in their mouths. It is not appropriate to leave out around your dogs, since some dogs have the common sense of a tic tac (yes, Clover, I mean you.) However, it is a great set for any child....or adult....who likes to build, and who has decent fine motor skills. I found building with the blocks rather soothing....when the cats were otherwise occupied....but I, also, like legoes. All in all, I am very impressed. I think this is a great toy for a wide range of ages, about 4-5 on up.

I totally enjoyed this little story with the St. Mary's crew. It was funny, interesting, and maybe, even, a little thought provoking about how one life can influence the lives around them and the lives to come.

At first when I read this novel, I found myself really frustrated with the main character of Alison. She was such a whiny milquetoast. While the abuse and neglect she suffered was very sad, even I found myself frustrated with her character. When Fred, the butcher, comes into the picture, Neale creates an unlikely, but totally lovable hero. This is when the novel takes an upswing, as the plot begins to take on some depth. I normally love a Cinderella story, but Alison was actually really self pitying in a selfish sort of way. Often, she seemed to have little regard for the feelings of others which would have made for a more empathetic heroine. However, it began to change about halfway through, and then I found the book hard to put down. It was a cute story. Probably more like 3 1/2 stars, but I will round up. I wish Alison had not been so one dimensional, sad sack like at the beginning, but am glad it got better.

This product was given to me for my review.Okay, I know that there are a lot of people who cannot get past the taste of this product. I assume that our tastebuds are just different because I really like the flavor of Healthworks Raw Certified Organic Maca Powder. To me, this product taste like malt balls without being too sweet. I put mine in a barely warm cup of soy chai latte because the temperature is hot. However, I have read different things about whether to heat or not to heat. I am not really sure what the final consensus is on that. For now, I am taking it in warm chai, and this winter I will take it in hot chai. It is really yummy, and works well with these flavors. I barely notice the teaspoon I put into my cup, except for that slight malted flavor I mentioned earlier. I find that it does not give me migraines like coffee does, nor do I feel as jittery. I do, however, feel more alert. I have not taken this product for a long period of time, so I will update if I find long term results vary. For now, it is exactly what I was hoping for, and I am pleased that I do not need to take a large amount to feel that it is helping.

This item was given to me for my review.I am not familiar with Hemp Protein powder. I have not used the product before. When I saw this stuff, and its rather unappealing color, I was not exactly enthused to try it. However, I looked up Hemp Protein, and I liked what I read. I smelled the stuff, and I liked the smell. It has a grassy, organic smell that reminds me of the fields on our farm (where I know for sure we did not grown hemp!). I tried four tablespoons in a cherry smoothie I made that included frozen cherries, water, and a little unflavored whey protein. That was all. I really liked the flavor, The hemp has a nutty, oat-like taste, but milder. It was not overly chalky, and it did not overpower the cherries. It mixed in pretty well with just a little residual on the bottom of my glass, so that was a pleasant surprise. Often, protein powders do not mix in well, even though I put the liquids at the bottom. This product is a definite win for me. I am using it in other smoothies, and I will attempt raw cookies when I find the time. When that happens, I will post as to their success with this product. Yummy product. Well done.

GelPro Plush Floor Mat in Shagreen is a fabulous mat for hard surface floors. I have mine in front of my sink on ceramic tile, and it is so comfortable. The mat has a great, no slip backing that keeps the mat firmly in place. The gle portion is thick and flexible, much like a memory foam mattress. The surface is slightly textured, but waterproof. so that it is wipeable, yet nonslip. The color is, eh. Sort of an industrial color, but it is neutral, and works okay with the pinkish color of my tile. I plan on buying another mat for my husband for Christmas, since he has a standing desk, and this will be perfect. Very good product and a total back and joint saver.

I found Personality Hacker when I took their Meyers Briggs test (spelling?), then I got caught up in some of their other articles/posts. This is a really interesting and well done site. I am impressed. I not only found information pertinent to me, but I, also, found information that helps me understand other family members.

This item was given to me for my review.Per Fit Adult Briefs is a diaper type product that opens flat, like a diaper, and has soft mesh material sides, like what one finds at the top of regular baby diapers. This material is sheer and does breathe, which allows the product to be cooler than some adult diapers that extend the padding to the sides. However, this material is, also, flimsier, and harder to fasten if there is any problems with hand mobility. I have previous experience as a nursing assistant in a care facility, and I think this adult brief works more as a diaper and less as a brief. If one is bed ridden, then it works well, but, because of fastening issues, and fit, it seemed not as practical as other products might be. I did feel it is cooler than other briefs, but this would not be a product I would use if the individual was mobile and able to function on their own to any degree. It is the product I might consider for someone who is unable to function without out toileting help. The sides do refasten, since it is a loop tab similar to velcro, but it is awkward. I suppose advertising Prevails as a brief gives it a bit more dignity, but it just does not function as one. Still, worth a look if the patient is bed bound and over heats easily. Additionally, I dumped over a cup and a half of warm water into the brief and it soaked into the padding quickly and without leaking

This item was given to me for my review.Well, this is basically an easy to put together box that can be put just about anyplace where there is room. There is no bottom on it, of course, but you use gardening fabric on the bottom to hold the soil in, and to reduce discoloring. I have a discreet area by the garage where I do not care if it gets discolored, but I am using the fabric to help keep soil well contained. I bought this product too late in the year to use, since we are in 100 plus degree weather, and it would probably be kinder to just toss seedlings into the fireplace as try to plant them outside. However, I am preparing the area for spring. My frame will house herbs. It is the perfect depth for the same herbs I planted in pots, so I will double my plants next year. It is made to be easy to assemble, and it does not need special tools or anything extra. Not much more to say about a box, but it is nice to have and suits my purposes.

This product was given to me for my review.Jarrow Formulas Mastic Gum Veggie Capsules. Wellll, I am not sure what to say about this product. I cannot honestly say whether or not the product works for tummy upsets because I could not get past burping up the pine resin taste. I am not sure whether anyone else will think this smells and tastes like pine, but when I was growing up in Maine, we used to dare each other to eat pine resin, and there was even a pine resin gum at one time. Mainers tend to be hearty folk, and I think most of us suffered tongue damage from licking frozen swing sets, so our palates were not very sophisticated, but I digress. Mastic Gum reminds me of the taste of pine. Maybe not quite as strong as straight pine resin, since it is in capsule form, but I burped it up like the ghost of bad ideas past for the rest of the day. I tried it more than once because I want to be fair but I could not get past the burping. I don't know if this is a normal problem to have, but it is the one I had. I gave it a star for being easy to take and one for being natural. Love the idea of taking it, just not the reality.

This item was given to me for my review.The Swiffer Wetjet Floor Mop Starter Kit comes with the Swiffer Wetjet floor mop, a few scrub pads and a small bottle of cleaning fluid. It does not come with the four AA batteries that I finally figured out I needed. I am sure it is on the package somewhere, but I did not immediately see it. Actually, I NEVER saw it. (I now understand what my grandfather complained about.) I started off the first time with REALLY dirty floors. I didn't even wet mop them to get rid of any border collie fur dry Swiffering might have missed, and there is ALWAYS border collie fur....Maine coon fur....tabby fur, etc, etc, etc..... What I learned is that the Swiffer will clean, but it is best used after you have cleaned a high traffic area with a regular mop, then the Swiffer can be used to maintain the floor on a regular basis from then on. What I liked about the Swiffer is that it cleans without my needing to bend over to mess with the mop head. I rotate the mop pad when it is really dirty on one side, and toss it when it is thoroughly dirty. It seems to do a decent job of cleaning, but a better job of maintaining a floor rather than trying to play catch-up. I will start using it daily to keep on top of things. I purchased more pads and solution, and that is another reason to use it as maintenance. You need fewer pads if you keep on top of things, and this can add up over time. However, it is easier on the back than my rag mop. I won't be getting rid of that anytime soon, but I will be using both. So, it is a good product, but I still see a need for a regular mop to be on the premises.

I am a sucker for witty banter and police procedural novels. Throw in an unlikely but sweet romance, and I am hooked. My second reading of this book. I have read the four written in the series. I actually like this one even better on the second read and have enjoyed all, so far.

This 4th book in the series is a lot of fun. I adore the humorous banter between the characters, especially Paul and Kate. The murder plot was interesting, and I was caught up in the politics of the back story. This is a quick read. I wish the book had been longer, but it is still satisfying. I hope the author matures Kate's character a little more. The age difference is less of a problem for me, if she is not behaving like a 6 year old. Great fun. Look forward to the next one.

This item was given to me for my review.Rubbermaid RM-PL1W Folding 1 Step Plastic step stool is a clever little gadget and easy to use. The stool states that it holds up to 300 lbs. and I am no where near that, but I am not tiny, either. So far it has held me, and my 6'5 husband just fine. The stool really does not slip at all, like the description says, and I have tile floors that are slippery. Additionally, it folds up, easily, and is easy to unfold and set up. I can put it in that space between the fridge and wall that goes unused. While I will use it as a step stool, my main use will be for those things that I used to normally kneel and do, or bend and do. The stool is the PERFECT height for cleaning baseboards, gardening and other down to the ground efforts. I am really pleased about that. It does not have a large platform, but that is actually better for me, since it takes up less space. My kitchen is crazy tiny. It is enough space for my ample derriere to sit on, and that is enough. I am quite pleased, but extended use will tell me how it does over time.

This novel was given to me for my review. Kitchens of the Great Midwest by J. Ryan StradalWere I to have rated Stradal's novel over the first half, I probably would have given it four stars, at least. The characters, Lars, Eva, Fiona, Cynthia, and Jarl are weirdly compelling in their quirkiness. I loved Lars passion for both food and for his daughter, and passion and love, or the lack of both, are two of the themes in the story. This is a foodie book on one level, as the name might imply, but it is, additionally, about the sub-themes we often attribute to food, like nurturing, or abuse, or even apathy. However, about halfway through, it seemed that the book became darker, and there were scenes, like with the deer, that sickened me. There is, also, a lot of foul language, which I find takes away from some of the truly interesting and, at times, witty dialogue. One of my all time pet peeves in writing. Yes, some foul language may set a character or group of characters apart, but this was excessive. Some of the plot elements centering around death, grief, addiction and mental illness were repeated, probably to make a point, but, then again, it became grim. Still, Stradal writes well, as the first half of the book attests. I wondered as the book became more brutal, if the author had a point that I totally missed, or was going for shock value, or if the shock value of some of the scenes overshadowed what was probably a very interesting theme. I don't know. Definitely worth reading if you the negatives do not turn you off. However, though it is often hopeful, and has happy moments, it is often grim. Just so you know.

This book was given to me for my review.The ADHD Advantage by Dale Archer, MD, proposes to readers that there is a positive way to look at ADHD in young people and adults, one that gets largely overlooked by society's desire to treat ADHD as a disease, rather than a different way of thinking. Dr. Archer, who has ADHD, suggests that the pendulum for treating this learning difference has come to fall somewhere between the emphasis on medication and the non-med fear mongering of past years. Archer makes a strong case for everything that is right with ADHD and how this condition is good for individuals who have it, as well as society, at large. The book is full of examples from the famous to the not yet famous who have this ability, and the personal stories are a strong point of the chapters. After a bit of history is given, Archer explains, in multiple ways, that ADHD is only a deficit "in certain contexts" and is a large benefit in others. It is, in his words, a "superpower" for a lot of people (Howie Mandel, Terry Bradshaw, Michael Jordan, Steve Jobs, etc...), but needs to be understood to be effectively applied. Certain career fields are especially a good fit for ADHD types, like sports, the arts, the military (I attest to that), and entrepreneurship, and certain lifestyles keep non-neuro typical types from being bored, which can be the kiss of death for many. Chapters cover education and learning, jobs, relationships, medications and non-medical interventions. What the book is limited on is more detail for some of the chapters, as it can be considered more of an overview, though a very helpful one. Additionally, the book is strongly skewed toward men and those with ADD with Hyeractivity, than those who tend towards a less physically active, plain distracted form that tends to be predominantly women (well, as of this writing.....definitions keep expanding). I got a lot from the book for my guys, and even for myself, but will look elsewhere for a book predominantly on the ADD without hyperactivity. (Hope I have that straight.....I am not a doctor.) As a positive overview, this is a great place to start. The fact that the author talked about different ways to deal with ADHD without over-medicating or without painting medication as evil, as well as why it is okay to do without medications, is a breath of fresh air to me.

This item was given to me for my review.Fekkai Soleil Beach Waves Spray has a lovely, slightly citrus/herbal smell that is not too strong or overpowering. It sprays on as a light mist, and it left my hair shiny, with some curl. In general, I liked the spray, but I did notice that it made my hair look oily when I conditioned my hair first. For my fine, but abundant hair, it works better if I simply shampoo first, no conditioner. My hair felt soft and not sticky afterward. I liked the product, and I could see the benefit of using it as a leave in conditioner for the beach. It, also, works as a light conditioner for my blown dry hair, though it does change my curls to more wave than curl. I like it.

This book was given to me for my review.John Schlimm tells a sweet, and, thankfully, uplifting story about his friendship with a lovely nun named Sister Augustine. Five Years in Heaven is chronicles the conversations that take place between John and Sister Augustine about life in general, God in particular. It, also, chronicles Schlimm's journey toward understanding himself better and his purpose in the world. The conversations are not necessarily earth shaking, since books on simplicity, New Year's resolutions, forgiveness, God and man have been around for a long time saying much of what Sister Augustine shared, but there is something very sweet and reassuring about how she says it. It is obvious that Sister was a woman who walked the walk, and I loved her pithy comments like, "A closed mind is like giving the Devil a handful of grenades. Unfortunately, he has a pretty good pitching arm." Is the story profound? Not really. The topics do bear repeating. In general I really enjoyed the little story of this friendship, and I got teary eyed at the end, but I, also, felt that Schlimm self promoted a bit much, and I would have liked to have heard more about Sister Augustine. Still, sweet story. Definite improvement over some memoirs I have read lately. Worth a read.

This memoir was given to me for my review.Let me set the record straight. I really enjoy memoirs of people learning to overcome life's difficulties and gain insight. I chose Pieces of My Mother: A Memoir because it was based on a topic I understand well, a girl learning to live without her mother. The book began on the sad day when Melissa Cistaro's mother got into her car and just drove away, never to permanently, or even frequently, return. Cistaro does a good job of capturing that moment and every miserable vignette she shares afterward. I feel for her because she DOES get how sad and confused and hurt she is as a child trying to understand a broken mother. There were some moments when the author could find common ground with her mother as an introvert in the middle of mommy-burnout, but as a mother who loved enough to stay and hurt, it is obvious that there are some things that neither the author, nor this reader, can totally understand. Cistaro shares how her mother's leaving not only affects her, but, also, her brothers Eden and Jamie. This aspect of the book is well established in flasbacks showing small cruelties, self blame, and the need to cling, as well as references to current alcohol and drug abuses. The flashbacks are well written, but begin to feel like a rehash of the same theme. When she puts in the part about the kittens in the buckets, I had to set the book aside for a while, then skip ahead. I hate the book. I hate the total misery of reading it. I know the book description says it is "haunting yet uplifting," but it was an "uplifting" desert for me. How do you rate a book that you wish you did not need to finish? I don't feel like there is much more to say about the author's mother than that she was obviously an addict with emotional problems, and that is sad, but I think her ex-professor had it right when he said she was a bit of a con, as well. Again and again the flashbacks tell the story. She is broken, got it. Cistaro is, also, broken, though by the chapter Clear Lake, she makes the conscious decision to turn her life around. But, that is the end of the book. Hopeful? For her, yes, but I struggle to say I would suggest the memoir to others. If the purpose of the book is to help the reader see her mother's dysfunction and the disastrous consequences, then that was established. But, a whole book of sad scene after sad scene? Perhaps it was cathartibut for the author. I hope so.

This novel was given to me for my review.Oh, my, a new, first in series that is NOT boring! On a Ring and a Prayer is a first in series book with a brand new heroine, Jessie Stanton. The novel is about a 37 year old newly dumped wife who hires a beach bum detective to find her dead beat husband. The story is sweet and funny with a characters that it is easy to rally around. Danny is not the stereotypical beach bum/detective/love interest (and, yes, there is a stereotype). He has morals and a Christian belief system that is alluded to, but the author does not beat the read over the head about. Jessie is a bit of an ingenue of sorts, but she is not stupid. With the help of her good friend Piper, and new friends Amber, Danny and Riggs, she manages to to make a new life for herself. Though I am not particularly into fashion, I was interested in her new business, and the descriptions of the styles. Danny often comes across as a little too good to be true, until one finds out about his past. The only drawbacks, I felt, were slight. The Grampy flashbacks disrupted the flow of reading and were irritating and largely unnecessary (No offense, Grampy). I would have liked the ending to be more finished, but since the novel covered a lot of territory in setting the series up, I did not feel as dissatisfied, as I might have.  I would, also, in future novels, a final conclusion to the last chapter, and I would like to see more of Danny and a bigger emphasis on Danny's job, with more mystery. Still, as a set-up novel, this is very good, and I look forward to more of this series. Well, done!

This novel was given to me for my review.Personally, I love English parlor mysteries where the bodies turn up dead, and I don't have to get into too much detail about how. I love the dialogue, and I love the humor that is often apparent. Beyond Belief does have these elements. There is some genuinely witty dialogue, though it is not evident throughout all of the book. Still, I did like the humor and observations of some of the characters. I appreciated that this book qualifies as a cozy, since there was no real violence, other than bodies inconveniently turning up. You'd probably find more violence in an American commercial. However, Emily Castles, who is supposed to be the main character in the book, is about as faceless and nondescript a heroine as can possibly be not described. I have no idea what this woman looks like nor what sort of personality she has. She is simply a prop, with a notebook....and I cannot even tell you what the notebook looks like. Other characters had more description, but I did feel that the author could have spent more time giving the novel adjectives in almost every area. I believe this is the fourth in the Emily Castles mystery series, but I am not sure. However, the problem does not seem to be that I have read the novel out of order. There is simply a lack of detail, as though the book were hurried, though it could be for other reasons. Throughout the book, Dr. Muriel exclaims about how clever Emily is and how she will solve the murder, but I have no idea WHY she says this, since Emily seems to be just a temporary office worker, running around with a notebook. Even if the mysteries should be read in order, some background information or detail needed to be provided here for the other characters in the story. After a while, I began to think, "Shut up, Muriel."  Those times when deductions or conclusions are made, are sometimes senseless, based on information that either does not make sense or was not provided. An example would be Mandy suggesting that Emily was brainwashed. Brainwashed? Really? That is not usually the first conclusion I reach. Even if she meant hypnotizing, it made no sense over the phone, as it were. The fact that Emily entertained the idea made it worse. As for the person and reason for the murders, I was disappointed. There were some genuinely good red herrings, but the final reason was a fizzle for me. And, what was with the drawing room conversations while people were drowning? I watch BBC, and I am pretty sure there should have been a little more reaction, even from the stiff upper lip crowd. That was nonsensical. It might have been a stab at humor, but, though my sense of humor is rather macabre, I did not think this qualified as anything but lacking. So, why three stars, then? Smith has a dab hand for humor and droll observations. I like elements of the novel, and I am willing to admit that I may have missed something by not having read the first three books (though I am not sure that is going to happen now because some problems with the story have nothing to do with that). I don't want to blast a book that made me laugh out loud a few times. However, I would say to someone wanting to buy and read this particular book, that if they have not read any of Smith's other books, they should start at the beginning, and if they HAVE read the other books, this one may not (I don't know) be up to par. Borrow it from the library.

This book was given to me for my review.Prissy Elrod's memoir, Far Outside the Ordinary: A Memoir, is one of the most thoughtful, funny, sad, and uplifting stories of hope that I have read in a long time. There were times that Prissy/Christy exasperated me, but I could also relate to her. Sometimes, I have read memoirs where the author has been honest, but in doing so, has revealed that they may not be that nice a person in real life. Prissy is nice. She is not Mother Theresa nice, but she is nice in the way real, fallible people are. The cast of characters in her story add an almost surreal touch. It's true. You don't make stuff like this up! I loved Sallie and Du, and even poor Willie. I felt like Elrod was able to capture them with few words, and that is an art. I was often exasperated by their decisions and behavior, but not once did I think that I could not sit down over coffee with them and not be totally touched by their personal stories. Such a well done memoir. I laughed, I cried, I related. Prissy Elrod has a very nice touch with the written word, and I hope she expands her repertoire to fiction writing, perhaps drawing on the colorfulness, the goodness, and the brokenness of the people she knows in real life.

This book was given to me for my review.The Oleander Sisters by Elaine Hussey is the story of a close knit, Southern family on the verge of change, but battling past hurts. The basic synopsis has been done, so I would like to look at what worked and what did not work for me.The beginning of the book had a lot of dark foreshadowing, page after page of dark foreshadowing. The gist of this foreshadowing was that something bad was going to happen, only the author said it in several different ways, some more poetic than others, but all leading to a high level of repetition. While I understand that it was Sis' role in the family to be a worrier because she loved and wanted to protect everyone, her character verged on morose to the nth degree. However, perspective came from Sweet Mama and Emily, as well, so we were able to discern that they, too, felt like something bad was going to happen. And so on. It took me several chapters to get into the book, but, once I did, I really liked it. The plot began to build, and, as it did, the suspense, and the characters became more interesting. By the end, I really did feel the tension of the dastardly husband, the storm of the century and the sort-of love story, and I found that the novel went a lot faster. Hussey is not a bad writer. She is actually very good, but the beginning of the book was bogged down in repetition and a heavy handed attempt at building tension and hooking the reader. I am glad I read the book, and I would consider another by this author. Perhaps, though, the next one I would borrow, rather than buy.

This item was given to me for my review.Alisa Kaplan's story, Still Room for Hope: A Survivor's Story of Hope, is an incredibly inspiring story of survival in the midst of incredible pain and degradation. Others have summarized the book, and I won't attempt to do that. I will address what I liked and found difficult with the story. First, the story is amazing and Alisa is amazing. I honestly do not think I could have come through what she did as well as she did. I am impressed with her, her parents, and those people who had the strength of character to step forward and help her. I am reminded that ordinary heroes still exist and walk this earth. I appreciated the tone of voice in which Kaplan relayed her story. I found it to be neither too emotional nor too stoic. I should think that is a hard balance to maintain. My problem with the book, really, is in her tendency to want to get sidetracked and try to say too much at times when she needed to stick with her original point. The book was generally an easy and captivating read, but for that. I, also, had issue with some of the examples of forgiveness she gave. While I am amazed and humbled by a child who would open their home up to their abusive parent, I hoped that they did not have children. I felt that while the other examples she gave at this point were touching, I wish someone had pointed out that reaching out to your son's killer or your abuser needs to be God initiated, since a person can find themselves in a dangerous or manipulative situation. Sometimes the author was repetitive, and I would liked to have seen a good editor go through the book a bit more thoroughly. So, the story is TOTALLY worth reading. It's tense and touching and an amazing example of the ability of the human spirit, through God's love, to overcome the worst humans have to offer. However, the book is a bit rough in its writing style, and some additional understanding of forgiveness needed to be, in my opinion, explained, since the topic was rightfully brought up.
A little primitive in the writing style, but this novelized how-to book was very effective in showing how the Flylady system might work. I actually enjoyed it for that alone.

This book was given to me for my review.When I began this book, it seemed like it took me forever to just read the first 100 pages, and I thought it would be one of those disaster books that make you want to put match to paper. However, about the time Sister Giorgia entered the picture, I could feel that first flicker of hope. Up to that point, the book was feeling pretty grim, and Charles had not transformed into a character for whom I was feeling much empathy. The dialogue was strained between Charles and his ex-wife, and I sometimes was not sure what the characters alluded to in some of their cultural references. Sometimes, they seemed just as confused. Layer by layer, Charles, Pam, Alison, Cody and Giorgia display their own personal communication patterns, and it become clear that the lack of communication, and the ability to communicate, are shared by each one, though not always recognized. The underlying spiritual element was subtle but a strong ribbon throughout the story, with Sister Giorgia a rarely seen character that steals the scenes she is in, even though I can only make out about five words that she says. The book is tender, sad, happy, discouraging and hopeful. It is at times painful to read, too close to home, and wonderfully inspiring. I rarely give a book five stars, if I have trouble getting interested or understanding bits, but the slow build and my own problems understanding references and meaning fit so well in the overall theme of miscommunication, that I wonder if it was not the author's intent all along. This is a good story, quirky but touching. Very nicely done.

If you are new to or familiar with Flylady, or if you are drowning in the mess of your home, Hidden Treasures offers a visual example of what the Flylady routine can look like. Written as a fictional narrative of two women, this novel is not exactly highbrow literature, but, then, that would defeat its purpose and main strength. This is a self help book made more interesting by its format. The story is interesting and suspenseful, and I found that it was hard to just put down. It is a great idea.

This item was given to me for my review.Jeremiah, Daring to Hope in an Unstable World, by Melissa Spoelstra, was originally meant, I think, to be one of those video studies. However, the workbook can stand alone. I think it would work better in a group setting, but most Bible studies of this nature, do.I have not finished the study because it is meant to go a minimum of 6 weeks, but I have gone through the different days and weeks to see how the workbook is laid out and what the activities are throughout. Overall, from the parts I have thoroughly covered, and the parts I have partially covered, I can discern that this is a typical Protestant study (though not just of interest to Protestants) in a workbook format that is typical to other studies in a similar format. It is thorough, though not as in depth as, say, Beth Moore, who often looks into the meanings of the original Greek or Hebrew words. It is competently written as far as giving basic information, but harder for me to fill out now that I am older, unless I use a separate notebook. I miss having bigger areas to write in and actual lines for long answers. Some of the activities feel like busy work, but I enjoyed a lot of the reading and looking up Bible verses. I sometimes wished she covered more than she did. I actually like what I have covered in it so far, though I would prefer a different format. If I were giving it the exact number of stars it deserves, I would say 3 1/2, but I rounded up, since that is not an option. I think I just need to look for a Bible study with a different format.

This item was given to me for my review.Apparently there is a learning curve for people like me. I got the Bialetti 06702 8-cup French Press Coffee maker, and it really is the easiest thing to use. However, it took me a bit to get my water hot enough, without bringing it to a boil (note to self: don't worry so much about it, just don't leave the kettle boiling for any length of time), and I had to figure out how much coffee to put into the press to get a good strong cup of coffee. It turns out that I need to put the same amount in as if I were using a drip coffee maker, if I want coffee to my taste. The coffee was very tasty, and I found that it was quite smooth, less bitter. However, I like my coffee VERY hot, and I did not feel that with the process being what it is, this coffee was as hot. I would rate this as a very good travel coffee maker, but I would not use it on a daily basis to replace our espresso machine. It is super easy to use, super easy to clean, and it is light. I like it, but I just want the hotter brew. Oh, one last thing....you do not actually put the carafe in the washing machine as directions imply. You put them in the dishwasher. It is dishwasher safe.

This item was given to me for my review.Love, love, love, love this Curel Ultra Healing Lotion. The lotion seems to be unscented and gentle on the skin. So far, I am not having any problems with itching or rashes. I tend to be sensitive, so this is a plus. The lotion is thick, and it stays on the skin even in areas where everyday wear may cause other lotions to rub off onto clothing or be washed off during washing. Unless I do a good scrub with soap and water, my hands stay soft for hours, even through dishes (I assume because the soapy water is diluted). I am very pleased with this Curel product. I do not use Curel normally, though my pharmacist recommended it, but maybe I will change that. Certainly, I will want to keep using this particular lotion on my legs from now on. My legs are a hot mess and very dry. Another great aspect is that it is non-greasy. I can put the lotion on, and drive without risking life and limb because my hands slip on the steering wheel. This lotion checks all the boxes of what I look for in a body lotion.

This item was given to me for my review.Rhiannon Thomas writes a fairy tale for cynics.....all of us who cocked an eyebrow and said, "And THEN what happened?" after hearing the rather unlikely scenario of a princess awakening to a strange man in her bedroom, and not at least beating him away with her slipper.  A Wicked Thing is a tense ride through the Tale of Sleeping Beauty, except set after the princess is awakened and faces the emotional sucker punch of being orphaned with an arranged....sort of....marriage to a stranger. The question is often asked, "Is our destiny the story that has been written by fate, the cosmos or others, or is it the story we have yet to write for ourselves?". The novel is ripe with political intrigues, dastardly villains, interesting possible villains, and magic. I truly enjoyed the novel, but I did feel that the ending was a bit unfinished. I know it must be a part of a series by the way it ends, and I think I very much want to be along for the ride. I just felt that I wanted there to be a next step taken, if not completed. As much as I would like to say more, I cannot without giving away the story. Definitely, a series to keep one's eye on. I will at least read one more, but I hope the author is able to avoid leaving things too open and hanging; some questions do need to be answered.

For any fan of the Good Dinosaur movie, Chomping Spot comes with 2 bugs to 'chomp'. He is pretty hard to remove from the package, which is a pain. His arms move and his mouth opens and closes.To make him 'chomp' and make noise, you squeeze his legs together. He makes eating noises, laughs and makes chomping grunts and growls. When something is in his mouth (and presses down on his tongue), he makes a chewing sound.

The theme of this game is obviously professional wrestling. Even if you don't follow all the ins and outs of this game, you will still have a good time playing it.The game is entirely card driven and comes with 6 wrestler figures and a deck for each one, plus a board. Each wrestler has a unique deck of 30 cards and each card is a wrestling move. The game is played over a number of rounds. You are taking turns trying to win moves against each wrestler in the ring. The game wins when one wrestler is either pinned or doesn't have any cards left to make moves.This would be great for anyone who loves wrestling or has a love of the nostalgia of wrestling past. You can play with 2 -6 players at a time. It is fun game for grown ups and with paired down rules, kids will enjoy this, too.

Great for use in the most toxic environment that I am in, a preschool. We use these in place of latex, due to allergies. The powder free is awesome when diaper changes must be done in rapid succession and one doesn't have time to wash hands between old gloves off, new gloves on.We use these to change diapers, change clothes after accidents, prepare snacks, clean up messes (you'd be surprised how many bodily fluids you local preschool wipes up in a day) and cleaning/ disinfecting after the day is done.I bought these in large, which fits nearly every person on staff.

My husband uses these for heavier applications, like changing oil and 'tinkering' under the hood of the car. I love them for painting and household use. Latex doesn't bother me, which makes these so great. The large size fit both myself and my husband without problems.

These gloves are great for cleaning, While they aren't super thick, they don't tear very easily. We used them to clean out drains, litter boxes and finally, carving pumpkins. My kids were happy to not directly touch the 'guts'. The mediums fit everyone in the house, which was great.

I don't have anything bad to say about this feeder. I love that it is glass but it is lovely. No more cracked or dried out plastic feeders. It is very easy to fill and clean. And that makes quite a difference for feeders that you would like to keep more than one season.The plastic parts are durable and easy to rinse. I really do love it and hopefully, hummingbirds will, too!

I was excited to get to try out this bathroom spray. I have used other sprays in the past and am always up for a new product.First off, this works. it will not totally mask the 'just used the bathroom' smell. However, it will diminish it considerably.With that said, my favorite thing about this is the packaging. The dark colored bottle and black label make this unassuming and hard to distinguish what it is. The other brand I use is more tongue and cheek with its grandmotherly label and bottle. I like to keep this out where it is easy to retrieve and most importantly, not an afterthought.I wasn't crazy about the fragrance, though. I prefer more woodsy, natural fragrances like sandalwood and juniper. The strawberry is too sweet for this application. In a kitchen or as an average air freshener, this is a pleasant smell. Covering up bathroom stink? Not so much.All in all, I was pleased to receive a bottle in exchange for an honest review and would try the other fragrances in a heartbeat.

Darth Tater comes packaged in a reusable container filled with the potato and 17 pieces for dressing up. The container also doubles as a carrying case!We had no problems inserting the pieces and keeping them in. This is certainly a novelty toy in my house, meaning that while it is funny, it doesn't have a lasting play time. However, this is really cute up on a shelf in a Star Wars themed room.

This feeder is much bigger than I had expected it to be. The mesh was difficult to fill with only one person. I'll know better next time. I have many bird coming to it from nuthatches to small woodpeckers. They have gone through about 1/2 the seeds in 3 weeks. It has rained and thus far, the feeder is still working great. It is sturdy and nice to look at.The decorative accent is pretty, but nothing I would put alongside the feeder. I would think the constant motion would scare off birds. However, it does look ok around the other side of the house, away from the birds. It was easy to hang and does its twirly thing in the breeze.

Great for fans of the TV SHOW! Lots featured from the show in the rule book including photos and detailed explanations, which is very well written. it is truly a game of negotiations and alliances. You are dealing in contraband and guns with the object being to get as much money as you can.3-4 players take on the role of each of the biker gangs featured on the show. The game takes place over the course of 6 game rounds. The game tiles take the place of a board, which represent the locations from the show. You send your characters to the locations to take its benefits.Each player gets a shield indicating their gang affiliation, which features a Round Summary, Order Summary and Throw Downs. The game comes with location cards, game tokens, Dudes, Prospects, 'contraband' bags, cash, guns, and Anarchy Cards. Honestly, it helps to have some sort of a container to keep all of these pieces in.You will need a steady playing area, something large to spread out on. This game takes up a lot of room and requires that you keep track of lots of little items. We played for about an hour and 15 minutes.Honestly, the game is slightly confusing and we spent a lot of the first two times playing it correcting behavior and referencing the rules. Now that we have the hang of it, it makes for an interesting game night with friends.

Having stopped going to my regular Yoga classes years ago, I forgot how calming and relaxing a lavender eye pillow can be. One whiff of the lovely fragrance and I was taken back to those end of session calming relaxation exercises.This bag is big enough to fit over my eyes and well as my husbands. The fragrance is perfect and not too overwhelming. The fabric is soft and satin-like. The option to use it both with hot and cold is a plus. When fighting a cold, it was amazing to be able to heat it up and set it on my eyes and sinuses. The lavender helping to open my nose, even if it was only temporary. The cooling is great for those moments of overheating.I hope that the lavender smell remains after a while. I received this item in exchange for an honest review.

This is a neat game for preschoolers. I can't imagine it can hold the attention of an older child.Pinkie Pie sits inside the cake. When the cake is decorated, one player will trigger Pinkie Pie's "popping" out of the cake. The balloons are the pegs that the children use to decorate. This is a very simple game. I suppose you could choose colors of balloons to signify players or just randomly pick up when it is your turn.It is cute just maybe not $25 cute.  A lower price point would make a difference.

This is a great deep cleanser. I use it 3-4 times a week. It is a little too much for me to use daily or even 2x a day. However, it works well to clear up small blemishes. Very lightly scented and is easy to use. Reminds me a lot of Cetaphil.

My skin tends to be oily near the nose and chin and dry everywhere else This mask was very rough and very drying on my skin. I loved the earthy smell. I found the texture to be a little too scratchy for me.My daughter, who is 12 and in the midst of hormone explosions found this to be perfect for her face.

These are being marketed as a business tool but they are also great for home made gifts. They can be used on jars of bath salts, homemade candles, jars of cookies, jars of cake mixes....the possibilities are endless. They stay on securely but can be removed if desired. The pearlized finish gives them a little extra fancy.

I love these tags. We had a cookie sale at the school for Back to School Night as a fundraiser. I baked some normal chocolate chip cookies, printed the recipe onto these paper tags, and attached them to the bag I packed them in. My cookies sold out first and I SWEAR it was because of the cute packaging. It was a hit and very easy to do.

I am not crafty, but with these kinds of Avery products, I certainly look like I am! At a recent corporate happy hour, I made these flags for drinks when people came in. This helped both to make the party a little more branded and festive but also helped identify people's drinks.They are easy to print IF you use the Avery online templates. Pick your product, create the design and print. Easy. I do wish there was one practice sheet to help align the printer, but it isn't a necessity.

Great for homemade jams! These labels give the jars a very rustic, homemade feel. They are easy to print using Avery's online designer and quick to peel and stick.Recommended for saving some money on professionally printed labels for corporate or personal use.

I have an 8 year old and a 12 year old. Both were just shy of 9lbs at birth. This didn't do my muscles "down there" any favors. So since their births, I have relied on a good washer dryer and regular pads to deal with colds that come with a lot of sneezing and coughing.This time, I was happy to have these on hand to try. After 4 days of constantly changing my pants and underware, I finally broke out the package, read the directions fully and gave it a go. I am very happy to report that aside from a few very full bladder moments, these have worked quite well.After insertion, there was a slight discomfort the first few times I used them. I haven't used a tampon in many years, so I think this was just a normal adjustment. I also felt a little tightness, which I typically also feel during a pap smear. This also lessened with use. Removal can be equated to removing a nearly dry tampon. If that makes you cringe, then I would recommend investing in a water based lubricant to make it easier.I had no side effects, although using tampons was easy for me so I didn't expect to have any problems. I am fine with the #1 size for now, which honestly was larger than a super plus tampon. I would recommend anyone dealing with this issue to give this a try. Just read the directions well and know what this entails.

I have been using wet wipes for make-up removal. In recent weeks, I have become disenchanted with the pulling on my skin I have to do to get my mascara off. It takes several harsh passes of the wipe to get it all and even then, I notice spots on my pillow when I wake up.I wanted to try this because I am skeptical of oil based makeup removers but I trust Neutrogena products to not steer me wrong. Thankfully, I was right. The oil, easily dispensed onto a cotton puff or round, easily glides across my skin and somehow, removes the mascara I had to work so hard to get off before. After 2 passes and another wipe to clean, my lashes are completely free of makeup. It doesn't leave my skin oily or create any new breakouts. It isn't heavily perfumed and easy to store.

Love love love this color! It is a grey-ish purple that is iridescent in the light. In cars, we call this "flip-flop paint", because you aren't sure which color it really is. I found it easy to apply and it has lasted on my toes for a week so far. Base coat, 2 layers of essie polish and a top coat is all I need to make this last.

I love these shipping labels and have always found them easy to use. They can be designed and decorated any way you like using the Avery Print designer. Simple, bold, with logo or without, these are easy to peel and attach but are nearly impossible to remove. That's what you want in a shipping label.

These jeans fit my big 9 year old just perfectly in the waist, with a slight adjustment of the strap, but the legs were too long. Nothing a cuff or a quick snip of some fabric can't handle. They are a little tough at first but after a handful of washings, they have started to soften up.We love the dark color and the many pockets. They feel very durable and I think we will have them for a long while.

These are thin and scratchy. Would be tempted to use in a group kitchen (like a church or dorm) where they needed to be bright and airy but not the greatest quality. These are truly more of a bargain store find.

I hate homemade signs used in professional settings. It looks so cheap. Being able to print my own signs for use in restrooms and dressing rooms gives the salons the look and feel of upscale, corporate printing at a fraction of the cost. Easy to print and adhere. They will last a long time!

These are great for homemade gifts and crafts. I used them at a Happy Hour for one of my clients. The personalized gift bags were well received. The tags were easy to print and the textured feel makes them even more 'rustic', which went along with the candle and twine used to decorate.

These are very cute and easy to peel off/ place on your item. I used them for small chocolate candies (Hershey Kisses) and also buttercream mints that were individually wrapped. I also used to cover the staple on small candy bags. While the Avery site is easy to use, the printing was somewhat confusing. I had to adjust the paper size, which was never indicated on the packaging. But I did figure it out and they printed quickly and easily.

I love these for labeling candy jars in the salons. Often there will be a couple of different glass jars with candy in them. "Take One", "Gluten Free" or "Guilt Free" are all labels we've used. These make it much easier to clean the jars between candies and relabel with new things. I love using chalk markers with less mess and dust!

In addition to being pretty, this vacuum was very easy to assemble, just a couple of screws to attach the handle and attachment holder. It includes any attachment that you might need including: crevice tool, turbo tool, pet hair tool, 3-in-1 pivoting brush and a telescoping wand, plenty of attachments to vacuum stairs and dusting. Changes height automatically for different types of carpet. The removable wand makes easy work of hard to reach places and reaching those areas that are hard to reach. Attachments are easy to switch out and it's easy to switch between carpet/hard floor cleaning. There are controls to turn on the beater brush for carpets and it automatically stops the brush when in the full upright position. There is plenty of cord for going up the stairs or across many bedrooms.The only negative is that it is quite heavier than I thought it would be. The canister is 14 pounds and it becomes a burden to carry around once detached to clean stairs or be more mobile. The vacuum in total weighs about 25 pounds. It is powerful right out of the box, but I would hope any vacuum would be.

Extra minty toothpaste to begin with. Sometimes, unbearably so. But your breath will be super fresh! The second step is a gel, which is to be used without rinsing from the toothpaste. This creates a strange gooey paste like feeling in the mouth, which you then get to brush around for another minute. I've never been so happy to give my mouth a good rinse.After 4 weeks of use, I can say that my mouth is very clean, my gums aren't sore like others have had problems with but my teeth aren't any whiter. At least not that is noticeable enough to continue use.

These have been a great item that you never knew you needed. We used them to label boxes and bags in the attic, vegetables in the community garden, new students packets at school, yard sale/ garage sale items (where the tags can't be removed or switched), mailing packages for etsy and ebay, labeling craft boxes and toy boxes/ baskets at home.The wires makes them impossible to remove without major effort. The manilla paper is plain enough to not draw from the actual item, but easy to label. You know these are on for good.

This is so super fun to have. We got this for an epic family vacation touring California (we live on the East Coast of the US.) This selfie stick recorded wonderful family portraits at the Golden Gate Bridge, Yosemite, Venice Beach, Monterey Bay, Alabama Hills, and more.It folds quite small, small enough to be tucked into the side pocket of a backpack (where a water bottle fits). Quick and easy to put the phone in, plug in the wire and telescope out. It was long enough that we could get photos without the dreaded out-stretched arm look.The button is responsive and easy to use. I can't recommend this enough and was lucky to receive on in exchange for an honest review.

This is a cool idea and sure to make a bag as a gift for any fan of Minecraft. Bonus points to those who are interested in stop motion animation!My 8 yr old son has used the Lego stop motion app and the OgoBild animation set with camera, so he is well versed on what kind of patience is needed to make these short films. We unpacked the box, with the backdrops, individual pieces and stand for the device.We downloaded the app on both a Mini iPad, iPod Touch and an iPhone 6. No problems on any of the 3 devices. Each fit fine in the holder without a bulky case, which we had to remove off the iPad. It was seated perfectly in the notches on the stand. There were shaky moments when my son went to take a picture. He still needs to push the button and this something throws the whole thing out of whack. This was the biggest problem of the whole set. But considering his Lego masterpieces were made not using a stand, it was a great improvement on what we are used to.The set itself is fine. However, considering the price point is $40, I can't rate it higher. There are "exclusive" mini figures and more are available for a price at most toy stores and online. The backgrounds are double sided which make 4 different ones. In two separate places on Amazon it says "6 background options."

I have an 8 year old boy, therefore I have a plethora of Legos in my house. While he used to build and then never touch again, recently he has become more adventurous and wants to build the set then take it apart and see what else he can do.We have the Lego Idea Book and a few other hardback, beautiful Lego books around the house that have been well loved and well used. This new LEGO Awesome Ideas book is full of EVEN MORE fantastic ideas. It is split into five categories: Outer Space, Modern Metropolis, The Wild West, Fantasy Land and The Real World. You can even learn how to build a LEGO world from scratch using the themed worlds section.A great gift for any Lego enthusiast, it is packed with projects, although there is a need to have a well rounded Lego collection in order to make many of the items. Not a problem for us, but might be for someone just starting on their Lego journey. The photos are lovely, the sections well put together and the instructions are easy to understand, at least they are for my son.

These are the perfect specimen of the 5 pocket jean. My son is thick and wears a much larger size than his age. The problem we always have is the length is too long. These were no exception.The waist fit fine (I suppose I should add that my son typically wears the 10 or 12s in Old Navy), especially with the adjustable elastics in the waistband. After many washings, the thick denim is starting to really soften.

This lotion is wonderful. It is not sticky but silky like a powder. The smell isn't overwhelming but isn't non-existent either. It goes on smooth and ends up silky. My feet stay soft between applications.I used this once a night for 2 weeks and been very pleased with the affect it has had on dryness. The skin around my toenails no longer shows signs of dry skin. My hands, a side effect of using this daily, have had the same thing happen.I like this brand and plan to stick with it, as the hand lotion was a good product, too!

We have been fans of the OgoBild line of toys for a while now, having several sets that get regular use by my 8 year old. When he started showing interest in stop motion Lego movies, he tried to experiment with various iphone apps. He found them all very frustrating because the phone woul be knocked over or fall while placing the next sequence. We were both thrilled to find this set.The software is easy to install and not hard to use, the camera quality is enough for this set I wouldn't film precious memories on it.) Included are many pieces to build to your heart's desire. The pieces are easy to manipulate although can be hard to connect to one another. We found the more you use them the more they loosen up.After playing around with the Ogo set, I found him moving along to Lego and his sister even took over and did some My Little Pony. We've had as much fun watching their creations and they have had making them. Highly recommended for your budding animator/ film maker.

I was extra surprised when I opened this cream. It appears more like a putty when opened. The texture is unlike any lotion I have tried. It isn't creamy looking. In fact, it isn't pleasant looking at all. But when I put a little on my fingers and rubbed into the back of my hand, it was smooth, silky and almost felt like a powder.I have used this each night on my face for 3 weeks and I can certainly tell a difference. Do I look year's younger? No. But is my face smoother? Yes. There is a definite difference in the feel of my skin and the appearance is brighter, smoother and clearer.With that said, I am always annoyed by products who claim to be "anti-aging." I don't want to stop aging, I want to have moisturized skin that feels nice.

This locker mirror is wonderful because it serves many purposes. The mirror is not too big and manages to give you enough space to check your teeth for food or make sure you don't have any grossness on your face. The whole thing is metal, which works with the magnets to hold up smaller pieces of paper and notes. The last part is the push pins, which stick into the blue foamy circles.I like the fact that it can be used several ways. The magnet that holds it in place works well, too, as it hasn't budged in the month that it has been installed.

My Acer Chromebook fits perfectly in this case and we all really love it. I love that the whole thing opens with the laptop when I open the case. The suction cups on top keep it attached. The bottom is held on by 2 large elastic straps. The case itself reminds me of soundproofing. It is a softish material but still keeps it well insulated.This is great for the kids to carry and use in their playroom and when we travel. The handle is a nice touch.

Eagle Creek Travel Gear Pack-It Starter Set includes a medium Pack-It Folder, a Pack-It Cube and a Pack-It Half Cube.  I travel a lot and often will be going to very different types of places during one trip.  For example, a conference in one place that requires dressy clothes followed by a week spent hiking and having fun.  So, I need to bring different types of clothes and I need to organize my luggage well to reduce space.  I already have two of the packing cubes and they are integral for organizing my luggage when I pack.  I was definitely keen to expand my collection of Pack-It accessories, especially since they are designed to integrate well with my Eagle Creek luggage.The purpose of the Pack-It Folder is to be able to fold button down shirts and pants and then to hold them in place to minimize wrinkles.  You can find videos on YouTube which show how the folding is to be done.  There are also instructions on the plastic sleeve which comes with the folder and which you use to fold the clothes.  I have mixed thoughts on the use of the folder.  While I do like how well the shirts and pants are organized, there do tend to be lines on the clothes where they were folded.  For dress shirts, I like to use the bundle wrapping technique instead because I think it wrinkles the shirts less and use the folder for polo shirts or for packing dress shirts for my return journey.  For the basis of the bundle, I use one of the Pick-It Cubes filled with t-shirts.The Pack-It Cube is great for holding t-shirts, underwear or items that would normally just float around your bag.  I roll up my t-shirts and then fill the bag.  Because the t-shirts are rolled and held in place, they dont wrinkle as much as if they were just rolled up in the bag.  Plus, I know where the shirts are located so that I can find them without digging through my bag.The smaller, Half Cube is useful for organizing smaller clothes or loose items.  I use it for my running gear to keep it separate from my other clothes.I have been travelling a lot of years and I have always sworn by Eagle Creek luggage.  I have used their backpacks during my backpacking days and now use my Tarmac wheeled bags.  I am bringing up their luggage here because with my Eagle Creek Tarmac came instructions for filling the  bag using the Eagle Creek cubes, kits, shoe sac and folder.  The bags and the travel gear are meant to work together to organize your luggage.  You dont need to have an Eagle Creek bag to benefit from the Pack-It Starter Set, but if you do have Eagle Creek luggage, it was designed to be used with the Pack-It system and so they work well together.  You can find more information about the travel system (bag and kits) on the Eagle Creek website.All of the Pack-It accessories are machine washable.  Like most other Eagle Creek products, the starter set includes a lifetime warranty.I highly recommend the Pack-It Starter Set if you are looking for a way to organize your luggage or as a way to reduce the wrinkling of your clothes when you travel.

"A lonely woman is a dangerous woman.  A lonely woman is a bored women.  Bored women act on impulse."Anna is a lonely housewife, originally from the US and now living in Switzerland with her husband and three children.  Anna left the US to be with her banker husband and has not been back to the US since.  With her parents dead and friendships neglected, there was nothing to go back to.  However, Anna never tried to adapt to living in her new country.  She has no friends outside of her home.  She speaks basic German and didnt try to expand her language skills until nine years after her move when she began to take classes.  At the class, she meets Archie from Scotland and on their first meeting, she flirts and then quickly joins him in bed after class.
