I searched and searched for a pail that was the right size to use with the BioBag 3 Gallon Food Waste Bags that I use (in Portland, OR, we have to use approved biodegradable bags in our Waste Management compost bins).  I had been using a 10 qt Sterilite blue plastic pail for my composting of kitchen scraps, which was a great size, but not very pretty.  After my kitchen remodel, the blue plastic bucket sitting on the counter when I cooked had to go.  So, this one works perfectly.  It's small enough that the bags can be draped over the lip, but large enough to hold all that the bag will.  I then knot the top using 4 corners, and go dump it in the roll-cart compost bin.  Occasionally the bags "sweat" and there is moisture inside the pail after dumping the bag, but that's a function of the compostability of the bags, and a quick swipe with a paper towel takes care of that.  So, if you are looking for a good easy way to compost, this is your best bet.  (I did try to use a stainless steel trashcan that had a foot petal and lid, but I didn't want to have to use a foot or a second hand to pitch stuff.  Also, I fill my bucket up every couple of days at the max, so I didn't find I was having a stinky food problem.  So I don't mind leaving my food scraps in an open topped container.)

I've owned the black version of this wallet for about 5 years.  All my previous wallets have been cheap, department store brands (usually bought at Fred Meyer or Target), which wore out and looked ratty after a few months of use.  I bought this because I fell in love with one my girlfriend had.  So, I splurged, having only ever spent about $15-$20 on previous wallets.  It was worth every single penny.  I used that wallet for 5 years, and it still looks just as awesome as it did the first day.  I recently bought a red one because I wanted to have both, to make it easier to find my wallet in the dark interior of my purse, and it is just as good, though I wish it had the coin purse pocket inside instead of the new cell phone pocket.  I just never use my wallet by itself so won't use the cell pocket.  And I saw several people complain about the interior fabric, and in the red wallet, the fabric is as pictured (perhaps they updated their photos due to feedback).  Quality is where this is at, my friends.  If you want to stop buying shoddy wallets, invest in this one.

The plastic on this pizza wheel seems low quality, and cheap.  The metal blade is thin, and seems cheap as well.  Maybe I'm just comparing to my previous pizza wheel which was replaced by this one, which was overall much more sturdy and higher quality in general.  I don't know that this will last us years like the previous one.  The other thing I don't like is that when I put the handle in the dishwasher, it gets water inside that then will just kind of leak and dribble out afterward.  Maybe the handle isn't supposed to be put in the dishwasher, but I think a piece of plastic should be able to be dishwashed without any problem.  The less I have to hand wash in my kitchen the better.  I'll continue to use it until it dies, which may not be too long, but if I see a better quality one in the meantime I may just give up on it and replace it.  That being said, it is a nice size and plenty big.  I have seen dinky pizza wheels that seem completely pointless to me, and this one is actually a good size.  Also, it is plenty sharp for doing its intended job.

I am a Patty Women fan, but this shirt just didn't add up for me.  I like that the material is thick, and stretchy, but one of the things that isn't obvious from the description or picture is that at hip level, there is a seam, and then a wide band (of the same material) that is double thickness that sits around your hips.  I don't like the line right there, with the added material for the seaming on the inside.  The shirt is less trim around the waist than other of Patty Women's shirts I have purchased, so it makes me look a bit thicker around the middle than I am, which is not what a girl likes to see.  I do like the color and material, so I am keeping it, but I don't pull it out to wear as often as the other shirts from PW that I have.

I like a big purse.  I'm a mom and I want to be able to tote whatever needs to be toted.  This bag was huge though, and I just found it too cumbersome to use, so I moved back into an old purse after a couple of weeks.  A lot of the problem is, it doesn't look good unless the top is cinched closed at the top like it's shown in the photo.  If you leave the top open more for ease of use, it looks pretty lame.  When the top is cinched closed, it makes for quite a bulky lump of material that hits right below your armpit because the strap is not very long.  I like wearing a purse on my shoulder, and I don't want long straps for cross body purses, but the length of the strap plus the extra material right there made it unpleasant to carry around.  That plus it's overly large size made me stop using it, though I really wanted to like it.

I bought an XS for my 4 year old and a S for my 6 year old for soccer this spring.Plusses:1 - Super long.  Actually goes above the knees, and needs to be rolled down at the top or they look like ladies stockings.2 - Thick, warm material.  The material is thicker around the heel of the sock, and thinner on the legs.  It is also quite stretchy and stays up quite well.3- For thin legs.  My boys are skinny dudes, and these socks are plenty tight on them.  If you have thicker/more muscly legs these may be uncomfortably tight.Minuses:1 - Really too long.  I like a knee high to be long, but on my kids, these went halfway up the thigh and looked rather ridiculous, especially since my 6 year old felt they would stay up better when they were pulled all the way up and wouldn't let me roll the top down to just below the knee.  I'd rather a sock be too long, rather than not long enough, because these are able to be rolled down, so that's why I put it in both the plus and minus category.2 - Not very good quality.  It's rather okay for my kids who only have to wear them 8 - 10 times for spring soccer and then won't fit into them next season, so I'm not too concerned about it, but if I needed them to last longer I'd probably send them back.  The stripes on the top are uneven in places, like some kind of glitch on the sewing machine, which is no big deal, but speaks to overall quality of the production of the socks.  And when I wash them, they end up sprouting long strings at the top that I need to snip off.  So, these aren't good quality for long time use.

I am a total Patty Women convert, and this top does not disappoint!  It is super flattering, super quality, super warm for the winter, and my new favorite top.  I loved it so much I immediately got back on Amazon to order another color.  I wish there were more than 3 choices.  I found the cowl neck appropriately sized (I tend to like cowl necks, but some are just too much material and quite unwieldy).  The length is nice and long so that you don't have to worry about any bits hanging out over your low cut jeans.  And I love the warm thick material, which is not bulky at all, on a cold winter day.

I've purchased several Patty Women tops, because they are amazingly priced for great products.  My main reason that I love them is that their tops are generally longer on the torso, so that I don't feel like I have to pull them down all the time (I'm 5'8").  This shirt is not as long as others and is just barely long enough for me.  I like the design, material, and quality of the shirt, I just wish it was longer so I don't have to worry about it with my low topped jeans.  If a long length is not your primary concern, then you'll likely love this top.

I really like this jacket.  The sleeves are quite long, which excellent because as a 5'8" girl, I'm always looking for tops that don't stop high on my wrist, and also hit low enough on the hips.  The length of the jacket is my only quibble.  Most of Patty Women's tops are nice and long (though not all), and this hits about an inch and half higher than I would like.  It is okay because with a long top underneath, I don't have to worry about my low cut jeans, but I do wish the jacket fit lower because it would look a bit better.  But I still like this jacket, and it's nice that it is very light material and not bulky at all.

This review is more for the company I ordered this from (Stuff With Attitude) instead of the actual shirt, because as the shirt has never arrived, I cannot speak to its quality.I ordered two t-shirts as Christmas gifts on 12/13.  Amazon indicated a delivery window of 12/9 - 12/24.  Figured it would surely arrive in time for Christmas.  It didn't.  I finally emailed the company on 12/28 asking about my order.  At that point, they told me that they are a small company and were 5000 orders behind this year and had a 12/12 cutoff for guaranteed 'holiday shipping'.  My problem is not that they are a small business that got overwhelmed, or even that they had a cutoff on guaranteeing delivery.  My problem is that they didn't inform me of this at any point, until I explicitly asked after it didn't arrive on time.  Perhaps they updated their personal website with that information, but Amazon was unaware of it, and nothing was updated here.  I surely would not have ordered from them if I knew it wouldn't be here for Christmas.  And today is 1/2, and the t-shirts still have not arrived.  The company's name is Stuff with Attitude, but the customer service rep I emailed was the one with attitude, and not the good sort.  My advice is to use another company for your needs.  It's sad when small businesses don't take care of their customers, because it just makes us go more and more to bigger stores who do work hard to keep their customers happy.

The Wild Wild West In The Deep South: The Second Seminole War (Native American History Book 2)  by Author Dwayne WalkerIt is not often that I read and review a history book but this interesting and action packed short story based on the Second Seminole War certainly grabbed my attention right from the onset. As a Canadian, my knowledge of American history is sorely lacking but I have always held a innate curiosity when it comes to our North American Native background. There are many similarities to be found between both the United States and Canada when it comes to our common history in our dealings with our oldest ancestors.The Seminoles were considered to be part of the "Five Civilized Tribes" along with The Creek, Choctaw, Chickasaw, and Cherokee people. Three of the tribes put up little resistance when it came to being uprooted and moved to Indian Territory as designated by the U.S. Government. However, while the Cherokees tried to engage in a legal defense, the Seminoles chose to resist this huge endeavor by using force against the powers that be. The process of forcing these tribes to relocate became know as the "Trail of Tears". President Andrew Jackson was instrumental in carrying out this mass exodus and his motives are unclear and have been discussed by numerous historians. Regardless of his reasons, "he was succeeded by a string of one term presidents who continued his policy in regards to Indian removal in the Second Seminole War."This well-researched book is definitely worth reading. It is relatively short but filled with plenty of historical facts which many of us may not have had the opportunity to read about in our younger years. I, for one, am one of them. I commend Author Dwayne Walker in his efforts to provide this relevant historical data.Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores Ayotte[...]

Harry Lane is Innocent by Author J ScaddonThe cover says it all...an innocent man is condemned to death by hanging for a crime he did not commit. Harry Lane is a simple-minded, gentle and eager-to-please boy, in a twenty-three year old man's body. He wouldn't hurt a fly if his life depended on it. He has many typical childhood fears such as fear of the dark and creepy insects like spiders. His size and mental deficiencies defy the gentleness of his nature. Harry is the subject of much taunting and ridicule by children in his neighborhood in a quiet London town in the late 1940's.One unfortunate evening when Harry is out running an errand for his loving father, he crosses paths with the likes of the devious and petty criminal Douglas Fields, in Hunter's Park. Unbeknownst to him, Douglas Fields is saturated with alcohol and primed to commit a crime...any crime that might fall onto his path. Peggy is a student on her way home from the local bar. Her parents' house is not too far away and she has walked this very path many times before tonight.  She has enjoyed a lovely evening with her friends and now she is about to walk through scenic Hunter's Park...The events that ensue in this suspenseful, legal thriller are mind-boggling to say the least. Unpredictable and well-written, Author J Scaddon takes his reading audience on one heck of an emotional roller coaster ride. I could not put this mesmerizing and somewhat haunting novella down. Haunted by the possibility that this could actually be a true story, I finished reading it last night and woke up thinking about it this morning. Great read!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Andee The Aquanaut: Guardian of the Great Seas (Andee The Aquanaut Trilogy Book 1) by Author Simon James HouseI received a complimentary copy of this book in return for my honest review.Andee, the young protagonist in this exciting children's book is a lovable young boy and the only child of two marine biologists. He enjoys the life that has been created for him by his parents which is a result of their devotion to make a difference in the world by discovering "new medicines and cures for modern day illnesses".  Andee thrives on his island home and develops a wonderful friendship with two young dolphins, Tingo and Tango. This relationship further enhances his long days on the sunny beach while his parents continue their research.An unexpected and rare storm occurs while his parents are out at sea which leaves Andee without his Mum and Dad. Andee is left as an orphan when it appears that his parents have perished at sea. He soon enters into the mysterious world of the deep sea with Tingo and Tango and is eagerly adopted by their parents. He is then forced to face a host of new challenges when he is exposed to a lively, and oftentimes, dangerous cast of sea world characters. This encourages him to tap into his new role as Andee the Aquanaut, Guardian of the Great Seas, to meet these ever demanding needs. In discovering his gift, he also realizes the important part he plays in protecting marine life and fighting the forces of evil in order to achieve this noble goal.The bright and colorful illustrations by Zoran Zlaticanin certainly add to the reading pleasure of Andee's remarkable tale. I am eager to share this chapter book with my 10 year old grandson. I am sure it will bring him great pleasure because I derived much enjoyment in reading it myself. I'm pleased to hear that it's Book 1 in a Trilogy because I know there is certainly more captivating reading to come. Can't wait to read about Andee's future escapades and learn more about Yolanda too...Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

I think this book is both well-written and informational. It adequately explains the types of exercises i.e. calisthenics, isometrics, and cross training techniques needed to enhance bodyweight training. This guidebook also targets specific areas of the body that require the most work and the physical activity necessary to accomplish the best overall results. In my opinion, as these workouts are described, I think it would be beneficial to have some basic illustrations to demonstrate the suggested physical activity.I like the concept of doing exercises within the comfort of your own home without the use of expensive equipment or costly gym membership fees. The accompanying diet and caloric tips give a realistic view by stressing the fact that it takes more than one life style change to achieve the desired result of a healthier body. The suggestion of "cheat day" also makes these goals more attainable. Great ideas in this bodyweight training handbook.Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Wendy's Wacky Dogs: Fun Rhyming Book (Rhyming Books 1) by Authors Hadas Korb and Ortal ZeretAs a former elementary school teacher, I can very much appreciate this well-written educational tool aimed at entertaining young children. I always enjoy books that are written in rhyme but I especially like the idea of leaving out the last word so that children have the extra learning opportunity to fill in the missing word. I utilize this teaching technique often when reading to my grandchildren even when the word is provided. This concept requires more concentration and thinking on the part of the child in order to fill in the blank. Therefore, children automatically pay more attention to the story being read to them which further enhances their enjoyment and learning experience.The bright and colorful illustrations provided by Shiela Marie Alejandro really add to the reading pleasure by giving the child the visual clue to help them out if need be. Wendy's wacky dogs are a delightful group of entertainers who provide additional assistance for children to readily discover the missing rhyming word. Wendy's Wacky Dogs is an ideal book to be enjoyed by its young reading audience!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

The First Day Of School by Author Lucy GrahamThis is a great children's book to read to young preschoolers to help them overcome the anxiety of starting school. Alex is about to start kindergarten and he is apprehensive about leaving his mother and his pet dog Patches all day long as he begins his first year of school. Although he is excited about his first day of school, Alex is nervous too about what is going to take place.After a restless night's sleep and with his new school supplies in hand,  Alex makes every effort to overcome the "butterflies in his stomach" as he gets on the school bus. He is pleasantly surprised as he meets his new teacher Ms. Green and takes great pleasure in meeting new friends. It doesn't take long for Alex to enjoy his new school routine.Author Lucy Graham does an excellent job of introducing children to the concept of starting school by providing them with relevant information so that they know what to expect.  Great book to read to three and four year old children as they begin their early years of formal education.Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Children Books: "Winner" by Author Idan Hadari"Winner" is a great children's book that is aimed at increasing self-confidence and self-esteem in young children. Written in rhyme adds to the reading pleasure as children get the opportunity to experience Andrew's frustrations of not feeling very "lucky" in life. He has every desire to be famous and to feel like he is special in some way or recognized for his accomplishments. He really does not have a very positive self-image until one day when...Andrew is delighted to make a little girl's day. Pre-school children or early readers will experience his joy when they discover why. Simple acts of kindness can go a very long way.Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteI'm Not Perfect and It's Okay: Thirteen Steps to a Happier Self

Children's Book: Lulu's Green Luge (Stories for children) by Author Joyce MitchellLulu's Green Luge is another delightful book by talented children's Author Joyce Mitchell. Lulu is celebrating her birthday with her friends and she is very pleased with all the lovely gifts that she is receiving. Unknown to her, the well-thought out items fit in very well with her biggest present. When she unwraps her last gift it is a green luge...the one she has dreamed of owning one day. Lulu is now able to go sledding with her friends as well as her mom. The children then get to enjoy birthday treats after a fun-filled day of sledding. What a great way for Lulu and her friends to celebrate her special day!Enjoyable children's book with bright and colorful illustrations which add to the reading pleasure for young children ages three through eight years of age.Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteI'm Not Perfect and It's Okay: Thirteen Steps to a Happier Self

Children's Book: Lulu's Green Luge (Stories for children) by Author Joyce MitchellLulu's Green Luge is another delightful book by talented children's Author Joyce Mitchell. Lulu is celebrating her birthday with her friends and she is very pleased with all the lovely gifts that she is receiving.  Unknown to her, the well-thought out items fit in very well with her biggest present. When she unwraps her last gift it is a green luge...the one she has dreamed of owning one day. Lulu is now able to go sledding with her friends as well as her mom. The children then get to enjoy birthday treats after a fun-filled day of sledding. What a great way for Lulu and her friends to celebrate her special day!Enjoyable children's book with bright and colorful illustrations which add to the reading pleasure for young children ages three through eight years of age.Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteI'm Not Perfect and It's Okay: Thirteen Steps to a Happier Self

The Sin: A Murder Mystery by Author Robert VaughanHaving already read and reviewed a couple of western novels by talented Author Robert Vaughan, I was eager to read this murder mystery and I certainly wasnt disappointed. It grabbed me right from the first page to the last. Immediately caught up in the murder of beautiful and rich Leah Graves, this whodunit was hard to put down.Mike Carmack, the editor and publisher of the local newspaper in the town of Sikeston, Missouri gets caught up in trying to help solve the murder. He works in tandem with the police chief, Stump Pollack who has his work cut out for him. Big Clay Thompson pretty well owns the town and the untimely death of his only daughter Leah, leaves him fit to be tied. He is determined to take matters into his own hands and prove that his former son-in-law, Dr. Ned Graves has done the dirty deed. Stump and Mike Carmack are not convinced and they have a big job ahead of them to prove otherwise as incriminating evidence keeps popping up in the most unexpected places. It smells like a set up butThis twisted murder with the "unusual" suspects of Big Clay himself, or Leahs brother Joe Dean possibly being involved, add to this mind boggling murder mysteryor is there another more violent and vengeful man at large? Could it be the redneck Harley Mack Jenner?  This is not your ordinary murder caseLeahs macabre death proves otherwise and then a second murder takes place. Are the murders connected? If so, how? So many questions, so few answers unless you read more.Kudos to prolific Author Robert Vaughan for another great fictional novel. A captivating read to be sure!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteI'm Not Perfect and It's Okay: Thirteen Steps to a Happier Self

Sisters Of The Wyoming Mountains: Book I (Sisters of Wyoming 1) by Author Gary McCarthyThis is the first novel I have read and reviewed by talented Author Gary McCarthy and it definitely makes me want to read more in this series. "Sisters Of The Wyoming Mountains" is a captivating historical novel set in the 1800's around the time of the Gold Rush.Sisters, Rebecca and Katie Prescott along with their parents and at the insistence of their father Micah, make the arduous trek to California in order to strike it rich in their hope to discover gold. Hardships and lack of good fortune haunt them and much to their distress, end up taking the life of their mother. With no money, no food and an injured father, they decide to try and make their way back home to Springfield.As seventeen year old Rebecca and younger sister Katie face each and every challenge with as much positive energy as possible, Rebecca harbors resentment towards her father and secretly holds him responsible for the death of their mother. She silently blames him for the hardships they endure as they pull the old cart along the treacherous path with him on board. Exhausted, they make their way to a stagecoach stop where they encounter Bryce who has been shot. Once again, Rebecca runs on adrenaline as she now must proceed to Temple City, a Mormon establishment, to get the medical assistance that both her father and Bryce require. Little does she know that in order to receive help, she must agree to the strict rules and regulations of this Mormon community run by Amos Ludlow. She finds herself trapped in an unthinkable situation...On the run, Rebecca finds herself at Fort Bridger under the tutelage of Captain Devlin Woodson, the army doctor. Her life then takes many unpredictable twists and turns as she tries to escape her past...Will she ever see her sister Katie again? How did Amos Ludlow react to her disappearance? Will Rebecca ever find a sense of peace and the love of a husband? And will Brice return to Temple City or break Katie's heart? So many questions...and well worth reading this well-written fictional novel to get the answers. Very enjoyable book!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Fireflies: Finding Light in a Dark World by Author Heather Gordon-YoungI agree with Maya Angelou..."There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you."Fireflies: Finding Light in a Dark World by Author Heather Gordon-Young is simultaneously heart-wrenching and heart-warming. I was deeply touched by her words and disclosure of her experiences as she openly shares her intimate journey with her reading audience.  Her older brother Jimmy....with a fragile psyche, scarred by an abusive childhood experience, is forever wounded and unable to overcome his inner torment. Trying his best to survive, at a young age he turns to alcohol to mask his suffering and ease his pain. As the author so eloquently states...anxiety and addiction usually go hand in hand. This proves to be the case with her much loved brother.Heather, spends her early teen years and well into her twenties searching for answers, striving to love and seek help for this broken brother of hers. Jimmy is endlessly haunted and persecuted by his past as he descends into a spiral of despair. Heather, herself, resembles a wounded bird in her desperate attempts to help her brother. Her heart is breaking as she is so deeply affected by his living hell. Her efforts to heal another wounded bird are admirable yet go unrewarded in this regard. She is so young...with such a huge responsibility...such faith, driven to explore every corner of her world to come up with answers to better understand her brother's plight in order to help heal him.She starts at the beginning, relating her challenges and her every desire to overcome the daunting obstacles she faces. She does so with clarity, honesty, and the gift of a talented story teller.  Author Heather Gordon-Young grabs you by the heartstrings and touches your life with her overwhelming love and desire to make a difference. There are a few bright moments in her tale and a glimpse at the love she shares with her husband James, as they move forward on their journey. God definitely has a Master Plan and they both know it!Mental illness is one of the most misunderstood, complex, and frightening afflictions this side of heaven. Education, awareness, and compassion are a few of the keys to ending the stigma and the suffering attached to it. In essence, it is up to those who have either suffered from or been exposed to the devastating effects of this debilitating disorder to share the truth. I believe Author Heather Gordon-Young has done just that!"And ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free." John 8:32 King James Version (KJV)Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteI'm Not Perfect and It's Okay

Children's book: Lily and the Animal Choir: by Author Ayala SaarAnother delightful book by children's Author Ayala Saar. "Lily and the Animal Choir" is chock full of learning experiences for the young child. It is a rhyming book with plenty of bright and colorful illustrations by Abira Das which certainly add to the reading pleasure.Lily is a "sweet goat who loves to sing and dance". She has every desire to join an animal choir so that she can share her talent along with other gifted performers. When Lily and her goat friends are walking in the forest, they are thrilled to hear the song of chirping birds in a nearby tree. When they ask to join the bird choir, they are totally rejected by the birds. They soon get over their sadness and continue on their journey. When they encounter catlike mewls off in the distance, they follow the source of this enjoyable sound only to once again be rejected by the huddle of cats they discover at the top of a hill.Sad and dejected, Lily and her friends continue in their search to find a choir that will delight in their singing and dancing abilities...Preschool children and early readers will be enchanted by this enjoyable children's book. They are exposed to the habitat of several forest animals. They also have the opportunity to learn a valuable life lesson. It is much better to embrace the friendship and talent of others...the more the merrier!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

The Lawmen by Author Robert VaughanSome authors just have a knack for spinning an enjoyable tale and talented Author Robert Vaughan fits the bill. This is the second western novel that I have read and reviewed penned by him and it definitely makes me want to read more of his works. I like his down-to-earth style and descriptive ability when it comes to relating a story. I was able to easily visualize any scene he described. I find this technique to be a very enjoyable reading treat. Not all authors are as gifted in this area. At times, I've skimmed over such passages but I did not do so in "The Lawmen" as they added so much to the storyline.The setting....Risco, Texas in the late 1800's. Every couple of years, arch political enemies...John Carmack and Charley Dawson, alternate in the role of being Sheriff in this small western town. Their children, Greg Dawson and Clemmie Carmack, manage to fall madly in love and secretly marry. Right after the wedding ceremony and without the approval of their feuding fathers, they quickly disappear to start a new life of their own They eventually give birth to a lovely daughter called Lucy, who...almost twenty years later, marries Phil Goodnight and moves to a small Texas town by the name of Blodgett.Angus Pugh, has a history with the two Sheriffs from Risco. Recently released from prison after twenty years of incarceration, along with his gang of criminal, he decides to rob the bank in Blodgett. Phil Goodnight is the new Bank Manager and before he even gets to start his first day on the job, the fun begins...Lucy then calls upon her two aging grandfathers to make their peace and help her prove her husband's innocence. Can they rise above their feuding? Both in their sixties now, do they have what it takes to ride into the criminal town of Salcedo and rescue her husband? It sure is worth the read to find out. Very enjoyable novel!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Children's book: "A Note for Mom ": Teach values book, Fantasy-Education-Animal Habitats, Children Book ages 3-8, Funny Rhyming Picture Book, Early readers...for kids and for Beginners Readers 1) by Author Ayala SaarThis is the third children's book that I have read and reviewed by talented Author Ayala Saar. Her love for children shines through each and every word that she writes as she reaches out to young children in a warm and friendly way.In "A Note for Mom", she utilizes the colorful illustrations of a variety of animals to teach a moral lesson to her young reading audience. Who better than the wise owl to help her in this endeavor? All the animals sit under a tree as they learn a very valuable lesson. Written in rhyme...which further helps captures the attention of children as it creates the added opportunity to guess how the sentence will end..is sure to add to the reading pleasure. I particularity like the gentle reminder at the end of the book that dads love their children too.Very enjoyable children's book!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteGrowing Up & Liking It

Wonders That We See: A Poetry Collection by Author Crystal HarrellWhat a lovely compilation of poetry from new Author Crystal Harrell. On reading her biography, I discovered that "Wonders That We See: A Poetry Collection" is her first Kindle publication.Her poetry is very captivating as she touches base on a variety of topics. Her poems are quite deep, meaningful, and very enjoyable indeed! Poems..."Written in Red" as well as "Wonders That We See" just to mention a couple, give her reading audience a small glimpse into how talented this young author really is...Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Just The Way I Am: How to Build Self Confidence & Self-Esteem in children's books for ages 2 4 8 (Bedtime Stories for Early Readers - Picture Books in Kids Collection) (Volume 3) by Author Idan HadariAndrew is a responsible little boy who is about to attend preschool. He tries to be independent by doing his daily routine of brushing his teeth and washing his face. One night in particular, he notices a brown stain on his arm and tries in vain to remove it. After much scrubbing with soap and water he is distressed to see that he is unable to do so.Andrew then decides to be creative by putting a big sticker on the disturbing stain in order to disguise it. It works wonderfully well but only for a short time. He subsequently decides he must come up with a more permanent idea to cover it up. After a few more unsuccessful attempts, Andrew cannot hide his concern from his mom. Once he shares how upset he is about his blemish, he is very pleased with her explanation and how special she makes him feel.Birthmarks are very special indeed because "God had marked Andrew in a very special way".Written in rhyme...with bright and colorful illustrations...Author Idan Hadari does a fine job of reminding children that they are prefectly fine just the way they are. Great self-esteem builder!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Children's Book: I was a mermaid for a day (funny bedtime story collection) by Author Yonit WerberThis is a cute story with a little moral lesson added to round out this book into a learning experience. One day when she is at the beach with her mom and dad, the young girl in this children's book wishes that she could be a mermaid. Although in her innocence, she can see all the positive things about being a mermaid, she has no idea that there are negative consequences as well. One night in particular, she has a very vivid dream and is indeed a beautiful mermaid just like her heart desires. She realizes that her dream has come true and now she can swim with the dolphins and other sea life. However, what this little girl doesn't count on is that she has left behind her parents in the real world. She soon comes to the conclusion that she is much happier just being who she is and living with her mom and dad and not being a mermaid after all. The illustrations are bright and colorful.Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteGrowing Up & Liking It

The Errant Flock by Author Jana PetkenThe setting...the small town of Sagrat, Spain in the 15th century when the Spanish Inquisition sparks fear into the flock who goes astray or the "converso" who are practicing their religious beliefs in secret. Heretics of the Catholic Church are tortured beyond human comprehension. An era of historical shame perpetuated by the Holy Office during the reign of King Ferdinand and Queen Isabella."The Errant Flock" by gifted Author Jana Petken, which is based on these horrific events, has a credible and authentic ring to it despite its fictional genre. The wealth and scope of her well-researched background information demonstrates the author's painstaking efforts to bring the atrocities committed on many innocent believers to light in present day times.  In my opinion, she manages to do exactly what she hoped to accomplish as my feathers got rankled by the mere thought of what took place in ancient times. I am incensed and outraged by these abhorrent activities as if they are still taking place today....that's how descriptive and precise the accounts are of what occurred so many years ago.David Sanz and his family become victims of Duke Luis Perato strictly by chance. The Duke's young, insane wife is unable to give birth to a healthy baby. He needs an heir and desperately seeks to find one by involving David Sanz in his wicked scheme. After the Duke's unprecedented request upon the innocent militia officer, David Sanz's life nor that of his family, is ever going to return to normal. One extremely painful event after the other befalls the Sanz family. The horror of their infliction is beyond words. David Sanz, victim or villain? Or perhaps victorious...as yet to be determined by each individual reading this heart-wrenching novel.Plain and simple...I could not put this book down. It captured my interest from the first page to the last and every page in-between. Historical fiction at its best!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteA Woman's Voice ~ Inspirational Short Stories ~ Volume 1

B is for Beach (Children's Vacation Series Book 2) by Michele Lynn Seigfried (Author, Illustrator)I love children's book and "B is for Beach" is no exception. It is written in rhyme, the illustrations are adorable, and it is a delightful reading experience for a young child. I like the way the "B" words are stressed in the colorful picture side of the book that corresponds with the story. This is done in order to reinforce the words that start with "B" in this early educational learning tool. Good stuff!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteA Woman's Voice ~ Inspirational Short Stories ~ Volume 1

Parenting: The Ultimate How To Parenting Guide on Raising Kids, Newborns, and Toddlers (Parenting, Children, Raising Your Child) by Author Mary AppletonThis guidebook on becoming a new parent is easy to read and helps give an idea of what to expect from the birth of a child to the toddler years. It is relatively short but gives a solid foundation and several tips on how to handle these first couple of years. I like the term "vocation" used to describe what parenting is really all about and the suggestion that it is important to have "me time". In order to have the proper balance in life and to be there physically and emotionally for your child, Author Mary Appleton stresses that is important to take care of yourself and to have a strong support system in place.Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteA Woman's Voice ~ Inspirational Short Stories ~ Volume 1

A Swing Set for Her Birthday by Author Ryann Adams HallKayleigh is a young girl who loves to go to the park or to her friend's to play on the swing set. It is one of her favorite, fun things to do. Her parents decide to surprise Kayleigh for her birthday and buy her a swing set of her own. Mommy has to get her out of the house so that daddy can assemble her surprise gift but the weather doesn't cooperate...Cute children's book with plenty of colorful illustrations to add to the reading experience which is sure to please young children as they relate to Kayleigh's surprise birthday present!

Books for kids: "Jack's Song" by Author Ayala Saar and Fatima Stamato (Illustrator)Jack is a young boy who is very musically talented but somewhat shy about sharing his gift. He can play several instruments but prefers to play in the comfort of his own room or home. Although, his parents encourage him to share his talent and become the star that they know he is, Jack still refuses to do so until...In "Jack's Song" talented children's Author Ayala Saar appeals to her young reading audience by drawing them into the reason Jack changes his mind. Jack soon realizes the benefits of sharing his musical talent and has every desire to do so once he knows how noble this act really is and the positive effect it has on others. In building his self confidence Jack is able to truly enjoy his own gift by sharing it with others. This is where the real reward for his efforts takes place.Written in rhyme and with colorful illustrations to add to the reading pleasure, this book is sure to bring pleasure to many young children. I know my grandchildren will love this book.Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteI'm Not Perfect and It's Okay

Dawn Of The Century (The American Chronicles Book 1) by Author Robert VaughanThis historical novel is my first exposure to author Robert Vaughan but I can see that he is a seasoned author with several other fictional novels under his belt. Reading this novel definitely makes me want to read more of his works.The occasion doesn't arise too often when I find a book that I just don't want to see come to an end. "Dawn Of The Century" is one such book. I consider it a rare gem to be caught up in so many different people's lives and for each of them to be equally intriguing. I didn't want to miss a word of their personal experiences and the challenges each of them faced in this turn of the century novel.Set in the beginning of the twentieth century with the introduction of the first automobiles, the Wright brothers and their flying machine, along with other inventions such as the concept of a water pump to drain swampland and convert it to farmland takes us back in time. The reading audience also gets the opportunity to enjoy the escapades, the romance, and a peek into the lives of the quad quad...J.P., David, Bob, and Terry, who are all graduates of Jefferson College. Eric a young cowboy who...due to unfortunate circumstances finds himself to be a hobo on a train, manages to cross paths with Pearl and Loomis Booker who are employed by the Dean of Jefferson College. Several other interesting characters add numerous unexpected twists and turns in this well-written and well-researched novel. Their stories are expertly intertwined and woven together in such a captivating way. If you like history, you'll really enjoy this great novel. I sure did!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteGrowing Up & Liking It

Inspirational Quotes: 365 Quotes for Daily Motivation by Jonny Fox  (Editor)If there is one kind of book I have a penchant for...it is one that contains inspirational quotes. This book with 365 quotes...one for each day, definitely fits the bill. Quotes, whether from the past or present, are a wealth of knowledge at our fingertips if we choose to draw from this deep well of wisdom and information.I thoroughly enjoy and take every opportunity to glean life skills from the sagacity of those who have gone before me or those who are still in the process of leaving their footprint upon the world. As a human being, it would be virtually impossible to experience everything in life, and who would really want to? However, it is not impossible to vicariously learn and subsequently benefit from the experience of others if we are open to this concept."Inspirational Quotes: 365 Quotes for Daily Motivation" by Author/Editor Jonny Fox is a wonderful compilation of a variety of motivational quotes to start off each day on the right foot. What a great opportunity to infuse our minds with positive thoughts and affirmations. Thank you to Jonny Fox for providing a handy inspirational tool in order for his reading audience to do just that!Although, I enjoyed all the quotes in this book, this one on March 7th by Robert Kiyosaki resonated with me. He is unfamiliar to me but I certainly like and agree with what he has to say. "A lot of people are afraid to tell the truth, to say no. That's where toughness comes into play. Toughness is not being a bully. It's having backbone." In my opinion, character starts with having the backbone to stand up for our beliefs.Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Meditation for Beginners: 5 simple steps to boosting confidence, creativity and relieving stress by Author Jonny FoxThis is the second self-help book that I have read and reviewed by motivational Author Jonny Fox.  After reading 7 Steps to Self-Confidence: Become Fearless, Bold and Resolute within 30 days , I was quite eager to read more suggestions in other areas of this author's expertise. The tips on how to build self-confidence really hit home for me. Now the positive guidelines on meditation techniques and the "gift" of learning to live in the present add to the previous foundation of positive thinking.In, "Meditation for Beginners: 5 simple steps to boosting confidence, creativity and relieving stress", Author Jonny Fox delves into the positive philosophy and benefits of learning meditation techniques. He stresses that it will take time and perseverance to fully capture a meditative state but it is well worth the effort. The results are profound once the mind can decrease the "inner chatter" and learn to settle into the mode of "mindfulness" rather than wasting time on mindless and unproductive thoughts.The first step in achieving these positive results is to start with the art of proper breathing. Choosing a quiet time of the day, preferably early morning, will help set the pace for a more relaxing, stress free, and hopefully more creative existence. Although, these steps may seem easy to follow, the author encourages the beginner who hopes to glean from the benefits of meditation to be patient with themselves. The desired results will not take place overnight.  He emphasizes on more than one occasion that it will take time to establish a rewarding and beneficial period of meditation on a daily basis.I fully agree when he concludes that "mediation is an insightful life practice that works at transcending you to a state of inner peace and acceptance".  Learning to "accept and love" who we truly are is definitely the foundation for all good things to come. As in the first book, Author Jonny Fox writes from the wealth of his own experiences. In doing so, he gives well-thought out and authentic suggestions based on the positive results attained in his own life. In other words, he is the living proof that what he suggests in his guidebooks actually works. He obviously believes in a "do as I do" philosophy in life which is a trait I truly admire and respect.Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

7 Steps to Self-Confidence: Become Fearless, Bold and Resolute within 30 days by Author Jonny FoxI could very much relate to this self-help guidebook for more than one reason. First of all, I am also an inspirational author and I have written quite a few motivational books myself. However, more importantly...I have also experienced the negative consequences of lacking self confidence and the debilitating effects of extreme shyness. Both of these personality traits have a huge impact on an individual's life and it is very difficult to overcome this type of personality without making the strong decision to do so as stressed by Author Jonny Fox.Making that decision is the first step on the road to improving one's confidence and building self-esteem. I like the down-to-earth, honest and open style, as well as the helpful hints provided by this author. He willingly shares his own experiences in dealing with extreme shyness to better educate others on how to build self-confidence. In other words, he can relate to his reading audience. He offers helpful suggestions in order to enable others to conquer the fear of being in the limelight or by caring too much about what other people think.He admits it is no easy feat and at the end of each chapter, Author Jonny Fox gives easy-to-follow daily exercises on how to improve our self-image. According to this author, using positive affirmations and becoming more fully aware of how others treat us are positive steps in the right direction. If we are surrounded by people who put us down, it is pretty hard to have or develop self-confidence. I also agree with his suggestion to step outside our "comfort zone". I particularly like Chapter 6 "Fake it 'til you make it". It reminds me of a quote I came across in my reading travels..."if you play the part long enough, you cease to be the hypocrite" (source unknown). In my opinion, becoming all that we can be starts with playing the part.I am still a "work in progress" and Author Jonny Fox's tips help remind me that I must stay the course. Good stuff!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteI'm Not Perfect and It's Okay

Kids books:"Children's beginner readers early reader books":Bedtime stories for kids collection:Fiction picture book:Preschool kids series 2-9-Animal stories:Friendship ... stories Beginner / Early readers eBooks) by Sigal AdlerChildren's Author Sigal Adler provides four children's stories in this collection of rhyming books aimed at young, pre-school children or toddlers.Starting off with "oops, I wet my pants" where a child is reminded to go to the bathroom when they feel the urge sets the pace to teach children some of life's small lessons. Followed by "Hippo Hippy", "Bacteria Joe", and then "It's a Baby!", this delightful collection of books continues to educate it's young reading audience on such things as oral hygiene or the upcoming birth of a new baby brother or sister.Quite the bonus to find four short stories with colorful illustration in one children's book...a rare find that is sure to please young children.Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteI'm Not Perfect and It's Okay

A Love Story for a Nation by Author Mark W SasseIt is almost impossible to adequately express in words how moved I was by "A Love Story for a Nation". The plot of this incredible tale sent shivers down my spine on more than one occasion. Author Mark Sasse is one gifted writer. The depth of his ability to connect with the characters in his stories which permeates through to his readers, to those of us clinging to every word he pens, is beyond description. I'm a huge fan...plain and simple.This suspenseful novel is more than a love story between two people celebrating their first anniversary. Gerald and Rosia Sanpatri share a much deeper connection. Gerald is a banned award-winning author, a former university professor, a man of great brilliance with strong revolutionary opinions...who now lives a mundane and repetitive life as a bank guard at the A.S. National Bank. For personal reasons, he has chosen to keep his past life a secret even from his beautiful and devoted wife, Rosia. Little does Gerald know that she has secrets of her own which are about to tear his heart apart...As both of their past lives come back to haunt them, Gerald Sanpatri decides to take a firm stand to combat his love, his loss, his feelings of betrayal, but most importantly his deep love and devotion for his nation. With a simple smile and the desire and determination to make a difference, Gerald makes the decision to "stand firm" with a never ending smile on his face. Unexpected twists and turns arise at every corner as Gerald Sanpatri mentally and emotionally takes on the persona of Jonny as he battles the evil dictatorship of Antoine.  One simple, kind-hearted man who loves his country...can Gerald really make a difference?I wish there was higher than a 5 star rating because I would definitely give it to this mesmerizing novel. Loved it!!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteI'm Not Perfect and It's Okay

Higher Education 101: Understanding the secrets to personal development by Author Osamede ArhunmwundeI thoroughly enjoyed this motivational book by Author Osamede Arhunmwunde. It is very well-written, inspirational, thought-provoking and will be beneficial to all those seeking some direction in their lives. Personal self-development is a choice. Once made, the opportunities and possible gains are limitless. This author clearly states over and over again about setting goals and mastering self-discipline in order to attain both daily and long term aspirations as well as fulfilling our dreams. In other words, dare to dream and dream big. According to him, all individuals are gifted. It is up to each of us as individuals to tap into the "infinite intelligence" that resides in each of us. Yes...we are made in the image and likeness of God and with that idea in mind, we can turn the ordinary into the extraordinary by being all that we are meant to be. It requires work, persistence and discipline but the rewards are numerous and long term.Author Osamede Arhunmwunde has a great philosophy on life. This self-help book is positive and upbeat. His use of quotes from a variety of great thinkers and philosophers as well as numerous ideas from his mentor really add to the reading experience. The stories that he shares to make his varied and valid points further enhance this learning experience. Great book!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Children's book: "WHO'S THAT NEW NEIGHBOR?": Bedtime story for kids: Early & beginner reader-Adventure-Values Book-Funny-free kid(prime)Rhymes Poetry-Education-level ... Beginner readers fiction books series 4) by Author Sigal AdlerAnother delightful children's book by talented Author Sigal Adler.Uncle Jake is none too happy with his new neighbor. Written in rhyme, the author...in the well-illustrated book takes the opportunity to teach her young reading audience a few moral lessons. Uncle Jake is a perfectionist and he likes things just so. He works very hard at keeping an orderly life; however, he does appear to have a bit of a mean streak. He is very displeased when a new neighbor moves in next door with a variety of pets and a cage full of pigeons. After a fitful sleep, he awakens to discover his clothes that are hanging on the line outside are stained with pigeon droppings. Uncle Jake reacts in anger...Shortly after that, he discovers that his vegetable garden has been disturbed and he quickly jumps to conclusions. Children are easily drawn into Uncle Jake's reactions to the events taking place in his life and the negative consequences of his rashness. They are then shown how he decides to positively turn the situation around by helping out his new neighbor. Good stuff!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AytotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Along the Way - Book One - Welcome to Alberta! by Author Teresa SchapanskyAs a former elementary school teacher, I must say that I am very impressed with this well-written educational children's book. Author Teresa Schapansky sets the pace for a pleasant and fact-based journey for school aged children.In "Along the Way - Book One - Welcome to Alberta!" children are introduced to Albert, a fun loving, adventurous Albertosaurus (aka Albert) who is about to take his reading audience on a thrill of an educational tour. He is happy to introduce his friends Jade and Ben. Their story unfolds as their mom and dad explain to them that they could possibly be moving because their dad is looking for a new job. After their initial trepidation, Jade and Ben embrace the idea of this new experience with a more open mind and look forward to making new friends while still keeping in touch with their old ones.A month later, when they actually do move, Albert kicks in again to explain the background, many points of interest, and the surrounding geography in and around their new home town in Alberta. The "enhanced text" really adds to this educational experience. A double tap on the bold word further explains or gives a more in depth description of Albert's effort to educate his young readers on such concepts as the seven continents,  Canada...its provinces and territories, as well as explaining about plant and animal fossils just to name a few. With some history of the French Voyageurs and the sights to see along the Yellowhead Highway, Author Teresa Schapansky does a fine job of touching base on several other topics.  This book offers many further learning opportunities. The illustrations are great and add to the reading pleasure and better understanding of the varied teaching goals.I really enjoyed this children's book and look forward to sharing it with my grandchildren!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteGrowing Up & Liking It

It's Time To Eat: A Children's Picture Book for Early/Beginner Readers by Author Helen H. WuI really like the cover of this children's book. It is both bright and eye-catching. The picture of Marcus Monkey sitting in his high chair immediately tells the age bracket that this book will appeal to...he is definitely a toddler or of pre-school age.Monkey Mom has prepared a delicious meal for Marcus but he is refusing to eat it just as we know all little children do at one time or another. Ms. Wu uses the contents of Marcus' meal as an opportunity to teach her young reading audience how to count..."One guavas, two bananas, three cherries, four grapes, five pecans, six raisins". She also creates the opportunity for the children to identify these fruits on a well laid out plate.When Marcus chooses to play rather than to eat his meal, he goes out in search of his animal friends. They are all busy eating their own meals as he quickly discovers when he first stops by to visit Pauley Pony who generously offers to share his meal of fresh green grass with him. A third learning opportunity arises as Marcus calls on each one of his friends. All the animals offer to share their meal with him and the young reader sees what each animal eats...from straw, to acorns, to bamboo branches, to worms and so on."It's Time To Eat" is a delightful children's book with plenty of teaching tools...counting, identifying fruits, identifying animals and their eating habits, as well as teaching the concept of sharing and appreciation for what we have to eat. Good stuff!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

The Tin Men by Author Amalie JahnI really enjoyed this book!Charlie Johnson, a young university student is deeply in love with his soul mate Brooke Wallace. At the deepest core of their being, they both know that they are meant to share a life together. However, upon the unexpected death of his father in a climbing accident, Charlie doesn't feel the pain of his loss. Throughout his life, Charlie has experienced an inexplicable void. When Charlie steps into his father's office after his funeral service, he finds more than he bargained for....the police have returned his father's climbing equipment. The knots on the rope....they just aren't quite right. Then Charlie discovers a picture of a young woman in his desk draw. Who is she? What does she have to do with his father? Why would he have her picture? So many questions...so few answers.When Charlie confronts his mother, he discovers more about himself but not enough to satisfy his desire to get to the bottom of his past. In this Sci-Fi romance novel, the readers are taken on a suspenseful journey in both present and time travel to the past along with Charlie and Brooke to get those answers.Well-written and captivating...definitely makes me want to read more novels by this talented author!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Anti Inflammatory Cookbook - 50 Slow Cooker Recipes With Anti - Inflammatory Ingredients - (Great For Gout Relief!) Crockpot Recipes, Slow Cooker Recipes, (Low Cooker Cookbooks, Crockpot Cookbooks) by Author Kate Marsh and Recipe JunkiesI really like cookbooks for a very good reason....I enjoy great food and the pleasure of experiencing different taste sensations. Another thing I like is art of combining healthy eating habits with recipes that offer a unique and delicious alternative to my everyday menu.This great recipe book does just that. Starting off with a recipe for Pulled Chicken and moving on to other delightful delicacies such as Cream Cheese Chicken, the author does a fine job of tempting the taste buds by encouraging people to try new and different ways to cook ordinary ingredients.The Nutritional Information provided at the end of each recipe is an added bonus and a health smart idea. There are many more recipes to follow in this Anti-Inflammatory Cookbook such as Summer Squash Casserole. It's the perfect time of the year to prepare this one as the crop of squash will soon be bountiful. Corn and Potato Chowder is one of my favorites. One recipe I will be trying shortly is Crock Pot Lasagna. I am a big fan of using this method of cooking. Bon appetit!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Simpatico: They Will Never Tear Us Apart: A Novel of Romantic Suspense by Author Dermot DavisAlthough Author Dermot Davis has published several books, this is my first exposure to this well-versed and talented author. In this suspenseful novel, he manages to capture the attention of his reading audience right from the get go. I, for one, was totally drawn into the storyline and could hardly put this book down.Starting off with the innocent love shared by Fiona and Andrew where they become soulmates by meshing their blood together to reinforce this concept...then on to the deep secret that Fiona's father keeps hidden in the basement room in their mansion...the stage is set for this suspenseful romance to unfold.Fiona, born a Moonchild according to her father, is a very unique young lady who is now in the process of trying to tap into her psychic abilities. She is definitely a believer in the occult which a few of Andrew's friends consider to be an exhibition of some very weird behavior. Simon, her father, is part of a secret society "The Order of the Wise Serpent". He keeps his clandestine activities well hidden in the confines of the mansion's basement where he often visits to perform his rituals. Fiona is aware that something is up but does not have full knowledge of his dark world and his hand in Andrew's streak of bad luck....Her father is wealthy beyond belief and Fiona lives with him. He loves his daughter and wants to protect her at all costs from the outside world. She has lived a somewhat cloistered life but at eighteen years of age she manages to fall madly in love with Andrew. He is a pretty ordinary guy who lives a simple life with his mother. His feelings for Fiona are genuine as he is equally enchanted with her. Simon decides that this union is not to his liking and he takes matters into his own hands in order to thwart the romance...A cruel turn of events disrupts the plans that Andrew and Fiona have and thrusts their lives into a downward spiral resulting in an incomprehensible and painful series of misfortunes. Fiona has a plan of her own...will she be able to pull it off? She is determined to share a life with Andrew no matter the circumstances. Does she have the psychic ability to do so? The suspense to follow is well worth reading.  Simpatico is a great fictional novel with many unexpected twists and turns penned by a very talented author with both a vivid and creative imagination. Great cover too!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

The Case Of The Tattooed Buttocks: An Inspector Cullot Mystery by Author Alan HardyThis is the first novel I have read by talented Author Alan Hardy and if there is one book I enjoy, it is a well-written mystery. "The Case Of The Tattooed Buttocks: An Inspector Cullot Mystery" does not disappoint and is even more than I expected it to be. With a murder to solve, Detective Sergeant Watkins discovers that ex-Inspector Cullot is very much involved in this crime. Police Constable Blunt, the first to arrive at the murder scene, assists in the case by sharpening his pencil to write down every clue in his notebook/notebooks as the mystery unfolds. Blunt...is not the sharpest knife in the drawer or is he really as dull as he appears to be?Irony, humour, satire and a well-honed knowledge of the English language set the pace as Inspector Sergeant Watkins works in tandem with his former partner ex-Inspector Cullot. Their efforts to get to the bottom or should I say "tattooed buttocks" of the case is nothing short of hysterical. PC Blunt, as he takes notes, is eagerly lapping up the lesson on learning the differences between homophones, homonyms and homophobes much to the chagrin of Watkins.A mysterious murder of a beautiful blond takes place at Bounderdales, the mansion where the elderly oil magnate, Henry Barble, resides. His red-headed, sexy main squeeze, Miss Andress is constantly at his side. Seven suspects, female and male alike, are all at the top of the list of people to be interrogated but there is an unusual twist in the case. Ex-Inspector Cullot seems to have access to some very odd clues. Perhaps he is a suspect too. Purple or red knickers...what does he know that Watkins and Blunt don't?Wow....if you are interested in a very unique roller coaster ride with numerous twists and turns, you won't want to miss a word of this satirical detective/mystery novel. Very entertaining indeed! I may be tapping into my own puzzle solving abilities or sense of humour but I find the last name of the ex-Inspector quite comical. Cullot reminds of the word culottes...a female trouser-like skirt. Hey...I can't help but wonder if Author Alan Hardy and I share a similar wry sense of humor and he specifically chose this name to better describe the eccentric ex-Inspector Cullot. After all, Cullot does have an odd fetish and I think his name suits him well!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Mazy's High Flying Adventure!: 2 Bonus Stories: Sable the Pony and Curley Sue's Lesson by Author Christine Gilliam HornbackAuthor Christine Gilliam Hornback is a talented author who is able to write in more than one genre. Children's book Caleb's Cereal, as well as a non-fictional/inspirational Tell the Enemy to Scat and the touching fictional romance If Oak Trees Could Talk can now be attributed to this well-versed author. Her books are easy to read and an inspiration to all...both children and adults alike.In "Mazy's High Flying Adventure", children have the opportunity to meet Mazy, the tiny duckling raised since birth by her lovable and loving friend Marylou. They have been best friends and virtually inseparable since Mazy's arrival on the Johnson family farm. However, every year when late fall arrives, Mazy has the deep urging to be like all the other ducks and Canadian geese that fly south for the winter. She has such mixed feelings about this desire as she could never permanently leave Marylou. Mazy spends a great deal of time confiding in Annabelle, the family cow that also resides on the Johnson farm.As time goes by, Mazy continues to pine for the opportunity to fly high in the sky. One day she discovers that Marylou has a very unique surprise for her. At first she is very frightened until she realizes this experience is a dream come true...Young children will love this story. It is great for the early reader or as a book to be enjoyed as a bedtime story or at quiet time during the day. "Sable the Pony" and "Curley Sue's Lesson" are two bonus stories at the end of the book written in rhyme that are also sure to please young children. I love the cover of this book and the true to life illustrations found between its pages.Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Bed & Breakfast Bedlam (A Logan Dickerson Cozy Mystery Book 1) by Author Abby L. VandiverI very much enjoyed this good, clean, and unpredictable mystery novel. Logan Dickerson is a young archaeologist who is following in her mother's footsteps. However, she has a long way to go before achieving her mother's great reputation and level of expertise. Logan decides she wants to make a name for herself by uncovering proof that the Maya may have once migrated to Georgia..."at the Track Rock Gap to be exact". These ruins are considered U.S. government property with obvious signs stating that there is no trespassing allowed. These signs seem to have the reverse effect when it comes to Logan.Although, usually a person that knows how to follow rules, Logan decides to take a gamble and cross into the "KEEP OUT" turf. While there she gets caught red-handed but manages to escape or so she thinks. The next morning, when she decides to clear out by leaving her motel bright and early, she discovers an FBI agent at the front desk asking questions about her. Logan manages to sweet talk and lie her way out of his questions when he catches up to her in the parking lot. She adamantly denies  knowing anything about the break in and states that she is on her way to Stallings Island to investigate another dig site. Little does she know that the FBI officer comes from this exact neck of the woods.To keep in tune with her lies, Logan heads out that way. Soon after her arrival, the whole ball of yarn starts to unravel. While there, the murder of Gemma Burke takes place at the Bed & Breakfast Inn where Logan is a guest. The owners of this quaint establishment are the two daughters of 89-100 year old Ms Vivee...no one seems to know her exact age. Irregardless, Ms Vivee decides to play Nancy Drew with Logan as her partner in crime. Ms Vivee, a spunky and intelligent old lady is full of opinions and is determined to solve this murder case. Before you know it...Bay, her grandson and FBI agent shows up at the B & B much to Logan's surprise. She thinks he has followed her there and tries to keep a low profile. This strategy is virtually impossible now that Ms Vivee, much to Lorgan's chagrin, is deeply involved in the case and on the move for the first time in twenty years...Author Abby L. Vandiver uses humor as well as clever witticisms and puns as she lets this mystery unfold. At touch of romance thrown in makes this fictional mystery novel delightful. It is easy to envision the main characters, Logan Dickerson and Ms Vivee, as this unique mystery novel takes its reading audience on a fun-filled fact finding expedition in order to locate the elusive murderer of Gemma Burke. Very enjoyable read indeed!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Children's Books:Ernie the Elephant and the Teddy Bear (funny bedtime story collection) by Author Leela HopeErnie is a cute little elephant that has misplaced his favorite purplish teddy bear named Plum. He is very upset and enlists the help of his best friend Martin Mouse to help him find his precious bear. Initially Ernie is angry at his dad because he thinks he has hidden Plum. His dad is not impressed. Ernie and Martin Mouse then decide to talk to Ernie's mom. She suggests that they retrace Ernie's steps to see if they can find Plum. Together, they manage to solve the mystery of his disappearance.This children's book is written in rhyme and the colorful illustrations really add to the reading pleasure.Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteI'm Not Perfect and It's Okay

"A MILLION GOLD COINS"Children's books:Bedtime stories for 3-8,Beginner readers Early readers picture books,Preschool book,Funny-humor,Children's poetry-Early ... early readers bedtime story fiction books) by Author Sigal AdlerAnother delightful book by talented children's Author Sigal Adler. Written in rhyme, Farmer Bill lives on a hill next door to Farmer Jack. They are both very hard workers but hope that one day their labor will pay off in a very big way. No matter the weather conditions, they toil away each and every day. Farmer Jack and Farmer Bill have plenty in common. They both have families to support but they also share a dream...that of "finding pots and pots of gold".Their adventure to follow as they release a strange bird trapped in a tree is sure to entertain the young reader...Great children's book with a moral lesson to boot. The colorful illustrations add to the reading experience and are sure to be enjoyed by its young reading audience.Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteI'm Not Perfect and It's Okay

Children's book: "Big Boys Sleep in Their Own Bed": Funny Kids Books(Preschool): Motivates your kids to sleep in their own bed, (Teach Values Book)... for Kids for Beginner Readers. Book 2) by Author Ayala SaarTommy is four years old and the youngest child in his family. He is very brave when it comes to a variety of things in his life including getting himself to Kindergarten on his own. He is also able to play outside, take a bath, brush his teeth and do several other things by himself. Tommy is a typical little boy who enjoys so many fun-filled activities. However, after experiencing a bad dream, Tommy has difficulty falling back to sleep. He then decides to creep into his parents room...The next day, Tommy's parents come up with a delightful surprise to help him fall asleep.This children's book is a great way to teach children that there is no need to be afraid. The illustrations are bright and colorful and add to the reading pleasure. I always enjoy rhyming books and this one fits the bill in that department. Good stuff!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

The Haunted Circus: The Astro's Adventures Series by Author Susan DayAnother great chapter book by children's Author Susan Day. The Organisation is at it again in its goal to save "other dogs from neglect". Are they up to the task as the face the menacing look of angry clowns? Gozo, their leader attired in a typical dotted and colorful jumpsuit is not your normal fun-loving clown. Commander Rocky, a black Border collie thinks he can handle the situation. Gozo, with the help and support of the other circus entertainers wants revenge because the Organization ruined the clown's tent. After throwing all the dogs into a cage, they decide to try and settle down for the night until...Commander Rocky has a huge decision to make. Does the Organisation only save dogs? Are they truly the "best rescuers in the world?" Only time will tell as this challenging adventure unfolds. They are not only facing the angry circus performers but now the evil doings of Speed Bump Charlie and Furball are added to the mix. Will they get their revenge too?Very enjoyable read by talented Author Susan Day....bound to entertain the younger reading audience!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

First Aid for Infants and Children: 30 Common Emergency Procedures to Save Your Child's Health and Life by Author Mikolaj LaskiThe contents of this medical emergency guide book are both extensive and useful. With thirty fairly common childhood ailments, the parent or child care worker is given medical advice on how to assess and deal with the issue at hand. As stated in the Introduction, "This guide is a collection of the most important first-aid instructions in life-threatening situations concerning infants and children".Although every adult may want to avoid situations that require emergency care, it is always wise to be prepared to face such a possible occurrence. In order to achieve this goal, it is necessary to have a well-equipped First-Aid Kit. The required contents of this Kit is provided in Chapter 1. Information on how to use unfamiliar equipment such as an AED (Automated External Defibrillator) also follows in this informative guidebook. There are several pertinent illustrations to further teach the parent the techniques needed to address the emergency issue at hand. From animal bites, to severe wounds, to bone fractures and so on, the parent or child care worker is taken through each and every step until the child can receive proper medical care if need be.This Emergency Guidebook is a very useful tool to have on hand. It can be easily read on a variety of technical devices which add to the convenience of using it whenever necessary.Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Children's Book of Magic: 30 Magic Tricks for Young Wizards by Author Konrad ModzelewskiThis colorful children's book for ages 4-9 starts off with the Golden Rules of performing magic tricks. I am sure the third rule of "practice makes perfect" hits home in all walks of life so why not start this good habit right from the get go? This concept is a wonderful educational tool.Two little characters...a young boy and girl add to this delightful book by introducing each new trick. The magic "secret" is then demonstrated with several illustrations to teach the young reading audience just how to perform the mysterious act with the magical skill required. I like the additional tips given after each lesson. This provides the young child a better chance of becoming the expert magician that he/she is aspiring to be.There are a variety of skill levels when it comes to the ease or difficulty of performing each magic trick. The little white rabbit/rabbits do an excellent job of letting the child know which tricks are easier or more difficult to perform. They helpfully sit in a hat at the corner of each page to give the performer an indication of the effort needed to perform each trick. From card tricks, to mind reading, to using the simple tools of a child's own fingers and hands, this interesting book is bound to amuse many an entertainer which may very well include both the younger and older reading audiences. Good stuff!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Peter: Darkest Fears - Dark Poetry (Peter: A Darkened Fairytale, Vol 9)by Author William O'BrienThis is not the first book that I have read and reviewed by talented Author William O'Brien and I'm sure it won't be the last. Once again the reader is entertained by being drawn into the dark side of life filled with vampires, ghosts, and haunted souls. Just looking at the mind-boggling and spooky book cover indicates exactly what lies between the pages of this well-written and eerie compilation of Dark Poetry for the adult reading audience.Vampires eating bodies, tasting blood, and leaving behind a trail of fear are enough to send shivers down your spine. Catching a glimpse of the "Undead" is also enough to leave a lasting impression.
