In "Reaper", "Leaving unhinged, the coven's wheel...Taking life the reaper's meal" leaves little to the imagination.If you are intrigued by this genre, you will not be disappointed in this book!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

How To Be A Better Husband: The Ultimate Guide To Mastering Marriage For Men by Author Joshua ColeI like the basic concept of this marriage enhancing guidebook. First of all, it's wonderful to see a book on how to improve a marriage written especially for the men in our lives. I hope some men take the opportunity to read the interesting and helpful suggestions that are found in this manual.Although the author admits that the most romantic years usually take place within the first few years of marriage, he emphasizes that there is no reason why the initial spark can't be maintained throughout a married lifetime. Desire, consideration, and communication combined with a dose of genuine affection can produce wonders...and it doesn't even have to be "work". According to Author Joshua Cole, adding a little creativity to your lifestyle will reap plenty of rewards. This marriage guide is both realistic and helpful!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteI'm Not Perfect and It's Okay

Quit Smoking: The Ultimate Success Formula To Quitting Smoking Now & Forever by Author Joshua ColeWritten in a down-to-earth and easy-to-read style, Author Joshua Cole takes his readers through the necessary steps to kick the bad habit of smoking. He not only describes the methods to be smoke-free, he discusses the benefits of getting rid of this addiction once and for all.Author Joshua Cole explains why the smoker should quit "the cancer stick" and then he goes into great detail about the positive advantages of doing so. Making the decision to quit this expensive habit is one of the first steps to being well on your way to actually accomplishing this somewhat difficult task. Read the book in its entirety to discover the "Game Plan".Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Gun Men by Author Michael NewtonWelcome to the wild west. I have never read a novel in the western genre before and what a treat it is to follow Sloan in his travels across Texas as he makes his way to the Mexican border. Sloan, a notorious gun man, knows no fear and thinks about his possible death on a daily basis. He's prepared one way or the other, shoot to survive or be shot. He's ready either way you look at it as he faces the killings in his past and knows one day they will come back to haunt him.Chadwell, prominent business man in Bloodroot has a score to settle. Sloan has shot his only son in a main street shoot out. Reminds me of the movie High Noon. Despite his son's bad attitude...deserving death or not...Chadwell wants revenge with a capital R. He has now solicited the aid of another gun man by the name of Lucas Grant. Grant has some history with Sloan and is quite eager to accept the $1000 reward to bring him back DOA...dead or alive.Meanwhile, Sloan is in the town of Agua Dulce and in no time flat he shoots down two more men. Now he has his work cut out for him as he accepts to stay put and work for Brubaker, a business man similar to Chadwell. His plans to escape to Mexico have been put on hold. Kit Gordon the Marshall of Bloodroot is widening the search for Sloan at the request of Chadwell, who owns him and everyone else in town. Lucas Grant intends to earn his money. In fact, he'd kill Sloan for free, that's how much he hates him. Will he succeed? Only time will tell...Very enjoyable read. I couldn't put this book down as I just needed to know the outcome.Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Paleo For Athletes by Author Megan White is not the first cookbook I've enjoyed by this author. Paleo Slow Cooker: A Sassy Cavewoman Makes (Slow-Burning) Fire: A Paleo Cookbook With 40 Gluten-Free, All-Day, $4-or-Less Per Serving Paleo Slow Cooker Recipes to Slim Your Waistline is another recipe book that I've had the opportunity to discover and enjoy.The recipes in in Paleo For Athletes are an extension of this well-rounded and nutritionally balanced diet specifically aimed at athletes focusing on "flavor and thought for what YOUR MUSCLES want to eat after your exercise."In this handy cookbook, once again "Author Megan White goes into great detail to explain the benefits of a Paleo Diet as well as sharing numerous recipes to help achieve the goal of living a healthier more nutritionally balanced lifestyle. The pictures of the ready-to-serve product look very appetizing. Great cookbook"...and wholesome guide for the serious athlete in you!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Judge, Jury, Desert Fury by Author L. J. MartinMike Reardon is no novice when it comes to the perils of war. State side, he is now in the process of forming a team behind the scenes to return to the battle field. Tough guys like himself...former military men around the age of forty, ready to walk away from their lives at a moment's notice to take the law into their own in order to complete a mission. Their names...Skip, Killer, TooBad, BeBe, Pax, and Mike Reardon himself heading up the team. Lots of money involved.....plenty of risk. Can they do the job that they have set out to do?  Time will tell. Moxie, murder, and mayhem make up the graphic plot as these gutsy guys become the motley crew and follow through on the plan...Add the gorgeous Sophia McAmber to the mix and you've got one great adventurous story. Afghanistan here we come!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

The Seamless Web Part 1: A Legal Comedy by Author Joe EliseonPete Roselli, Attorney at Law, is relatively young and wet behind the ears when it comes to practicing law at Myers, Rothstein, Gould & Moskowitz. Jack Berman, his superior...with his ornery, bigger-than-life personality is about to irreversibly change Pete's life.Jack needs an underling to research a case for him and Pete has been hand selected to do the job. After a long tirade from Jack, Pete sets about to find a case that sets a precedent for Jack which will enable him to win his case for the richest man in Brooklyn, Mr. Marvoules. With this daunting task, Pete begins his legal research and comes up empty handed until...Pete Roselli is either smarter than he appears or the dumbest lawyer around as he plies his trade and makes a name for himself in the firm. Author Joe Eliseon combines his legal expertise with a touch of wry humor and successfully fills the pages of "The Seamless Web Part 1: A Legal Comedy" with a most enjoyable read.  This entertaining fictional novel is sure to entertain a wide reading audience as they share the roller coaster ride that Pete Roselli endures. I can't wait to read Part 2 in this series to discover the future antics of Pete, a very likable character, and the troubles that seem to entrap him where ever he goes. Great fictional novel that's hard to put down.  Both amusing and easy to read!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ` Dolores AyotteA Woman's Voice ~ Inspirational Short Stories ~ Volume 1

Blood of the Eternal Moon by Author Simon OneillWow...what a gruesome tale. I couldn't agree more with the words of another reviewer. He states, "What could be more tasty, and lusty for that matter, than a vampire novel set in France just before the great depression".Author Simon Oneill has expertly penned one such novel filled with the dark adventures of vampires, witches, and demons. The graphic descriptions of the torturous experiences faced by Delicate Rose are both nightmarish and hellish in nature. The main question is "can Delicate Rose rise above her hopeless situation and free herself from the macabre cloud that surrounds her?" This is a well-written novel by talented Author Simon Oneill. I wouldn't say that it is easy to read or to digest for that matter. However, if you're into vampire novels, you will not want to miss a word of this one. Scary stuff to be sure...both mind boggling and eerie!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

LOVE MAKES: BOXED SET (BOOKS 1 - 3) (New Adult Seduction Series) by Author J.S. LuxorTalented Author J.S. Luxor does an excellent job of briefly introducing her reading audience to the previously written books in this series. Her goal is to give a short preamble and a glimpse at the challenging history between the two protagonists, Joanne Prime and Tristan Grant. This allows the reader to jump right into the story-line of "Love Makes". In doing so, she adeptly provides the necessary background and makes this book a very captivating romantic novel which is sure to please many a reader.Shortly after the background buildup, we are brought to the present day events....the wedding day between Joanne and Tristan. J.S. Luxor manages to entice her readers right from the onset by flipping back and forth between the voices or personal "points of view" of each of these main characters. I enjoy her style of writing as the reader is drawn into the heads of Joanne and Tristan and are exposed to what they are thinking and experiencing at any given moment. From the wedding ceremony, to the honeymoon, to the morning after, we share in the events and excitement experienced by this newly married couple. Humorous and entertaining to be sure!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteGrowing Up & Liking It

Where Are Ayden's Easter Eggs? (Children's Easter Books : Beginner reader Early Learning) (Dinosaurs) Children's eBooks (Animal Habitats) Holiday Fun Book by Author Joyce MitchellI think this children's book is really cute. The illustrations are bright and colorful and Ayden has plenty of fun teaching young children the colors of the eggs and their various hiding places. It is especially delightful during the Easter season when children are excited about the arrival of the Easter bunny. My young grandchildren love being read to and I know they will enjoy this book!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteGrowing Up & Liking It

Childrens Book: At The Zoo (Happy children's picture book with photo) by Author Leela HopeFirst of all, I really like the cover of this children's book. The pictures of the animals are delightful. However, it gets even better after that because the animal pictures in the book are true to life. It is also written in rhyme which I think will bring even more pleasure to the children reading it. Secondly, "At The Zoo" is a great educational tool to expose young children to our animal friends in their natural habitat. Good stuff!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteGrowing Up & Liking It

Tall Tales: Diary of Chris & Boomer The Wonder Dog, Peculiar Children Books Series with Virtues: Wisdom by AuthorWalter RouzerIn this children's book, Author Walter Rouzer introduces the Bacon Family by starting off with a day-to-day diary about the adventures of Chris. On Monday, he is given the opportunity by his Uncle Louie to meet Chucky the elephant who works for nothing but peanuts. His uncle quickly gives Chris a life lesson by sharing his advice. He states that it is no fun to work for such a meager wage. On Tuesday, Chucky the elephant decides to pull up his roots and travel to greener pastures...Children will delight in the daily diary of Chris...and what he and his wonder dog Boomer encounter along the way. The colorful illustrations add to the reading experience!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Tall Tales: Perfect Pam And The Big Bad Wolf: Peculiar Children Books Series with Virtues: Bravery: Courage by Author Walter RouzerAnother great children's book in the Tall Tales Series by talented Author Walter Rouzer. Perfect Pam is the main character in this well illustrated story aimed at the younger reading audience. When Pam decides to take a shortcut on her way home from school she makes a gruesome discovery. She soon wishes she had followed her mother's sage advice and stayed on the main path home. She sees several animal tracks in the snow and is quite frightened by the unknown consequences of not obeying her mom. Pam acts quickly and manages to think of a plan. She also learns a very valuable lesson. Your child with enjoy the brave actions of Pam and what ensues...Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Conflicting Webs by Author Darlene QuinnWow...another intriguing fictional novel by talented Author Darlene Quinn.  Adorable four year old Lindsay Levin is the product of a one night stand. Precious to the core and dearly loved by her doting grandmother, Nora Levin, Lindsay becomes a pawn in a custody battle by her irresponsible mother's reckless behavior. Kyle Clark, biological dad to Lindsay takes full financial responsibility for her well-being but finds that he comes to love this precious daughter more than he ever dreamed possible. Soon to be married to loving bride, April Toddman, the unthinkable happens just a few short days before the wedding ceremony. Britany Levin is released from a drug rehabilitation facility before the upcoming wedding with just enough time to wreak havoc with their nuptial plans. With Lindsay as flower girl, Britany along with fellow drug addict Chloe, work at disrupting the wedding. Many unforeseen complications ensue...As if this isn't causing enough stress for April...Madison Monroe, her lifelong friend and matron of honor, is late for the ceremony. Unbeknownst to the bride, a horrific accident is about to rob April of the usual joy a wedding day brings. Bill Boyd a passing stranger is witness to an incredible car accident which involves Madison and her family. He subsequently manages to become deeply involved in their physical and emotional struggles for reasons of his own...Each character in the well-written novel is skilfully intertwined and connected in such a way that nothing short of a miracle will make it all work out. Likable personalities combined with obnoxious ones like Britany's dad Dr. Levin, add to the realism of this down-to-earth captivating novel. Although fictional, I always enjoy a story with a plausible and uplifting plot. "Conflicting Webs" is another fantastic read by Author Darlene Quinn. At the end of it all, it left me with a "feel good" experience. It is always a pleasure to read and review her books!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteI'm Not Perfect and It's Okay

Dogs in Space: Book 8 in the Astro's Adventures Series by Author Susan DayThis is a great chapter book for school age children who enjoy stretching their imaginations into the world of make belief and outer space.  Speed Bump Charlie is an old alley cat with incredible abilities who is on a great adventure. As he grabs the reins of his chariot, he takes his reading audience on that unique adventure with him. The illustrations add to the enjoyment of this well-written children's book by talented Author Susan Day.Great read!

Write a Step-By-Step Book: Write Fast, Write Better, Write More, Solve Problems, Write Bestsellers, Learn How To Write a Book That Sells by Author Dean R. GilesIf there is one type of book I can truly relate to and appreciate, it is a step-by-step guidebook. Author Dean R. Giles delivers yet another helpful guidebook in his down-to-earth and easy-to-read writing style. His instructions on how to write a nonfiction book are very useful and to the point. He starts at the very beginning and then takes the new writer through the process of penning an eBook. Every tip that he gives can be easily put into place. There are tips that will be useful for published authors as well.Of course, the first step is to choose "a topic that will be of interest to a good number of people". It also must be a topic that the writer has sufficient knowledge about and is fueled by a personal passion to share this information.  If an author is passionate about his/her own work, it will generate a positive result by piquing the interest of others. Giles offers the marketing tip of narrowing down the topic. I agree with his insight of focusing on "one problem-one solution". There are plenty more helpful tips to be discovered in this writer's handbook. Good stuff!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

First Priority: A Short Story by Author B. J. RobinsonShort and sweet novella by talented Author B.J. Robinson!"First Priority" is a great introduction to "Mysterious Ways" when the reader gets the full picture of the romance which is yet to unfold between June and Andy. They were initially attracted to each other in high school. After going their separate ways, they meet up again at the strawberry bureau where Andy works as an inspector.  June, Myrtle's college-educated daughter, is home helping her superstitious mom with her livelihood...strawberry picking. Her mother openly wishes she had a son who could help her out on the farm. Much to the chagrin of June, this constant reminder encourages her to rise to the occasion. She comes up with a bold plan to get a better price for their strawberry harvest after their crop is hit by a hail storm rather than take the measly amount offered by Andy at the bureau. June uses her creative thinking and and marketing skills to come up with a better plan...When Author B.J. Robinson puts pen to paper she clearly demonstrates her love of writing and her gift of telling a compelling story. "First Priority" is bound to pique the reader's curiosity with the desire to know more about June, her possible romance with Andy, and whether Myrtle's suspicions are just old wives' tales...Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteI'm Not Perfect and It's Okay

Blue Lady (The Angelic Mason Series) by Author Stephany TullisWhat a captivating short story! Angelica Mason is a successful business woman who is both well-educated and ambitious. Her high school sweetheart Shaw Mallory is equally educated and successful. How did she let him slip through her fingers and what can she do to get him back? He has the makings of a desirable husband and Angelica is about to engage in her "Blue Lady" tactics to win him over. Little does she know that Shawn is playing a few games of his own...This romantic novella is short, sweet, and the reader is left wanting to know more.  I'm no exception as I can't wait to read what unfolds in this intriguing series. Great cover...especially if you like the color blue!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

LOVE SHAKES: A ROMANCE (BOXED SET) (New Adult Seduction Series) by Author J.S. Luxor"Love Shakes: A Romance" is a great Boxed Set (Books 1-4) to introduce the main characters in this series. Joanna Prime is a soon-to-be college graduate with a major in Psychology who is applying for a data entry position at a private security company owned by handsome dude, Tristan Grant.  This well-written and humorous romance/parody takes the reading audience on a roller coaster ride with its many emotional twist and turns. After a very bad job interview...Joanna and Tristan, literally fall into each other's arms as an earthquake takes place when exchanging a few words before Joanna steps into the elevator. The electric charge between the two of them sets the pace for the complicated and hot romance to follow.Both Joanna and Tristan have plenty of unresolved issues in their past which come back to haunt them as their relationship unfolds. Although I have not read "Fifty Shades of Gray", there are some pretty steamy episodes in "Love Shakes" that you might not want to miss.  Sue, Joanna's alter ego or conscience, is a neat touch to this young adult romantic story. Lots of fun, humor, and great writing to keep you glued to the page! The cliff-hanger at the end of the book definitely gives the reader the itch to return to the next volume in this series in order to learn more about Tristan and Joanna. J.S. Luxor is a master a penning a captivating and intriguing tale.

My Crazy Pet Frog (The perfect bedtime story!) by Author Scott GordonI really enjoy reading and reviewing children's books and "My Crazy Pet Frog" is no exception. The main character is actually a father frog. He seems to spend a great deal of time investigating a wide variety of personalities in order to figure out which one best suits him and the image he wants to portray. In the end, he comes to realize that his family and friends love him for just the way he is...for himself and not for what he thinks he needs to be. The illustrations are absolutely delightful!

Look and Find book for Kids: Find the CutesI think this children's book is bright and colorful. My grandchildren always enjoy these kinds of books. It is a great idea to have the answers at the end of the book so that the children can check things out if they can't find an item. They will then discover and  eventually remember where everything is in each picture.  Great book to enhance a child's memory!

Who's That Lazy Boy? by Author Sigal AdlerI recently had the opportunity to read this delightful children's book to my seven year old granddaughter and she loved it. The pictures are great and really add to the enjoyable reading experience. The book teaches a moral lesson as well. It is sage advice to realize it is not always wise to jump to conclusions. The humorous and unexpected ending brought a smile to our faces.  Good stuff!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteI'm Not Perfect and It's Okay

Passionate Paleo by Author Victoria LoveThe delicious piece of cheese cake displayed on the cover of this recipe book sets the pace for 25 tasty Valentine's Day treats to follow. In a nutshell, Chapter 1 explains the principles behind a Paleo diet. Written in a down-to-earth style, the benefits of following this diet are further expounded upon along with suggestions of what foods to eat or avoid according to the Paleo diet and lifestyle choices.The recipes are relatively easy to prepare and the images of the finished products serve to enhance their visual appeal. These pictures are sure to get the mouth watering as the meals look so tasty and appetizing. I enjoy a variety of dips and the Spinach Chip-Dip looks like a crowd pleasure to me.  For those with a sweet tooth, the Hazelnut Slice and Coconut Macaroon recipes look like real winners. Can't wait to give these delicious recipes a try!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteI'm Not Perfect and It's Okay

How To Get Over a Broken Heart by Author Debbie CarsonThis motivational book is short yet packed with positive insights on how to overcome emotional and psychological upsets. There are five true to life stories that are written in a down-to-earth style. Most of us may identify with any one of them at one time or another in our lives. These stories are shared in such a way as to provide the readers with the opportunity to live and learn from the experiences of others. Rejection by loved ones is never an easy emotion to embrace but with the help, support, and encouragement of others, Author Debbie Carson helps point the way. I like the "In Brief" section at the end of the book where she recaps the necessary steps to heal and move past the negative effects of a broken heart.Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Love Beneath a Florida Sky by B.J. RobinsonLove on a storm-tossed Atlantic Ocean. Cari must overcome the ghost of a past love to redeem the love of a present one. A bit of history mixed with contemporary romance. Love and passion on stormy seas. A different type of romance. Can Blake find a way to propose to Cari, one she'll always remember as he wants her to? A real treat with this one. Don't miss it. If you've never been to Florida, you might discover places you'll want to visit while you're there. If you live there, you'll identify and bask in romance under the  Florida sun. Love in the Sunshine State. Don't miss it.Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteI'm Not Perfect and It's Okay

The Faces Of Struggles Such As Cancers Are On The Journey To God's Glory! by Author Alfancena Millicent BarrettWhat a wonderful testimony to God as provided by Author Alfancena Millicent Barrett! While reading her inspirational book, I felt like I was sitting across the table from a dear friend whom I was getting to know better.She shares her life story with both openness and honesty and manages to draw the reader right into her life and the many challenges she encounters along the way. She starts at the very beginning as she explains her genetic birth defect. With her requiring corrective surgery, she is taken to a rehabilitation center at a very young age. Alfancena is a very positive and upbeat person who is easy to love and embrace.I enjoyed hearing about her life in Jamaica before she moved to the United States. She shares her family history and her relationship with both her mother and father as well as her siblings. The love and devotion she still feels toward them is heart-warming. Her faith in God sustains her through any and all hardships that she faces including cancer and her treatment. I can truly identify with the expression she uses to describe her life and her writing endeavors...she states that she is vessel for God`s Glory. Inspirational Author Alfancena Millicent Barrett has touched the lives of many people and as observed in the one of the final chapters, Contributions From The People God Placed In My Path On This Journey...relatives and friends in Christ have also touched her life in a very profound way.  In Chapter 16, she pens words of love to her readers to ensure that they take care of themselves and listen to their bodies. Great advice to be sure...her faith-filled words reflect her smile through every page that she writes!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer - Dolores AyotteI'm Not Perfect and It's Okay

The White Light by Authors Peter and Pattimari CacciolfiThis is not the first fictional novel that I have read and reviewed by this talented husband and wife duo. However, the theme of "The White Light"...although certainly enjoyable, is quite different from their other books. Tessie and Toni have been friends since childhood and spend endless hours together. Toni purchases a book called The Wizard from a local bookstore and manages to convince Tessie to join her in making a wish. They write them down and place their folded slips of paper in an old desk as instructed in the book. When Toni suffers from an unexplained coma and near-death experience, neither of the girls realizes it has anything to do with their earlier wishes. While in the coma, Toni can hear everyone around her but is unable to respond. She also sees an incredible white light but resists the temptation to draw closer to it. Instead she returns to her old life.Both girls go about furthering their education and eventually pursue successful careers. They forget this silly childhood indulgence for a number of years. However, some time later, Tessie and Toni decide to go home to celebrate Christmas together with their families. While there, they have a frightening, unique, and somewhat eerie experience. It is as if they have been catapulted into another era that only the two of them can share. There are more odd and scary occasions to follow. They therefore decide, along with Toni's boyfriend Bob who has also had a near-death experience, to revisit the past and read The Wizard one more time in order to discover exactly what is happening to them and why...Once I started reading, I couldn't wait to see what happened next!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteI'm Not Perfect and It's Okay

The Hundred Year Clones: The Warlords of Andromeda by Author Dean C. MooreThis Sci-Fi epic novel is the second book in this series but as of yet I have not had the good fortune of reading the first. However, it is quite easy to get caught up in the gist of things without having done so. Author C. Dean is a talented author with a well-honed and creative imagination.In "The Hundred Year Clones" he continues with the epic battle between good and evil which in many ways mirrors some of the activity on our own earthly planet.  This saga is mind-boggling and stretches the imagination to new levels. As one reviewer so adeptly states, it is..."a tale of rebellion and revolution as ordinary humanoids, now spread across galaxies, struggle against a corrupt system".  The million dollar questions are...who can stop the corruption and plundering taking place?  Who has the power to prevent the stealing and looting happening or quash those who are taking advantage of the weaker planets?  Will Dargan, a hundred year clone, have the courage and wherewithal to fight the war of all wars...?This novel is suspenseful, thrilling, and very difficult to put down. If you enjoy Sci-Fi action-packed adventures, you won't want to miss a word of this well-written series. This outer space adventure takes its reading audience from one galaxy to another on a memorable inter-galactic and challenging journey.Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteI'm Not Perfect and It's Okay

Hot Mines - A Contemporary Bad Boy Romance (Good Girls Love Bad Boys Book 1)"Hot Mines" is not your typical, fictional, romance novel, at least not from my frame of reference. The paths of two unlikely people cross at the airport when their luggage is lost in transit. Amber is tired and frustrated after a seven hour flight. She watches as the conveyor belt goes round and round with no sign of her missing suitcase. As she looks up, she catches the eye of the most incredibly handsome man. The most beautiful blue eyes she has ever seen look back at her from across the room. This is not a man that would ever give Amber a second glance...or so she thinks. Apparently, his luggage is missing too and...this Greek god of a man decides to take her under his wing as he handles their problem. Amber is totally intrigue yet somewhat stunned as he efficiently takes over. Kyle, introduces himself to her and decides to abandon the idea of taking a cab to his hotel. He surprises Amber by sitting in the seat across from her on the train commute home. They enjoy each other's company and eventually exchange phone numbers. Amber doesn't really expect to see him again but...Author Nelly d'Este takes her reading audience on a emotional and steamy roller coaster ride as the romantic relationship between Kyle & Amber unfolds. Expect the unexpected in this romance novel! I'm sure Book 2 in this series will be equally as exciting.

Mama Cried by Author Talia HavenWow...what a short and powerful read! In "Mama Cried", Author Talia Haven manages to address a very profound subject. Jenny is a young, innocent girl whose life has been taken from her. As to be expected, Jenny's mother sorrowfully mourns her untimely death. This short story begins with Azula, Jenny's guardian, who leaves her along with two new puppies and some new playmates in a park. They keep her company in this fun-filled playground as they enjoy their time together. Azula informs Jenny that she will be back to collect her and when she does, Jenny will have a very important decision to make. Jenny has no idea what is to unfold when Azula returns. When this occurs, Jenny tightly grips Azula hand for reassurance as they enter an unknown room where she meets, Theodore, the man who has taken her life. He is on death row and Jenny has the power to show mercy and leniency or to pass judgment. Now with all the facts at her fingertips, Jenny makes a decision for mama...Author Talia Haven has done a fine job of sharing her philosophical views with her reading audience. Mercy or justice...are not subjects to be taken lightly and she succeeds in getting to the heart of them in a few short pages. This is a very thought-provoking and interesting fictional novelette!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores Ayotte

Mindfulness: Miracles: 21 simple techniques to boost you daily happiness (Happiness Series) by Author Murali Sundaram"Mindfulness: Miracles" by motivational Author Murali Sundaram is bound to appeal to a wide reading audience comprised of both females and males alike. This wonderful tool is written in an easy-to-read comprehensible style. This book stresses the need to eliminate stress from our daily lives in order to live a calm and peaceful existence.  "Mindfulness: Miracles" also emphasizes the benefits of living in the present...a desirable goal but not always easy to achieve. Learning how to control our minds is the first step in the right direction. Great suggestions in this self-help book!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteUp The "Down" Ladder: Simple Ideas to Overcome Depression

Expecting Your First Baby: First Pregnancy Ultimate Guide by Author Cathy WilsonAnother great guidebook by Author Cathy Wilson!  Once again, the voice of her experience shines through. In the Introduction, she briefly explains the physical changes that will take place for the first-time mother. After that, she goes into more deal about "The Science behind Conception" and other pertinent facts in the chapters to follow. She adds her personal touch by sharing some of her own thoughts about each subject whenever possible."Expecting Your First Baby: First Pregnancy Ultimate Guide" is the perfect little guidebook for new parents. It is informative without being overly medical. The information and suggestions provided are easy to read and equally easy to understand. Author Cathy Wilson is writing to her peers in a style that is both refreshing and comprehensive. There are several minor pregnancy issues addressed such as nausea, bloating, cramps, aching back, and so on. These are explained in such a way in order to prevent needless worry. Knowing what to expect can certainly clear up a lot of unnecessary concern. This helpful guidebook certainly provides several answers to some common questions that first-time parents might ask. In a nutshell, it provides all the basic information from pre-conception to birth.  Good stuff!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteGrowing Up & Liking It

Loved this short little paranormal number. It was an intense, sexy read but there was plenty of mystery surrounding the two lead characters and the tension was beautifully built up, notch by notch. Would look for more from this author.

While I'm Waiting by Author Laura Hodges PooleThis wonderful, Biblical based devotional is both inspirational and heart-warming. Gifted Author Laura Hodges Poole utilizes personal stories from her own life and the lives of others to inspire her reading audience. I can see how she has been very influenced by her father and the love, respect, and admiration she feels toward him. I can identify with these deep feelings as I experienced a similar and special relationship with my own father when he was alive and still do to this day.In "While I'm Waiting" there are thirty-one, easy-to-read and down-to-earth short stories that we can all relate to or learn from in order to enhance our own lives. Each of these sweet tales is effectively backed up with several appropriate Bible quotes. This devotional booklet is the perfect way to start your day. Each chapter ends with a few reflective questions to get us off on the right foot and will perhaps be the incentive to start a daily journal. Author Laura Hodges Poole is a gentle soul with a soft voice. She is bound to touch the lives of many people with her sage advice and gift for the written word. The example she sets is definitely "to die to self, live for Christ, and reflect God's grace" in spite of our trials and tribulations as she so eloquently states. I love the cover too...it's perfect for the theme of this book!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteA Woman's Voice ~ Inspirational Short Stories ~ Volume 1

Pregnancy Nutrition: Before, During, & After Eating Tips by Author Cathy WilsonFirst of all, I really like the cover of this helpful guidebook. In my opinion, it is very eye catching and appealing to a pregnant mother.  Secondly, if there is one thing I enjoy about non-fictional books, it is the fact that the author speaks from experience and that the book is well-researched and documented. Author Cathy Wilson certainly fits the bill in this regard. When she states in her preamble to the book that "I'm not Perfect....but I'm REAL" she really hits home for me. She is the mother of six children and it is obvious that she has done her homework when it comes to the nutritional advice she gives to women for the before, during, and after pregnancy periods. At the end of several chapters she also includes some personal thoughts on her suggestions. An added bonus to this helpful book is the "Sample Pregnancy Menu" found in Chapter Eight. The pictures at the beginning of each chapter also positively add to the reading experience.Although I am well past my child bearing years, I have a daughter who is expecting a baby and I will be happy to share this information with her. "Pregnancy Nutrition: Before, During, & After Eating Tips" is written in a down-to-earth and easy-to-read style which is sure to appeal to those expectant mothers who have every desire to ensure the proper nutrition for both themselves and their babies. Good stuff!Inspirational Author & Book Reviewer ~ Dolores AyotteI'm Not Perfect and It's Okay

This case is designed for people who ski, kayak, climb, or hike, and it made in a very rugged fashion to be sure that the user's phone is protected if it gets dropped or splashed around in the elements.  For this reason, the case offers top notch protection.  For those looking for an every day case that easy to handle, this X5 isn't the one you're looking for, but it's clear this case isn't meant for that.  Be sure to research what you need, but this case is fantastic as far as protection goes.You can read the basic specs on the product page, and there's no reason to believe it doesn't hit these standards.  I'm not about to drop my phone in to a lake to test its merits, but just gripping the case in my hand makes it obvious this phone is the real deal.  The case easily snaps on and off, and the stratoshield protector works just fine.Ports are easy to access, and the sound coming from the sound doesn't suffer from the thick casing.  The one drawback of this case seems to be pushing the buttons on the casing -- they don't seem to reach the phone all that well, and response can be missed at times.  In my opinion, a thick case like this that is designed for lugging around outdoors on hikes and stuff needs to be thick enough to prevent damage, so I'm not all that surprised that getting the buttons to react can be a bit of work.This case is pricey, but again, it's designed for certain needs.  This isn't an everyday iPhone case you'll be carrying around with you to work and to school, this is a case that's designed to take a beating, and in that regard, it hits all the necessary points.

Yeah, I'm a 43-year old dude who loves toy guns based on video games -- what of it?  This gun is sort of a no-brainer for anyone who has ever played Halo, and thankfully, this gun works really well!  The "needles" shoot pretty far and they don't get stuck or jammed which it seems like they would upon first glance of this object.  This is a pretty sizable gun as well which will take two hands to grip and shoot with any accuracy.  It's made well and built to last.Long live Halo!

This clipper works surprisingly well!  I was a little skeptical in regard to how it would hold, but it turns out to be quite a plus to have to deal with a longer handle so you can reach the harder to get to places.  The clipper comes with nine different adjustment sizes, so it will work for anyone at any hair length.  The blade is strong and quiet, cutting close without pulling, and with minimal noise.  It also will continue to run while it's plugged in which may sound like a no-brainer, but there are plenty of shavers out there that won't.I'm knocking it down a star because the price of this kit is a total mystery -- I've looked all over the internet and found absolutely nothing about its price.  If it's priced between 40 and 50 dollars, I'd give it a full five stars, but anything above 50 might be asking a lot. All things being reviewed have to be looked at through the prism of price, and right now, it's hard to give full marks to a product with no known price point.

The presentation with this tin is nice, and what's inside it is even better.  The combination of all the elements make a really tasty treat here, and it would work well is an opener-type gift for the holidays, or even a stocking stuffer type present.  It's presented in a tin can that could easily be reused, and the candy itself is super good.  You can read the ingredients for yourself, and I for one am glad there are no nuts present here -- nuts always ruin a good treat in my opinion!  It holds a good amount of sweets inside, and you'll be snacking off the contents for a good while.  Having said that, the current price of 33 dollars seems a bit steep in my opinion considering all you get, but this is one of those unique holiday presentations that people will more than likely scoop up without much thought.All in all, a very good treat presented in a classy tin.  Recommended!

Great little thumb drive, and when I say "little", I do mean "little".  This is the most light and compact flash drive I've ever seen, and it does its work very quickly.  I can't argue with its claims about speeds as I transferred a movie to it in literally seconds.  My TV has no problem recognizing the drive, and it plays whatever is on it quickly and cleanly.  Not much more to say here -- this is just a flash drive with respectable storage, plays fast, and is extremely compact.

I'm extremely impressed with this phone and what it has to offer.  I'm a devoted iPhone user, but I would certainly recommend this phone to anyone who does not prefer iPhone and wants to have a device with a beautiful big screen and easy to use options.This phone is a cinch to set up.  It comes with all the stuff you need including cables and what not, and even comes with a screen protector as a bonus.  If it came with a sim card it would be an insane deal, but not many will be expecting that anyway.  The 7" screen is seriously awesome.  It looks pretty amazing and whips along at high speeds no matter if you're streaming a movie, or using an app.  The colors are vibrant and it pops off very nicely.  You can view the memory for yourself in the specs page, and it handles itself every bit as strongly as my iPhone does.I'm using this as an extra phone with my AT&T plan, and as a phone it works just fine.  Calls are strong and signals are good.More than anything, though, the screen on this baby makes it every bit worth the 200 dollar price tag.  It's simply huge, and depending on your needs, could easily be used as a tablet.  I could certainly see someone buying this simply for the apps and video capabilities, foregoing the option of using it as a phone all together.  I have to admit that the build quality isn't nearly as robust as an iPhone or iPad, but if you care for this properly and don't drop it or sit on it, you could be using this for quite some time.I wasn't expecting to like this as much as I do, but I'm a convert now.  Highly recommended!

This printer does everything it claims to, and does it quickly and efficiently.  I've had mixed results with Canon printers in the past, but this printer comes prepared with everything you'll need to do fast printing in quantity right out of the box.  Set up for Mac users could be better, but other than that I'm very happy with this experience.As I mentioned, I'm using this with a Mac, so I had to fish around Canon's website to find the necessary drivers and download them first.  Canon's website and support is nothing less than terrible, but luckily I figured this out and set up the printer after some troubleshooting and sleuthing.  In fact, the online manual instructed me to follow a certain protocol when setting up wi-fi for a Mac, and it was completely erroneous.  For those of you who aren't tech savvy, set up might be more of an issue.  Canon could seriously step it up in this regard -- it's 2015, is it that much to ask that the required updates are in the box?  And if they aren't in the box, maybe they could supply the specific driver site address where the drivers are instead of making customers stumble around their clunky website looking for clues?  The actual literature in the box says "go online and find the drivers you need."  Oh, really?Once I got the printer up and running, it prints perfectly and quickly via w-fi.  The machine seems to make a lot of noise pre and post print which is odd, but it works well, so no complaints.  The printer comes with all the print drums you need (there are four), and they are about half-yield drums, so unlike most printers that give you just enough to print about 20 copies before the well runs dry, you get a half charge here which is slightly disappointing, but still will last an acceptable amount of time before the need to replace them becomes a reality.  A full run of the four ink canisters will cost you about 75 dollars when it's time to replace.  It prints off multiple copies with ease with no hiccups or problems.The scanner works like a charm with no stalls or weirdness, as well.  I tried regular size scans as well as ID card scans and it all worked perfectly.  The copier is standard and works well, too.  Not a lot of head-scratching or detective work -- it's all very intuitive and works quite well.The touch screen reacts quickly and efficiently.  It guides you through the setup (much better than the manual and included CD-Rom does), and makes it very natural for the user to get to the next phase of whatever you need to get to.  Its error warnings are very useful as well -- I forgot to yank the ink drum cover tags off before printing, and it warned me that I needed to do so before continuing.  Always good to have a printer that's smarter than I am!This is an excellent mid-level printer for anyone with a small business that needs to occasionally print off a few sheets, or needs to print a large quantity in a short period of time.  Recommended!

This is a very capable and handy wireless photo printer.  It's very easy to setup, and prints out the high quality photos it claims to be able to produce.First off, the printer is much smaller than I was anticipating, but this is a good thing.  It prints off 4" by 6" and 5" by 7", and the printer itself is barely even two feet long.  I wouldn't say it's 100% portable, but it would definitely be easy to haul it around if you needed to.  As I mentioned before, it's really easy to setup, and I had it up and running within five minutes.It's compatible with Windows and Mac, and the setup was a piece of cake with my Mac setup.  I'm using this wirelessly with my iPhone 6 and iPad 3, and have had no issues whatsoever with response times or setup with these devices.  Photos sent from these devices print quickly and easily, and look exactly as you'd hope them to.This is just a really simple yet effective photo printer that works great if you use Mac products.

This is my second foray into the world of Lenox products, and both times I've been very impressed.  This is a very nice piece of craftsmanship giving off a nice glow without being too bright, and emanating a warmth that is sure to make your living room more festive for the holiday season.  The light is perfect and would look great on a mantle or window sill with all the other lights off, or even better, with nothing but Christmas lights up.  They are very solid to hold, and I can imagine these lasting a lifetime and handed down to future generations of families over the years.  Just a very pleasant and fun piece of art here.  They run on batteries as well, so there is no cord to deal with.  Very nice!

At first I was concerned looking at the images of this card as there seems to be a lot going on to provide a simple service, but after I got it set up and working, I realized that it's a simple and effective little unit.  I'm using this with a laptop, and it was extremely easy to set up, and provides a great signal.  The price perhaps may be a bit on the high side for what you're getting, but its solid construction may make this worth the money in the long run.

This is easily one of best bars of chocolate I've ever had.  I'm a sucker for almonds and hazelnuts in chocolate anyway, but I mist admit I was a bit concerned with how the cranberries would fit in.  Turns out, the cranberries are a frighteningly good compliment to all the nutty action going on!  The bar's tagline is "no two bites are a like", and I have to agree with this assessment.  One bite was more almond-centric, the next was filled with a cranberry influence, the next was full of hazelnut tones.  These bars are relatively expensive compared to the typical candy bar, but once you chomp into this you'll notice why they're more expensive.  Quite simply, these are absolutely delicious, and well worth the price!

This is a very nice five-piece china set that looks exactly like the photo represents.  The pieces are very elegant and look extremely nice in a holiday setting.  The china has a high quality gloss like you'd expect, and you can feel the workmanship as you hold the pieces in your hands.  These are "dishwasher" safe, but as with any higher priced dishes, you'll want to hand-wash these.The only thing to look out for is the way Amazon ships these: while they are securely placed in their factory packaging, Amazon just tossed it an oversized box with no other packaging resulting in the handle mug being completely snapped off during shipment!  Very disappointing.

Having used several humidifiers with varied success, this Vicks humidifier is simple and easy to set up, and it works quite well with a cool little bonus.  It takes less than five minutes to assemble: the easy to follow instructions guide you through the process of wetting down the filter, filling up the water tank, and then letting it begin to work.  It's rally that simple easy, and the humidifier works well in a normal-sized bedroom.  It is a pretty small unit, so don't expect it to be effective in a large room.  The unit is relatively quiet to others I've used as well -- it has two speeds, and even the higher speed is quite quiet and soothing.  It acts as a decent noise canceler as a matter of fact.The cool little side addition is that it has a slot for the scent pads.  The unit comes with one pad smelling of menthol, and it's quite strong.  It actually tells you in the literature to not touch it -- that's how pungent it is.  They last for 8 hours, and they will fill up a room with a nice aroma without a hitch.  The scent pads are about a buck a piece, and in addition to the menthol scent, they also come in lavender (I would have much rather had that smell).In the end, this is a very nice humidifier which is right for the price, and wins over other similarly priced units due to the scent pad feature.  Worth it!

This basically tastes like slightly watered down cranberry juice.  That's no bad thing -- if you enjoy flavored water this is actually quite flavorful compared to other waters.  It claims to "cleanse and purify" and all that tagline nonsense, but in the end, you're drinking flavored water here.  Of course, if you're looking to cleanse and purify to the fullest, you'll just be drinking regular old water, but if you need to spice it up a bit without your choice being sickeningly sweet, this is a good option.

This is easily one of best bars of chocolate I've ever had.  I'm a sucker for almonds and hazelnuts in chocolate anyway, but I mist admit I was a bit concerned with how the cranberries would fit in.  Turns out, the cranberries are a frighteningly good compliment to all the nutty action going on!  The bar's tagline is "no two bites are a like", and I have to agree with this assessment.  One bite was more almond-centric, the next was filled with a cranberry influence, the next was full of hazelnut tones.  These bars are relatively expensive compared to the typical candy bar, but once you chomp into this you'll notice why they're more expensive.  Quite simply, these are absolutely delicious, and well worth the price!

This is easily one of best bars of chocolate I've ever had.  I'm a sucker for almonds and hazelnuts in chocolate anyway, but I mist admit I was a bit concerned with how the cranberries would fit in.  Turns out, the cranberries are a frighteningly good compliment to all the nutty action going on!  The bar's tagline is "no two bites are a like", and I have to agree with this assessment.  One bite was more almond-centric, the next was filled with a cranberry influence, the next was full of hazelnut tones.  These bars are relatively expensive compared to the typical candy bar, but once you chomp into this you'll notice why they're more expensive.  Quite simply, these are absolutely delicious, and well worth the price!

This iron really couldn't be simpler to use, and the features are very helpful.  The digital read out makes gauging the temperature a complete breeze, and  the readouts seem to be 100% accurate.  I don't normally iron a ton of stuff, and because of the light usage, this iron proves to be quite helpful for me.  The iron cleans quite well, and the auto-clean system is as simple pouring water into the iron and letting it flow out.I've never left an iron on once I'm finished using one, but if you do tend to do this, the auto turn-off features work like a charm.  The iron comes with easy to follow instructions and a starter guide.Not much to say other than this is a simple, effective and affordable iron with a very cool digital read out.  Recommended!

I'm not much of a watch guy, but for the price, this is a very nice option for men who are looking for something classy yet affordable.  The wristband feels a little cheap with its rubberized feel, but display is cool and has a high quality finish to it.  I'm not a huge fan of the way Invicta makes it feel like you're getting a 600 dollar watch for 80 bucks, so don't get caught up in the marketing: this watch is an 80 dollar watch, no more no less.

These are very durable and serviceable dish rags.  Color is perfect for what you'll be using them for, and they absorb nicely and wash easily without shrinkage.  Like all DII products I've used, these are reasonably priced and will last just as long as you need them to.  Recommended!

What you see is what you get here, and it's a very nice addition to your holiday collection!  Made of porcelain and built to last, it's a sturdy mug with a nice Christmas theme coupled with the tea bag holder on the side which is crafted very well.  It's simple and works very well!

Having used several bluetooth devices in the past, this is by far the best headset I've ever seen.  It's functioning power coupled with its features and price make it the best buy I have yet seen on the market.I'm not a big user of bluetooth in general, but the things I look for are comfort and usability, and this Eclipse has both in spades.  The first thing I noticed is how tiny and lightweight this thing is -- at first I thought I'd break the thing pulling it out of its packaging.  Once you grab it and put it on you can tell that its made very well and stays put which is a big plus in my book.  So many bluetooth sets I've used in the past shift around and never stay in my ear, and this one doesn't budge even one tiny little bit.I'm using this with an iPhone 6, and the setup couldn't have been easier, and the sound quality is outstanding.  It's pairing with Google and Siri is absolutely seamless, and you never even have to touch your phone if you choose not to.  Simply tapping the headset will initiate pretty much whatever you want to do including taking calls, and hanging up.I've seen some complaints about sound quality, but none of those reviews were using this with an iPhone 6 -- if you plan on using this with an iPhone 6, believe me when I say that sound quality does not get any better than what you will hear with the Jabra Eclipse.  It stands to reason that if you use a headset with an inferior phone you'll get inferior quality, right?  Make sure you use this with a nice phone that can compliment its features instead of some third rate piece of junk and you'll be fine.I'm loving this headset -- well worth the money!

This Chamberlain garage door opener is highly functioning unit with cool features and operates very quietly.  It's a bit tricky to set up, but once you get it up and running, it's worth every penny.There are directions included for setup, but I found that each step of the process was a bit longer than it should have been.  I would set something, tighten a screw, or test out one of the features, and it wouldn't work.  It would take some unplugging, rebooting, or fourth or fifth tries to get things running, but once I shook off all of those technical cobwebs, everything started working great.  All of the different ways to operate the machine is what I find most useful about this opener which includes a wireless keypad, an LCD wall control device, two remotes, and of course an app you can download.  I'm using the app through an iPhone 6 and an iPad 3, and the app runs perfectly.  It's cool to get precise timings of how long it will take the door to open and close!  It also has a three-day battery backup in case the power goes out.This is also the quietest garage door opener I've ever heard in my life.  I should say, the quietest door opener I HAVEN'T heard as it really lives up to its "whisper quiet" tagline.  This opener is also compatible with Homelink, though I don't use that system and can't vouch for its effectiveness.I've tested the safety sensors, and they work very well in letting you know that an object is blocking the closure of the door.  All of the remotes are very responsive and work quickly.  It's worth noting that garage doors over seven feet high will require an extension kit.All in all, this is a very nice garage door opener that I can see myself using for a long time to come.

Having used several Panasonic hair trimmer/shavers in the past with varied results, I have to say this is the best I've used in quite some time.  It's slightly more pricey, but the features you get and high functionality definitely make the asking price worth it.The coolest feature is the trim length options, giving you 39 different settings which is more than I've ever seen at this price range.  It's also easy to clean thanks to the water draining system, and it works like a charm.  A full charge will last you an hour, and it comes with a 2-year warranty.The other things I like is that you can use it while you charge (many shavers won't let you do this), and it really does trim well.  I have a thick dense beard and typically I have no choice but to use a straight razor.  While this isn't going go supplant the closeness I get with a razor, this does get pretty close to what I need.  For 100 dollars, this is definitely worth it.

I can't imagine many women on the go who wouldn't love this bag!  Made entirely of nylon, the bag has a very nice look and had a rugged quality to it as well.  There is a compartment for just about everything you could ask for with leather trim on the outside and metallic jewel-toned hardware to boot.  It's simple to carry with a catch-all handle if you'd rather grab the bag by hand and go.A very nice addition to any traveller who wants to store all of their "must-have" items!

This figure is very cheaply made and doesn't even appear to have all of its stated parts.  Apparently there is supposed to be a code in the box that will level you up in the game, but alas, no code in included.  The figure is very small and stiff, and the craftsmanship is about as standard as you get.  I guess if you're into the Kulipari Battalions game you might want to collect these, but personally I'll be depositing this cheap plastic junk directly into the garbage.

If you own your business or are an accountant, Sage Premium will be invaluable to you.  After delving into this program, I've realized that there is nary a business/accounting/record keeping detail this program does not address.  It's extremely exhaustive, and easy to navigate which is important with a program this deep.The program installs very easily and takes up relatively little space for such an exhaustive piece of software.  This is the first accounting software I've ever used, and found it to be very intuitive from the very start.  The interface is pleasing to use, and has many features that makes navigation and searching very handy and simple.  I was a bit intimidated once i started to use the program because of its size and scope, but I found it pretty easy to go back and forth with the tools I needed.All I really care about with any software is that's it's easy to use, easy to install, and has many features that make usage easy to navigate.  This program features all of those aspects, and I can't think of a single reason why this can't work for you.  Recommended!

This is what it is: toilet paper with a smushed cardboard roll in order to save space.  It's basically exactly the same as any normal Quilted Northern you're used to buying, you just can't slap it on your paper roll bar.  Big deal.  It's toilet paper, and if you can look past (and simply read) what this paper is marketed for, you'll know that it's the same paper you're used to using.

I can't imagine many women on the go who wouldn't love this bag!  Made entirely of nylon, the bag has a very nice look and had a rugged quality to it as well.  There is a compartment for just about everything you could ask for with leather trim on the outside and metallic jewel-toned hardware to boot.  It's simple to carry with shoulder straps and a catch-all handle if you'd rather grab the bag by hand and go.A very nice addition to any traveller who wants to store all of their "must-have" items!

This is a great case for your drone offering all kinds of side pockets and protection.  Even if you were desiring to use this for camera parts, computer accessories, or anything else that required extra padded protection, this case gives you a lot of options.The case is actually very compact and small, but that works to your advantage.  It utilizes space excellently, and the adjustable shoulder straps let any sized person conveniently lug around your belongings on their backs.  It is designed for your drone, though, and each little compartment it has fits the necessary perfectly.A highly recommended pack for anyone looking to protect their valuables!

All the basics are clearly illustrated for this 6-outlet unit, and for 20 dollars it's worth it.  It's got a nice warranty which sweetens the deal a bit, however a longer cord would have been nice.  I'm using this with my computer setup which includes speakers, a USB hub, a CD drive, a monitor and a turntable I use for vinyl ripping.  I'm feeling pretty safe and protected with this and have no cause for alarm with solid warranty.

This is the third or fourth Belkin keyboard case/folio I've used, and I find them to be easy to use and a cinch to set up.  I've never quite gotten myself used to the tiny keyboard, and always have felt they're a tad on the flimsy side, but for all intents and purposes these work rather well.  I also especially like this newer version that accommodates two devices at once.I'm using this with a third generation iPad, and a sixth generation iPhone, and have experienced no issues thus far.  It was super easy to pair, and toggling between both devices couldn't be simpler.  The keyboard is responsive and is highly functional from the get-go.The stands on these Belkins have always been a bit wonky for me -- the devices stay in place, but I feel like the weight of them is slightly pulling the entire keyboard backwards a bit.  Also, I don't think I'll ever be able to get used to the tiny little keys on the keyboard.  They obviously are smaller than normal, anyone will notice this, but I have bigger hands and it just never feels quite right to me.  That's a personal thing though, so I can't dock it for that.  The kickstand works fine and adjusts well enough.  I will say that these Belkin folio boards have always felt a bit cheap, and for 80 bucks they could perhaps step up the quality a bit.  Calling this a "case" is a bit of an overstatement -- you can fold the iPad down on top of the keyboard, but is that really acting as a case?  I think most people think of protection when they hear the word "case", and this isn't going to be protecting your devices at all.All in all, another functional folio keyboard from Belkin.  Construction is a tad wonky, but it works and is easy to set up!

I've used a number of Dove products over the years and I'm always happy with the results. This "deep clean" version has a great scent and classy presentation. I've also used the "extra fresh" version, and this is more or less the same, but I like the smell of "deep clean" much better.  It's got the fancy title of "body and face bar", but it's just a bar of soap, and an above average one at that. I will say that my skin does feel quite smooth after using, and I don't need to use a great deal of the soap bar to work up a nice lather. My skin isn't dry after use, and it really does smell quite nice. Check it out!

I've been using Suave for years, and as a dude with short hair, I just want an affordable bottle of shampoo that lasts and smells good.  I don't have to use a lot of shampoo typically, and the Suave products I've used lather very nicely even with a small amount, and leave my hair smelling good and feeling clean.  I like the Sea Infusion theme here as this shampoo smells really good.  It's a nice big bottle as well, so I'll be using this for some time to come.  For a couple of dollars, you can't go wrong here -- Suave always delivers!

For five dollars, you get a big bottle of very nice shampoo here that lathers quite easily while not having to use a lot at a time.  I have short hair, so I barely have to use even a pinch of this to make it last through one sitting.  It smells very nice, and my hair is full looking and even feels fuller when I'm done using it.Not much to say other than this is a high quality shampoo worth that's worth the asking price!

Most of the reviews cover what this grill delivers pretty well, and I don't have much to add other than I've had nothing but success using this.  It's easy to assemble, simply to clean, and works just as well indoors as it does out.It is electric, so no charcoal or propane is needed here.  It's grill is 200 square inches and can accommodate 12 servings.  The grill plate is non-stick and has a highly functional temperature control feature for precision grilling.  To move the grill from outside into your kitchen, you you simply remove the unit from the stand and take it inside -- easy peasy.The flavor of meats and veggies I've cooked thus far has been perfect, and I have no complaints at all about this grill.  Compact, durable, and cooks perfectly -- what else do you need?

Food should taste good, right?  I'm one of those types of people who watches his weight and monitors my calories somewhat, but when it's time to live a little, it's time to live a little.  This is one of those foods that's pretty healthy while taken in moderation, and wow, it tastes awesome.  The combination of chocolate, macadamia, and chai is pretty fantastic, and having these around in them around in the kitchen is just dangerous.  There's 15 in a box which makes the price about 1.25 a piece, and they're worth every penny.  They're gluten free if that's your bag, and each bar has around 200 calories which is pretty standard for nutrition bars.  It sound corny, and but they really are the perfect snack when you're hungry and don't have time to futz around the kitchen making food and preparing meals.Seriously, buy these.  They taste so good you won't even notice they're heath bars!

I've used a number of Dove products over the years and I'm always happy with the results.  This has a great scent and classy presentation.  It's got the fancy title of "body and face bar", but it's just a bar of soap, and an above average one at that.  I will say that my skin does feel quite smooth after using, and I don't need to use a great deal of the soap bar to work up a nice lather.  My skin isn't dry after use, and it really does smell quite nice.  Check it out!

...I really like these!  I can't really speak to the anti-fog factor, but these are comfortable, look good, and seem to be very durable.First of all, I have a big head and these fit perfectly -- the two ear-rest things sort of conform to any sized head, so no matter how big or small of a cranium you have these should fit just fine.  The nose stems and pads fit perfectly as well and I pretty much forget they're even there.  I have very light blue eyes and typically have issues with just a little bit of sun, but these block it out extremely nicely.  The only remote issue I have with these is that they don't cover your full field of vision.  The lenses aren't that big, so light or glare from below will be an issue if you're at all sensitive to extended periods of light exposure.  These also don't come with a protective case or bag which is a bit of a bummer.For the price of 20 dollars, though, these are a very decent buy if you're looking for some sporty looking sunglasses that work.  These also work well in the yard if you need to protect yourself from dust and debris, so I can easily recommend these at the current price point.

After using this lens kit for a number of days, I have found it to be more than worth the price tag.  It depends on what you intend to use it for -- and how picky you are -- but for the most part it acts and performs precisely as it claims.To be as straight forward as possible, this kit is extremely rigid and well made.  It fits my iPhone 6 perfectly, and never moves an inch during picture taking.  Photos are crisp and clean.  The case just slips onto the phone and the lens just pops into place where your camera lens is.  It works intuitively and easily.  This lens kit gives you 35% wider photos which pretty darn awesome if you're using your phone primarily as a camera.  This alone will be worth the purchase price for many.I've seen some grumbling about the fact this kit cannot slide on the phone if there is a case on it, but come on, how realistic is it that this would be a possibility with all the different sized cases out there?  I hardly think that many grounded people will find much room to complain about taking an additional five seconds to slip off your case to use this lens kit.  Hardly a deal breaker -- just don't be a klutz when you're handling your phone.I'm really enjoying this kit and it's giving me newfound interest in my iPhone 6 as a camera.  Worth it!

This shower curtain rod is easy to install and works like a charm.  No drilling is necessary for this to be installed, and you simply twist it in place once you get all parts and accessories in the right places.  It took me a bit to get everything in its rightful place, but once I did it's proving to be a sturdy and solid rod for my shower.  I do have to mention the parts attaching to the wall are sort of cheaply made -- the entire package looks nice, but I have my doubts about how long it will last.  I'll update as time allows, but for now, this is an easy to install and attractive shower curtain rod.

I would have loved to own this as a young boy -- any excuse to run around the yard catching critters in a mini-vacuum, putting them under a magnifying glass, then placing them in a critter barn and looking at them again with another magnifying glass?  Sold!  As it happens, I'm a 43-year old dude who has a ton of use for this.  You see, my house gets a lot of little spiders marching through it, and while I usually just ignore the little arachnids and let them chill in the corner, sometimes I do not appreciate them crawling on my feet, dropping on my head, or otherwise just being present.  I tend to just catch them with a tissue and place them outside, but that's far from a foolproof plan.  I've scooped up a few already with this gun, which effectively sucks them up, puts them in a chamber, and holds them long enough for me to either put them out side without risking getting them on me, or throw them into the barn from which I can just dump them outside from there.When you pull the trigger it basically just creates a vacuum and sucks things up.  There is a flap in the chamber that also works as a magnifying glass, so when you're sucking things up, you flip the glass as to give the bugs room to fly into the chamber, then once you have the critter caught you flip the glass once more which acts as a barrier so the bug cannot escape, and also serves as a great magnifying glass.  If you want to put the animal into the barn, there is a hole on top of the lid that fits the tip of the gun, so you just put the tip into the hole and the bug slides into the barn.  The barn also has a magnifying glass with which to look at the bugs, and it also has an LED light to use in darker environments.  The gun runs on AA batteries while the barn runs on three of those little coin batteries, both of which are included.  I've seen some griping about the light on the gun being off-center, but it's straight and true for me.This is a blast to use for any age.  Fun for kids, useful for adults!

This camera delivers exactly what it claims, offering a very nice picture while being easily mountable to pretty much anything.  It uses a Micro SD as memory, and the laser is spot-on.  I've taken short videos and shown them on my 60-inch plasma with great results -- the quality is fantastic and its aim is true.  As the product claims, it offers five times the magnification, and the picture it provides while magnified is clear and beautiful.This is my first time using one of these mount cameras, and I can easily recommend it for ease of use, the laser feature, and most importantly, its high quality of video.

I was given an extremely brief 16-page sampler of this book which will be 304 pages in its finished form according to the literature included, but what is included here is quite funny.  As most people will know, this book is based on the series from Wisecrack, a chain of Youtube videos that features Sparky Sweets giving his gangsta take on classic literature.  The contents of the book will include (and are not included in this sampler I was given):  To Kill A Mockingbird, Pride & Prejudice, Lord of the Flies, Romeo & Juliet, The Great Gatsby, Frankenstein, Moby Dick, Fahrenheit 451, The Catcher in the Rye, Crime & Punishment, Things Fall Apart, The Scarlet Letter, Invisible Man, A Raisin In The Sun, and The Color Purple.  Just seeing these titles that will be included has me laughing at where they might go with it.As I stated before, this is just a sampler for review purposes, but they do give a taste of what's to come with a few pages from Sparky's take on Romeo & Juliet.  Sparks breaks it down: "Up in da swanky part of Verona, two hood-rich families called da Montagues, and da Capulets been beefin' since back in da day. Ain't nobody know why, but both a' dem gangs always walkin' 'round town, strapped up, just waitin' fo' a reason to start s***."  The writing is peppered with funny little images of the characters from these stories with ghetto captions next to them which makes it even funnier.It's hard to give this a five-star review as this is only a sampler, but it's easy to extrapolate from the Romeo & Juliet chapter where this book will go with it.  The Youtube series is much better as seeing Sparky talk and all his mannerisms is part of the joke, but with the pictures and rhythm of the writing here, I can see people loving this.

If you're buying this with the hopes you'll be depending on it deep in the midst of the wilderness in order to survive, consider yourself officially f'ed.  This thing is only retailing for 25 dollars, but it's still 15 dollars too expensive.  I have no idea how you would use this as a "survival" tool, as it's flimsy, junky, and most importantly, doesn't even work!First thing's first, and a wake-up call to Smith's: bubble packaging was wacky and cutting edge back in the 90's, but here in the 21st century it serves no identifiable purpose.  It took me five minutes just to open this stupid thing!  Once I finally reached the promised land and got my hands on the tool, I laughed out loud as I noticed the compass not working correctly.  North is pointing westward, and so on.  Really?  The compass doesn't work?  Well, alrighty then.  I started pulling stuff out of the base, like the knives, tweezers, LED light, etc, and they're all flimsy and cheap.  What in the world would you cut with these dull knives?  Even with the sharpener?  Beats me.  The LED light works fine, so I could see that being of use.  Removing the tweezers is a ponderous process.  You have to provide some sort of thin instrument to pry them from the casing, and this instrument is not included.  The directions are ponderous as well -- a series of non-corresponding numbers and pictures that confuse more than aid.Seriously, skip this thing.  Maybe for five bucks, but 25?  Please.

I'm using this with an iPhone 6 and it works fine in every way.  The cord is six and half feet long which is nice, and I've used it both with another usb charge knob to charge it, and I've plugged it into my usb hub to sync my phone with, all with expected results.  It's quick and accurate.  Comes with a two year warranty as well.  I've never had any issue with Belkin products, and this MFi cord is no different!

I really like these storage "units" as you can stuff a lot of items into them and easily stow them un a bed.  I've got these stuffed with clothing, and as the containers are soft and woven, it will pretty much fit into a space.  The handle is of a high enough quality where you don't need to worry about it coming loose or unstitched.  The zippers are a bit wonky -- I've had issues with both of them zipping up already, but after some finagling they finally zipped up.  I think for the price tag you can do a heck of a lot worse.

This is a good basic set of non-stick kitchen tools.  They are very durable, easy to wash, and resistant to high temperatures.  The handles seem to be a bit shorter than what is typical, but it's not a deal breaker.  I like that they have holes on the bottom so you can hang them if you need to.  I've tossed them in the dishwasher and they have come out damage and smell free.Not much to say other than these are certainly worth the 20 dollar price tag.

This is my first try and using a Surface case, and this passes the test with flying colors.  It snaps into place easily, is very rugged, surprisingly light, and the kickstand feature works like a charm.
