The crane arm rotates by pressing a button on the crane and the hook moves back and forth along the arm using a third set of buttons.The issue that I see is that if you pick it up and move it the electrical connections can imperceptibly pull apart causing some frustration on the part of the young crane operator.  You'd expect that this connection would be a more positive engagement and I was surprised it wasn't better.Otherwise it comes with two dudes who operate the crane, each with a tiny cell phone that will be vacuumed up shortly to the chagrin of the young crane operator.Everything worked out of the box as advertised, and as usual, it arrived on time and in perfect condition from one of Amazon's vendors.I would recommend this with the reservations stated above.  Our son doesn't share my concerns and loves it so from that perspective, "mission accomplished".

I was hoping for more from this but it was busy paying homage to the prior Terminator catch phrases and not focused enough on plowing its own ground.  On Blu it was amazing to watch at home.  There is a scene at the gas station where a ginormous Terminator thing flattens everything in its path.  At the theater that scene was one of the best of all of the summer blockbusters.  At home it's not as impressive but the sound and picture quality on this disc is stunning.  I watched on a Panasonic plasma, 50", 1080p via HDMI from a Playstation3.

I have the 120 Zune.  As a die-hard Microsoft user, I have found the Zune software very easy to use and the Zune itself is more or less idiot proof.  My wife has an iPod 16 gb touch that I got for her because it can sync contacts and surf the internet; 2 things missing from the Zune which is numb where most folks who go the Msoft route would likely be at work, older farts like me who use it at the office and would like a means to sync w/ Outlook.  Anyway, the Zune is way easier to use as its drag and drop interface is intuitive compared to the cumbersome iPod software which doesn't appear to be simple as both my wife and I have struggled to understand it.  An example is the recent Madonna CD Hard Candy.  Ripped to the Zune, it files under "Madonna".  Done.  Ripped to the iPod Touch, some files are filed under Madonna and others are in Various Artists.  What the...  Just an example of the frustration we've had w/ the iPod versus the Zune.The key selling point for me was that the Zune will play lossless music which means it's supposed to be as good as listening to a CD.  MP3's are not the best sounding because they're compressed.  Lossless WMA on the Zune is great and you can listen to it on a home theater and appreciate the quality.  I listen to mine at work on a Bose AWMS so you can tell the difference.  The problem is lossless music takes up a crapload of space which necessitates the Zune's mechanical 120 GB monster hard drive vs. the dinky solid state 16GB stuff that it competes with.I don't travel any more so I can't say if the Zune lasts for days on a battery.  I unplug it from my laptop at work and it seems to play lossless tunes for a couple of hours so that's not too bad unless you're flying to Afghanistan in which case you have far larger issues than just battery life.  I would say it ranks as a 'meh' on the suck to awesome scale with 'meh' squarely in the middle there.I don't watch video on my Zune but I suppose you could.  It's just wicked small so really, what's the point?  I don't get it but some folks are all worked up if it won't play HD video.  I understand the newest Zune will play HD video but it doesn't have a big hard drive so I'm not sure what the advantage is there.The Zune is bulky but since I grew up in the 80's, it's a long way from the original Walkman or the Aiwa tape decks we used to cart around.  A Nano iPod seems to be about 1/8 the size so if you're a jogger, go w/ the iPod.Is it tough?  Dunno.  It works all the time for me but I haven't accidentally dropped it, kicked it or parked a cross-town bus on top of it.  I think it's a glass screen so though it is really clear and nice looking, glass isn't renowned for its resilience to blunt force trauma.Gripes?  The cord stinks.  I keep mine plugged in all the time and it's all frayed.  That said, it still works but jeez.  No other real gripes.As for features like the awesome iPod touch screen etc well, Zune ain't an iPod.  But if you have a Blackberry for internet and contacts and stuff but want a solid unit to play very high quality tunes on and you don't want to hire the neighbor's kid to show you how to make a freakin' playlist, Zune is simple, easy and is an outstanding unit for playing tunes.

I have an older Garmin V that I have used for about 7 years.  The old Garmin is great for driving around provided you plan ahead and update the maps to show where you're traveling.  If you forget, you miss critical detail and you'd better have good local maps.  I still have that unit and use it mostly in the woods due to its limited memory.So on a recent trip to Sacramento, I decided to upgrade to a newer unit that had more memory.  The 205W worked so well out of the box I was a little disappointed.  The tech on these is so simple now it's almost 'boring' to use.  It navigated rapidly and accurately and provided clear directions within minutes.  Most amazing to me was how well it picked up satellites compared to the Garmin V.  Extremely fast and even worked resting in the space between the seats of our rental car.  Pretty cool.I'm not sure you can go wrong with the 205W.  I've been a GPS geek for about 10 years and we use them at work.The 205W is intuitive enough for most folks to use right out of the box and the routing is good.  By 'good', I mean it's fast and accurate.  If you accidentally drive by something it quickly recalculates a route for you.The screen is nice and bright too, even in daylight.  It is wise to bring along the supplied 12 volt cigarette lighter plug as it seems to last for very short times on battery alone and there is no way to replace the battery or bring along a spare.  Fortunately, you can charge it off a mini-usb port from your computer too so it's not a big issue but if you're the forgetful sort, perhaps a replaceable battery model is better for you.This is not a unit you'd really use in the back-country.  It's designed for highway use and works great for that.  There are other more costly units that more effectively marry the needs of sportsman and the occasional traveler.It does nicely link up with Google Earth via your computer (you'll need to latest free version of Google Earth).  It does not appear to provide a real-time GPS position signal to your computer (my 7 year old Garmin V does though) so if you're looking for that capability this doesn't appear to be a solution for that specific problem.  However, if you are traveling and wish to save the addresses / places that you visited it easily imports that information and it's pretty cool to see those points overlaid on Google Earth.You can add an SD card and put photos and stuff on it like you might on a USB memory stick but I don't think many people use that sort of capability.You can easily download different icons to show your position.  I downloaded the tank.  The tank rules.  It's a gimmick but it shows the folks at Garmin have a sense of humor.You can view your route in the traditional overhead routing or 3D; both work really well.The provided suction cup mount works very well.  It uses a ball mount that allows for infinite positioning.  If you want a really rugged mount I'd strongly recommend the Ram-Mount systems available online.  I bought one for my ATV and it's amazingly stout and simple.  I digress.If your primary need for a GPS is a very simple, plain and effective unit for over the road travel, this will exceed your needs and your expectations in an easy to use package.

Not sure who likes this more, our 15 month old little guy or me.  You should buy Season 1 of the Muppet show too just to bring back how much fun this was growing up.  Back when specials were just that and getting to watch the Muppets was a reward for good behavior.  I still think this is a reward for good behavior.  You can't help but grin at the witty lyrics and the very real threats that Miss Piggy unleashes on hapless foam rubber Kermit.  It's a great compilation that you'll like and your kids will love as much as you did.  Mahna mahna is the best though.  Great stuff.

I have a 36" Sony XBR TV from 2002 connected via component cables to an Xbox 360.  The TV is supposed to do 1080i; who am I to disagree?  I installed the HD DVD today in about 5 minutes.  Very simple to do which is key considering the time it saves (and component cable space on the back of the TV) from hooking up a non-USB device.So far as I can tell, there are no drawbacks to this device.  Very easy to use, connects quickly w/ one USB wire to the Xbox.  Slick.The remote is slick, but now I have one more remote.  No drama really.My wife now needs another "how do I play a movie?" education as this is different from the standard DVD player that we still use to play standard DVD's.  I've not tried playing a standard DVD on the HD DVD rig, though I've read it's dreamy.I watched King Kong today and it was a noticeable improvement over the standard DVD, though most folks wouldn't likely pick up on it.  However, if you're researching HD you're an "early adopter" and you would probably point it out to your friends who likely don't care any more than your cat does.One review said the sound was bad.  On my setup, sound comes out via an optical cable; I thought it was fine and most folks would agree.I read one review that said it only plays 1080i via component cables and that there is no timeframe yet for Microsoft to make an Xbox cable that goes from the 360 to HDMI which apparently allows full progressive 1080p and hence even better quality.  This would not help me one bit since my TV is old school and has no HDMI anyway, so I guess it's a mixed blessing.  That said, the picture is very good even if it's not fully digified to my TV.At $200, it's a cheap, easy way to get at the HD DVD format.  If blu-ray wins in the end, I'm not out much dough, and with the ease of set up, I think this will be very popular w/ the 360 crowd.

We bought this microphone to facilitate recording meeting minutes.  It works well in a conference room setting w/ say, 10 to 12 people.  We connect it to a Dell laptop's microphone jack.  Using the mid-boost built into the Sony mic helps a lot.  We also use a free version of Audacity software to record the meeting directly to the computer.  Audacity allows you to rip it to .mp3 format directly for long term archiving which is very handy.  It also makes it easy to distribute minutes widely.  The product works well in these conditions and I'd recommend it.
I use this as a "drop-down rig" for my fixed blade ESEE knife. Fits stock ESEE belt clips.

Much preferred over the old-style that attaches on the outside of the window which eventually come loose and flop around. Started using this style in 2007. When I bought my new truck, this was the first thing I put on it!
Bought a pair for a kayaking buddy. He drives a hatch-back but needed a better way to tie down his kayak. He loves them!

I keep one in my travel kit, one in my locker one in my book bag, one in my camping bacpack, and one in the shower. It makes a great scalp scrubber, in the shower, if you don't like flakes. Also keep one in the kitchen for scrubbing potatoes!

Want a neat nesting set? This Stanley cup + a glacier cup + the SS nalgene with the tapered bottom. The SS bottle fits in the "stanley" and the "stanley" fits in the glacier cup. This will fit in the common brand tactical bottle holders. Ultralight? No. Apocalypse proof? YES!

Love the "kidney cup". I have always liked using these. If you don't add the matching stove from Rothco, you'll be missing out on a lot of functionality. The matching lids are one of the very few that snap in place securely. I'm used to the old style "L" handles, but these are very comfortable. I will say that the Nalgene canteens are an improved addition over the old school bottles, so pick one of those up as well.
Its a taller lighter version of the "glacier style" cup. I prefer the larger handles and lighter weight. My Nalgene nests perfectly in it. Fits well in my "Bottle pouch".

I love this lid. It is one of the few that actually "Snaps" securely in place... with the matching Rothco cup anyway. It misses 5-stars only because I feel it should have drain/vent holes on at least one end. However, I fixed that issue myself.
I prefer evernew over the "platypus" brand. I feel they are just more functional and have better threading on the neck.

Be sure to buy the matching cup with this. I have found that this stove won't fit ALL kidney shaped cups. works with sticks, small candles, fuel tabs.... Add a 6-9" square of foil in your pack and it can be used with alcohol. It misses the 5-star mark only because there are improved versions, which I have now upgraded to, with a grill-like surface, sold by "canteen shops" online.

Plastic is not quite as thick as my round nalgene bottle, but it seems rugged enough and fits much better in my backpack. FYI, the mouth is a different size than wide-mouth nalgene bottles and will not accept accessories such as specialty lids, or non-splash inserts.
As per another reviewers comment I ordered an XL instead of my usual XXL size, and it fit perfectly. Looks great!
Holds my 32oz Nalgene and nesting cup. Side pocket holds my Esbit stove, fuel tabs, and wind screen.

I have this cover, a US-Mil issued cover, and a cheaper cover. Of all 3, this one is my favorite. Plenty of room in the main compartment, and also the side compartments. The Molle on the back can be fitted to a pack or belt, alice clips can even be installed. On drawback, that is easily fixed, is the lid/cover. It just felt too high and floppy. I made a triangular cut, following the "V" of the straps, on the lid. Now the top of the canteen can protrude through the pack, the top of the pack tightens down snuggly (photo attached. sorry they rotate it 90-deg). I did this because I also carry a GI-style cup/stove/lid which the canteen nests into. This method keeps everything "tight" and quiet. On a side note, I store the lid for the cup in the very bottom of this cover, so far, this is the ONLY pouch I have found that I could do that with. The cover is thick and very rugged. I'd have no issue taking this into the bush for several weeks at a time, and not have to worry if it will hold up.

Very happy with the purchase. The water bottle serves its purpose, with no leaks or issues. The Cover is large enough to fit a matching GI cup/stove/lid (with the lid stowed vertically in the back.) It missed 5-stars only because the Nylon cover could/should be thicker.
Was given this by a friend. VERY attractive. I have received tons of complements on it.

PROS: Nice detail work. Fits true to size. CONS: This thing is MASSIVE. I'm talking way bigger than expected..... I'm a big guy and I like big rings; but I personally cannot see myself wearing a ring this big. If it were normal size, it would be a really nice ring. Unfortunately, this one will be returned. (3 photos added)
Camping jewel! Great for marking those small items that might get dropped in the dark.

I like em! Hold firm. Don't snag on my gear when packed. A little tip... although it is designed to use with larger cord.... for SMALLER cord, thread from the INSIDE out first (Which ends with the knot on the outside)!
Great little utility knife. Could also see it for food prep for campers. Very light. Very sharp.
Great stocking stuffer item for survivalists, campers, or anyone that like the outdoors.
Great in conjunction with a Grid-It to keep small items organized in a bag.
Great EDC pill box.
Nice pill box without being too foofy.
My favorite pen. I buy em by the box.
Nice supplements to EDC kits, tins, BOBs, GHBs, or INCH bags.
Love the look. Fits as expected.
Fits great in my urban survival tin or wallet. This is part of my EDC when wearing a suit. Great in combination with a bladeo knife and credit card flashlight.

Beats Mayday, Datrex, Mainstay, and other survival bars. Great flavors, big variety, filling, seem less crumbly than other brands. No they would never be my ONLY source of food, but they are really nice to grub while on the move!
Love the look. Fits as expected.
Its not a tank or one-blade wonder, but it fills a niche. Perfect for performing finer tasks. I really like tis in conjunction with an ESEE-5. Between the two, they cover all my needs.
Would prefer the double open-ended ones.
Save your pennies and buy the real thing.

I'm a fan of Honest Amish products. They all work and smell great. A full 2oz for less than what the other guys charge for 1oz. I have a thick tactical beard and it loves this stuff!. Half a dropper full worked into this facial extravaganza is all it takes. I rub it in as soon as I get out of the shower and work it through with a few strokes of a fine comb. It keeps this masterpiece as soft as the fur on a baby bunny's belly, and tangle free too. The only con is my inability to concentrate due to the constant distracting sound of panties dropping.....
Love the look. Fits as expected.
Will be a classic......
I liked it until I got my hands on the Streamlight mini lantern.
Bought as a gift. The case makes it a tad bulky. Replace with Victorinox clippers
As well made as any other brand I have used.

Guess my review is par for the course. Love this thing! Probably the most functional mess kit I have found.  The larger 7.5" version was a bit much, but the 6.5" is perfect for any BOB. Also added one to my GHB. Its also the ultimate "Survival Tin" when used in conjunction with a belt pouch (found on another site). Holds plenty of full size items or a ton of micro items.

I was skeptical at first, and I'm not the kind of guy that usually spends this much on a single pair of underwear. But now I am a believer! I like to pack light both in the city and in the bush! You can literally travel with only 2 pair! Wash and dry fast! After a quick scrub in the sink with a drop of body wash and toss over the towel rack and they are good to go before morning arrives. Not light enough for you? Then cut the undie weight by 50% more. Wash your only pair while in the shower, lay them flat on a towel and roll it tightly to get the excess water out. 2 minutes with a blow dryer and you're good to go. And yes, they are very comfortable! They are also designed to help fight the junk funk! Well made and built to last.
You can never have too many pairs of mechanic gloves.

You can't go wrong with this mighty-mite. Fits the need no matter what brightness you require. OK it isn't an aircraft landing light, but pound for pound (or ounce for ounce), this baby kicks butt. Super bright for its size and doesn't require costly specialty batteries. If you REALLY want to push it to full potential drop in a 10440 rechargeable, to surpass the 120 lumens. So small and light you will forget its in your pocket. I even forget its in the shirt pocket of my scrubs. Liked it so much a purchased an extra for myself and a couple for friends.

I'm a fan Honest Amish products. They all work and smell great. A full 2oz for less than what the other guys charge for 1oz. I have a thick tactical beard and it loves this stuff!. Half a dropper full worked into this facial extravaganza is all it takes. I rub it in as soon as I get out of the shower and work it through with a few strokes of a fine comb. It keeps this masterpiece as soft as the fur on a baby bunny's belly, and tangle free too. The only con is my inability to concentrate due to the constant distracting sound of panties dropping.....
Bought this for my Autistic nephew to help with learning to tell analog time (with assistance of the digital). Waterproof and tough.
You can never have too many pairs!

All worked and all came full of butane! Keep these in all my packs, for easy fire starting. Easier to get a fire going than with a mini-bic. Tips: Know how to fill them properly, and keep them in your pocket of jacket in cold weather to make sure they function properly.
My "Go-To" knife for fine tasks in the bush.
Less than great performances from both main actors.
Functions well for my uses. Used to mount a RD HAWK II to the molle on my bag. Don't think I'd ever use them to mount anything on my belt though.

I love this knife! This is my second one. My first got lost or stolen, so I replaced it immediately. I have many popular knives by many popular makers. This is by far my favorite and is my EDC. I was turned on to karambit blades about 12 years ago, they are all I carry now. Anyone that has carried a quality karambit blade knows the benefits. If you've never owned one, you're missing out! I prefer the plain blade over the combo blade. I've just found that I rarely used the serrations, therefore I prefer the full length of the blade be plain, which is more functional for my personal uses.

I agree with the earlier reviewer that said, "Its more of a hatchet, than a tomahawk". It actually is! Thats part of the reason I bought it. I'm ok with "tactic-cool" gear, but I needed something in between hatchet and tomahawk. I wanted a tomahawk that was a "work horse". It works well as a hatchet and I have no doubt it could split a wig as well as it splits wood. The sheath can be worn on a belt and is molle compatible, by way of velcro belt loops. I wish it would have came with "snap" belt loops instead of the hook-n-loop style, other than that, I'm very pleased with the purchase.
Yes it is thin, but I prefer it that way.  I have replaced a couple of bandanas in my hiking bag with these. I find them to be much larger and more versatile.

Until now, I have been very pleased with Camocon products, this one.... not so much. Only 2 sides have hems, leaving the other 2 sides to unravel. I bought this daily because it was cotton, thinking it would be soft/absorbant. The camo is printed only on one side. The paint/dye (pretty sure its paint) makes the fabric stiff and "scratchy" on the skin. In its current state, I'd never wear it as a scarf or head wrap. I'm going to give it a wash and see if it softens up, and see how much it unravels. I'll update after it dries.
In conjunction with the hatch loops (the ones with perpendicular hose on the end) it makes hauling a kayak a snap!
These things have hundreds of uses!
3 out of 4 worked. I see these as disposable items.

2 things would make this perfect. Addition of a red light (I'd rather have red than SOS) and reversing the lumen selection. Why start out on HIGH, instead of low? You BLAST everyone in the tent when you turn it on. Fix those and you'd have a 5-star product!
I use mine to keep my brain-bucket on my kayak when I'm not doing whitewater.
They work great. What else do you need to know?

This iPhone 6S Plus glass Screen Protector saved my phone more than once!  When accidents happen that would normally result in a scratched or broken screen this screen protector does it job!  It goes on easily and fits well. We received this product in exchange for an independent review and in my opinion this is a great product!

We were sent this product in exchange for an independent review. I have stated before that I really like this brand and as usual this iPhone 6s Plus case did not disappoint. It has a great fit and a great feel! It is light and not bulky.  I would definitely purchase this case!

This slim case looks good and has a great feel.  It is well made and the button and port cutouts have a are a perfect fit. We were sent this iPhone 6S case in exchange for an independent review and we are very pleased with this product. As usual LK products live up to their reputation!

This is a great case for those of us who seem to drop our phones often or may have children that drop our phones!  The sleek case fits very well and the cutouts for the buttons are perfectly aligned.  We were offered this product in exchange for an independent review and as usual we were very pleased with the quality of this LK product.

The case is made well and fits the phone very well. The credit cards slots are handy and the fact that you do not have to remove the phone from the holder to use it is great. But, the best feature of this case is the stand! You can watch videos without having to prop the phone up or hold it.  We were asked to independently review this iPhone 6 wallet flip case with stand and as usual were impressed by the quality of this LK  product.

We were asked to do an independent review of this water resistant wireless bluetooth speaker.  It has great sound for a small speaker and even lets  lets you use your phone handsfree!  I will even let my teenage son borrow it since the speaker is  water resistant and a great price point!

Great sound for a small speaker!  It is water resistant so you can use it in the shower.  Or, clip the speaker to you and take it around the house or yard.  My audio books and music can go everywhere with me and sound great! We were sent this speaker to review and I would definitely buy it!

This wine saver vacuum pump we were sent to review does the job.  The easy to use vacuum removes air and you can preserve two bottles at once with the two corks.  Great for when you don't use the whole bottle and want to enjoy it later!

We were sent this tray for our independent review and gave it two stars simply because the idea behind it is solid, but that is basically the only thing about it that is solid. It is our job to screen items of poor quality - this is one! The tray is priced too high for what you get. Ours arrived cracked, and as I was reviewing it, one whole side broke off! Sure, I could have asked for a refund but as a top reviewer, I instead want to screen these products for the rest of the Amazon ecosystem. Thus, here is the unfiltered review:Acrylic is a heavy, breakable material that does not ship well. So why is this tray being tossed in Amazon boxes and shipped all over the US in big brown trucks?? Bad idea all the way around. I just glanced at another buyer's review about this tray not being too heavy. It is not only too heavy, it is poorly designed with too much weight held together by thin sides, and the choice of material cheapens the product even further! All of those elements together lead me to say you should keep your money.Buyer - do not purchase this product unless you want a 50/50 shot that it will be break. Forget about serving anything with it or carrying it long distances, it is best suited to sit and look pretty from afar. Thus, for the price point ($30+) save your money and consider other options.See photos for more details.

I know, I know, I shouldn't be swayed by color because it has nothing to do with the product itself...BUT I think the pink is cool. There I said it.The cords themselves are exactly what you would expect in a Apple accessorie - simple, durable, and made with high quality materials. The length is helpful because it isn't too long or too small. I especially liked that CSync is offering a warranty, any company willing to do that gets high marks in our book because most are not. See photos for more details.

As a regular reviewer of dildos and vibrators, I am no stranger to their construction. So when I was asked to review this King Kong version independently I was more than open to it. The medical grade silicone is one of the key distinctions this model brings to the market. That type of engineering creates a high-end luxurious quality that others lack. The switches are sleep and the design is life like yet not distasteful. I gave this product 4 stars because I would have liked to have seen two C batteries as opposed to two double A batteries. The double A batteries do not give the device as much of a range with the 7 functions as two C's would. If this is your first vibrator, you probably wouldn't notice the difference. However, if you've been using toys for a while you will want to find a C battery version.

This is a product we hadn't seen before. We thought this product was answering a problem that many people have yet to to ignore. For under $10 a person can fix the leaky lemonade decanter at the graduation party, or create fr nice experience with water at a wedding. The options for this little piece are endless and most households struggle with this problem on some container or another. We thought this might have some great gift potential because almost any home w could put this in a drawer and grab it when the occasion arised. Very high quality and efficient engineering.

We were asked to review this cable independently and thought it was straightforward and highly effective. The overall goal is to charge faster and we felt like it definitely achieved that. Also, we like that this is Apple certified because not all are. Order with confidence.

When we were asked to review this money belt independently I expected something very basic and was pleasantly surprised. First of all, I ordered a different color because I was tired of black and tan. The blue color is very nice and different. Then, once we put on the belt and started digging around in it, we discovered way more pockets then we ever expected could be fit into such a small space. Depending on what you're using this for, you could fit a lot of items into it. However, if you are traveling and looking to keep important documents close to you there's a lot of ability to stay organized and keep it low profile.

We have reviewed several garden nozzles independently, and this one is made a bit differently. Previously, we had reviewed plastic versions and we think that the brass material provides better seal when attached to the hose. Overall the use of a nozzle like this helps cut down on water waste and increases sustainability. We like that aspect a lot. This is a unemotional purchase that is straightforward and durable. Order with confidence.

We probably review a audio headset at least once a week. Thus, we know what to look for and these headphones are made well and provide a lot of versatility for anyone with an active life . The battery life is always a frustration and these held their charge all day with heavy use. Also, we look for comfortable earbuds and this molded piece is better in our opinion than a simple plastic earbud. Overall,  this would make an excellent gift for someone or addition to your daily life.

I am new to retinol, so it was a bit surprising how much my face tingles when using this mosterizer. I was independently reviewing this product and thought that I definitely saw some good exfoliation after a few days. I would definitely agree that there is a surge that happened. The formula was higher quality than what you would find in a store.

I am an avid swimmer and I know the struggles with long hair and swim caps. Thus, when we were asked to test the swim cap independently I thought it was an excellent product once I got my hands on it. There is plenty of room for a bun or a ponytail in this cap. I tried to show how much on my mannequin. I really liked the grippers around the edge of this cap again, see photos for more details.

This is a classy product. We were sent this wine opener for independent review and were very surprised at how nice it truly was. Once we got it out of the package the overall impression is stunning. The wine bottle itself opened fine and we really liked the foil cutter as well. A lot of versatility and a small box plus a nice touch with the bonus foil cutter. We think this would make an excellent Christmas gift for that hard to get person on your list.

I am an avid swimmers so I definitely have an opinion when it comes to goggles. Thus, when we were sent this set for independent review I jumped on it as only a seasoned swimmer good. I think the anti fog and glare qualities are totally there, but the fit of these goggles is fairly uncomfortable. I don't know if I could wear these for too long at a time. My mannequin definitely looks nice in them so if you feel like your head is shaped like his you may have a different outcome than I did.  The nose plug was a nice touch.

I wanted to purchase a fountain for our pup for a very long time. For a while was hard to find a proper one with a good price, scanned through the website for a while, eventually found the right one.The stagnant water is not healthy for the animals so I think it was wise to turn to this thing, actually should have done this earlier. Its really convenient and I dont need to worry about whether he has enough water in his bowl or not. I just connected it to a hose in my backyard and the boy just plays with it all the time and having fun. Seems pretty reliable, I dunno if all thoseon the market are of the same quality or not, but this one was definitely a good one.

On his journey, Nicolai discovers the secrets of his hidden past while facing his enemies, both external and within himself. A great read and definitely an attention grabber.
I was able to use this weight-loss pill and was able to lose 10 pounds in the first couple of weeks.  I highly recommend this pill to anyone who are trying to lose weight.
After taking this pills, my belly fat is gone bye-bye.  Thank you lipo abs!!!
I recommend these pills to any married man out there.  My endurance is much longer now than before.

I remember from an early age my parents telling me to 'stop grinding my teeth', so I suppose it's been a bad habit from an early age. I didn't realize the problems it could cause until I was much older.  Thanks to Knight's Night Guard, I no longer have trouble sleeping at night!!!

I bought this product for my wife and have been amazed with the results.  It has truly enhanced the bust and curves of her body.  If you are looking for a product to compliment your body, this is a purchase that you must make.

Fantastic sectional outdoor sofa set. The cushions are deep and comfortable and I love the way the whole thing is easy to keep clean, the wicker can just be hosed down and the cushion covers can be washed. The frames are strong and the wicker is very high grade plastic.

My brother and boyfriend both are balding and I know it bothers them. So I bought this in the hopes it would work. Quite frankly, my expectations were low.  But, wow after just a few weeks what a difference! Hair is sprouting and thickening in areas that were previous bald or only wispy.  I'ts been very nice to see that ,and to bring a smile to their faces as well.

This product has definitely helped me slim down.  I threw out the scales a long time ago, but I know I've lost weight because the same clothes that felt tight a few weeks ago now feel loose.  Plus, I'm happy with how since taking this product I have more energy.  Must be the coffee -- but what I like is that it doesn't make me jittery or keep me awake at night.  And it tastes good, too!

This is a good cookbook for the novice cook, which would include someone who is both new to cooking and new to the logistics of cooking for two.  Much of it is common sense -- such as estimating portion control  by dividing a given recipe in half.  I've been cooking awhile, and generally cook for 1 or 2 people, so much of what this book has to offer was already known to me.  But the sections on different types of foods, and what amounts and types are best for 2 person dining, was useful.  Also, enjoyed a few of the recipes I've sampled, such as the one on roasted brussel sprouts.  I've often had it with bacon, but the balsamic glaze was new to me, and a welcome addition. I received this book for free, and don't know that I would have gone out of my way to buy it, but it will come in handy.

I bought this product after seeing the great results a friend of mine had from using it. She's a smoker and black coffee drinker, and her teeth had been pretty darkly stained. But after about a week of using this, her teeth looked so much brighter and whiter! It made her look younger, and happier -- more 'up,' you know?  My teeth weren't as stained as hers, yet about a week after using this friends began complimenting me on how 'bright' my smile was. One person at work remarked how happy I seemed.  Frankly, I don't think it was the way I acted, I think it's that my teeth are now sparkling white.Also, this item is easy on the pocketbook. Another reason why I'll be reordering a fresh supply soon. . .

Some months ago I was tested and found to be deficient in Vitamin D. So I started taking these capsules. About 4 days later I began to feel my mood brighten, and then a few days after that -- wow! It was like someone switched on a light bulb inside.  Inside of dawdling in bed in the morning, I find myself leaping out of it, eager to meet the day.  For me, Vitamin D and this brand is now an essential item.  I simply can't be sure that I can meet my body's need for this vitamin through food or through the sun. So I'll be sure to always have a bottle of Omegaboost in my bathroom cabinet.

Finally!  An Omega-3 Fish oil product that doesn't leave that 'fishy' aftertaste or a slightly "sick to the stomach" feeling. The lemon taste is actually very pleasant.  And the benefits are real: my skin is no longer dry, and my hair is actually shiny.  I also feel more alert, and notice that after working out, my joints are less sore. Feel very lucky this product is on the market, and available to me. I've tried a lot of Omega-3 Fish Oil capsules in my day. This is the best, by far.

This stuff is great. I"ve not only lost 10 lbs since I started taking it, but my energy level is both up and steady.  And all this considering I haven't been exercising any more than usual.  Recommended!

Very useful introduction and guide to juicing.  I"m someone who never juices, as I need a lot of fiber to fill up.  But having received this book for free, and after looking through it, I found some of the recipes so attractive I sampled them. Can report that the Green Energy Juice is indeed a good pickmeup and energy tonic for breakfast.  And the Green OJ worked well, despite the unlikely combination of orange and spinach.  Very much appreciated the introduction which discussed the various types of juicers -- all information I was aware of.  Also extremely useful to this novice juicer was the clear listing of amounts of various ingredients of the different recipes. Other juicing recipes will be somewhat vague on this, I've found. For the more experienced juicer, I wager that the nutritional breakdown of each drink will be useful, especially as it includes the grams of sugar, a measure that many recipe books omit. The only reason it doesn't get all five stars is I feel this book downplays all the prep time it takes to make these nutritious wonders.

I have no reason to think I am gluten intolerant but periodically like to make sure my body has a 'time out" for wheat products, especially because gluten is everywhere.  I also go through bouts of using a slow cooker, especially in the fall and winter months, when making batches of hot food and then freezing them for later meals comes in handy.  So this book is very useful for me.  It is well written and well organized.  I especially appreciated the list of foods to avoid,  and the tips on how to stock my pantry.But white "gluten-free" may be in the title this is actually a collection of recipes of service to vegans and vegetarians, as well as paleo and whole foods dieters.  Probably my chief criticism is that while these recipes seem easy enough to prepare, they do take time and look to me like afternoon projects. But there are enough dishes that you can whisk together quickly that even the time-pressed can benefit from this book.

I see most of the reviews of this book concentrate on its discussion of the science and rationale for adopting a candida diet.  Readers should know that this discussion comes in the introduction, but that the book is, at least for this consumer, first and foremost a cookbook full of recipes,. And I find the meals and snacks it describes as being very tasty, filling, and, in being made mostly from scratch and from whole foods, 'clean.'  So it is a very good whole foods recipe book for anyone looking to eat healthily while not depriving their palate of those interesting sensations that make life worthwhile.  Particularly like the coconut, almond waffles for breakfast and the cayenne spiced walnuts as a snack choice.That said, while the discussion of candida seems to fairly responsible, in that the editors concede the lack of empirical medical evidence for its existence, I found myself rolling my eyes at the questionnaire meant to self-diagnose it.  Who doesn't at times feel irritable, or subject to mood swings and fatigue? And the number of maladies that could produce these symptoms is endless.  Nevertheless the authors are to be commended for how they propose people adopt the candida-free diet, which is, after all, a very healthy one.  They have all sorts of recommendations for how to transition, and emphasize that it does in fact amount to a change in lifestyle, not just eating.

This book is a wonderful example of how stories marketed as "Young Adult Fiction," and "Romance"  actually transcend their commercial niches.  The historical backdrop to this story -- ancient Rome -- is in itself captivating and a draw.  Another engrossing and imaginative element of this story was the blend of natural and supernatural.  And of course, the character of Marcus and his journey -- I don't want to spoil the adventure for others, but I do want to encourage future readers to make sure they stay with this story till the end, because the last 30 pages are truly gripping.  This book is supposed to be the first in a series. Looking forward to its scucessor.

A real gem.  I don't have celiac disease, nor am I gluten-intolerant (that I am aware of), but every so often I try to give my body a break from it, because it is in so many foods and foodstuffs, it just seems like the healthy thing to do. These recipes are great -- especially the ones that offer wheat flour substitutes, like the pumpkin cinnamon pancakes.  Especially useful is the guide to the different type of flours and grains that can be used in place of wheat (coconut, almond, brown rice, millet).  This book also serves as a good introduction to the health benefits of the gluten-free diet, giving what looks like responsible overview of the medical science in support of it.  My only quibble likes with the claim that each dish takes "30 minutes or less."  Don't feel that's  realistic, given that some of them need advance preparation.  Was given this book for free, to review it. Now I"m very glad I have it, as hardcover, in my possession.

Have taken this product for about a week now and can report that my sugar cravings have calmed WAY down, and generally tendency to impulse eat or overeat is also WAY WAY more manageable.  Another bonus is simply that I sleep better at night -- especially have an easier time falling asleep.  Recommended.

This book is very useful for people considering veganism or open to changing their diet to a more plant-based, whole food approach.  It doesn't hype the health-promoting benefits for going without dairy or animal products, which makes many of its recommendations more credible.  For example, rather than urging readers to totally transform their eating habits immediately, but rather suggest to "begin slowly." Eliminate one food group at a time, beginning with ones LEAST essential to your daily eating, while giving yourself "time to adjust" to the changes.While the advice is generally sound it's also a bit meager, and perhaps misleading. For example in the recipe for sweet potato and kale hash we're told that the orange vegetable is a good source of Vitamin D. Never heard that before -- I wonder if the authors had Vitamin A in mind instead? Also, there is a cheerful recommendation for vitamin supplementation, though it seems to medical studies keep refuting the supposed health benefits of these usually pricey pills.That said, it is the recipes that this books' value rests on, and here it delivers. I've tried quite a few, and have in the past made variants of some of the ones listed here.  They are indeed quick and easy and flavorful.  The breakfast ones are especially useful -- concoctions like the pumpkin pancakes and broiled grapefruit look like great finds.  Look forward to using this cookbook quite a bit in the future.Btw, I received a free copy of this book in exchange for writing this review, but was free to say whatever I wanted in it.

This is an important magazine.  It's not simply that many of the stories in this issue are well -- crafted, but cumulatively they offer a portrait of America, or open a window onto what it means to be alive and struggling to walk the lonely tightope straddling hope and delusion, realism and despair.  Every story revolves around the struggle and point of view of some character who is lonely and profoundly isolated, engaging in marginal and/or taboo behavior, whether its a young slacker male succumbing to the allure of 'forbidden' sex in a BDSM Craigslist ad, as in  Don Boles' Swimming With Sharks, or the older nominally successful businessman and family man of J.A. Bernstein's An Affair, who flies halfway around the world to consummate a passion kindled decades ago by a fleeting glimpse of a woman (prostitute?).Many of these protagonists in this  story seem to be on an unacknowledged quest for passion, or authenticity.  Their journey generally culminates in a deepened insight into how limited their lives and possibilities are -- they remain as isolated at the beginning of the story as at their end. The true standouts, for me, in this collection is the last one, On Bread Alone, Josh Goller. T he story of a how a hapless homeless man became the matrix for a short lived religious movement, as told by his first supporter, is at once funny, sad, and horrifying -- because utterly believable.  Not all the stories felt especially inspired -- some felt more like story ideas forced into production, as With Janna Layton's Oddly Precious Melancholy -- the premise sounds irresistible on paper -- parents organizing to dispose of their debt-ridden, financially dependent children -- but what might work as, say, a screenplay, falls short in a short story, where some psychological plausibility needs to be in evidence.Another reason why this collection only merits 4 stars is the poetry. None of the selections were especially well-crafted,  and all seemed to have been willed into existence to serve an intellectualized idea, as opposed to inspiration.  Which isn't to imply that all the stories are perfectly realized works -- but it does feel they have been written because they NEED to be written.A final note on this issue:  A number of reviewers of this magazine cite Bukowski and Selby as influences. I honestly -- and it may be a strictly idiosyncratic response on my part -- feel as if I were more encountering the echoes of Flannery O'Connor -- the dark satire and ending of On Bread Alone certainly resonates with her work.
Lovely set of two loungers match my dinning set, they are comfortable and light so easy to move about. Very pleased.
Bold and striking big comfortable chairs, looks fantastic on my patio. Much better than the smaller round set we used to have.

This is fun novel with some depth.  Morgan is a hard-driving, wealthy, self-made businesswoman who has climbed to the top of the high stakes, ruthless world of trading.  She has nerves of steel and much inner strength, but also, is, in her own words, 'damaged goods.  Flashbacks reveal a childhood marred by tragedy that left Morgan an orphan, with no one to take care of her. Crossing the busy New York Street, focused as ever on her pursuit of wealth and the 'killer trade,' she is herself nearly killed by an oncoming massive motorcycle, helmed by the enigmatic, honorable, but tough as nails Cabe.  In short order the plot has Cade offering Morgan his home to stay in until she can  get back on her feet (literally, the acccident broke her leg.)And this leads us to what makes this novel interesting. It is not just that this proud Wall Street businesswoman finds herself attracted to this rough and tough biker. Through Morgan's eyes, we are taken on a journey into the world of motorcycle outlaw clubs. Because Cade is the head of this club, and on his firm and strong shoulders rests the responsability for this 'tribe.' Morgan, and the reader learn not just about honor and the subculture of this club. But then Cade's story, and his past heartbreaks and tragedy that turned him into not only a warrior but a leader, is what makes us truly care about him.Morgan and Cade are not the only characters in this novel. Stacy, Morgan's assistant, all corporate polish on the outside, but vulnerable and passionate as hell on the inside, has her own story to tell. And then there's Cades' treacherous twin, brother, whose vendetta against Cade fuel much of the plot's narrative.There are some plot details that go unexplained. Early on we find out that Stacy is related to one of the central characters. But that issue is dropped -- as if the fact that she's Asian and her relative is white and western. One of the reviewers said she stopped reading shortly before the end. Pity. Because the very end is a shocker -- won't give anything away, except to say I didn't see it coming.  But I believe it means that Morgan is not finished with her experiences with the Filthy Few outlaw club. Be interesting to see where her next journey takes her.

I'm a person who doesn't always do what I'm told or follow instructions exactly... so when I didn't notice any immediate benefits from Ever Young in my facial appearance I took a few extra capsules. And I actually noticed a difference in my face the next day! It had color again which instantly took off about 5 years. I won't continue at the higher dose, but at least I know it does work. Having a vibrant looking face again is worth the time and money in taking Ever Young consistently. I would definitely recommend this product.

Like most women  on the 'other' side of 40 those lines at the corner of my eyes have been getting deeper and longer.  And that's been getting me down -- have even found myself avoiding looking into the mirror. Especially cause I coudn't see myself running to the Doctor every three months to get some toxin injected in my face (i.e. Botox).  But then I had lunch with a friend who I hadn't seen in a few months -- and I noticed her skin was seriously smoother and brighter.  She had gone from being more wrinkled than me to less! Figured she was doing the Botox thing but no -- she said it was this product.  Really grilled her but she was very firm -- no surgeries or procedures were behind her suddenly refreshed look, just this DNA serum. So, yes, I went home and ordered some.  A month later and I felt like a walking infomercial. Now I look forward to looking in the mirror every morning -- my face looks just a bit softer and younger every day.  And I'm grateful. It's nice to look as young as you feel:)

"I was still falling at unstoppable speeds- only in his arms, as his body claimed me without a single word spoken, I was suddenly falling....up"Aly Martinez... If you wanted me to fall, then you have succeeded. I have indeed fallen. Fallen in love with your writing, stories, characters, and the raw emotions that you evoked through your words. And I will continue to fall for your books every single time. Aly's books has been somewhat an addiction for me. She never fails in delivering books that can grip you to the core, strip you naked and make you FEEL. And in her newest standalone, The Fall Up, Aly Martinez DELIVERED. She more than delivered. She held me HOSTAGE as she drowned me in one of the most heartfelt, beautiful, touching stories that I have read."No words were exchanged. Everything had been said as we both came on the gasp of the other's name. I'd claimed her. And, in turn, she owned me. It was almost as exhilarating as it was terrifying. Almost."The Fall Up is truly one of those reads that you want to savor and re-read again. In this spellbinding tale, Aly perfectly weaves a romance like no other. A romance that was palpable and tangible right from the start when two strangers meet on the ledge of a bridge. An unconventional meeting of two broken people. A young woman who is lost in her guilt, pain, and loss. And a man who feels the need to help with his Spiderman complex."She wasn't the princess. And I wasn't the pauper. She was just a sad girl who liked to write songs. And I was nothing more than a simple guy who was lucky enough to have made her fall in love with him."On a cold rainy night in San Francisco, Levee Williams meets a tattooed stranger, who saves her. Saves her from taking that jump. The jump to end it all. When Sam interrupts Levee from these thoughts to jump, he saves her in more ways than he knows. Whenever he sees Sam on the bridge, he continues to disrupt her and forms a special friendship with her. When Levee finally takes Sam offer to get a late night snack, she finally lets her guard down. As Sam learns of her true identity as Levee Williams, the pop star celebrity, he doesn't seem faze of her celebrity status. All he sees is Levee. Levee, the beautiful brown eye girl who stole his heart the moment he laid eyes on her. The girl who has bewitched him with her beauty, honesty, witty personality and vulnerability."Levee, I'll tell you anything you want to know as long as it means you're with me to keep asking."As Sam and Levee embark on a relationship, a connection is formed. A deep raw tangible bond where there are not enough words to describe this connection they feel for another. A connection of peace, of hope, of love, and new beginnings. As they continue to fall for each other, Levee must face with the realization of the truth. The truth that she needs help. If she wants any chance to have a real relationship with Sam, Levee goes to a rehab facility to help deal with her anxiety and depression. As Levee undergoes her treatment, will it be enough to keep her off the ledge? Will she let her issues prevent her from truly living her life and the possible chance at love? Or will she find herself falling in love with Sam Rivers?"Hell, I could probably pretend for the rest of my life if he continued to hold me the way he did. Kiss me the way he did. Touch me the way he did. Save me the way he did."The Fall Up has to be one of my favorite books that Aly has written. Aly has once again perfectly weaved an emotional and heartfelt story-line with witty humor and of course sexy steamy scenes. This book is definitely a book that needs to be read, experienced, and savored. I loved every aspect of this book from the raw and flawed characters to the emotional heartstrings that can tug your heart. As I stated earlier in my review, Aly Martinez will hold your hearts and attention hostage. She will grip you with a love story that will leave you breathless. A story that will make you want a real life Sam Rivers to catch your fall. So if you are looking for a book where the author tackles an important issue in such a deep and profound way, you NEED to READ this book.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

Rules of the Ride is my first H.J. Bellus book that I have read and I'm scolding myself as to why I haven't read any of her books before because if this book was any indications of the raw emotional touching storyline that can grip your heart, then H.J. Bellus you have my full attention now. I honestly didn't know what to expect when I first started this book. At first, I was thinking a hot sexy cowboy who ropes in the woman that catches his eye. But Ms. Bellus completely surprises on how deep, touching, and emotional Rules of the Ride was as it weaved the depths of forgiveness, acceptance, love, and second chances.There was only one woman Maverick Slatter loved. And that was Ella James. She had the power to destroy him and yet a part of him yearned for her love. When she walked out of him and never looked back, he never thought that their paths would collide. What he once thought was finished business with Ella, turned out to be unfinished as sparks begins to flicker and reignite. When Mav learns of the reason of why Ella ran away, how far will Mav go to get the woman he has only loved? Can Mav's love heal all the brokeness that Ella feels? When it comes to love, there are no rules...so will Mav and Ella get their second chance at love?"Love doesn't follow the rules or view of life the way our eyes see it."H.J. Bellus has a way of pulling and tugging those heartstrings in this beautiful well-written book. I have always been a fan of family themed books and Rules of the Ride is a great example of a strong united family who are willing to go beyond the means to help one another. As I have said earlier, this definitely won't be my last H.J. Bellus book. I look forward to reading what lies ahead for the Slatter's Family and as well as what other books Ms. Bellus has in store. So if you are ready to get swept away in a sweet and heartbreakingly beautiful second chance love story then Rules of the Ride might be the book for you.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

I can't even begin to express how much I LOVED and ADORED Pucked Up!!!!! Helena Hunting has seriously stole my heart when she introduced me to one of the sweetest, charming, and lovable Yeti that I have ever read. Okay, well there is no actual Yeti but Miller Buck Butterson will make me reconsider thinking Yeti's aren't so bad especially if they have a heart of gold like Miller.Helena Hunting is seriously one of those authors who has mastered weaving romance with smart sexy humor while integrating a touching story-line with raw emotional undertones that can pull all the heartstrings. If Helena Hunting wanted to steal your hearts, then she DELIVERED!!!!! Helena Hunting DELIVERED a fun, sexy, fresh romantic comedy that will have you wanting to get PUCKED UP by Miller Buck Butterson.Miller Buck Butterson is a professional hockey player, who is tired of the puck bunnies and playboy lifestyle. He is ready to settle down and be committed to a girlfriend. And the only person that he has set his eyes and heart on is Sunshine "Sunny" Waters, the younger sister of Alex Waters, who happens to be one of his teammates. Miller wants Sunny. He wants to show her that he is a changed man. A man that can be faithful and committed. But unfortunately for Miller, a few misconstrued and misleading pictures taken of him soon begins popping up on social media which doesn't help his image of a changed man. With Alex and Sunny's friend not being supportive of Miller also doesn't help convince Sunny's in her trust issues and insecurities. Will Buck be able to show and prove to Sunny that she ain't another notch on his bed? Can Sunny learn to trust Miller?Did I mention hot much I LOVED PUCKED UP? Okay, let me reiterate it one more time again... PUCKED UP is a MUST READ!!!!! Here is why you have to read this book. First and foremost, this book is so refreshing, entertaining, and oh so funny!!!! Secondly, Violet is back and let me tell you that I absolutely LOVE this WOMAN!!!! She is so blunt, funny, and yet has this BIG HEART for her brother whom she happens to think is a YETI. And lastly, Pucked UP has one of the most lovable hero that can make your hearts flutter with his honesty and big heart. So if you are ready to laugh out loud and be swept up in this sweet and charming romance, then this book is for you!!!!! #BeReadyToEmbraceAYeti~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

There is something about small town romance that I always finding charming, sweet, and touching. And in Lia Riley's third installment to The Brightwater Series, Ms. Riley enchants her readers to a fairy-tale love story with a modern twist to the beloved classic, Beauty and the Beast.Wilder Kane is your grumpy alpha hero who had to leave his career behind after a tragic accident. Now back home in his hometown of Brightwater, California, Wilder is not exactly your friendly neighbor that is until he meets Quinn Higbsy. Slowly, our sweet heroine was able to draw out this stubborn man back into society. Slowly, the walls that have surrounded Wilder Kane soon begins to crumble when he allows Quinn into his life. Can Quinn show this perfectly imperfect man that he is not broken at all?I adored this sweet, charming and touching small town romance book. The Best Worst Mistake is my favorite of the series. I have always been drawn to flawed broken heroes and Lia Riley did an amazing job showcasing that behind all the facade, Wilder Kane is a good, honest, and beautiful man. So if you are looking for a book that is a great reminder that true love is about loving and accepting all your imperfections then the Best Worst Mistake is the book for you. Also, sometimes the best worst mistakes make the best kind of stories so be prepared to fall in love with Quinn as she tames her own beast, Wilder.

Calling all fans of sweet romance...Jessica Clare's third installment to The Billionaire and Bridesmaid's Series will satisfy your hunger!!! The Billionaire Takes a Bride has one of the sweetest beta hero, who will leave you swooning on how perfect, patient, understanding, and loving he is. Usually when we think of billionaires, they are usually identified as arrogant, dominant, in control, and total alpha but in this book, Ms. Clare made readers fall in love with a charming hero and his sweet beta ways.Billionaire Sebastian Cabral doesn't want to take part in his family's reality TV show that is similar to that infamous reality on E! He loves and adores his family but can't stand his mother's crazy antics on how to boost TV ratings. So when he meets Chelsea Hall, a bridesmaid that he is being paired with for Hunter and Gretchen's wedding, they instantly clicked. He loved that Chelsea didn't care for his money. So when Sebastian proposes marriage to Chelsea as a way to get his mother and ex off his back, they decide that it will be totally platonic. Just two friends helping each other out since Chelsea is not looking for anything romantic. But as they continue to spend more time with each other, Chelsea begins to open up to Sebastian of her painful past and why she has a hard time with intimacy. Without realizing it, they both begin to cross the lines from fake marriage to possibly something "real." Can Sebastian slowly heal Chelsea's fears of intimacy? And will Chelsea's past destroy her chance at love and happiness?I adored this sweet read!!!! There is something refreshing about reading a book with a hero that was super sweet in his beta ways!!! All I can say, Jessica Clare continues to mesmerized here readers with the sexy, sweet, steamy billionaire romance that has a way of stealing your hearts.

"I want Emma Burke. I always have. And I'm going to fight like hell to make her mine. I know a thing or two about fighting."Ginger Scott.....there is only one question I have for you. Can I claim Owen and Andrew all to myself? (**please note- I am here picturing you nodding and agreeing with me that I can have those Harper Boys. haha**) Wicked Restless is the second and final installment of The Harper Boys and one of my most highly anticipated YA/NA book of 2015. When I first read about Andrew Harper in Wild Reckless, I wanted to know more about him. And let me just say, Ginger did not disappoint me with this book!!! Ginger Scott DELIVERED!!!! Wicked Restless was an emotional, slow burn second chance romance that was brimming with so much passion, angst, loss, hope, forgiveness and a palpable unforgettable love story.Ginger Scott has been one of those authors whose writing speaks for themselves. She never fails to deliver a book that is refreshing, touching, and heartbreakingly beautiful. I love how her books always finds a way to grip and tug all those heartstrings. And the story of Andrew Harper and Emma Burke was a devastatingly beautiful love story where readers are taken on a Ferris Wheel ride, where sometimes you are up, sometimes you are down, but in the end, you just need to enjoy the ride. I can't explain how much I loved this book because Ginger held my heart hostage with Andrew and Emma.Wicked Restless is one of those stories that allowed readers to be consumed with it's characters. Andrew Harper, the genius of the Harper boys. The brother who could get into college that he wanted to. But living in a small town, people talked and they automatically labeled the Harper Boys as bad seeds. When Andrew first laid his eyes on Emma Burke, it was like something in him click that arrows and neon signs were pointing to him that Emma is the one. As a young sixteen year old teenager, Andrew knew without a doubt he was in love with Emma Burke. He fell in loved with her vibrant personality, beautiful soul and her charisma. He would do anything for her. And Andrew proved that when he took the blame on a car accident that forever changed his life. Fast forward to five years later, Andrew is angry at the girl who didn't bother to write back and wait for him. He resented that his time away changed him to a broken man. Call it fate or what not, when Andrew is reunited with Emma, he is filled with a mixture of emotions. Hurt, betrayal, anger, loss,pain and emptiness are coursing through him. He needed Emma but at the same time he didn't. But one thing is for certain, Emma Burke was under his skin. She was the girl that he loved so much and having her reappear back in his life brought back a storm. A storm where he knew he had to face head on to find out why the girl he loved broke his heart five years ago."The more she talks, the more I feel every scar on my body all at once- the burn marks, the stab wounds, the broken bones that never healed quite right- abuse I took so Emma Burke didn't have to experience anything sad."They say every story has two sides. And in Wicked Restless, Ms. Ginger once again pulls your heartstrings as you discover what really happened five years ago. Emma had a secret that she kept from Andrew. She was born with a heart condition that was life threatening. Emma needed a heart transplant in order for her to live her life to the fullest. Though Emma may have been born with a broken heart, her heart was filled with so much love for the boy who owned it. Andrew Harper was the only one that her heart yearned for. And so when she was reunited with Andrew, she was hurt, saddened by the way Andrew treated her. The way he could treat her as something of the past. But when Emma and Andrew finally had the chance to rehash what happened, truths and secrets begins to be revealed? Can love heal all the scars that were inflicted upon Emma and Andrew?Wicked Restless was more than a love story. This book was a prime example of why I love reading Ginger's books. She was able to incorporate the elements of love, forgiveness, hope, and second chances. And most importantly, Ginger reminds us all that every scar tells a story. A story that says, you have survived. And for Emma and Andrew this sentiment holds true. They are both survivors. They have both lived through the ups and downs of life and through all the hardships, they were able to find and fight their way back to each other. So if you are looking for a book that will tugs all the heartstrings and hold your heart hostage in this touching second chance romance, then I highly recommend you to read Wicked Restless.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

If you ever read a book from River Savage then you are fully aware that this author takes her readers on a whirlwind of raw emotions and surprises. And in her newest release to the Knight's Rebel's MC Series, Ms. Savage holds her readers hostage as she consumes us with raw emotions, grittiness, intensity, and passion. Infatuation was so much more than your typical MC romance of a good girl meets bad boy biker. This book sends a powerful message that no one is truly broken and life is full of second chances.Infatuation centers on the story of Beau McIntyre and Mackenzie Moore. Ms. Savage introduces her readers to a broken, beaten Mackenzie Moore. A woman who has first hand experienced physical abuse from her husband. A woman who lived the tale of what it means to escape from a monster and be a survivor. Mackenzie Moore is a resilient woman, who just needed time to really see how strong, beautiful, and tough she is. And the only person who was able to transcend and help bring out this side to Mackenzie was Beau McIntyre."I'm consumed by everything he gives me. Everything he takes from me."When Beau first rescued and helped Mackenzie, he never thought he would see her again. But eighteen months later, she shows up at his MC clubhouse asking for help and protection. There was something about Kenzie that instantly gravitated him to help her. There was this strong sexual, emotional, and physical connection that was buzzing through the air whenever they were around each other. As Kenzie and Beau continued to spend more time with each other, they soon found themselves crossing that invisible line and they knew once that they crossed that line, there was no going back. Kenzie is well aware of Beau's need for control and submission, can Kenzie submit and let go knowing that she was abused by her husband? Can Beau heal the shattered pieces of Kenzie and show her that she is not broken?"The truth is I do. I love the way he is. Love the way he speaks, the way he treats me. I love it all and yeah it scares me. Oh, God, does it scare me."As always, River Savage did another phenomenal job writing Infatuation. It was an emotionally raw book that evoked a wide range of emotions. Infatuation was brimming with grit, passion, grief, loss, hurt, pain, love, and second chances. I loved that Ms. Savage continues to blend and integrate layers of suspense, romance, and raw vulnerabilities. The story of Beau and Kenzie is a reminder that love has the power to shine in our darkest and weakest moments. The strongest light is the light that shines within you.... and for Mackenzie Moore, it lead her way to Beau. Although this book exposes all facets of love and second chances, I loved that Ms. Savage raises awareness on domestic violence. River did an amazing job showcasing that LOVE HEALS and that starting over is a gift that we should not waste. So if you are looking book that reminds us all no matter how much you may think you are broken, you can always build yourself back up and start over again. It's never too late to start over; never too late to love, and never too late to be happy.P.S.~ River Savage please tell me the next book is Brooke and Kelly because I seriously can't wait for their story. This couple's story gripped and tore my heart. Please don't keep your readers waiting long.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

I am addicted to Rachel Van Dyken and her mafia series!!!!!! And in her newest release, RIP, RVD continues to spellbinds her readers with this edgier, dark, gritty, and suspenseful read. I love reading books that holds you hostage because you never know what to expect. I love how RIP was a story that unfolded in a precise and intricately manner. Slowly, RVD peels each layer of grit, suspense and truth as readers got to know Nikolai Blazik, the Doctor and Maya, the daughter of a Russian mobster.I really don't want to say much about the book because this story will grip you right off the opening pages. You will want to know more of Nikolai, the doctor who can help erase memories by incorporating pain and pleasure. What I can tell you is that Nikolai was the one who helped erased Maya's memory when she was sixteen and now a couple of years later, Maya is standing in his office. And this time, Maya belongs to him for one year. She will have to abide to his rules in the contract. No questions. So what happens when memories comes slowly seeping back? And what happens when a strong connection between them begins to develop? Can Nikolai save and protect Maya from the danger that threatens her safety?As always, RVD continues to hypnotize her readers with her sexy suspenseful mafia romance. I loved RIP. It was exciting, engaging, compelling, and sexy!!!! There was never a dull moment in the book because RVD did an amazing job exposing the secrets and truths. So if you are looking for a hot new sexy, edgy mafia romance then I highly recommend you to read RIP. Also, you definitely want to one-click this book because the cover alone is HOT!!!~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

"The scars are faded, but they'll never go away."An irresistible twisted dark erotic romance!!! Pretty When You Cry by Skye Warren is one of those reads that hooks readers instantly as she introduces a young heroine, who has been brainwashed by a religious cult leader that she is a sinner and that she belongs to his flock. For years, Candace has been ingrained with scriptures and teachings from her cult leader. When Candace finally escapes the religious compound and heads to the city, she finds herself in the streets looking for shelter and luckily she meets a man who saves her from danger. Alone, scared and with only $20 in her pockets, Candace, who happens to be 16 years old at the time finds housing with Ivan, an owner of The Grand, a seedy strip club. Ivan takes its upon himself to house the young girl providing education, clothing, shelter, and a job for Candace. When she turned 19, Candace who now goes by Candy decided that she want to earn her keep and become a stripper at The Grand. Ivan never wanted her to strip but Candy insisted that this is something she wanted to do. The relationship of Candy and Ivan is a complex one. Both of them, craves and needs each other emotionally and physically. Candy needs the mixture of pleasure and pain and Ivan needs the control. As much as Candy wants to leave Ivan and be free, she couldn't because there is this tangible bond between them. From an outsiders perspective, we may not understand their relationship dynamic but what we should understand that both of them are broken and share a painful past of abuse. They may have physical scars but the emotional scars that they have runs deep. Their push and pull relationship gets tested when the cult that Candy tried to escape comes back looking for her sending her a message that the flock must return home. Can Candy finally be set free? Or will she retreat back to the young fearful girl? Can Ivan be the home and salvation that Candy needs?"He hurts me and he soothes me, but never enough. Back and forth. Never enough pain or pleasure. He always leaves me needing more."Pretty When You Cry is not your typical romance with hearts and flowers. There is no prince charming and white knight but there is a hero, who is broken, flawed, imperfect and domineering. Ivan may not be your ideal hero but he is indeed a hero in his own sense. He saved Candy and in turn she saves him too. He may show a different way of his affection and love with his control but it's love nonetheless. So if you are looking for a book where the author perfectly weaves a love story in the backdrop of abuse, sex, control, and suspense then I would definitely recommend Pretty When You Cry. Ms. Warren will remind us all beauty and hope can be found in the ugly. And in this case, it's about finding beauty in life's scars.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

A near death experience was all it took for bad boy nightclub owner, Logan McCabe, to reassess his life and have him reflecting on what is the one moment in his life that he would love to get a second chance. And the only thing that Logan could think of was his one hot wild sexy night eleven years ago with this hot young 18 year old girl. This young woman turned out to be his fantasy girl. Every dream and sexual fantasy would always go back to that one night and girl. And so begins Logan search for his fantasy girl, Abigail Parker.On her eighteenth birthday, Abigail Parker decided one night to be reckless. One night to be wild and have some fun. Well, Abigail did just that. She had one hot passionate night with a man that she met at a nightclub. And the end result was her being pregnant with Jenny. Fast forward to eleven years later, Abigail never expected to see Logan standing on her doorstep. Unaware that he is a father, Logan convinces Abigail to let loose and submit to his sexual fantasies. As Logan and Abigail begins a whirlwind of sexual fantasy, Abigail finally tells him that he is the father to their daughter, Jenny. So when fantasy collides with reality, will Logan realize that his fantasy girl could be his shot at a second chance?His Fantasy Girl by Nina Croft had every elements that every Brazen junkie craves from hot sex, dirty talking alpha males, and of course those HEA endings that will leave a smile on your face. This book was a great read and definitely a reminder that fantasy can become a reality.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

Tempting the New Boss by Angela Claire was a quirky fun and yet a sexy read!!! I enjoyed this book a quite a bit since this is not your typical book hero. Mason Talbot is a successful wealthy business CEO. Usually in most books that deals with CEO's, the hero is typically found to be dominant, total alpha male, and exudes confidence but in the case for Mason, he is none of those things. Mason is your hero who is socially awkward and has no filters. He lacks the social skills and comes across sometimes as aloof, brazen, and brash. His personal assistant is the only one who can understand Mason and his quirky personality. So when his assistant hires Camilla Anderson, a new attorney for Talbot Inc. to accompany Mason in securing business deals, Camilla never expected to find herself attracted to the socially awkward Mason.When Camilla and Mason had to fly out on a private plane to London, they never expected their flight would be full of unexpected surprises and bumps. Due to a severe weather storm, their plane had to do an emergency landing in Nova Scotia. Camilla's first week on the job was nothing what she expected because soon she finds herself having hot steamy passionate sex with her boss. Being not so good with words, Mason makes it awkward for her when her family lands in Nova Scotia to make sure she is okay after their plane had to do an emergency landing. And lets just say Mason didn't make a great first impression with her parents. As Camilla and Mason begins to have deeper affections for one another, can Camilla be able to separate her business and personal relationship with Mason?This book was definitely your feel good kind of romance. It was different, fresh, and sweet. I loved that the author didn't give us your standard alpha CEO but instead gave us Mason Talbot. The ending of the revelation of why Mason acted the way he did was done in a way that will make readers understand for Mason's behavior. This is my second book that I have read from this author and will definitely check out more books from Angela Claire. So if you are looking for a sweet and lovable book then I would suggest you give this book a try. I loved that this book sends a positive message reminding us to never judge a person and see the beauty in their flaws.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

When I read the first book, Slow Ride of the Playing for Keeps Series by Cathryn Fox it was more on the romantic and emotional connection between Chase Cooper and Julia Blair.
