And in this second installment Wild Ride, Cathryn Fox definitely took this book up a notch on the wild side. And when I mean wild, I don't mean wrangling horses but wrangling deep sexual fantasies that only Tyler Mackenzie can fulfill for Jess Gray.For Tyler, Jess was the one woman from his past that he knew was perfect for him since he has been harboring deep feelings for her since they were high school friends. So when Tyler invited Jess to his ranch that he co-owns with his friends, he wanted one week with Jess to show her that they are perfect for each other emotionally and physically. And Tyler is the only one who can fulfill all her deep sexual fantasies since he knew she was a shy girl who had lots of dirty naughty fantasies. One week was all it took for Jess to be awaken sexually, emotionally, and physically to Tyler. So when their week is up, will Tyler be able to wrangle the woman that he has been in love with or will she be too scared to take a chance with this sexy cowboy? Is Jess ready for one wild ride?Wild Ride was definitely a fun, naughty, and sexy read!!!! I enjoyed reading this quick sexy romance between Tyler and Jess. Though the book started with insta-lust, I didn't mind it all since these two shared a past together and had feelings for each other. I really enjoyed Tyler's character since he really wanted to show how much he knew Jess and her sexual fantasies. I loved that Tyler did these sexual fantasies for her pleasure alone. So if you are looking for a quick steamy read where a couple explores their sexual fantasies, then Wild Ride might be the book for you.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

Ilsa Madden-Mills has always been on my list of authors that I adore and love. When I first read her debut book, Very Bad Things, I was instantly addicted to all her books. There was no ifs, ands or buts about it, Ilsa has reminded me as to why I enjoy and love reading the New Adult genre. Personally, I think she has the magic touch when it comes to this genre because I have always found myself spellbinded and bewitched with all her stories. There is never a dull moment in her books because all her stories have always been so raw, captivating, emotionally gripping, sexy, and breathtakingly beautiful. And in her newest release, Dirty English, Ilsa truly has outdone herself with this book and I personally think this is my favorite book that she has written so far."Loving Declan was like the rain storms I loved to dance in. Crazy and unpredictable, sometimes turbulent, sometimes gentile."The Brits are coming!!!!!! And I might just say I am loving this British Invasion of Declan and Dax Blay!!!!! Ilsa Madden-Mills if you are reading this review, can I just say how I much I freaking love you for writing this fab book. Dirty English was more than your typical romance of hot tattoo British bad boy meeting a young American lady and falling in love. This book was so much more than an ordinary college romance. Dirty English spoke volumes of love, forgiveness, second chances, redemption, hope, and new beginnings."I'm the guy who's going to take you up against this wall. I'm going to bury my c% in you and own your body and you're going to love it. But I'm not going to hurt you. Ever."I have always been a Jane Austen fan and Pride and Prejudice has always been one of my favorite literary classics. As a romantic at heart, I have always wanted my version of Mr. Darcy. And in Dirty English, Ilsa has put a modern twist to a beloved literary classic. Well if I thought Mr. Darcy was a man to swoon for, then ladies Ilsa will have your knickers in a twist when she introduces us to Declan Blay. What's not to love about Declan Bay...he's hot, single, smart, sensitive, loves literary classics, and he's BRITISH!!!!!!! Oh yeah, he also has a hot twin brother named Dax. That's right TWO BRITISH MEN!!!!! So let the swooning begin!!!! And oh yeah, Declan's leading lady is named Elizabeth Bennett. Jane Austen gave her readers Elizabeth Bennett and Mr. Darcy and now Ilsa Madden-Mills has given us Elizabeth Bennett and Declan Blay."She was my queen and I wanted to be her king. I wanted to sit at the throne of her body and love her forever, but it wasn't just sex, although that had been over the f&%#@ing moon. No, with us it was about two broken people who looked deep into the eyes of the other person and just-meshed. Call it fate or destiny or just plain old karma, but whatever it was, the moment I watched her dance in the rain, my heart had known, only it had taken my head a while to catch up."Right off the opening pages, I was emotionally hooked with Dirty English. Ilsa consumed me with such strong emotions for Elizabeth Bennett for what had happened to her in her senior year of high school. My heart ached and broke for her. Elizabeth learned the hard way that sometimes the people whom you thought you loved could have the power to destroy and break you. So fast forward to two years later, Elizabeth learned that the only way that she could control her life is to not let anyone have the power to destroy her emotionally, physically, and sexually. Elizabeth doesn't have many friends but she has two best friends that she allowed into her heart. Shelly and Blake are all aware of what had happened to Elizabeth and hopes that their friend can finally move on. And the first step in living life, they forced Elizabeth to attend her first college frat party where she meets not one hot Brit but two."And no matter what came our way, I was in this for real. If he wanted to use his fists, I'd stand in his corner and kiss him before he put his gloves on."When Declan Blay first laid his eyes on Elizabeth Bennett, it was game over for him. He felt the instant connection to her. Her brokenness spoke to him and there was nothing he wanted to do but help heal and piece back the shattered pieces of her heart. Declan Blay did not see a broken woman but a woman who held his heart hostage. He saw a beautiful woman inside and out, who just needed to fight through her emotional demons. Declan and Elizabeth's relationship stole my heart. It gripped me emotionally on how Declan was able to heal Elizabeth's heart. I love a book that can make you FEEL. And let me just say, Dirty English was brimming with such passion, intensity, raw emotions, tangible bonds, and a palpable love story that will leave you yearning and swooning for more Declan Blay. Can a scarred fighter heal a broken woman? There is only one way to find out... go read Dirty English and I promise you that you will not regret it.The writing and story-telling in Dirty English was well executed. Elizabeth's brokenness gripped my heart. I wanted to hug her and cheer her on as she learned to move on with her life. I have always been drawn to books with strong heroines and Ilsa Madden-Mills did an amazing job showcasing and highlighting a strong heroine, who has gone through hell and back. Elizabeth Bennett reminded readers that there is always hope, second chances, and new beginnings. Declan Blay may have been the fighter but Elizabeth was the true fighter in every sense of the word. She survived her demons. They say love hides behind every corner, and for Elizabeth Bennett love was literally next door. Dirty English was a great reminder that one should not be looking for someone who will solve all one's problems...but looking for someone who won't let you face them alone. So if you are looking for a book that will have you chanting THE BRITS ARE COMING!!!!! then I highly recommend you to read Dirty English.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

Erin Noelle continually spellbinds her readers with her newest release Transparent, the final conclusion of the Luminous Series. Ms. Noelle truly has outdone herself with this emotional consuming romantic suspense that had me intrigued right off the opening pages. I went into reading Transparent without really knowing that I had to read Translucent first but luckily for me, I was able to get a gist of where Erin left off in the last book but I do highly recommend that you read the first book because after I finished reading Transparent, I knew I had to read Translucent next in order to find out how steamy and sexy Madden is of course.Transparent was such an enticing gripping suspenseful read!!! Erin Noelle had me glued to my kindle as I await the fate of Blake and Madden's story. I was so absorbed with the many layers of suspense and intrigue that Ms. Noelle incorporated into the storyline. Each fiber of raw emotions and vulnerabilities were seeping through the pages allowing readers to be consumed with such strong passion, devotion, and sacrifices one must go through in order to fight for one's love. Transparent really captures your attention as you await the plot of revenge and chicanery in order to fulfill one's mission. I loved that Erin not only incorporated such craftiness into her storyline but she was able to pull in her readers to see a love that is not blurred or obscured. But a love that spoke volumes on sacrifices. A love that you are willing to fight and die for. I know readers will fall in love with Blake and Madden's story but Erin Noelle stole my heart with her secondary character, Raze. Raze's character instantly caught and held my attention throughout the book. The raw and tangible emotions that Raze evoked really made Transparent to stand out for me personally.I have not read many books from Erin Noelle but I can attest that Transparent is a book that was beautifully well written. Ms. Noelle did a phenomenal job integrating so many layers and elements into this story that there was never a dull moment. This book was an exceptional romantic suspense that was raw, passionate, deadly, and full of surprises. So if you are looking for a book that reminds us all that love enables you to see the one you loved in a way that nobody else can see. It sees everything; the good, the bad, the flaws, the in between, the strength, the weakness and yet you still choose to love that person then I highly recommend you to read Transparent because this is a love story that was able to find light in the shadows of the past.P.S.Erin- If you are reading this review, PLEASE PLEASE (see I had to put please in all CAPS) write that certain character we were chatting about a book!!!! You know how much I loved that character and if I must BEG then I will beg. Hahaha. ;)~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

I am huge Aleatha Romig fan ever since The Consequences Series. She has been one of those authors that I gravitate towards to ever since she made me fall in love with an unlikely hero in Tony Rawlings. Ms. Romig constantly surprises her readers with her wicked brain as she continually writes stories that pulls, shocks, and hooks readers like myself. Aleatha Romig is an evil genius!!! And in her newest release Betrayal, Ms. Romig delivered a book that has me begging and craving for more.Alexandria Collins is a recent Ivy-league college graduate and will soon be attending Columbia University for law school in the fall. Wanting a much needed escape and relaxation, her best friend and her are off vacationing at an exclusive resort. Alex wanted to reinvent herself and let go of all the pressures that her mother and stepfather expected her to do so she decides to be "Charli" for one week. What Alex didn't expect was to meet was a tall dark mysterious handsome man who invited her to his penthouse suite. So when Charli decides to live for the moment, she begins a one week hot and sensual affair with Nox. The rules were simple. One week. No last names. No past. No future.As Charli begins to spend time with Nox, he opens this new sensual, seductive and sexual side that Charli never before had experienced. So when their one week comes to an end, she decides to close that chapter of Charli and begin a new one as Alex Collins. When Alex is summoned to returned home to Savannah, she was stunned to hear what had become of her trust fund. Betrayed by her mother, Alex is stuck in a dilemma as she tries to figure out a way on how will she pay for her tuition and apartment in NYC. She is forced to call her cousin who lives in New York if she could stay with him a couple of days while she reassess her financial plans. While there her cousin informs her a way that she can make some money. How far will Alex go for survival?"Is it really cheating if you're doing it to yourself?"Betrayal was perfect title for this story. It was so fitting as to what the heroine Alex Collins had to do in order to survive. Though this book is not the typical dark romance that I have been accustomed to by Aleatha Romig, I will say that this book will shock you especially in the last couple of chapters. Of course, Aleatha wickedly will have you craving and begging for the next book because I need to know more... As always, the writing and storytelling was brilliantly done!!!! Betrayal was an amazing start to the Infidelity Series, which I forsee will be a dangerously addicting series. If Betrayal already hooked me with this first introduction to Charli and Nox, I can't wait to see what Aleatha Romig has in store for them in the next book.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

Monica Murphy..if you are reading this review, I am a bit sad to say goodbye to Shep, Gabe, and Tristan. Reading the last installment of The Rules is a bittersweet feeling but I am thrilled that Tristan Prescott is finally a taken man and is no longer the fifth wheel!!!Tristan Prescott never thought he would be the one tied down to one girl. He was the bad boy manwhore of the group. If you expected a relationship, I am sorry to inform you that Tristan doesn't do them at all. So when he meets a sassy and feisty blonde, he never thought she would make him chase her. Usually it was the ladies chasing after him but this time, Tristan Prescott had to do all the chasing in order to get Alexandria Asher's attention.Alex Asher is a former rich girl. When her parents lost all their money, Alex had to reinvent herself and started using her mother's maiden name as her last name. Supporting herself financially, Alex was forced to sell her designer belongings in order to make ends meet. The old Alex would be about glamour, fashion, and boys. But this new Alex is all about working and making enough money to support herself. And the new Alex knew she had to stay away from guys like Tristan. But as it turns out, Alex couldn't stay away from him. Tristan got under her skin. She was constantly finding herself thinking about him.As Tristan pursued Alex, he found himself wanting her in ways that he never thought possible. And the same would go for her. These two had such a strong magnetic pull for each other that it was inevitable. When they found themselves forming a relationship, the truth as to who Alex parents were angered Tristan since her parents played a part in the downfall in his family. Can Tristan forgive and forget? Or will his anger and resentment affect his shot at love?Slow Play was fun, sexy, steamy, and sweet!!! I loved it. Monica Murphy continues to spellbind her readers with this fun, fresh, and deliciously entertaining read. I loved how the author was able to showcase changes in Tristan's demeanor but still kept him as the lovable dirty-talking hero who can make our hearts flutter. Slow Play reminded me of a modern day Cinderella fairy tale. And so if you are looking for a book that will have give you all the warm fuzzy feeling and at the same time have you swooning then I definitely recommend you to read Slow Play and The Rules Series. Monica Murphy will not disappoint you with her witty dialogue and oh so steamy scenes!!!!~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

In life, we all have reached a breaking point. We can decide we can give up or we can learn how to stand up again in the face of adversary. It is the marking point or what we like to call the defining moment. And in Hard to Break by Bella Jewel, we are introduced to Quinn, a female mechanic who lives and breathes fixing cars. She took on the responsibility of running her family's mechanic shop when her father became alcoholic due to his severe depression of losing his wife. Quinn struggles to keep the shop afloat while helping her father. So when she falls through hard times, she didn't expect her garage to be bought by Tazen Watts, a sexy, famous custom car builder. Quinn can't stand Tazen and his arrogant personality but at the same time, she can't stop her attraction to him. So when she forces herself to annoy him at the garage, she didn't expect this sexual attraction to be revving with such sizzling chemistry. When sparks begins to fly between these two, will Tazen be able to show her how her beauty outshines everyone in a male dominated profession?Hard to Break is an easy simple straightforward story line with little angst that has your sweet happily ever after ending. I enjoyed the book but did not love it since I really just couldn't connect to the characters. It felt a little too insta-love for my taste but I do love that the heroine is a bad ass mechanic who can show the boys at the shop that she is knowledgeable when it comes to fixing cars. So if you are a fan of enemies to lovers trope with lots of love/hate banter, then I suggest you give Hard to Break a try.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

"I'd be inside your body. Your mind. Sometimes both."Ella Frank has always been on my list of authors that I MUST read and one-click. I have practically read all her books and always found myself devouring every book. When I first heard that she was releasing a new book titled Alasdair, I knew I had to read this book stat. In all honesty, I knew this book was going to be a paranormal/supernatural romance but I didn't know it was going to be an M/M vampire book. Well since Ella was the first author who popped my M/M cherry with TRY, I think it was fitting that she popped my first M/M paranormal erotic book."This man was all the things he shouldn't want, but as Alasdair continued to stroke his lip, all Leo could think about was him replacing that finger with his mouth."Alasdair was dangerously spellbinding and alluring!!! Ella takes her readers on a sexy bewitching journey of intrigue, suspense, and hot sensual erotic vampire love. When Alasdair meets Leo, a human, he couldn't understand the tangible and palpable bond that he had to him. There was something about Leo that made him want and need him. And as for Leo, he is well aware that Alasdair is dangerous but a part of him lust and craves him. Will this pull that Leo has for Alasdair be a deadly attraction that will alter the course of his life?Alasdair wouldn't be your typical paranormal romance book since I felt this wasn't quite a love story with your standard HEA. But I thought it was brilliant that Ella Frank wrote and told the book the way she did. She allowed readers to feel the palpable sexual tension and desire of the characters. Alasdair was a well executed paranormal book that had elements of lust, suspense, mystery, and forbidden desire that were integrated in the story. So if you are looking for a hot, sensual, steamy M/M paranormal book with sexy Greek vampires, then Alasdair is the book for you!!! I can't wait for book 2 and see what Ella Frank has in store for the other characters.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

**Note: This is not a standalone and must be read after Chasing the Dragon.**T.k. Leigh once again douses her readers with raw emotions, intrigue, suspense and romance in her newest release Slaying the Dragon, which happens to be the second and final installment to The Deception Duet. Slaying the Dragon picks off where it last left off and readers are left reeling with the hurt, pain, betrayal, and loss that Tyler Burnham inflicted on Mackenzie emotionally.When Mackenzie discovered the real reasoning as to why Tyler got close to her, she never accounted for the emotional mess that Tyler would inflict on her heart. Those weeks she spent with him was forever ingrained in her heart and something that memories couldn't erased. Her heart, body, and mind belonged to him emotionally and physically. She ached for him especially when he disappeared from her life for almost 4 months. Four months where she was questioning her sanity if Tyler was ever real. Was their love ever real? So when Tyler returns home, he tries to earn back Mackenzie's love and trust. And he will stop at nothing until he slays all the dragons that stands in their way."You're my heart. The air I breathe. My everything. I don't care what it takes to prove it was real. That it is real. Still. I will beg every day for the rest of my life to make you mine. You can tell me no every day for weeks, months, years. I don't care how long you want to hurt me, to tell me you never want to see me again. I deserve it."Since this book is the conclusion as to what will happen to Tyler and Mackenzie, I really don't want to say much and spoil the book for the readers. But I will just say this, T.K. Leigh will shatter your heart emotionally but slowly she will piece them back together. And as always, she never fails to deliver a suspenseful story that is full of shocking and surprising twist and turns. Slaying the Dragon was an emotionally gripping sexy suspense story that will tug all the heartstrings. So if you are looking for an edgy, sexy, steamy, and dangerously addicting suspenseful story, then I highly recommend you to read The Deception Duet series. As always, T.K. reminds us all that love isn't a fairytale. It isn't perfect. But love is about overcoming obstacles, fighting to be together, facing challenges and slaying the dragon together.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

Calling all Derek and Melissa fans... Tia Louise wrote a paranormal romance and revamped the retelling of ONE TO HOLD. In all honesty, I love anything that Tia writes. Her stories are always sexy, touching, and dangerously addicting. She has a way of sucking you in and wanting to take a bite of all her alpha male characters.One Immortal was sinfully bewitching and captivating. There is no other way to describe this book because right off the opening pages, Ms. Louise will entranced readers with one hot sexy meeting of Derek and Melissa. And let me tell you Ms. Louise will have you begging for more for those sexy and steamy moments. I swear Derek and Melissa's interaction in this book was HOTTER and SEXIER than before.When I think of New Orleans immediately I think of voodoo magic, witches, and the rich history the city has. And so, this is a perfect backdrop to set this modern spin of Melissa and Derek's story. Melissa is a vampire and she came to New Orleans to seek out answers and possible find a cure. Derek on the other hand is a vampire hunter, who works alongside with two shifters, Patrick and Stuart Knight. Derek is on the search to hunt down the Old One in New Orleans. So when Derek meets Melissa, he is easily bewitched by her beauty and the lure of the sexual attraction they have for each other. One taste of her and he wanted more. One taste of him and she was addicted. As Melissa and Derek further get entangled emotionally, physically, and sexually with each other, the secret of who she is begins to unfold. As Derek tries to saves Melissa in order to help her reclaim mortality, what danger awaits for these two?One Immortal was dangerously spellbinding. Tia Louise masterfully created a perfect blend of the supernatural and erotic romance. She hypnotizes her readers in the rich world of vampires, shifters, gypsies, psychic, and vampire hunters. I love this paranormal twist that Tia has woven with the added elements of romance, suspense, and mystery. As always, the writing was bewitching. All I can say, Tia Louise did a magically fabulous job with One Immortal. So if you are ready to fall in love with a sinfully hot vampire hunter, then this book is definitely for you!!!!~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

Pretend lovers turned real lovers!!!! Sold. I adored this sweet story, Pretend It's Love by Stefanie London. The premise of the story is two strangers who both needs each other's help and decides that they can work out an agreement. And the agreement is to be in a pretend "relationship." Paul needs Libby to be his "girlfriend" so his family can stop asking him when he's getting married. And Libby will use her girlfriend status to befriend Paul's brother's Des in order to help her with her vodka infused line. So what happens when these two realize that you can't pretend feelings?Pretend It's Love is a sweet and charming story that centers on romance and family. Ms. London was able to create and weave a fun filled love story with realistic characters who found unexpected love and happiness with each other. So if you are looking for a quick fun cute and sexy story, then I would definitely recommend Pretend It's Love because I can definitely say that there was no pretending about the chemistry that Paul and Libby had.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

What a fun and sweet read!!! Slow Burn was just the perfect sexy and sweet read to get lost in!! If you are a fan of second chances and taking risks then this book is for you. In Slow Burn, Ms. Cathryn Fox introduces two high school "friends" get their chance at love and romance. I use the term friends loosely since technically they weren't friends since the hero, Coop was best friends with Julia's twin sister, Mari. Fast forward to ten years later, Coop gets his second chance to finally admit to Julia that she has always been the girl on his mind. Julia always assumed that Coop only liked and wanted Mari and had blinders on when it came to her but as it turns out she was wrong. When Julia arrives at Coop's ranch, she didn't expect the same feelings she had for Coop ten years ago would be just as strong. As Coop and Julia begins to spend time with each other, feelings begins to intensify and it is up to Coop to make Julia see that she is the only person he wants. Will Julia be able to let Coop into her life?Slow Burn was the first book that I have read from this author and it surely won't be my last. I thoroughly enjoyed this quick, light, fun, and sweet read!!! This book was well-written and had lovable characters. So if you are looking for a quick romance escape then I highly recommend Slow Burn by Cathryn Fox!!! There is nothing like a hot sexy cowboy and attorney to heat up those e-readers.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

Regrets...let's face it, we all have one whether we like it or not. In life, we make mistakes and it is up to us to learn and grow from them and to never repeat them. And when it comes to the matters of the heart, the regrets and the what ifs are something that can never be fully forgotten. Love can be a defining moment in one's life. It can be refreshing, hopeful, beautiful, poignant and yet heartbreaking. And when our chance at love is lost, it can be so devastating and life-altering that it can put into perspective of the people who really matters in your life. If we really reflect on our choices, there comes a time where you can't blame someone for walking away if you didn't do anything to make them stay. And in Desperate Chances by A. Meredith Walters, we are reminded that life is about choices. The choice to fight for one's love, the choice to forgive, and the choice to walk away."Because every single minute of every single day that I wasn't with you was wasted time."Gracie Cook wholeheartedly was in love with her best friend, Mitch Abrams. All it took was one night for her to ruin everything. Sex with Mitch changed the course of their friendship. Mitch has always been in love with Gracie. He thought the one night that they shared was magical and a turning point in their relationship. He saw it as the time they both finally gave each other their hearts but when Mitch woke up the next morning, his Gracie was gone.When Gracie walked away from Mitch, she was at a stage in her life where she was trying to get her life in order. She was a recovering alcoholic who had just came back from rehab and also trying to conquer her eating disorder. At that time in her life, she was afraid of ruining everything with Mitch and it took her a year to really see that she loved him. For one year, Gracie distanced herself from her friends because she was trying so hard to avoid Mitch since she ruined her chance at love."I see all of you, G. Even the parts you try to hide."Mitch was devastated when Gracie walked out on him a year ago. He tried so hard to put Gracie behind but he never really could because she was the only one who ignited passion, desire, lust, and love. She was everything to him. She was his home, his life, and best friend. So when she walked away from him, it angered him. He wanted to hate her but couldn't. When Gracie's friends tells her that she needs to talk to Mitch and tell him how she really feels about him, she faces one of the biggest challenge in her life...to put her heart on the line. Will Mitch find it in his heart to let Gracie back in? Can Gracie grab that one desperate chance to get her second chance at love?Desperate Chances was one of those reads that gripped your heart from the opening pages. It was such a beautiful, poignant, touching, heartbreaking, and compassionate tale on love, healing, and second chances. In this emotionally charged book, A. Meredith Walters did an amazing job showcasing all facets of friendship, love, heartbreak, regret, healing, and second chances. I loved how Ms. Walters stripped Gracie and Mitch's characters to be so vulnerable and flawed allowing readers like myself to understand and relate to their emotional battle. Their struggle with their friendship was written so raw and poignant that it tore my heart to see two people who love each other so much hurting. But in true A. Meredith Walters form, the author was able to break our hearts and yet heal them as she reminds us all that love shouldn't be a secret. If you love someone, tell them. You will always regret it if you don't. So if you are looking for a book that is brimming with emotions and palpable chemistry, then I highly recommend you to read Desperate Chances.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

Ahhh....the Capital Confession Series comes to an end and it's such a bittersweet feeling to say goodbye to this series after I've been so wrapped up with the scandals, gossips, politics, family drama, romance, and unexpected surprises. In the third and final book, Falling for Danger, Chanel Cleeton reunites her readers with one final thrilling, surprising, and romantic suspense that will have readers on the edge of their seats.In Playing with Trouble, we all learned what happened to Kate Reynolds and why she distanced herself from her parents. The Reynolds family is no stranger to having their family name blasted through the gossip blog, Capital Confession and so Kate uses that to her advantage when she decides that she is willing to discover what happened to her fiancee, Matt. For four years, Kate mourned for his death in Afghanistan when his team were killed in action. She has never been able to truly moved on and when papers were sent to Kate showcasing that her father and Matt's father were possibly involved in the military attack, Kate will stop at nothing to bring down her father and the corrupt men who destroyed her life.As Kate delves deeper into cover-ups, her life is put at risk when danger begins to threaten her safety and well-being. When Kate is targeted, she never imagined who would come to her rescue. Matt. For four years, Matt kept the secret that he was alive and didn't die in the ambush. Together Matt and Kate must work together to discover if their parents were involved in the murder of young military men. In order for Kate to find the evidence that she needs, she must keep her enemies closer and that means she has to have a little reunion with her parents. While working together, Matt tries to keep Kate away because he doesn't want to taint her life with his PTSD. Matt has always been the one in her heart and so she won't allow Matt to push her away and she will do anything to show him that she will be there for him. Will Kate's love slowly heal the broken pieces of Matt? And what danger awaits for Kate as she discovers the truth?Chanel Cleeton ended this series with a BANG!!!! Falling for Danger was filled with so many unexpected surprises, twist of events, suspense and danger. If I thought the first two books of the series was scandalous, Falling for Danger took it to another level as we really see how corrupt on some politicians are in Washington DC. But as always, Ms. Cleeton does a perfectly job in orchestrating and interweaving suspense and romance in such an addicting way!!! So if you are ready to fall and get addicted to a series where scandal, gossip, fourberie, and tangible romance are intricately weaved to produce a beautiful provocative and deliciously scandalicious series then look no further than the Capital Confession Series.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

A sexy romantic suspense thriller that will have you on the edge of your seats!! In this 9th installment of The Tracer Series, Laura Griffin hooks her readers once again in her newest release, Shadow Falls.Shadow Falls is a hair-raising and riveting suspense thriller that will have you gasping and holding onto your breath as you delve deep as FBI Special Agent Tara Rushing tries to solve a case of grisly homicides. When Tara is assigned to the homicide of a female politician, she immerses herself fully to the case trying to find the killer. Soon Tara and her partner, MJ finds similarities with their homicide case that are closely related to other Jane Doe murders. All Jane Doe cases shows signs that a serial killer is on the lose and targeting unsuspecting females. As Tara investigates further, she realizes that her deceased politician was a client to a former ex-Marine, Liam Wolfe, who now runs a private security firm.In order to catch the killer, she finds herself getting close to Liam Wolfe. She uses his expertise in military knowledge as he teaches her how to track down the killer. As they continue to get close, they soon find themselves developing feels for one another. As Tara gets closer to finding the killer, she soon finds herself doubting her trust with Liam when another body turns up. Evidence points that these homicides are happening near the vicinity of Liam's private security training campground. The pressure is on Tara and her partner MJ to find the serial killer before another grisly murder occurs. Tara must now decide if Liam worthy of her trust.Shadow Fall was just perfection!!! Laura Griffin did an amazing job with the sexy suspenseful thriller. The writing was phenomenal and engaging!!! This book had it all from romance, suspense and mystery. Reading this book was like watching a movie or crime TV show unfold before your eyes. If you are fans of those CSI and FBI shows, then this book is for you. I loved that Ms. Griffin made this book so thrilling and had readers like myself glued to the pages. So if you are looking for a sexy, suspenseful nail-biting thriller that will have you on the edge of your seats as you await the identity of the serial killer then Shadow Fall is the book for you!!! A real pager turner and must read!!!!~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

"I'm going to give this everything I've got, Margaret. I promise you will never regret inviting me into your heart."A heartwarming, sweet, and sexy read that will have you Crazy About Cameron!!! So sit back, grab a glass of wine, and prepare to fall head over heels with the sweet and charming Cameron Winslow. Crazy About Cameron is a story of two childhood friends who are crazy about each other but never had the right timing in expressing their feelings about one another. Well, when they finally were at a place in their life, they finally couldn't just sit back any longer and watch their chance at love to slip away. So can Cameron and Margaret make their relationship work even though they have family expectations to live up to? Is their crazy love for each other enough?Crazy About Cameron is definitely your feel good love story that had a case of minor drama inserted into the story line. The story was well-written that flowed at a great pace. What I enjoy about this book was that this book could be read as a standalone since the author wrote it in a way that the story solely focused on Cameron and Margaret. So if you are looking for a book that reminds us all to take a chance on life and love then Crazy About Cameron is the book for you.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

Scandal. Sex. Lies. Drama. Secrets.... Ahhh...the perfect elements to brew a rising storm. And in this small town called Storm, trouble, scandal, death, temptations, deceit, and lust begins to cause a fury as this small town must prepare itself for impact of this deadly storm that may cause a wave of destruction. When Ginny Moreno returns home for the summer, she didn't expect that her arrival to cause a destruction.The Tempest Rising by Julie Kenner reads like a daytime soap-opera. So if you have ever watched All My Children, One Life to Live, or The Days of Our Lives and found yourself getting sucked into the character's drama, then The Tempest Rising is the book for you. In this small town of Storm, the chaos of destruction is crazy. You have adultery, political scandal, pregnancy, secrets, and so much more.... If the first installment was just a taste of what is to come, I can't wait to see what awaits in the next installment.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Page

" You taste like sin"Altered Allies by Tara Sue Me was really a short sweet yet seductively sexy read. A successful sexy computer geek and a hired nurse for his grandma was all it took for sparks of desire, lust, and passion to be ignited. In this book, readers will get a glimpse of a woman whose inhibitions get lost as her employer awakens a sexual desire in her to submit. So if you are looking for a quick sensual read, then Altered Allies is the book for you.On the side note, I can't wait to read Obscured. Just reading the sneak peak chapters, I am so intrigued and can't wait for this sexy, dark erotic, romantic suspense thriller.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

Mari Hart is a 21 year old naive virgin who certifiable genius. She is 21 years and already has two doctorates. Accomplished academically, she has it all but she is lacking in a social life. Mari doesn't have friends and doesn't know how to interact with the opposite sex. Tired of being inexperienced, Mari decides for one night that she will let loose and have sun fun. Well at least try to have fun and do what normal 21 years do. When Mari attends one of the hottest new nightclubs in Florida, she didn't expect to witness two homicides. Her night of being reckless lands Mari to be targeted by the Greek mafia. As Mari tries to escape, she finds herself getting help with one hot Greek billionaire, Alexi Kosta and all of sudden married to him.The relationship of Alexi and Mari was an insta lust and love which I found didn't work with this book since the author should of showed readers more interactions with them. And I wanted Alexi and Mari to really get to know each other instead of them professing their love. And I honestly thought the story of John and Sylvia piqued my interest more than Mari and Alexi. Overall, if you are looking for a quick read with a Greek billionaire and a genius socially-awkward heroine then this book is for you.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

I think everyone has experienced getting a wrong text from an unknown number but for May Wexler, she thinks the text is from her sister since they have been exchanging text messages that has been filled with auto-correct mishaps. So when May receives a text message that she is assumes from her sister to meet at a bar, she finds herself in a shootout and is rescued by Ozzie. Chaos ensues and soon May finds herself thrown into a mix when Ozzie hires her to be part of his security team, Bourbon Street Boys as a photographer. As May learns the ropes of her new job, she soon finds herself being drawn to Ozzie. With May being new to the team, will she find herself in danger when complications arises that threatens her safety?Wrong Number, Right Guy by Elle Casey was one of those reads that I wished the author focused on more the Ozzie and May's relationship since I wanted more from these two. I wanted more of a romantic connection as to why these two were professing their love to each other. Other than that, this book was an easy, light romance with humor and suspense integrated into the story line.~Michelle of Four Chicks Flipping Pages

I really have loved Sabrina's past stepbrother books.This one there was many things I enjoyed and many things I didn't.I liked the flashbacks to a point, I felt it helped connect the characters and their feelings and thoughts. But on another note, I felt there was TOO many flashbacks and it took away from the story as well. Does that make sense? it helped and hurt it, I felt. And I would of liked more interactions and things going on. I felt just a sexual connection between them. Nothing much more. Towards the end I started to feel more for them. But at the end was when it started getting good and then the epilogue. Wish that would of been in the story and more on that. It had lots of potential, but fell pretty flat for me. I will continue to read her books though, GREAT writing, very hot characters and scenes. This one just didn't do it for me like prick, Tool, etc. But worth a try. Someone out there may love it. It wasn't horrible. But wasn't as great as past books from this author."You are mine, Addy. It's a fact. But when I mark you as mine, you'll f****** know it."" But I guess that's why light exists- to illuminate the dark places"

I was given a ARC in exchange for my honest review.Well what can I say? Manwhore+1 was the best in the series so far and probably one of my most favorites by Katy. It was hot, intense, beautiful. Every moment I enjoyed so much. We watch Rachel fight for Saint and we watch Saint fall completely in love with Rachel and chase the moon for her. The lengths he goes to for her is heartwarming. We watch him faceoff with his father and it's fun to read. To see the many different sides of Malcolm Saint. I can't give much more away about this installment, but let me promise you that you will NOT be disappointed. It was the best in the series and I cannot wait for Manwhore 2.5! <3 :-)May I add that Malcolm Saint is the best thing since sliced bread. He is the very reason I enjoy reading. well done, Katy."I'll take this fire any day over the ice I live in.""You're the only heaven I will ever know, Rachel""and if you were a hell, I'd sin my whole life just to stay with you."

I was given a arc in exchange for my honest review.So, we finally got more Sloane and Zeth! WOOWHOOOO!!! :-D and Callie did not disappoint! I loved every single epic second. Zeth is going through the motions and change is a happening with him. I love watching him go through these emotions and feelings. The fruit. PRICELESS. Sloane love as always. The whole Mason thing was really interesting and added to the excitement and a new King Pin is in the picture. Trying to "persuade" Zeth into taking up his offer. But Zeth has left that life behind. But what happens when he threatens Zeth's entire existence? Sloane. Will he take him up on his offer? what is agent Lowell doing back and where will this go?I cannot wait to read the next installment! and you guys will NOT be disappointed with this! promise :-)

I  was given a ARC in exchange for my honest review.Ava has done it again. This series keeps getting better and better. Xander and Penny realize they want to be in a REAL relationship, so they give that a go. Then things start to get messy. They're going to have some obstacles to overcome and the ending. Ava LOVES cliffhangers and this was not exception! cannot wait for the next installment! :-)

I was given a ARC in exchange for my honest review.I have been DYING for this book. It sounds AMAZING! and Michelle did not disappoint. The concept alone is captivating and intriguing. A hot rock star who is fed up with his life and goes missing. What could be better?Well that said rock star shows up in a small town in a trailer park. Looking for a new start and a place to crash for a while. get his thoughts together. And he meets the new owner, Iris. He instantly feels a connection to the sweet country girl. But he realizes he must pull back, he doesn't want to get into something he can't finish. So he acts like a douche for most of the time. Until Iris comes into some trouble. But she soon shows Ace that she can handle her own and take care of herself. Not only is she sweet, but she is sassy and fierce. I LOVED Iris, she didn't take any crap and she gave it back. As do most of Michelle's lead female roles. One reason I love her books and characters. The pair start growing closer and she soon realizes his secret he has been keeping. But what happens when the media starts to catch on? what happens when Wicked White needs their front man back? you will have to read to find out :-)But it was amazing, perfect, beautiful. I loved every single second and I truly hope for more! I think everyone will love this story as much as I do :-)"My bounty is as boundless as the sea. My love as deep. The more I give to thee, the more I have, for both are infinite."

I honestly don't know what people expected with this book? a new book?Because it IS FSoG just from Christian's pov. So not sure why everyone is so upset over this. We asked for it, for years. Erika delivered. And we got MANY new scenes that we did NOT get to witness in Ana's pov. His interactions with her, his deepest thoughts, his dreams, fears, his relationships with his staff, family, co-workers, etc. We got to see many things we never from the original. So, no idea why people are not pleased with this?Yes, some stuff was repetitive, dragged out, yes, I found Christian sounding rather British. But I choked this up to his love for British literature, and what not. Do I remember him being that way in the original? not really? but it's been a while since I read the original. There was some stuff that I didn't love. His inner monologue at times was annoying and over the top. But who cares? overall I thought it was well done and I truly enjoyed it. And Christian. I enjoyed it more than Ana's pov actually. We got exactly what we have all been asking for. And I want more. The ending. His realization. I NEED book 2 and 3 from Christian's pov. Especially since book 2 was my favorite. I truly hope Ms. James gives us those other books. The one thing I enjoyed the most and found VERY refreshing was Christian actually has a sense of humor. I really enjoyed Grey and I hope there is more. Well done and THANK YOU Erika, you cannot please everyone.But, pleased me you have :-) be proud of this story!"I wake, with a start." "Today, I win her back."

Quite simply the best series ever. Zeth is the best ever.It has everything you need in a story and more.Callie delivers, she's created a unique and beautiful story that will captivate you from page one and not let you go until the very end of the series. Even at the end, you're left wanting more. I promise you will love this entire series, and for 99 cents, who can go wrong!? <3

Again, Ava does not disappoint. She NAILED this new, amazing story. I LOVE the concept of the pretend boyfriend. I have never read a pretend boyfriend. Just a pretend girlfriend story. And I LOVED every single second. It was HOT, Xander is hot and he will give Jacob a run for his money. And he made me swoon, I just love him and soo excited to see where the story goes. And I hope Penny's sister face plants into her wedding cake. What a major beotch she is. But she brings the drama for sure. Cannot wait to see what they know about Xander in the second part. A must read series for sure!"You're mine, and I'm yours."

Been looking forward to Rory and Houstons book.I wanted to see where it would all go after Rory read the letter. And it went to hell and back. I felt bad for Rory, my heart broke for her. But her leaving with Liam on a whim really bugged me, I have always had an uneasy feeling about Liam and it seems it was true. I think Rory being gone was good for her in a way. I think Hannah was good for her. Liam,however, was not good for her. And I hope she never goes back to him. Houston I liked a lot better this book. I actually really started to like him and all he was willing to do for Rory and to get her back. And Kenny, well who doesn't love Kenny? he's the best.All in all the story was much better than the first book in my opinion. I enjoyed it and even though I felt it dragged at some parts, it was a enlightening, touching story that I think many could relate to on a level and that many will enjoy. I would for sure recommend this story to others and I'm excited and nervous to see where the last book goes. I just want everyone to find their happy :-)"No matter what your destination is, there's no safer road than the one you take with someone you love."

I can't stand Ash.I couldn't take the whole moving in after a week of stalking her.I gave up.The first was my favorite. Jace's was EEEEHHHH. Not great at all, this was...ugh.May be for others, you may like it. Gabe will always be my favorite, but this.. I just had to stop. Could be for someone else though.Can I have another Gabe book? le sigh.

I was given a arc in exchange for my honest review.I really can't give much away. You will want to read the finally installment for yourself and find out what happens and if Theo and Cassie have their happily ever after.But I can tell you this, you will NOT be disappointed. This was the BEST in the series. Best writing, best everything. And Justine, unlike MANY authors does not drag stuff out the entire book. And if you have read the books you will know what I am talking about. So that is a TINY spoiler. But this was beautiful from start to finish. It was a fairy tale and I loved every single second. I never wanted it to end and my heart breaks that it's over. The epilogue was perfect, but I will always want more. As I'm sure many of you will also. So if you loved the Lane One series, you will love this breathtaking addition to the series. I highly recommend every single person out there read this series!"I'm starting to. I'm willing to believe in anything that allows me an eternity with you."

I was intrigued by Jace and Ash in Gabes book and couldn't wait to read it. It started off very well and I loved how they hooked up and the plot line that she was homeless and had not such a wonderful life. I really enjoyed the first half of the book and then it started dragging for me and I started really not liking Jace. He seemed to be a douche, hypocrite, et cetera. He really started grinding my gears. I loved that this series has had REAL aspects of a dominant and submissive relationship. But Jace pushed it for me. And Bethany, I really loved her in the first half of the book also. My favorite moment with her was when she let loose, took control, and she of course was drunk. I felt that Jace was truly bad for Bethany, I dunno. I really didn't love their story and it went downhill for me. The ending felt rushed and I was feeling like I am missing something. Not sure. The first book was the best so far and I LOVED Gabe. He is my new man, way better than Christian or Gideon. That book was a 10 star, this, well, not sure about this one. I feel a bit let down and I feel like Jace should of been better, maybe I seen something in Rush that I didn't actually see. Maybe this one just wasn't my cup of tea, mot sure the reason. It wasn't horrible, but was NOT great either. I will give Ash's book a read because I am curious, as was I with Jace. To see what happens and see what happens to him. And of course, more Mia and Gabe! love those two. Now those two I could read about FOREVER! I would recommend the series though, others may love it.  It's worth a try."The truth is I want you in any way I can have you. The truth is if you told me right now that you could never submit to me, never give me what I want so badly from you, that it wouldn't matter. I'd take you any way I could have you. The truth is I'm not letting you go.""You'll never be lost,baby. Never again. I'll always find you. No matter where you go, I'll always be there to bring you home."

My boss talked me into reading the series. I have seen these books out there, but I felt it was too soon after Gideon and Christian. Felt like it would be similar. And in many ways it was. But Gabe was 100 times better than Gideon or Christian. He is my new favorite billionaire. Sexy and suave. I loved every single second of this book and I'm on to Jaces story now. I think everyone should give Rush a try. Promise, you will LOVE IT!"Not love you?I'd slay dragons and lay them at your feet. I adore you.""I've waited just as long for you, Mia. Maybe I didn't always know what I was missing, but it was you. Always you."

Have you ever a read a book that was so terrible it was good?Well this would be it for me. It had HUGE potential to be more than was it was, had it been worked and twerked. But I feel if this is some of the authors starting work, it is pretty decent for a first go. I have read stories very similar to this. But I didn't get the ripped off vibe. I really did not like her mother at all, she was a horrible woman. Her roommate was a little...hmmm...odd? creepy? not sure. Haha. She and this story was something else. It was a little far fetched and many scenes I was like that would NEVER happen. And a doctor would NEVER do or say these things. And Shantelle was totally out to left field hahaha. Naive, too trusting, etc. But again, it's fiction and that makes for a story. It was pretty hot though. And by the end I was wanting more and I actually hope there is more haha. Kinda left off on a cliffy and I kinda wanna know more? For 99 cents it was worth it. It wasn't great, wasn't horrible. It was worth 99 cents and for the 20 minute read. I would read more and recommend it for s***s and giggles.

I was given a ARC in exchange for my honest review.I LOVE Christina's stories so very much. Each story is beautiful and unique. You do not have had to read the previous books in the series to get it. But reading the previous ones so you have an idea of the characters personalities and what not is always good.Dakota and Shane had a relationship years ago and they ended it for many reasons.Fast forward to the future when Dakota's father passes and Shane wants to be there for Dakota. The story was humorous, sweet, touching, made you sad and happy. And there was some mystery as to what was going on in the casino and all of that stuff. It kept you in suspense a little and wondering WHAT IS GOING ON!!?!?!Dakota is a strong girl. But she does not want to let her father down. Will she live in his shadow or break out on her own? can Shane break down all those walls and insecurities? do the two have a chance at a happy life? you will have to read to find out :-)But promise, just like ALL of Christina's books, you will NOT be disappointed :-)Great addition to this amazing series!

I have very few words for this story.All I will say is...It. Was. AMAZING! and one of the funniest books I have ever read. I could not put it down once I started. A real page turner. Sometimes you get tired of the touchy feel books. The feel good and typical book. The everything is too perfect book. I loved every single moment of this enthralling story. I only wish there was more and hope there will be more Violet and Alex and even Buck and Sunny. Would HIGHLY recommend this book and looking forward to reading more Helena!"No one gets that much money for sucking, not even extremely skilled prostitutes.""The ridiculousness right here"- I kiss her- "is why I want to spend the rest of my life with you.""I'm so glad you fought for me. You're the best chance I've taken."

REALLY, really wanted to love Rock Solid. I have loved all of Rileys previous stories. And I was excited for something new and fresh. But I feel a tiny bit let down. Maybe I was expecting too much? maybe I'm holding her previous characters on too high of a pedestal? I'm not sure. But something feel off with the story, the characters and the connection. I loved the plot between it. Trevor being an addict. Simon being a surgeon and with the tragedy that happened to his hand, he may never be able to perform surgeries again. The concept was great and promising. I just did not feel like Simon was gay. I knew he was bi, but I just didn't get the connection for him as much as I got it for Trev. Trev was great. In some parts the story felt overly rushed and then some parts I felt like there wasn't enough. I felt like the two were really great friends and not too much more. At about 80-90% it started to change for me and I felt the connection more. And then I was really getting into it and loved the last 10-20% of the book. There is a major twist that I didn't see coming and I was in shock and that changed the story around for me. I started to feel more and love more. Some of the intimate scenes I felt were rushed also and didn't feel a strong connection or bond there. Although they were hot, just didn't do it for me. Overall the story was pretty good, the characters were pretty decent. Didn't LOVE Simon. The guy has some issues, but he grew on me more towards the end and once he admitted his feelings and actually showed he gave a damn about Trevor. I hope there is more or even a Blake story. I would and will continue to read and give everything Riley has, a try. It wasn't my favorite. But it wasn't horrible by any means and I'm sure others will love it. But I would still recommend this story to everyone."You think you took my life from me, too, but you didn't.. you gave me one."

Trust was breath taking.Every word touches your senses. I simply did not want it to end. Couldn't put it down once I picked it up. There was highs, lows and memorable moments. Many obstacles and challenges to over come this time around. Family. Ex lovers. Tragedies.  Things that can happen to any one of us at any given time. Tate and Logan must learn to trust one another and their decisions. And that in the end, they will always make their way back to each other.So much happens in this book. This is all I can pretty much say without giving anything away. But I promise you this. Ella does NOT disappoint. Trust was perfect and beautiful and I truly hope for more Logan and Tate. I never want these two to end and I want nothing but the best for all our beloved characters."But stop avoiding the issue and talk to me. Tell me what you want to do with your life so I can be a part of it.""Thanks for the biology lesson,smarta**, but you never talk about your family, so I was starting to imagine maybe you just arrived on Earth all perfect and s***.""Stop giving your brother s*** and tell him to relax. I just bought him a caramel muffin.""What'd you buy me?""I'm gonna buy you a muzzle if you don't watch it."These two crack me up :-)"So I'm daring you.Wake up and tell me that you were right. That you're the best thing that has ever happened to me.""I happen to love the way your crankshaft works. Your piston sliding through my cylinder."

I was given a ARC in exchange for my honest review.Lex does it again.This was as beautiful and touching as the others before it. I loved every single, sweet, moment. Maddie is a sweet, funny, charming reporter. Who one day happens to catch her boyfriend cheating. She heads for the hills. To her friend. Who happens to live next to the next big NFL star. She soon learns that she will be covering him on the news. The two get friendly and fast. The two start in a secret romance. But their romance has many obstacles. The risk of losing her job,the risk of things getting out that they don't want to be, jealous ex's, trust and commitment issues, and much, much more. You will have to read to see how Daren and Maddie's story ends? but if you have read the other stories, I'm sure you possibly have an inkling on how it ends. It was perfection and I know everyone will love it as much as I did. I picked it up and could not put it down. Did not want it to end ever. I love this series and these characters <3

The last installment was wonderful. Alicia made me laugh on many an occasion. The b**** is hilarious. I only felt like she needs to have redemption. She needs to change and give a crap about her children. Try to find some way to make up for being a horrible mother. I hope maybe in another book to come she will do this. Cole, I was proud of and hope one day he has his own book. Jacob and Leila were amazing as always. I love these guys and never want their stories to end. And of course I am DYING FOR A WHITMORE BABYYYY!!!!! PLEASE!!! LOL!!!! Very proud of Jacob also. From the start of his entire series to now. The person he has become. Very impressed and proud. Same with Leila. She is a strong woman. It ended very well. I just am very greedy and want more."The one good thing that's come out of all of this is that she finally considers you a Whitmore. Congratulations! Welcome to a family filled with kidnappers, would be murderers. and sociopaths. "  ( best.line.ever! HA )

I was given a ARC in exchange for my honest review.This is unlike anything Kandi has written in the past. So for that I would love to applaude her for writing something totally differen't and not like her normal romance stories. Proud of her for stepping out of the box.That being said, I did not love nor hate this story. It was in the middle for me. It wasn't that there was anything necessarily wrong with the story, I just found it hard to get into, hard to follow for me. And it didn't grab my attention and COMMAND I read this NOW. It could be in the start I was a bit confused with the poker stuff and the fraternity stuff. I know absolutely nothing about either and I found it hard to pick up or keep me interested. So, that is the reason I do not love and would probably not read it again. The story all on it's own was fine. Kandi writes beautifully. There was a really good story going on there with Kip and what was going on. The characters were pretty amazing, Skyler at times I got a little annoyed with, but over all I enjoyed her. And Kip, WOW. SMOKING is all I have to say. Really enjoyed him. The story is intriguing and sometimes catches you off balance with things that happens. Always a welcoming surprise. The book made me laugh on numerous occasions, so that is ALWAYS a HUGE bonus. Has drama, angst, HOTNESS, everything you could want to read. I would give this book a recommendation for sure. It was wonderful in it's own way. It just wasn't my cup of tea, per se. I will continue to read anything Kandi writes and eagerly wait for her next hit :-)Love doesnt play our games because love is a completely different game in and of itself. And in the game of love, when all the chips are on the table, no one emerges unscarred. No one. But sometimes our scars are the most beautiful story tellers.

So here we are. The moment we have been waiting for.I truly knew in my heart Jacob would never kill his brother. Leila would never forgive him. And he loves her.So, I'm glad he made the right choice. I'm glad the two seem to be working at things and that Leila finally told him about what happened and that without Cole, she may not be alive. The story was short and sweet and of course, HOT. Because Jacob Whitmore IS HOT! sigh. I love that man. And at the end was hot and then Cole walks in and...awkward...hahaha. Poor guy. And then Cole asks the ultimate favor from Jacob. To help the woman who nearly killed his wife.AND BOOM! another cliffy.Love it.Love this series.What will Jacob do? will he help Cole or will he bring Brittany to her knees?Cannot wait for the next installment.Must read series :-)"For better or for worse,"

I was given a arc in exchange for my honest review.I have been waiting for this book for what feels like forever. After how it left, I needed to know how it ended. I have been dying to read it. And sadly, I was disappointed in many ways. I can't really say much more, because there is so much that can give stuff away. And you guys need to make that up for yourselves. The story itself was very good. Intriguing. Many twists and turns and unexpected who did its and all that. It was a very cool story and very good twists. I just felt like a lot of certain relationships were forced, didn't feel right and in the end I guess I was just happy that everyone was happy. I didn't love it, didn't hate it. I was just sad and disappointed. That could of been of because who I felt should of been the winner and the better person. But it is a book and everyone will make their own conclusions and teams and happy endings. Just like Team Jacob and Team Edward haha. Although I didn't love it or was let down, I highly suggest everyone read this series. The story is great and the writing is phenomenal as always. And I'm sure everyone can find something to love about the Archer brothers :-)Enjoy!

I was given a arc in exchange for my honest review.We pick up where we left off and it starts off with a WOW :-)Cassie is at the church where she has always felt at home and is volunteering with her friend Matt. Theo see's this and butts in. He as always does not disappoint and is amusing and hilarious. Book two they both struggle with their relationship. I was given a arc in exchange for my honest review.I have no words. I finished this book in 5 hours. Could NOT put it down once I started and I was NOT disappointed at all. This was an AMAZING read. Totally worth the 99 cents and worth way more. Have been eagerly awaiting a new book by Jenn and she did not disappoint. I was given a arc in exchange for my honest review.Well where to start?Manwhore was everything I expected times a million.Katy does not disappoint AGAIN!This woman can do no wrong and write no wrong!It deserves more stars and praise than I can give.Manwhore was captivating from page one. Seriously LOVE this series and it did not disappoint. We meet Reese, a man who is hot and has power. But the two have secrets, especially Kennedy. Loved, loved, loved Shaken, Not Stirred. I have read every book in this series and loved every single one. This one may of been my favorite though. This was a really sweet and fun read. Linden and Steph are best friends and they are tired of dating losers. They secretly carry torches for the other and Linden makes a pact when they turn 30, if the other isn't in a serious relationship, they will marry. We get a look over the next 5 years of the people they date and how their relationship becomes more HOT and intense. When 30 rolls around they both give into temptation while playing truth or dare while friends. They keep it secret and their other best friend finds out and guilts Linden outta staying away from Steph, ruining his chance for being happy. So can they overcome this obstacle or are they doomed to walk the earth alone and without love? you will have to read to find out!I simply loved this book. A great weekend read. Hope there is a another to see where their life is taken them and the other characters in the book."But really, you're my everything. And there's nothing that will change  that."
AMAZING series! I love the FireNine boys. Roy is probably my most favorite though. Worth the 99 cents! you get FOUR amazing stories. PROMISE, you will NOT be disappointed!
Got here in a great time. Great price! can't find these where I live in Canada.And its bigger and more adorable than looks or thought would be. My daughter loves her baby Tiger! thank you :-)

This vacuum is lightweight compared to some larger models, but heavier than I would expect for a vacuum named the Ultra light weight. The good thing is that for its size, the vacuum has great pick-up and did a good job cleaning both carpeting and area rugs. The smaller size is easy to maneuver, transport to various areas of the house, and easier to store than larger models. The pet attachment worked well to remove cat hair from our rugs. The dust cup is described as being easy to empty and it is, so that is a benefit.Black and Decker is a brand I trust, and I have had good results from other products they make, so I expect the vacuum will be as durable as it looks. I have had no issues so far. Although not a heavy-duty model, the vacuum works well for routine clean-up.

Archie and Wolfes latest case involves five main suspects who have been accused of making threatening calls against an arrogant, abrasive gossip columnist for the New York Gazette. When the columnist is found dead in his apartment by his young protg, Wolfe is hired to investigate. Archie and Wolfe work their usual magic to solve the case, with the conclusion announced dramatically at a gathering of all the suspects and interested parties in Wolfes office, as expected in a Nero Wolfe mystery.I am so pleased that Robert Goldsborough has continued the Nero Wolfe series. Each new book brings back fond memories of reading books in the original series by Rex Stout, as well as enjoyment of reading a great mystery. Wolfe is a brilliant detective and his right-hand man, Archie Goodwin, is one of my all-time favorite characters, so Im always thrilled to get the chance to read new books spotlighting Archies charm and wit. Goldsborough captures the essence of the characters perfectly, as well the interactions between Archie and Wolfe.  Im pleased that Archies longtime girlfriend Lily Rowan also makes an appearance in the book. I love her character and love her and Archie together.The case at the heart of this story is interesting. I enjoyed the interviews with all of the suspects, each which are on record as despising the victim and had a motive for the murder. The case turns out to be more complex than it appears and I loved the twist at the end and was pleased to be completely surprised by the results of Wolfes investigation. Stop the Presses! was a quick, enjoyable read and fans of Wolfe and classic mysteries will enjoy reading about this latest case.

California zookeeper Theodora Bentley gets a rare opportunity to travel to Iceland. She is sent to pick up a polar bear cub for a new exhibit at the Gunn Zoo. Soon Teddy is helping police detective Thorvaald Haraldsson with her murder investigation and has to be careful that she doesnt become the next victim.The Puffin of Death has the excellent writing readers expect from author Betty Webb, but is lighter in tone than her Lena Jones series. The book has the perfect mixture of a fun-to-read cozy with intelligent writing and interesting characters with whom you enjoy spending time. Another positive is the book provides the reader with a unique Iceland setting, without the darkness of a typical Scandinavian mystery. I liked learning about Icelandic customs and language, while being entertained by a top-rate murder mystery.Since Simon Parr, the murder victim, heads up a bird-watching club, the story includes a lot information about the birds the various characters see. Bird-lovers will enjoy these details, while others may think it slows the action of the book. I enjoyed most of the information, but sometimes the plot did seem to slow, but that was only partially due to the birds. In spite of some slow spots,I received this book from NetGalley, through the courtesy of Poisoned Pen Press in exchange for an honest review.

I am a fan of Robin Burcells suspense novels, so I was intrigued when I saw this new book by Burcell. This time, Burcell has written a police procedural based on a series by Carolyn Weston, on which the television series, The Streets of San Francisco was based. I hadnt read any of Westons books and I have only a vague memory of some of the old television episodes starring a young Michael Douglas. Burcell says she has merged some aspects of the original books with the television show and I think the result is a success! I really enjoyed this book which pairs veteran detective Sgt. Al Krug with the younger Casey Kellog, who is eager to put what he studied in school into practice. The two work very differently, but are ultimately a good fit. They each learn to be more flexible in their crime-solving methods and bring out the best in each other.The characters are appealing and the procedural elements are both believable and interesting. Descriptions and dialogue in which Krug and Kellog are on the job make excellent reading. On the other hand, while it is tied into the novels main plot, Kellogs love life isnt as interesting to read about, partially because one of his potential love interests wasnt that likeable. I was eager to find out how things turned out in the case, which had plenty of twists and turns to keep the reader guessing about the solution. I enjoyed the rapport between Krug and Kellog and hope Burcell keeps this wonderful series going.I received this book from NetGalley, through the courtesy of Brash Books. The book was provided to me in exchange for an honest review.

This series by Shelley Freydont is charming and has such a clever premise. The town of Celebration Bay, New York really enjoys each holiday that comes up all throughout the year. Liv Montgomery, whose job it is to organize all of the various festivities, seems to spend her free time solving murders on the side.Trick or Deceit is set during Halloween and I enjoyed reading about all of the events, such as a haunted house competition, in Celebration Bay. I like Liv, with all of her energy and plans for the town, along with her enigmatic assistant Ted. I love the idea of celebrating each and every holiday with gusto the way they do in this festive town. This installment started out slow and it took a while for me to get into the story, even though Ive read and enjoyed each of the prior books in this series. My affection for the characters got me through and I wanted to keep reading to discover the identity the actual murderer out of the various suspects Liv investigated. Because of the slower pace of this book, I would give it 3.5 stars, but because I enjoy the characters and this series so much, I have rounded up to four stars. I am looking forward to the next book and hope it has the spark and excitement of the earlier books.

Deputy Mattie Cobb, along with a German Shepard named Robo, make up the first K-9 unit in Timber Creek, Colorado. Mattie is assigned to a disturbing case when a young girl is murdered and left in the mountains. Mattie is driven to solve the case to prevent further violence, but also to prove herself as a police officer and as someone worthy to be Robos partner. Mattie is kind and caring, but somewhat prickly. Its fun to see her gain the respect of local veterinarian Cole Walker and no-nonsense detective Stella LoSassio because of her dedication to her job, to Robo, and to doing the right thing. My favorite parts of the book were seeing how well Mattie connected with Robo and with a couple of children who are key to the story, as well as the parts of the investigation when she and Stella worked together.This is a well-written book and the author uses simple, straight-forward language to tell the story. Readers who enjoy M.L. Rowland, Jessica Speart, or early books by Nevada Barr will enjoy this book. I think there is a lot of potential in this series and would enjoy reading further books about Mattie and Robo, and hopefully Stella.

This is an attractive, stylish diver-style watch with a gold face and a black leather band. It doesn't look too flashy, but it does have a very large face. It is definitely sturdy and feels heavy on your wrist. The larger face would appeal to teens and younger men and is a nice-looking casual watch.It has a second hand, tachymeter, small 24-hour dial, along with small dials for the date and day of the week. It does glow, somewhat, in the dark, but it's hard to tell time without other light.On a side-note, this watch is packaged in one of the largest, heaviest watch boxes I've ever seen! There is a yellow cardboard outer box and then an imitation leather, hinged box that holds the watch. It would make a nice presentation for a gift.

Robbie Jordan has just moved to South Lick, Indiana, and with the help of her no-nonsense Aunt Adele, she opens a country store/caf. She works so hard preparing for the grand opening and is devastated when a murder throws a damper on the festivities and her fledgling business. Now its up to Robbie to find the killer to make sure her business and her new life in Indiana isnt over before it starts.I enjoyed this cozy mystery and there is enough uniqueness in Robbies character and her circumstances to make the premise of the main character settling into a small town to open a business fresh. Robbies personal situation gave added interest, although the fact that her family kept secrets to begin with, as well as how easily Robbie figured everything out, seems a little hard to believe, but it does set up an interesting situation which could play out in a future book.Some of the side characters could have been developed more as a few were easy to mix up. Even the characters who stood out, such as Robbies friend Phil, needed more background information about them shared. I liked Phil and Robbies young assistant Danna, and others on the surface, but wish there had been more details that brought the characters to life a little more. A cozy wouldnt be a cozy without a potential love interest for the main character and happily Robbie has two, so things could get really interesting in future books.I think Flipped for Murder is a promising start to a new cozy series with a likeable, down-to-earth heroine and an interesting Midwest setting and I would enjoy seeing how Robbie continues to make a new life for herself in the small town of South Lick, Indiana.I received this book from NetGalley, through the courtesy of Kensington in exchange for an honest review.

This assortment of safety glasses covers all conditions you will run into, clear for inside, tinted for sunlight, and amber for overcast days. They are good quality and fit and do not fall off like others I have used. These do not seem to scratch as easily like others I have used. A good value.

Got these the other day and they are fun to play. they come as a pair with 8 bean bags (blue and red) and are easy to set up and use. They are well made and mate together for easy storage of the bean bags, and for transportation. In all these are a nice, portable set of bag toss boards.

The Bosch drill and driver set comes with metal, masonry, and wood bits, phillips, straight bits along with some hex and torx head bits in the set. The bits are secured in the case with soft rubber blocks that also identify the size and type of bit. All of this comes in a handy carry case that keeps it all together securely. In all, this is a very nice set for the price.

I am very pleased with these earrings. They look nice and have an attractive shiny, gold finish. The round portion of the earrings is a little larger than a quarter. They are large enough to stand out, even with long hair, but are surprisingly lightweight. The clasps seem well made and easy to open and close. They are comfortable, but secure, when wearing.These earrings are perfect for treating yourself, but would also make a nice gift.
