It is actually an 880 MAh. I contacted the retailer and gave the the chance to change the description before writing this review. They would not refund my money and obviously have not changed the description. They only offered me a couple dollars back.Move along,  This is not the battery you are looking for!

I was careful to read the reviews to ensure i got what i was after, this is in fact a Bluetooth speaker and not a iDevice docking station.That said, we have have all been blown away by it.The touch pads on the ears are not only cute but seem to work well, and the remote also is great controlling not only the volume but the device to change tracks and so on.Looking at it you see these two little speakers int he ears and you right away thing "well its a cheap toy for the kids". This couldn't be farther from the truth. These two ear tweeters are small but handle the mids and highs well, what you miss at first glance is that it leaves the rest of the device to act as a huge woofer box. This device is loud, clear and delivers solid tones from the low bass hits to high vocals. In a living room it will easily provide quality sound for the whole room on part with what you would expect from a 2.1 receiver setup.Dont underestimate this cute kitty, its portable, loud, and well worth the price.

I got this cable for use with a portable battery.The idea was to have a have a iPhone, this cord and a portable batter inside a Sealed Waterproof Bag. This was a gift for my daughter for when she went to the pool or beach, she used it multiple times in this setup and overall it worked out very well.

I am the owner of at least 10 different types of external battery packs, ranging from 1,850mAh to this behemoth 18,000mAh pack. For the most part they all work well and do what they are supposed to, they are just batteries after all.The Limeade Blast really sets itself apart in a few ways that make it worth checking out.1.) The exterior is a really nice design and material, soft/tacky to the touch and very clean design.2.) The Auto-On is a great feature for many that don't really realize it. The simplest use case would be:Get this battery, stash it in a pocket in your backpack with a cable or 2 and just have a quick 'on the go' way to recharge. Most battery packs, once you plug-in your device, you have to then find the pack and push a button to turn it on. The auto-on allows it to function just like a wall outlet, but say in your backpack. (first world problems, i know right?) just think if you are on the train, or something, charger hanging out.. you are pulling your device out every so often to check a mail or text. You just plug it in, no digging for the pack to start the charge.3.) The LED flashlight is a nice touch, the pack itself is a bit large and heavy for this to be a primary feature, but its nice to know its there if you need it, and to be fair, it actually works decent.4.) Capacity, this is kind of an obvious one. While this thing sure can take a while to charge, it really lasts. Using the backpack example (#2 above) you can really just leave it in there and forget about it. It will charge most phones 5-10 times over before needing to be charged itself. It can even pump a full charge into a tablet/iPad, and with the 2.1A output it will do so at the normal wall outlet speed. The only note here is that this device is not exactly lite, but to be fair, its friggin 18,000mAh.. its really good for its capacity. Trust me i have of these to compare.5.) This device has 2 Outputs, one 1.0A for most small electronics, phones, headphones, etc. and a larger 2.1A output to allow normal full speed charging of larger devices like tablets, iPads and some newer larger battery phones like the GS4. With the capacity of this battery you can use both without a concern. If you are not sure which one to use, look at the original charger for your device, the plug will state 1.0A or 2.0/2.1A and then you will know.6.) Extras, the included 2-in-1 cable works good. its a bit cheap feeling, but its the ONLY part that even kind of feels cheap. Being a secondary item that is really just a free add-on, i didn't really care. The quality of the actual battery pack more than makes up for it. There is also a very slick case for the Limeade, is worth checking out, another great design.7.) The price point really comes in good, especially now with it on sale, but even overall. Compare for yourself and you will see that this is a great product at a great price.As a Kickstarter investor, i think its also worth of making a note about the company itself. Not only did Limeade build the product they advertise, they did so exactly as laid out. Timelines and deliverables were met, expectations exceeded and the Limeade blast is one of the select few projects who exceeding delivery expectations and timelines.. something like 80-90% of all kickstarter projects come in late. To me this shows that they really have it together, and i would continue to invest in their projects.

As an early user of this light it's amazing to see the amount of light that is produced out of something so flat or thin. It sits at the side of my bed all the time. It's perfect to get the light I need where I need it. The light is emitted very directionally. It will not light up the whole room but will light up what you point it at very well. The built design of the initial batch wasn't perfect amid have some minor concerns over the longevity of the battery flap, but still a good product. We will see how it goes long term

When I first received my Ideafolio the first think I noticed was the extremely high quality of the build materials. After you get past that you will quickly find out its more that a pretty folio.The combination of built in white boards and notepads, three rings and plastic sleeves allow this folio to cover any business you throw at it. Great for meetings, requirements gathering, technical troubleshooting, and brainstorming.Due the the amount of stuff you can store in the Ideafolio,it's a bit larger than most, but was still able to travel fine to and from meetings with it in my bag or backpack.Highly recommended.

As an avid player of every iteration of SimCity i found the always online, server based requirements of this version appauling. The intention of the game is great but way to many aspects were no where near ready for launch. I can only hope it can get better with future versions of the game.

One of the better small WiFi Dongles for the Raspberry PiIt also has a nice blue LED on it to show when its connected and working, other dongles i have tried dont always have a light. This helps if you leave your Pi powered up for long periods of time. Personally a quick look at the top shelf of my closet and if i see the LED i know its ok.CompatibilityI have setup the WiPi with both Wheezy ([...] and Adafruit's Occidentalis ([...]). Occidentalis is im personal favor, but both come with the right drivers and everything ready for this, and other dongles like it to work.I have found that this WiFi dont does not seem to support AP mode which is required if you want to set up your Raspberry pi tyo run as a wireless access point or to try and run it as a wireless TOR router. If this is your intention, then you will need to check out another dongle. Adafruit sells one with their OnionPi kit that you can buy separate that will work properly.PowerThis is actually the most important part. Most WiFi dongles actually need to be plugged into a USB hub in order to word due to the Pi's really low USB power output. The WiPi is actually designed, and does work very well directly connected. In my case, i run my Pi headless and access it over the WiFi network so this part was important to me. you should be able to get a USB Keyboard and the WiPi working together but it may be real tight on power.If you want a WiFi dongle that you know will just work and not cause any power resource issues, this is the one to go with.

Through her personal experiences, the author gives us a broad knowledge of the othersde that love continues and our soul continues.  what I particularly like about this book is the experiences are raw and innocent, of her early discovery of her experiences and trying to find the vocabulary as well as finding out she has a unique gift.  I can relate as I have a gift and it is hard to realize why you don't fit in and no one else gets it.  The whole book is about her learning and discovery, very readable.  For those who are new to mediumship, grieving, this book really will help to alleviate the loss, and learning that our energy lives on and our loved ones are THAT close to our world. Loved her recount, and whilst I am very familiar with the material, I found the recount very refreshing, and humbling.

great economized footprint for our space!  We are a big fan of the Brita brand and have owned a number of filter pitchers over the years.  We currently own the 10 Cup filter, which is the same design as this one.  As with all brita brands, the filter is a one-that-fits all, so very transferable and you are wasting your inventory.Love this filter in the one key improvements: the lid does not flip off [otherwise you have to hold it down when pouring] when you pour.  It it thinner than the 10-C filter, and hence has a smaller footprint on our kitchen counter.  we use the filter water for our making seltzer water at home.

We own an ironging board/iron that is connected such that the water is held in the ironging borad, and the iron produces so much steam that ironing is a breeze.  So how does the new Black and Decker compare in terms of its claim to more STEAM production?The iron has 3 level of steam settings, and i used the maximum level:  still did not produce enough for me and I had to use the button on top of the iron to pump out more steam.  there is also a button for water jet too.  The extra umpf helped. but rather a bother to use to expedite the ironing process.  Also that uses the water in the iron ratehr fast too.Whether you have a mnaule dial or a digital button to move the temperature: I am indifferent.The iron is heavy without the water, and after using an iron where the water is held elsewhere, it was harder to use.  Compared with other B&D's irons we have also used in the past, I am not convinced that this one provided more steam, and with the added weight, I am not sure it was an easier ironing expereince.  I still rate the B&D brand as top of the pile, and would still buy one.

First time reading anything from this author, and I am very impressed.  The subtleness of the plot was unique, and whilst you are drawn into the politics of Zimbabwe and South Africa , you are also learning about the power behind the election process; the world powers view of let us not rock the boat even though doing the right thing should be for the good of the people.I loved the characters and the complicity they played in the plot, and to say the least, everyone is not what they seem to be on the surface, and then all is explained!  Sometimes the power does not lie in the title that you have, but in the information you have and how you can use it!  Build your own super powers!  Loved it.  Well written, nothing dragged and the story moved very smoothly.  Whilst some violence was necessary as we are talking about the atrocities that has plagued that part of the world, it was not over the top to make a point.  I love when there is some history behind the fiction, as I would not have known about many of what the people in that part of the world faces: beautiful,  very enjoyable read, and I look forward to the next novel.

Whimsical, delightful, a tabloid fiction of what could have been between Truman and the wealthy elite of New York.  I loved that the story had references to news of the time, the fashion, and the culture so splendidly retold that I thought I was there in person, I could smell the dirt in the street or the deep leather of fancy living room.  The author was so clever with her words, and I was the fly on the wall, and sensing all the human emotions that even money couldn't eliminate; nope,  money can't buy you love and can't remove your insecurity.  Women on those plat forms where pedigree is everything and brain/smarts count for nothing.  Bravo, loved it.

Love the style of this watch.  It was working out of the box as there was a small plastic that was placed in the Crown that u have to pull off for the watch to run.  Simple to change the time, with an inner second dial.  Have good heavy feel, not flimsy lightness.  The quality of the watch feels good for the price point.  Very beautiful face and lovely links, which was fairly easy to adjust with a watch kit.  I am ordinarily a big fan of Kate spade and fossil, now this is a new brand than I will follow.

Saved!  made a whole world of difference having correction in swimming goggles!  maybe psychological, but i can see!  although not perfect in that it is not my exact measurement, but the correction is 85% and I am super happy with them.  The fit well, no fogging as a result, and  I can see so much more whilst  I am practicing: adds a few degree of confidence when you are in the pool.  I have only tried them in the swimming pool, but can't wait to try them in the sea/beach fun.  for the price, super happy.

this is all the craze right now - in packing your salad in a mason jar!  i love the design in that there is a separate salad container, but wished it was bigger!  otherwise, i have tried with salad, cheese/chicken, that I may make along with the evening's supper. then stored overnight in fridge: then take to work for lunch.  the salad leaved [if fresh to start with] remained crisp and did not wilt overnight.  add the salad, shake it op and I have a meal.  this is how we have gotten most use out of this jar - make another salad meal to go.i can't see myself using it for making a mean, maybe for a picnic.

fabulously light to carry, easy to dismantle and put together.  we took it to the park and it was perfect to carry at least 160b weight.  more comfortable than sitting on the hard ground, and we were there for over 2 hours and noticed little discomfort.  for the price it is terrific.  storing them away takes up so little space too.,  love tit.

i like kate spade's design, and the wrist band can be adjusted.  the only annoying thing, but big is that the battery arrived dead, and whilst I have changed batteries before, the damn back will not go back in easily.  otherwise, I would like to say this is a nice watch with a large face without the bulk or loosing the feminine touch.

beautifully executed and for the price both at MP3 and CD versions.  As an adult student, it is fabulous to get this great collection to work through as part enjoyment and technical training, as good as BACH for student..s and the sonatas are so beautiful with all the trills and speed.  not easy, but nice short pieces to work on with the metronome.  Compared with other recordings there was only one other I was considering, as execution was important for me.

The watch is pretty on its own or with a combo of the two bangles.  the color rose is actually a very pretty medal alternative to silver or gold.  the watch actually worked on arrival [past eperiences with watches that the batteries are often dead and have to be replaced before you can even us it!].  in fact the time was set correctly for our time zone!  all three items have simple extension bands that you can manually remove a few links if you need a tighter fit.  there is no need for any watch tools to remove the links.  if you like a delicate small face watch this is defiantely an option and Ann Klein often have simple and yet nice designs.  nice to have the options to combine many of the different bangles and watch together.also excellent as a gift, as i was impressed with the presentation box, as many modern brands come with poor presention option if you wanted to gift a watch.  [fossil: poor; kate spade: good]

we have a Oster Blender with the sports bottle look.  I prefer the power behind this blender as there are four blades as to two blades.  there is also more power behind this blender, as much as it is very easy to use.  it comes with a lid that I prefer as I can carry it to work, as oppose to 'drink as you do', and I wished it came with two closed lids as there are two jars that come with this blender.We use it to blend forzen berries for smoothies, and it does a great job.  definately more ummph.

very beautiful locks, although unless you have done this before, I recommend you go to a music store and get someone to help you.it is mainly about the looks, which the design of them are 'clean and modern'.  Worked well as you would expect and we love the quality.

surprisingly, the slim line and cut were pretty good, and the material was solid, not thin at all.  The only negative is that the waist line sits low and a little tight about the crotch that from the back, the material pulls in and up.  hmm, not attractive.  if the bottom area was a little looser or a little more material then this would be a super pair of khaki.

Perfect medium, still got room.  We love these gloves for potting work, polishing, waxing, and I even use it for oil painting, and art work!  They are comfortable to wear long long stretches of time without that sweaty feeling.  Still provide enough grip with paint brushes and plant cutter.

we tested thecharger using sunlight we get from our building [south facing windows) and I got less than one blinking lights!  I am not sure there is a place in our neck of the woods that has 18 hours of sunlight, as advertized!?  hmm, the solar panels work, but how useful when in a prolonged power out situation.  I guess some charge for cells is better than nothing at all.  In terms of charging from the mains, the device took over 4.5 hours.  once charged we were impressed how quickly and efficently it charged our tablets/cell phones.  for the fully charged battery we were able to charge, fully, two cell phones [iphone and android] and one tablet, and 30% of an ipad!  The charge time was fast as off the wall charging.retention of energy was good, very very slow drain when not being used actively.  hence this is great if you are off the grid for a day or two - like airport + travel.very compact in size and easy carry in any backpack/handbag.  fairly light too,

Strength of the tissues is good, compared with the Cotton brand we use.  Also very soft at the same time as it is strong.  We like the compact packaging without the core.  It is the way forward for all tissues.  Look forward to this design with paper towels too.

Cool and refreshing to apply, and with some gentle rub in, there were not residues or stickiness left on my face.  We are in a humid and hot summer season, and whilst I sweated and wiped some of the cream off my face, face still stayed moist.  Even under full air conditioning, my face did not dry up as it often does.  Definitely, apply a little as the creme does spread in nicely.  Very light cucumber fragrance, touch of air freshness.  Lovely!

A british based MI6 agent, Hawker, super mode, working with international support from the US, and yes, the Russians are back.  What makes this novel very interetsing, there are Russian characters with names of real people, and it made me fully absorbed.  The author pulls you in with personal aspects of Alex Hawke, nd you fall in love with this Lordship title, and yet, here he is an action figure with money, and brains.  There are many sub-stories rolling within this novel that makes it an interesting story and plot.  You still dont know how it ends until the last few pages!  There is action, there are multi plots, loyalty, suspense, comedy and sassy moments.  I loved the multi dimensional aspects to this story, and look forward to some more Hawke

For sure Tumi is a great brand and it is known for its durability and quality.  The design  and material used for this new light luggage bag do not disappoint who is looking for quality.  Compared with Delsey, a brand we have, for this size, the storage is comparable but unlike the Delsey, the Tumi does not expand to accommodate another inch of depth.  We have noticed a design inefficiency where theyhave hinged the zipping flap in the middle of the suitcase, rather at one end.  What this means you have to keep flipping the flap back and forth when you are packing.  Otherise, tsa locks and the wheels move nicely for easy maneuvering.  One star deduction for the few bits we noticed when you compared with many similar and  lower end priced luggage.  If you love Tumi, you are just gonna love this new addition. We just took it one its first maiden plane journey, no scratches on the body.

These muscle pads have come a long way.  We bought this to work on tired and tight muslces.  I get a lot of tension on my upper back, and although I have regular massage sessions, I needed something inbetween.  These pads were what I needed. It has 6 programs:1. Exercise prep (12 min)2. Endurance  (20 min)3. Strengthening  (20min)4. To 6 three recoveries from 20 to 30 minutesAside fromantic the programs, there is th e intensity strength that is separate for each apd, which was great as one tighter set of muscles can be worked on more than the other.  Actually it took up to level 40 for me to feel the pulse!  So it can be that gentle.  I used the 30 minutes recovery for my upper back, and I noticed slightly looser back!The premise of this apparatus is based on 'pulses' and the frequency of these pulses.  We didn't find the pulses uncomfortable at all, which I was afraid that it might over twitch ..very comfortable.  Easy to set up and to use.  Hmm, nice little relaxation after work.

this apparatus is not for those who hates to work on their core muscles and wants to loose some inches without doing the real exercise,.  I am one such person.  The premise of the apparatus is to work on your base muscles and to strengthen it along with the other core exercies.  any lost of belly fat is incidental!  I have used another brand that claims to build muscles, but if you are that keep you would use the old fashion method,  I am sure this will end up beign a gimmick for me.  The vibrations work through a series of intensity and it is intiially uncomfortable to get use to, and if you have never used anything like this, dont be too ambitious and work with a lower settign for the first week or so, before increasiong the intensity.  if you are like me who is prone to motion sickness, you may want to stay on the low intensity and do some housework to take your mind off it.compared with an older model, i like that the vibration pack is separately attached to the band, which makes it easy to wash, as you do generate a sweat around your tummy area.  the band will fot 50 inch waist line comfortably.  i dont know why the batteries compartment is such a funcky shape as it was nto easy to slot in batteries nuimber 2 and 3.it comes with 3 AAA batteries, but I will switch to rechargeable as this can get very expensive along with the gel pad replacements.  I will try some of the life extension recommended in the other posts.  to get any resultsm, you really have to stick with the recommended program, and like me- it is tough to remind myself.  I think this apparatus needs to be used along with a proper exercise regiment and calorie controlled diet.  seriously, I am not looking for miracles.Not recommended if you have weak ab muscles - ie hernia or plannign to get pregnant.  or is pregnant.

Compared with a $230 down filled sleeping bag is synthetic does not pack down as small.  Other than that key pointer, this synthetic is just as awesome in that it has ample room inside to do a 360 turn  inside easily (reference: 165lb, 5 ft 6 inch), inner zip too for adjusting the zip without extending the hand outside, has a bottom zip if you want aeration at the bottom, velcro at top to seal you in, and the pillow hood is huge!  Great material, comes with a stuff bag.  We wouldnot put this into a backpack, but rather attach it outside as it does not compact small enough. The stuff bag is not waterproof.

Holly molly, my first experience with this author, not his first novel, but what a ride.  Less about the codex, more about secret ops, fbi, police and whole lot of comrady, trust, violent hisotry, very up to date scenario of terrorism and effects on our world, and in society as we know it.  What a brilliant plot, a tion, twists, and yes, I could figure out who to trust.  Written with a lot of wit too, Karen Vail's wit is dispersed throughout the story, and had be lol, and then pulled through the action.  A thoroughly great read, and now I am gonna read the Karen Vail series....

For the price, we were super suprised by the softness, and the warmth of the comforter compared with many expensive duck feather filled comforters we own!  Decent queen size and fits into our duvet covers nicely.We washed it before we used it  using warm water, the filling did not displaced itself much and that was a good thing.if you were going to rate like a sleeping bag then it would be a 50, i would not use it during the super cold NE winter!

fabulous porch light!  i love it that it is wireless, okay batteries.  non-the-less, dismantling the light from its sleeve and putting in the batteries are very easy.  the detection is good and picked up movement from about 6feet away from the light.  The LED effect lighting is  good, and you can read under it with no eye strain.  with batteries, the whole light is not very heavy.The light is mounted on a sleeve and locks in with a down facinghook. the sleeve is secured on the wall via one inch nails.D4 batteries do not come with the light and you will need 4 of them.

yeah, they do not last as long as duracell, but these are as good as other brands we have used.  It last as long as the amazon rechargeable batteries,  and we are trying these for the 'green' and safer ingredients, which we can all do to help the planet.  price point is not that much cheaper, but in the long run, there are just a few other benefits that we can't quantify.  great batteries that we are using with our outdoor lights, and remotes.
l;ove love love this little pruner for my flowers and cuttings.  sharp and light and just great for those little plant trimming jobs.  do not use for hard wood or rose bushes.

finally we found a sink strainer/plug for our kitchen sink that works perfectly!  i love that the strainer can be reversed to clean out all the bits easily and allows the water to drain.  Does not slip into hold water mode on its own, which other ones just annoyed me to hell when it did that.  A lot easier to clean which is another plus for me.

this was a very big [2 person] flask!  i love hot teas in hot and cold weather so hot tea was the test.  the heat survived 5 hours of travelling and I still enjoyed my cuppa.  Did it stay boiling hot as if I had made the tea minutes ago - no, but it was pretty warm-hot.  Large enough to hold good and hearty vegetable soup as well, which I look forward to have for lunch.  the cup helps and sueful.  Such a throw back design, and a great thermos!

i am big thriller-mystery fan, and an avid reader of such stories. James Rollins come to mind.  Did I get engaged with Joe Rush and his life - i did and I am hooked,  the story line was very pausible, and I loved the twists .. who do you trus?, it certainly kept me guessing and doubting everyone.  There some background information and history of the location, which I always like as that puts some reality into plot and fiction telling, and a little bit of liberty taken by the author is fine by me.  I love the under dog that comes out right in the end, after coming through after many harsh obstacles; and that egotistic bosses dont win the day!  I would read another Joe Rush novel, and I liked it was not over the top, engaging, but would like more background material would be great.

very easy to use, and we did not print the labels - we just used a marker pen.  great for labelling kitchen containers, plastic boxes for all the various wirings.  We have a lot of electronic wirings and often have to sieve through the boxes; now there is a simple labelling sytem, and cheaper than a label maker, which is what we ordinarily use for labelling.  Love Avery brand in making filing a bit more efficent.

We took some pics in the park: one normal lense, one wide angle and one 2x..All  crystal clear still.  We can see that th evasion is super locked down and with rubber attached to the lenses, it would be easy to change lenses on a wet day, but not submerged in water.  There is thin hard case for the phone, that can doublemup as hard case for the phone before placing it into the waterproof case.  Once in the case, you don't loose any of the functionalities, excep you have to swipe harder on the screen.  Love that the lenses come in their own protective soft pouch.  Lenses are not bad, even if just basic.

loove this brand, and I use it for both indoor and outside with the window boxes.  Mainly flower plants and i don't need to add food for the growing season until the end of the flowering season, and then of the next season,  I remove some older soil and mix in some fresh soil.  I have been using this brand for years, in as far as it being organic, that is a personal choice, the results are the same.  the 4qtr is a great site bag for 2 window boxes or 3 large planters with at least 7.5 inch diameter.

boil egg snobs will love this little egg cup .. pricy but hell it is worth it as it as it really holds an egg!  and provides just enough coverage that when i break open the open there is no spillage of the precious yolk.. even works on the large duck eggs - such creamy yolk.

expresso does taste better with a ceramic cup than a paper cup!  our work just introduced an expresso machine and we use the disposable paper cups .. and for a little price and being green too!  the heat in the coffee is retained here and does sharper!  hard to believe until you try it.  love the brand and color.  thanks for offering a one cup version as it was all i needed.

love love love Dyson, very light to hold with one hand, and so handy for those little jobs where I really don't want to pull out the other dyson vacuum cleaner!  also there are hard to reach places like the window sills and blinds where a little versatile suction beast like this one really helps.  two speeds sand we usually use the lower speed for most of the chores around the house.  charging is easy and less than a few hours for a full charge.
love the quality and that it is a bit thick as it cushions my feet all day whether for walking or running.  love this brand too.

fantastic value and great for those you sometimes forget to water as the soil retains the moisture very well.  Great for plants and flowering plants.  I mix it with some perlite to provide aeration for the roots - about a cup for every 6 cups of soil - rough guide.
The whole season was edgy and funny, and love th drama.
Looooooove this show. Funny, and yet the details of the time were impeccable

For an UNLOCKED phone, the price is unbeatable.  I am an android phone person, and hence compared with Samsung there are a few shortfalls: the sound is a little 'tiney' on bass and not as sharp; the pixel is not as colorful and sharp but decent and hence does have an dampening effect on the photos regardless of how good the camera might be.  The speed of loading up ebooks were adequate and depends on your wifi and plan.I love the large screen and reading is so much easier.  the apps are easy to load and there are not many pre-loaded apps. The phone also came with a clear and thin plastic gel case, which i found to be more than adequate.  Great android phone, does the job,

So delicate and true to nature, I was blown away by the delicate fragrance, and how lucidly familiar to the original!  Nothing cheap or chemical and that surprised me.  The wick burnt slowly and the fragrance was not over powering at all.  A beautiful presentation and well worth the price.  Bravo.

The WEMO Link and WEMO OSRAM Bulbs are my first entry into the world of home automation. Setting up the WEMO Link took a bit of trial and error. WEMO only supports 2.4GHz 802.11n. If you have a 5GHz network you are out of luck. Hopefully you have a Dual Band WiFi Router that supports both 2.4GHz and 5GHz networks.Connecting to the WEMO Link (I used an iPhone but this works with Android as well). Plug in the WEMO Link somewhere central in your home or apartment. Wait a couple of minutes for the unit to boot itself up. Go to the WiFI settings on your iOS/Android device. You should see a new WiFi network called WEMO.xxxx.xxx. Connect to this network. Once connected, launch the WEMO App (which you should have previously downloaded from the Apple App store or the Google Play store. It will automatically start setting up the WEMO Link device. It will ask you which WiFi network it should join. Choose your 2.4GHz network. You will be prompted for the security password. Once entered it will connect the WEMO Link to your WiFi.Activating the Bulbs. For best results I set these up one at a time. Screw in one light bulb and turn on the lamp. Wait a few minutes and then launch the WEMO App. The App should detect the new Bulb and ask you to give it a name (like Bulb 1). Save your changes and you should now be able to control the Bulb from the WEMO App. Continue through the above steps for as many bulbs you may have purchasedUnfortunately the WEMO Link is not supported by Amazon's ECHO device. I think there is a way around that by using the If This Then That (IFTTT) website.Once you have the bulbs all talking to the WEMO App you can group them together (this is helpful if they are all in one lamp).I was disappointed about the no Amazon ECHO support (as I have one) so I went ahead and purchased a couple of WEMO Insight Switches. These are supported by Amazon ECHO. The setup is exactly the same as the WEMO Link device.Now that it is connected to the Amazon ECHO I can say "Alexa, turn on theliving roomlights".  Poof, the living room lights come on.WEMO Link is also accessible from outside your home if you enable the Remote Access Feature from within the App.If you want to get started with a bit of Home Automation, WEMO seems to be a good start.

I love this book, nothing fancy, no glossy pics, you are paying for information and information is what you get.  It starts with the basics, as if it is the first time you are learning about this subject.  The health benefits, for kids, what each fruit/vegetable's benefits, vitamins, equipment you need..and loads of easy and good recipes.  And a list of the top ten antioxidants.  I love this easy to read and reference book.

Elegant it is and heavy too, just a note to make sure the suction pad is tight before hanging the squeegee.  It hung best against the glass shower door, not so much on the wall.  Besides its sleek look it functions pretty awesomely with its long length to cover a wide area and the rubber worked well to pull the moisture off the surface.  A good squeegee
Very delicate in design..thin metal. The size is adequate, and looks very pretty.  Not chunky at all.  Love it.  Nice light gold color.  Not gaudy at all.

Zips and compact mens galore.  It took a wee moment  to figure out all the zips and compartments.  All compartments are well thought out.the main  compartment has ample space for some serious 3 to 4 days of light clothings.  Second main compartment is for lap tops and pencils etc.  Two side pockets that I will find handy for an umbrella. The straps for the backpack can be hidden away behind a zipped section, very helpful if u check in this  backpack.  Yes,there is a little backpack that you can zip off and use for holding monies and travel documents.  Very well thought through and very comfortable and padded shoulder straps.  Size will work for overhead too.  Material appears string with good and strong stitching.

Three pulses: clean, sensitive and massage.  Because of the small toothbrush the clean vibration is quite intense, so I prefer the sensitive mode. The massage mode provideo intermittent pulses that I use for the back molars.  There is s second button that switches between the three difference cleaning modes.  The tooth brush itself is very thin and design is elegant compared with my own bulkier design.  I really like it, and love that it comes in its own slim travel case.  Each box comes with a spare toothbrush head.

I must be in denial, as I thought I am a medium..but it was a little loose at the tummy end, and it was very comfortable and gave me some hold at the tummy end.  I think this would fit someone who is ordinarily a large, and comfortable for a medium too.  I wore it on one of those sticky and humid days in the north east, and I remained very comfortable throughout the whole day.  Material is strong and appears to be good quality.

I was afraid pulling the lashes on and off, no pain!  Also nice you can trim the ends shorter to fit your eyes.  Not messy to use the adhesive, and did take a few tries to get get it right.  The qualitybof the lashes is pretty good, not trashy looking and nice length too.
Love it..works great with the sodastream.  The lid was good and held the fizz in for the 24 hours. Super happy.note that this can not be placed in dish water..hand wash only.  Love it.

So easy to use, no plugging in to use. Okay, bring the knowledge of biolofpdy, nature, the birds and the bees, a deep refresher course for those who enjoyed studying these subjects at school; and throw in the theory of quantum physics.  What do you get?  A PhD I hope.  I love biology and quantum physics, at high scholl, but never took it up to college level, the material in th book is detailed enough for the learned, but you don't have to get it all to enjoy the book.  The book did a good job in providing the fundamentals before adding the quantum aspect in it, and yes, I couldn't believe how far quantum physics has come and if nothing else, you will be more impressed in the wonders of nature.  It is not an quick read, but take your time, as there are a lot of material condensed in the nook, but well written for a subject matter that is not always well explained in layman ters.  Good job.

The infinity aspect is beautiful, beautiful design and made.  I wished the chain was not just a simple loop that would work for necklaces, but makes the bracelet look cheap.  A shame as the infinity aspect is beautiful.

These are the real deal.  There was a review that stated they are only 75% down, and actually what it says is that it "HAS TO BE AT LEAST 75% DOWN".  I had contacted the seller and they said 100% down and I believe them.  Not blindly, I know the difference between all or part down and these are 100% down pillows with excellent loft.  I will be buying more as to get 2 for $140 is a real deal as they probably sell at other stores for close if not over $200 for 1 (ONE) King size pillow.  Very happy and if things change I will update this review.
DOES NOT WORK ON HP, WILL NOT RECOGNIZE THE CARTRIDGES< ANY OF THEM

This is the real deal, BUT YOU ARE GETTING ONLY 1 PILLOW!!  This is 100% down and excellent quality in a firm Queen.  These will be sold at full retail at around $200 each and I am not making this up.  Have had down bedding since a teenager and know what to look for.  It is great for back sleepers with shoulder issues as I bought these for my Mom who has 2 rotocuff tears in her shoulder.  It was time to replace the pillows and I saved up the money over time as I knew these would be expensive.  I also bought 2 King size, soft with 700 fill power from someone else for $140 for both, still waiting for and will review upon receipt.  Below is a link to those pillows and I contacted the vendor and he confirmed they are 100% White Goose Down and 100% guarantee on quality.  We will see...LUXURIOUS Two (2) Goose Down Pillows - 1200 Thread Count 100% Egyptian Cotton Cover , Soft, King Size, Set of 2 PillowsThe way you get scammed is that a vendor will state "High Quality Down" but do not state how much of the filling is down and you have to search for it, if that is the case then run away.  Usually these sellers are selling crappy pillows with 95% duck feather and 5% duck down.  Here is what you want to see and if they are selling good quality 100% White Goose Down they will always state that:1.  Description states up front that it is 100% down2.  Description states "White Goose Down", which is a whole lot better than duck and "White Goose Down" is the best3.  The fill power on Queens should be no less than 500 and on Kings 7004.  You should usually get med-firm if you like softer pillows as "soft" are usually really soft.  "Firm" pillows are firm but you sink down into them and they cradle you.  This is just a suggestion before getting a "soft" pillow as you may be disappointed but it is not the pillow but  your choice of firmness as long as all the above criteria are met.If you are looking for an alternative that is not as pricey, you can try pillows that are 50% "GOOSE" feather and 50% down, but I prefer to save up and get all down.  But, a lot of people like the 50% - 50% who prefer a harder pillow, I would also buy a body pillow that is 50/50 and never 100% down, kind off a waste of money.And to put price in perspective, pay $88 for a Queen pillow now and it lasts 10 years with proper care and sleep like a baby or buy the crappy ones at around $30, toss and turn, they make crunchy noises and replace them every 6 - 12 months = $360 at the least if replacing annually, and you will because the crappy ones will start to stink and are not hypoallergenic.Also in general, it is really important to have a good pillow to sleep soundly otherwise you will toss and turn or the pillow will make noise when you move and wake you up, like a crunchy sound, which are the crappy feathers. So while pricey for AMAZON, I do recommend this pillow.  They also have these in a King size for $99 each pillow.So, that is what I know and I hope it helps.
Excellent price and really good card, I know these are expensive, not at the retail point they give, but still an excellent buy at $6, I see these regularly for around $25

11/05/2015 UPDATE:Took away 1 star because when taking pictures of the same item, the colour is not consistent.  Say I take a picture of a rose coloured blanket trimmed in light pink.  Some pictures are true to the actual colours, but other pictures of the same thing, the pink looks like and entirely different colour, even though it should not.  For that reason I took away 1 star and downgraded this from a 4 star to a 3 star rating.  I also have a very robust photo software package, and no matter what I could not get the colours to be accurate across the board.  Also, it only had 4x optical zoom and I wanted/needed more.  I still believe in CANON so when I bought yet another camera, got a CANON, just an upgrade from this one.  Basically this camera is for fun shots or facebook and stuff.Since I had to get another camera with a much higher optical zoom range, I bought ANOTHER CANON with 30x optical zoom, but had to buy a flash separate.  I got the PowerShot SX400 and once I get it and use it I will review it.  I actually needed something more, but not an actual professional camera as it was overkill for me.  I sell items on the internet and needed an upgrade from this to get better pictures, that look like the items I am selling and looked true to the actual colour.  Also bought a 5 foot tripod.___________________________FINALLY BOUGHT A CANON!!!!! I got an older model with 10.2 megapixels but when buying a camera that is one of the things you look at but not the most important with "Point and Shoot", it is like the third thing as you can buy a 15 or 21 megapixel and still get really bad grainy or dark pictures, like I did, and anything over 18mgp does NOT do well in low light.  Also, camera manufacturers push out new lineups every single year with only minor upgrades, so phased-out models can be a real steal for the same thing costing 2x.TIDBIT on Optical and Digital Zoom:If you are using a digital point and shoot camera you may have something called "digital zoom". For great pix AVOID digital zoom.  If you have the option of optical zoom, use that instead.DIGITAL zoom is basically a digital crop within the camera and is NOT true magnification. Basically you are only capturing part of an image with LOWER RESOLUTION  and not the full frame.  So it is like fools gold, it looks like gold but not worth anything and in fact makes things worse.OPTICAL zoom IS magnification created by the lens. This is a TRUE ZOOM and should not degrade the image quality. Optical zoom should ALWAYS be your first choice for magnification to make sure the quality of the pix is high.Also, Optical zoom is the most important zoom measurement because it measures the Focal Length of the camera.  For example, a 10X Nikon zoom lens might have a 35mm film equivalent of 24mm-240mm, while another might have a 35mm-350mm equivalent.The 24mm lens would have MORE wide-angle capabilities than a 35mm lens, and a 350mm lens has more zoom than a 240mm lens.  So, if you can start with a 25mm  100mm zoom in optical, which is usually the first number.So that is why megapixels really is the third of fourth option to look at since such numbers refer to the magnification and wide-angle capabilities of the lens and the quality of the pix is in Optical or Digital Zoom, and NOT JUST megapixels.___________________________So, after trying 2 highly rated point and shoot cameras, reviewed next, in the $200 range I finally just spent the money and bought a CANON, which I have used since a teenager and still have my film camera, which to me is the only way to take photos.(9/17/2015 - Full Retail $250) CANON POWERSHOT A3000 IS: 10 megapixel, 4 times zoomSet Up:Easy enough, but check the site for updates AND there is a lot of great support and information about the model, so thumbs up.  Also, you can option in the descriptions when looking what to set the camera on in the LCD screen, like with the OLYMPUS.Picture Quality:First, the megapixels of this camera is  of the NIKON @ 21 and the OLYMPUS was 14 and the quality is actually very good where there is a lot of light with the ISO at 400 or under and excellent at 100. I especially like the vivid shooting option which beefs up the colours as I am taking pictures of hand knitted items to sell.  And while it has image stabilization, I turn it off as I use a tripod.  Video quality is par for the course, but I did not buy this for video.CONS:Shooting speed is slow, slower than most at 4 seconds in between shots with the flash and 3 seconds without the flash.  Most others are at half thisEditing Software:The same as everyone else, I do not think is it better or worse.  I use Corel anywayCamera Quality:Overall for a camera that was around $250 full retail and you can now buy for $150 new I would say a top contender for ones costing over $200.  It feels like it has a metal housing, it has weight and feels substantial in your hands, so if dropped I think it would survive, which I could not say that of the plastic cameras I tried before I finally bought this one.  If you are looking for something basic that takes great pictures in optical mode, then this one is a great little camera.  Taking off 1 star because of delay in between shots and slight picture noise.So, again hands down I go for the CANON, needless to say that from now on I will just stick with CANON.  They are the higher priced point and shoot, and in general if on sale not much of a discount, but I think this is because of the quality of the camera.  My film camera is 30 years old and still works like a charm.  External reviews rate between 4 to 4 1/2 stars and B+/A- on average.If something changes, I will update the review.______________________OTHER CAMERAS: NIKON AND OLYMPUSI first bought an Olympus, then a NIKON before the CANON and I did not like them.  Also, I did buy these used, but I do buy products on AMAZON that are used about 25% of the time and usually do not have issues, but always buy items stated as LIKE NEW. Here are my reviews:1. (9/3/2015 - Full retail $200) OLYMPUS STYLUS -5010: 14 megapixel, wide angle dual image 5 times zoom,There is not much support on the OLYMPUS website, so that is a bummer, and it did not come with a CD.  From what I read in the very basic manual the driver, software and manual should download when you plug it into your laptop, so if it is pre owned, this does not happen. The pictures it took were grainy and mostly out of focus.  Also, there is a lag time from when you press the button to take the pix and it actually taking a pix so the moment for all intent and purpose is gone.Upside:  Newer models may perform better, I do not know.  But, I did like that when I scrolled through the different options on taking a pix, a brief description pops up on the screen as to why you would use this option.  This I have to say is a great option as I am not a photographer.  The editing software is average, but I have Corel for that.  Also, it is a dual lens so it has optical and digital options.External reviews rate OLYMPUS highly, but more of the high end cameras costing $450 and up.  Can be as high as 4 stars and a B+ grade, much higher than NIKON, but not better than CANON.  My camera failed miserably, I could not even download my pix, so I got a refund.2. (9/8/2015 - Full retail $150 - $185) Nikon CoolPix S3600: 21 megapixel, 8 times zoom NIKKOR lens, video 720HDThe photos are really bad, something about the lighting just does not work and when you hold the button for a shot it takes forever, so as with the OLYMPUS the moment is gone.  Also, not very user friendly.  In addition, when using video it barely captures any audio, so the speakers are either really bad or whatever it is that tapes is really bad.It may be a dual option lens as I am assuming the NIKKOR lens means digital, but there is no upside to that, as stated above optical zoom is the best.On the upside, the photo editing software does allow you to apply the different filters in the camera after you download them, I like that option.  The manual is comprehensive, but the website support is minimal, as it seems with all point and shoot.Con, the camera body feels very cheap, like thin plastic so if you drop this one I doubt it would survive.  External reviews give NIKON mostly an average score, 3 out of 5 stars and a C grade, and after seeing one I understand why.Sent this camera back and got a refund._________________I know a long review, but I hope this helps with your choice.SIDE NOTE: Anyone can get a great picture with a digital, especially since you can alter the pix after, but a real photo artist to me is one that uses film.  I am not that, but I can really admire that type of photography and the skill required from taking the photo to developing it in their own dark room.

I BOUGHT A CANON POWER SHOT AS3000 (see that review for a comprehensive review of all three cameras), I got an older model with 10.2 megapixels but when buying a camera that is one of the things you look at but not the most important with "Point and Shoot", it is like the third thing as you can buy a 15 or 21 megapixel and still get really bad grainy or dark pictures then take a picture with a 10 megapixel camera and it will look better than a high end 20 megapixel camera.  Issue is when you go digital zoom which is not a true zoom, but a crop of the picture being taken, it degrades the snapshot, what you want is high zoom with the regular lens and anything over 18mgp does not do well in low light.TIDBIT:DIGITAL zoom is basically a digital crop within the camera and is NOT true magnification. Basically you are only capturing part of an image with LOWER RESOLUTION  and not the full frame.  So it is like fools gold, it looks like gold but not worth anything and in fact makes things worse.OPTICAL zoom IS magnification created by the lens. This is a TRUE ZOOM and should not degrade the image quality. Optical zoom should ALWAYS be your first choice for magnification to make sure the quality of the pix is high.First I bought an Olympus Stylus 5010 with 14MGP and 5x wide angle zoom and it was  dud.  But I gave it 2 stars as it is very user friendly.  This issue again was the quality of the image it took.  No matter what kind of lighting, in or outdoor, it was still grainy and dark, just like this camera.  It had fairly high mark, as this camera, but no where near the quality I would expect with a 14MGP camera.Tried this camera next, the Nikon CoolPix S3600 20.1 megapixel with 8x Zoom and I am assuming the "NIKOR" lens is the digital zoom. It is a wide angle lens BUT the photos are really bad, something about the lighting just does not work.  Also, when you hold the button for a snap shot it takes forever to focus and then there is a long delay before the picture is taken so the moment is gone.  Also, not very friendly as far as controls.Here is the deal with OPTICAL zoom, IT IS magnification created by the LENS - Digital zoom is not. Optical is a TRUE ZOOM and should not degrade the image quality. Optical zoom should ALWAYS be your first choice for magnification to make sure the quality of the pix is high.  So spend the money on this option and not megapixel or digital zoom for point and shoot cameras.So, I finally spent the money and bought a CANON AS3000 POWERSHOT which is well over $150.  I have used CANON since a teenager and still have my film camera, which to me is the only way to take photos.  Giving this 2 stars as some people might like it, I did not.Anyone can get a great picture with a digital, especially since you can alter the pix after, but a real photo artist to me is one that uses film.  I am not that or even close, but I can really admire that way type of photography and all the work and expertise that goes into it through to producing the final picture in a dark room.  Like Ansel Adams, such a magnificent photographer!!Still waiting to get the CANON, will review that when I get it and use it.

I first bought this item I think about a year ago, and it was for my artwork.  I paint and draw.  But I did not like it for that since it had such a small area that it lit up, so I did not give it a great rating but an average one.  This time it is 5 stars but I bought it for my sewing machine area.  I am older and when you get older it gets harder to see, especially in the dark or a room that is not well lit.  Part of nature and part of getting old.  But this is perfect for my sewing area as:1.  Small footprint2.  Illuminates a big enough area so that I can see clearly, the light on my sewing machine is not enough even though quite bright3.  The light is excellent on it's brightest setting as you can see even the smallest detail4.  The quality of the light is excellentAlso, I paid 1/3 the cost of the item, which is another plus.  I gave the black one I bought to my Mom for when she crochet's and she loves it.  So, if you are looking for a study lamp, a lamp to light up what your sewing or for crafts, for crochet or knitting, even a table lamp then this is the one.  And no need to spend $100, when you can get it on AMAZON for around $35.
